2,CREA2,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,ANGEL.ME,CREA-SHARES,"Kempische Steenweg 311 bus 1.02, 3500 Hasselt, Belgium",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Bart  Becks,"We want to createÿCREA-SHARESÿin order to facilitateÿcrowdfunding for the creative industriesÿby rewarding funders for their risk by allowing them to take revenue or profit sharing.ÿ
ÿ
Crowdfunding for the creative industries in Europe have 2 main components:
Reward based crowdfunding, where goods or services are sold in exchange for a donation
Equity based crowdfunding, where you can invest in starting companies in the creative industries by buying shares

However, many individuals in the creative industries would prefer to reward their funders in exchange for a part of the profit. This is currently not possible via the reward method, while the equity investment would immediately require a participation in the entire company (in case this would exist).
ÿ

By building a crowdfunding platform which allows a profit participation based on the creative work in question, build on theÿRSS (Revenue Settlement and Sharing) FI-WAREÿ? would enable a platform in which profit participation on the work in question is possible. This would be application to all creative industries, such as design, music, film &amp
column2: TV, gaming, and many others. This would be a new class of crowdfunding, situated between the current for of crowdfunding by rewards (dominated by US players such as IndieGOGO &amp
column3: Kickstarter) and crowdfunding by equity (due to regulation very country specific). In the attached presentation you can find a more extensive competitive description

column1: ÿ
Since the profit-participation has no regulatory hurdles, this can be launched across Europe, and would allow aÿEuropean leading and disruptive platform, based on the FIWARE components.
ÿ
The 2 FI-WARE components that we would implement are:
-ÿThe Revenue Sharing System (RSS) GE is in charge of distributing the revenues originated by the usage of a given service among the involved stakeholders

-ÿIdentity Management (KeyRock):ÿIdentity Management covers a number of aspects involving users' access to networks, services and applications, including secure and private authentication from users to devices, networks and services, authorization &amp
column2: trust management, user profile management, privacy-preserving disposition of personal data, Single Sign-On (SSO) to service domains and Identity Federation towards applications.

column1: ÿ

The implementation of would allow to implement a form of virtual shares (crea-shares) that allow to have stakeholder involvement and participation from theÿcrowd, also for projects from creative industries, such as design, fashion, music, , jewelery, gaming, tv and other. The US platforms ? which are currently the market leaders ? do not allow this form of participation, creating a unique opportunity for Europe based platform to lead by innovation !
ÿ

In such, the development and implementation of a CREA-SHARES platform will lead to more entrepreneurship in the creative industries. We could see the platform as an enabler for more creative entrepreneurships. As such, you can see this as the activitation of a know principle, and would lead to a form of ?Profit Shares?.
ÿ
Additionally, this also creates the following:
a user test of the idea, concept, design
clear advantages related to creating a fan-base. This are not only helping to fund the project and give feedback, but will lead to ambassodors that will act as sales enablers and even ambassadors
this allows for multi-national fan approach from day 1 across the EU",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

3,CREA3,CREA,CREAtiFi,Ireland,Artomatix Limited,Artomatix Cloud,"26A The Mews, Mount Eden Road, Donnybrook, Dublin 4 Dublin, Ireland","BUSINESS SERVICES, TELECOM AND MEDIA",B2B,3,2,YES,IN,Neal Joseph O'Gorman,"61% of the budget for producing the top console games is spent on creating art.ÿIn 2014, greater than $3bn will be spent on the generation of art assets for video games. This industry has identified the rising art costs as their largest problem. The Artomatix solution is an automated art-creation software application that will significantly disrupt the art production process for video games. The goal is to halve the time and halve the cost to make a video game.
ÿ

The overall objective for Artomatix is to deliver the next generation of graphics tools, based upon the first Artificial Intelligence (AI) system that can mimic human-like artistic creativity and can semi-automate the process based on examples. By semi-automating the generation of art, Artomatix will expand the games market and significantly disrupt the current art creation process by:
Enabling digital graphic artists to focus on high-creativity tasks rather than spending time on mundane low-creativity tasks (e.g. painting each individual brick in a wall)
Improving art generation efficiency and consequently reducing project times and costs
Providing studios with the means to keep art creation in-house, thus reducing or eliminating their reliance on Asian Art outsourcers
In the longer term, people (game designers for example) that are lacking in artistic talent will also be able to use this technology to create the vision they have in their mind.
ÿ
To make this happen, Artomatix needs to port the present, stand-alone prototype software, to the cloud.
That is the focus of this project, Artomatix Cloud.ÿ
ÿ",Tech provider,,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Authoring and Publishing Software,Applications,Content Applications,"1, and 2",X,http://artomatix.com/,Startup,50000,artomatix.com

5,CREA5,CREA,CREAtiFi,Germany,bitkraut GmbH,fisualize,"Meierottostr. 5, 10719 Berlin, Germany",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,bitkraut GmbH,"fisualize is a Web application for context-aware content creation. It provides an easy-to-use user interface to visualize static, time-dynamic and context-based information in a graphical manner. Created visualizations (infographics) can be embedded into websites, used as single page websites or exported to single page mobile application for smartphones or tablets.

The most recent ipunkt (one of the leading web application developers for publishing industry) study on digital publishing identified three major consumer whishes on digital content, which are up-to-dateness, individuality and mobility.

Future Internet needs to fulfill these wishes by offering innovative solutions to content creators, including journalism, publishers, advertisement, designers, arts, museums and many more. Graphical visualizations of information become increasingly popular (cf. over 2mio. created infographics on the infogr.am platform alone) as data has become one of the strongest arguments in our data-driven world and storytelling visualizations are a perfect tool to make them amenable. This is a neccessary step to enrich people's everyday lives using the flood of information provided by the Future Internet. This is a relevant issue for major parts of creative industries.

fisualize supports three kinds of information, including a totally new dimension to infographics, building on these developments. Static information is every kind of static text, graphical element or picture, whereas time-dynamic information is information that changes over time and is usually loaded from databases, especially open data. A once created infographic updates when being loaded by a content user and refreshed in defined time intervals. Additionally, fisualize adds context-based information to the content creator's construction kit. This kind of information represents a completely new approach of up-to-date, mobile and individual content. Context-based information is user-specific information from sensors like location, noise, temperature or even statistical data collected on the user's mobile device.
Using fisualize, content creators may visualize these kind of information or use it to filter and select other data by a simple and intuitive graphical programming approach.

If a web user loads an infographic created with fisualize by a content creator, the browser or mobile app first requests relevant contextual sensor data, loads up-to-date dynamic data from relevant databases and finally generates the user-specific infographic, that the user can share in social networks.

By this approach, fisualize profoundly changes how content is produced, distributed and consumed by allowing media companies or individual creatives to create a new personalized customer experience. Note that this approach keeps user interaction very simple by offering individualization in a non-intrusive, magic way. The users do not have to enter any information by theirselves.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

6,CREA6,CREA,CREAtiFi,Germany,bitkraut GmbH,truffledoc,"Meierottostr. 5, 10719 Berlin, Germany",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Dominik Lahmann,"truffledoc offers an innovative new interface and experience to working with documents by merging digital and physical world.

Although there are many efforts to reduce paper consumption, document printouts offer a better experience than reading on screen in many cases. Especially in creative industries printouts are indispensable to get a good impression of dimension and color of print media, to get a quick overview on large documents or to work with high dimension documents like technical drawings, and there are many more cases. As a consequence there exist various copys of a document and not only a single one on a central document server. Beside printouts, there exist versions on eBook-Readers or tablet PCs that do not have a connection to a document server. Therefore, It is often difficult to find the corresponding digital document in a document repository when working with a print out or reading on an Ebook-Reader.

truffledoc finds documents in a repository by simply capturing the document copy (printed out or on a screen) with a mobile device's camera. One can select the identic or a similar document and open it on any device with internet access in the web browser by scanning an QR code on the truffledoc website without needing to enter credentials in the browser, but with full security of data transfer by ssl. So it is even possible to open a documents on an untrusted PC/device without needing to enter the repository login data on the untrusted device. Moreover truffledoc is able to overlay annotations of the document in the document repository on the document the user is currently working with by agumented reality. It may extract the paper annotations and merge them into the digital document in the repository.

truffledoc will totally change user's interaction with documents by blending any kinds of document representations in the digital and in the physical world. It establishes mobile devices as a second screen in working environments to playfully jump over the gap between different devices and even between physical and digital world, creating a smart user interaction and amazing user experience.
ÿ

Use cases are to read some piece of paper, usually without filename or document title printed on it and need to get the whole document by downloading it to your PC. Or to print out a large scale document (e.g. a large drawing), pin it to the wall and use your mobile device to overlay individual annotations, that are available in the digital document, to it using your mobile device (and even find the file again by one click, if you missed to print the filename on it). Or being at a customer's place and want to give him/her a document - you do not have to enter your server credentials on a foreign PC anymore or to share flash drives, use your mobile device to authorize document access instead. Or sitting in a presentation and want to download the current slide, that is somewhere on the document server, to your tablet - capture it and load it. And there a re plenty more possibilities.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

7,CREA7,CREA,CREAtiFi,Germany,Blogbox UG (haftungsbeschr„nkt),Blogbox Content Captain,"Schwanthalerstraáe 155, 80339 Mnchen, Germany",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Moritz Orendt,"The importance of Content Marketing is increasing since traditional marketing does not work anymore: Consumers are subject to a flood of advertising messages and block them consciously and unconsciously. Red Bull , Coca Colaÿ and Volkswagen show how Content Marketing is working with a big budget. We are going to offer the impact of Content Marketing to SMEs since our software and networt of content creators makes this marketing technique simple and affordable for them.
Our technology solves the problem of content creation: How do I get the content my audience is interested in?

We created a web interface, called the content captain. It tailors the content for the target group from a random company and makes it easy to distribute in different channels like social media, mobile apps or corporate blogs. We collect the content from a hand-picked network of bloggers (541 bloggers, 250 new articles per day, 82.000 articles in total) and sort the different articles to topics via a semantic technology. Afterwards we match topics and target groups.
The Content Captain saves time and resources for SMEs, since it reliably identifies relevant content and makes it fast and easy to share it via Drag&amp
column2: Drop.

column1: The business model is simple: Software-as-a-Service. SMEs pay a monthly fee for access to the Content Captain. According to our calculations, the Customer Lifetime Value is 520 ?.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

8,CREA8,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Bovicom,MmmooOgle,"Zeutestraat 1, 2870 Puurs, Belgium","AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING, HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES",B2B,10,2,YES,IN,Miel Hostens,"MmmooOgle:ÿAs in other sectors, Veterinary Medicine is evolving quickly in the 21th century due to new Precision Livestock Farming (PLF) technologies. At Bovicom, dairy researchers and veterinarians are trying to adapt to the wide range of new technologies. The amount of data created on a dairy farm exponentially grew over the last decade to 100 MegaBytes each day (milk meters, accelerometers and vaginal or ruminal temperature loggers). However, trying to integrate the widespread data streams from PLF technologies is tempting. MmmooOgle covers theÿidea to have develop a smartphone application for veterinarians, farmers and other consultants, whereby the data from a newly build data warehouse (named Dairy Data Warehouse or DDW) would be used. Besides the data already available in DDW through conversions, additional information can be added to the DDW platform with the input features of the app. The app will be tightly coupled to the DDW platform as the data access and storage is based on the DDW database. Typical features that will allow the user to add data to the platform are the entry of pregnancy diagnoses, mastitis events &amp
column2: treatments, body weight &amp
column3: other clinical parameters, genital &amp
column4: other clinical examination, pictures, etc. This information is then stored in the DDW platform and available for applications inside the DDW platform.ÿAdditionally, the app can be used to display data and reports available via HerdNet. As the MmmooOgle is built on top of DDW, it is not a competing system. Usage of the app will even stimulate farmers to work more close with their consultant, stimulate these consultants to work more close with DDW and convince them to purchase more of its features (f.i. datamarts).ÿThe ultimate goal of the application is to facilitate communication in the 21th century between farmers, veterinarians and the animals. column1: 9,CREA9,CREA,CREAtiFi,The Netherlands,CleverLions Smart BV (changing during this application),CleverLions,"Vrouwe Udasingel 207, 6663GT Lent, Netherlands",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,3,1,YES,IN,Erik van Heeswijk,"CleverLions wants to change the paradigm of content strategy using data visualisations and has developed an unique dashboard with predictive and prescriptive elements. There are a lot of tools in the content space, but they suffer from a couple of disadvantages. First, they cover a part of the content space, for example social media, or web, whereas distribution is a multiplatform business. Secondly: data stays in silos, because content and content marketing organisations use a wide variety of tools (social media analytics, web analytics, A-B testing etc) that do not communicate. On top of that there is no grip and real overview because there are no powerful visualisations of content distribution concepts that span across those platforms and silos.
ÿ

CleverLions has developed a dashboard ÿ(name: SmartOcto) that visualises the whole content strategy, multiplatform, and focuses on real impact. It has modules on influencers, scraping, social media and ROI, but can also make use of existing pro tools within a media organisation.
ÿ

Important perspectives: the CleverLions dashboard captures the history but focuses on the future. It calculates the momentum of content and gives real time alerts when content has a lot of engagement or virality factor. In that way publishers, broadcasters and content marketeers can influence the impact of their content in realtime or at birth, not when it is at the end of the lifecycle.

Secondly: it has a holistic approach on impact. Clients choose their KPI, which could be different than only views, or social media likes. SmartOcto lets media organisations establish the relationship between their content strategy and other business goals, like sales or engagement.

Thirdly: in the coming times it will make the shift from predictive analytics to prescriptive. SmartOcto will calculate the best ?moves? in contentdistribution (?your audience is in Facebook now, please post this video, it has a high virality factor?) and send out an alert to the right people in the organisation.
ÿ

A lot of the unique visualisation concepts in the dashboards (see mockups section) have been validated in the business environment of public broadcasting and are ?proven technology?. They will be generalised for the whole content sector.ÿ
ÿ

Uploaded, CleverLionssteps: a way to talk to clients and walk them through the advanced learnings",Tech provider,,0,X,0,X,0,,Software,Marketing,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,X,www.cleverlions.com,Startup,50000,cleverlions.com
10,CREA10,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,CREACTIVA,CREACTIVA,"Rey Francisco street, 10. 1D, 28008 Madrid, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Mario Mahr Avila,"CREACTIVA
a creative discovery application
ÿ
The product.
CREACTIVA aims at the development and exploitation of a novel, playful and low-cost ?creative discovery &amp
column2: recommender application? that attempts to provoke entrepreneurs to think ?out-of-the-box?, and in consequence boost disruptive ideas and innovation, in the benefit of a responsive society.

column1: Operative goal: ÿ?Based on your usual ?comfort zone? data, CREACTIVA starts applying big data/graph mining and new creative discovery processing techniques (ie. through concepts blending *, bisociations, etc) thus to discover out-of-the-box perspectives and recommend you potential (existing and/or new) creative ideas?.
ÿ

* About conceptual blending: Knowledge discovery and computational creativity have until lately been investigated by two separate research communities. However, research in bisociative, cross-context knowledge discovery has recently started addressing creative tasks, including creative literature mining. Bisociation is a term coined by Arthur Koestler in The Act of Creation (1963), and recently by Fauconnier and Turner (2008) in conceptual blending. It basically refers to the bridging or mixture of concepts from two contexts or domains that are normally considered separate or hidden.
An example: The old cash register idea emerged thanks to the ""bridging of concepts"" (blending) between a ship propeller counting engine and a restaurant need for management.ÿ
To put this conceptual approach in context, let?s analyze a simple scenario:

?Lucas is an aspiring entrepreneur with a deep knowledge in the E-commerce sector (comfort zone, his domain), he knows there are plenty of space for innovation in Logistics and Stock Management (out-of-the-box: other domains), but these are well known and he wants to make something truly innovative that helps him to stand out of the crowd when pitching to investors.

To accomplish thisÿhe starts thinking about these other sectors or knowledge domains, not directly linked to his domain: E-commerce, trying to discover hidden relations between them, that help him to put together something really disruptive.
However Lucas won?t be able to execute all the tasks involved in this analysis in a timely manner, mainly due to the enormous volume of information available and its unstructured nature?.
ÿ

CREACTIVA is the tool Lucas needs for detecting and assessing new domains, and discovering new ideas and hidden relations, whether existing (unknown for him) or totally new (unknown for everybody). It isÿable to analyze large volumes of information, and applying different Artificial Intelligence (AI) techniquesÿin creativity, it discovers untapped relations, scoring them and finally presenting results to Lucas in a simple, powerful and highly usable way.
ÿ
At the end, this application triggers computedÿcreative ""sparks""ÿto boostÿhis creativity, allowing him toÿundertake truly disruptive projects.
ÿ
The Services.

Our product concept will be based on diverse types of services and interface functionalities: from playful exploring, to discovering new sparks, from scoring to filtering the relevant sparks, amongst others. A total of 6 separate domains are considered thus to get a great amount of rich findings.
ÿ
The technology.

The product/services will be developed through 2 main phases:ÿthe Mockupÿdevelopment (early prototype) andÿtheÿfinalÿfully functional Prototype. Both developments will mainly consider key items as: Domains characterization, Web mining, NLP and machine learning (forking the tool Pattern, developed by Tom de Smedt), AI techniques (conceptual blending), the architecture and the Fiware GEs to use.
ÿ
NOTE: See ""Idea/Product"" at Supporting material (Creactiva FINAL, pdf).

It reduces waiting in line to pay, or looking for a payment station/kiosk in that parking. The APP component of this project also allows customers to find nearest parking from their current position.ÿ
ÿ
We call it smart access, smart payment technology.
ÿ
ÿ ÿ ÿ The goal and unique selling proposition of Smart Parking is
Innovate in payment through card-less parking payment
Innovate in access through ticketless parking access
Improve customer service &amp
column2: loyalty by reducing stress

column1: ÿ

It allows for more loyalty/customer follow-up by the parking operator and gives an overview of parking transactions per customer. Fro large scale events parking management and payment if often not their core business. This solution can allows for a more professional approach.
ÿ

14,CREA14,CREA,CREAtiFi,UK,Divido Financial Services Limited,Divido,"5 Bonhill Street, c/o Seedcamp, EC2A 4BX London, United Kingdom","BANKING, WHOLESALE AND RETAIL TRADE
column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Fredrik Borgquist,"At Divido we are in the process of redefining the Point of Purchase (PoP) for finance in the digital age. Our technology will enable online merchants to provide consumers with credit through a smooth online process. The plan is to let online merchants offer a simple, quick to use finance option at the PoP for consumers who don?t want to pay in full upfront. The merchants are able to provide 0% financing as a marketing tool by subsidising the interest rate making this a very attractive option for the consumer. Designed from the ground up around a paperless e-signature process, customers will get an instant decision and can ?sign? their credit agreement on screen. No paper forms, no waiting, no hassle.

column1: ÿ

Once a customer has been approved for financing (based on pre-agreed criteria with lenders) the lender settles the full amount with the merchant within 24 hours. The lender collects the monthly instalments from the consumer until the outstanding amount has been settled in full. The lender pays Divido a commission for all credit brokered.

The lender takes full responsibility for debt collection, managing bad debt, providing debt management advice to the consumer. The merchant manages general product consumer customer service after the finance has been approved.
ÿ
Divido achieves the above and will stand out from competition by:
(a) Multiple finance options: if declined by one lender, alternatives are presented. This mean more transactions will be approved.
(b) Additional credit: consumers are shown how much more they can finance.
(c) Catering for long tail: finance transactions from ?250, aiming for an average order value of ?750 and above.

(d) API: allow merchants manually to add Divido as a payment option. This also includes integration with the most popular eCommerce platforms such Megento and Venda so that merchants on these platform can add Divido as a payment option in just a few clicks.
(e) Mobile optimised: intelligent UX makes it easy to apply for credit on a mobile.

(f) Support: Divido will provide support to merchants during office hours (Business Development or Developer as appropriate) and the lenders will provide support for consumers applying for credit. The lenders will also provide FCA stipulated debt management advice services.
(g) Payment Guarantee: merchants are guaranteed to always be paid in full.
(h) Customer reporting: partners and consumers can view their transactions online.

(i) Consumer Intelligence: consumers using Divido only have to register once so subsequent purchases will be facilitated quickly. Each time someone applies or completes a purchase via Divido their shopping habits and payment history are recorded. This information will later be made available to merchants that want to target their previous consumers, consumers? shopping habits and information about additional credit they are entitled to, in order to facilitate cross selling and up-selling. This feature will be rolled out ÿto merchants for an additional fee, or offered for free to create additional stickiness, once a critical mass of user data has been collected.
(j) Flexible platform (UX, process): built to scale and for multiple languages.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

15,CREA15,CREA,CREAtiFi,Latvia,DOOHapps SIA,DOOH Apps (Interactive Applications for Digital-Out-Of-Home),"Krisjana Barona iela 5-4, LV-1050, Riga, Latvia",Consumer Undefined,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Frederik De Wachter,"DOOHapps is the world's first interactive application store for the Digital-Out-of-Home industry. Far too many public displays only broadcast information and advertising. With DOOHapps, we want to make sure viewers can interact with their smartphones or gestures in a straightforward and intuitive way. We don't build applications but select the best apps from expert App builders to link them in our App Store.

DOOHapps turns your display into a smart screen. We use smart sensors and elements like touch, cameras, Wi-Fi, beacons, NFC, mobiles and social media to enable interaction. Some apps are html5 based and require no additional effort. Others are native and more advanced apps for typically premium locations. They require additional hardware features for the interaction.

Next, DOOHapps? web based application store provides interactive content formats for large displays. The app store contains specialized applications that attract, engage and convert consumers for outdoor advertising, shopping, entertainment and information purposes. The apps are provided by expert developers and come from successful outdoor campaigns.

You select, personalize and schedule apps to run on yourÿconnected Digital-Out-Of-Home (DOOH) display inventory. On a cloud based solution, you can upload your media and set parameters to turn the apps into a unique branded interactive campaign with your logo, videos, hashtags, parameters and choices.

The campaign generates relevant marketing data such as reach, awareness, action, appreciation and advocacy. DOOHapps triggers consumers to leave their profile data and interests with cookies, likes, tweets, emails and other recordable details. They give valuable insights in the effectiveness and ROI of your campaign.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

16,CREA16,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Dough VOF,Sparker,"Daenenstraat 17, 2600 Berchem, Belgium",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Tanguy Coenen,"The need for an open flow of knowledge in the organization

Creativity and innovation are widely recognized as of crucial importance for the functioning of modern organizations, commercial and non-commercial alike. This is equally true for the ability of employees to solve problems and engage in informal learning. Each of these processes relies on the flow of knowledge between employees, which in turn is contingent on the social cohesion and the transparency of the knowledge distribution in the organization. Knowledge silos exist, often between departments, preventing many larger organizations to achieve a higher level of creativity and innovation through collaborative problem solving and informal learning.
ÿ
The Sparker way

Sparker runs on a number of tables, placed at strategic social locations in the organization. The tablets are connected to an RFID reader. Employees can perform check-ins on the tablet using their Sparker RFID card to score points for their team. They can engage in a Sparker conversation, by checking in with another player of their team. Both players are presented with a number of conversation topics that are based on their user profiles. By performing these actions, players can score point for their teams.

The overall state of the game and the recent activity can be followed through a responsively designed website. In addition, the website allows participants to perform missions that are tuned to organizational goals, like contributing ideas through a crowdsourced ideation campaign.

As players need to fill out their profiles in order to participate, this data becomes available to the organizational leadership, who can query it and perform analysis using the Analytics dashboard. This yields insights in the interests and competencies of the employees, which can be used to e.g. find out what issues are alive in the organization or to create teams in a more targeted way, combining different areas of expertise.

At its core, Sparker provides a new way of letting people meet in a meaningful way. It offers an experience that brings people together and stimulates them to build social contacts that are based on meaningful discussions. The ZWERM prototype, on which Sparker is based, produced design research knowledge on how to build systems that activate and consolidate the social fabric. Our paper ?ZWERM: a Modular Component Network Approach for an Urban Participation Game? won a ?SIGCHI Best of CHI Honorable Mention Award? at the CHI 2014 conference and we believe that it would be a missed opportunity not to bring this type of application to the market.
ÿ
Primary market
The market and especially the ?Learning &amp
column2: Development? segment has sent out a number of positive signals, strengthening our belief that the concept has market potential. Nowadays, the vision on learning has changed from strictly formal to a combination of formal, informal and social learning. However, there is lack of clear insights and data on where knowledge is located in the organization and how knowledge can be exchanged between colleagues. Sparker solves these issues to a certain extent, making it a promising instrument for engaging in social learning and obtaining data on future needs and opportunities.

column1: ÿ

We have engaged in a track at BNP-Paribas Fortis to implement Sparker for their 17.000 strong staff. In addition, we have received interest from Belfius bank to test the application when it is finished.
ÿ
Secondary markets

Focusing on large organization with knowledge silo?s looking for ways to engage their employees in a playful way is the most promising marketing strategy at this time. However, we have also identified that the concept would be applicable to spark social cohesion at events (conferences, business fairs,?) in schools (to server educational content) or in cities (as was done in ZWERM).ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

17,CREA17,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Eland & Vos - de gemotiveerde medewerker,The Motivated Collaborator,"Tiensesteenweg 251, 3010 Kessel-Lo, Belgium",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Tine Vos,"Everybody knows the hr-consultants who comes in a company and assists with the problems with the staff. Everybody also knows the business coach. I want to combine them both. For me the people are the heart of the business. But most of the timethe staff is considered as a burden. Company leaders often think you can not rely on your staff.
For me the staff is the people who makes it possible to grow your company even more. They are the beating heart and the centre of the corporation.
ÿ

I think it is rather logic people don?t know how to motivate other. We simply didn?t learn it. We learn to talk, but not to talk about the things that matters the most. We learn so much in school, but we don?t learn to communicate in a respectful way. We learn that there are people we have to listen to and be quiet when they speak. A teacher, boss, director is always right because the rank higher on the superior ladder.
ÿ

For me respect and responsibility are the basic values in people. So I have made a prototype of new creative online hr trainings. I want to help business owners of SMEs to find the motivated collaborator so they can lift their business higher and generate more revenue.
ÿ

For a long time you had to be though and objective in business. You had to think with your head. You weren?t allow to make decisions with your heart. My creative part in these training is that I?m convinced you have to do business with your heart. It is all about passion. Passion makes you move boundaries and reach for the sky. Passion makes you attract the right people for your business. Passion gives you enthusiasm, joy and freedom.
ÿ

Nowadays hr-people motivate company to hire the best man on the job. They have created a hole list of questions to keep everything as objective as possible. Mostly it means that the person with the best test results will get the job. But will this man be the best fit with his colleagues? Will he represent the company in the way the owners wants to be represented?ÿ
ÿ

So I want to create an online training which gives business owners without hr department tools the hire to ideal collaborator for his company. I help him from creating a vacancy and to identify his needs to get the best person sign the employment. I want to create a training where the owners really learns about the strengths and weaknesses of his business. Where the owners really know their business as good as themselves so they know what collaborators they need.
ÿ

The second training I want to create is a training where the business owner can built a better relationship with his staff just to build open communication. Communication without pride and prejudice. I want to give tools to the business owner to make difficult conversations really easy. Lots of leaders don?t know how to tackle difficult issues such as work ethics, ? They delay though conversation in the hope the problem will fade. But the problem will only escalate. I have great tools to open up the bond between an employer and his employee. I want to create an online training which can help the employer step by step in guiding him with the bonding with his staff.
ÿ

So the basic idea of my online training is to provide the soft skills of the hr to the business owner. They built up their company with their passion and skills. And then there was the need for staff because he couldn?t handle it on his own. But the minute you begin with staff you have less time to do the things you love most and are best at. So with these hr-trainings I want to help them out with their staff. Because people are social being. It should all come natural: the knowledge how to work together with others.ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

18,CREA18,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Elixir Solutions GCV,Integrated sales and marketing approach for the process industry,"Radenberg 7, 9506 Idegem, Belgium",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Elixir Solutions GCV,"Business problem:

Marketing departments were among the last departments that got impacted by IT.ÿ The last years with the social media / mobile/ÿ big data hype, a lot has changed.ÿ However, despite this advance (and momentum), we can say that marketing still operates in a silo in most companies.ÿ This because this advance in marketing technology has not been absorbed by the rest of the organisation.ÿÿ As a result, a lot of potential remains untapped: sales is still complaining that marketing does not help them with lead generation and supporting sales.ÿ Whereas marketing still works on an island, complaining they lack input from the field (sales, backoffice)ÿ in order to be able to conduct the right segmentations, predict customer behavior, anticipate competitor actions, etc...
Also, information that is (or not yet) gathered about competitors is not processed in such a way that is becomes usefull to sales, marketing and general management.
ÿ
Solution:
The goal is to develop a platform that breaks the boundaries between sales, marketing and the backoffice, by:
* Assuring that multiple CRM, ERP, and marketing automation tools can integrate on a data and process level
* leveraging open data as to enrich our knowledge of our customers and competitors coming from the above mentioned systems
* Providing artificial intelligence to support business processes and decision making.ÿ These algorithms should be relatively easy to configure by business analysts
* Provide a visual representation, tailored to the role of the business user
ÿ
ÿ
The software will comprise following elements:
* SaaS software platform, able to visualize and interpret data and do predictions
* Connectors to be installed within the customer ÿfirewall so data can be extracted
* Connectors that can extract data from the cloud
* Add ons for specific software components (first focus: SAP ecosystem), enabling our customers to use data and intelligence also in backend systems to steer processes of any kindÿ
* FIWARE used: GIS Data provider, Application Mashup
ÿ
Target market:ÿ
* Process industry (Main focus EU, although we expect to have a global presence once certified by SAP)
ÿ
Sales and marketing strategy

* As a member of the SAP Startup Focus Program, we'll be able to sell our solution, once certified, using the SAP sales channels to their customer base of 250.000 customers. ÿContact: james.crawford@sap.com. ÿWe're also an Adobe partner.
* Next to that, we have a strong network within the SAP market, which can be leveraged
* Finally, we'll also aim to generate leads using online/inbound marketing, outbound calling of target customers, etc...
ÿ
Business model:
Canvas attached
ÿ
Competitors
None known for process industry. ÿ
ÿ
Competitive advantage/USP
Break down silo's between sales, marketing and back office by integration all available data, both from within as well as outside the company, allowing:
Data and process integration
Quick google like search on all relevant data, regardless of source system or API
Visual representation of data
Calculations of scores and predictions

Focus on industry specifics for process industry: e.g. location of customers and competitors with regards to transportation costs, determination of regions where additional sales effort is needed as to avoid production over-capacity, etc...
Applies 3 C model for B2B marketing (Customers, Company, Competitors)
ÿ
ÿ
Challenges and risk
Technical complexity of solution
Quality of the FIWARE platform currently not proven
Finding equilibrium between general functionality and industry specific functionality
ÿ
Please find attached a presentation explaining the expected technical architecture and the solution architecture.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

19,CREA19,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Eventigrate,Eventigrate,"Lijsterlaan 19, 2630 Aartselaar, Belgium",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Gert Trekels,"Offline networking stays the most effective way in establishing new relationships, despite the omnipresence of social networks. Presence at congresses, receptions, seminars and exhibitions remains the most efficient way of extending your network as a businessman.
ÿ

A lot of people see these events as a necessary evil. Which interesting profiles are present? Who to talk to? Can someone introduce me to that one person? How can I put my company and me in the spotlight on these events? How do I keep track of all newly acquired contacts? In order to successfully experience an event, these questions should be answered as much as possible.
ÿ

Event organizers would like to facilitate this ultimate experience for the attendees. In order to do so they need to collect data about the event participants. Which workshop was the most popular? Do people like the gadgets that are placed in the central hall? What sort of relations exists between the attendees?
ÿ

Further improving the event experience has advantages both for the attendees as for the event organizers. But an optimization would also have a significant economic impact on the event industry, since both efficiency and effectiveness are increased. However there is more than an economic incentive. Conferences, receptions, seminars, exhibitions and networking events are the basis of meeting new people and sharing innovative ideas. By easing the exchange of these bright ideas, the whole society could benefit.
ÿ
Our product will be the combination of a tool, the so-called beacon, and a mobile and web application. The attendee application will be a mobile app
column2: the organizer application will be a web application, as well as an application suitable for tablets.

column1: ÿ

Aÿsmartphone applicationÿwhere users can see all the events they subscribed for and use our technology. Based on LinkedIn connections the app shows relevant attendees. At the event the app notifies the user when he is close to potentially interesting contacts. Immediately, he is able to view shared connections also at the event.ÿ(For more detailed information please have a look at the PDF in the ?mockup? section.)
Key features:
Coupling with LinkedIn profile
Personalized statistics
?Notify me? option
ÿ

Anÿonline platformÿin combination with a tablet app where event organisers are able to see real-time analytics about the event as well as links to other tools.ÿ(For more detailed information please have a look at the PDF in the ?mockup? section.)
Key features:
Real-time event analytics
Social graph of attendees
Using heatmaps to deduce popularity of locations
ÿ

In a later stadium of this project we want to develop our ownÿsmart badgesÿthat enable app users to easily find business contacts.ÿ(For more detailed information please have a look at the PDF in the ?additional info? section.)
Key features:
Beacon integrated in the name badge
Wireless battery charging
Personal design",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

20,CREA20,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Foodpairing NV,Visualization and personalization of existing recipes,"nijverheidsstraat 7, 8310 Bruges, Belgium","ACCOMMODATION AND FOOD SERVICE ACTIVITIES, Consumer health/wellness, MANUFACTURING",B2B/B2C,8,5,YES,IN,Bernard Lahousse,"Food faces many challenges. Food is not only energy. Food is experience, local, global, seasonal, health, sustainability, global warming, animal welfare... Food literacy is an important element to cope with the future of food.

Food or drink recipes are omnipresent online. However to find the recipes you like or easily adapt these to your liking or needs is not possible. A limited number of websites give feedback on the taste profile of the dish or filter out certain recipes, but the results are very limited.ÿ

In the ideal case a recipe would tell you how it will taste like, how much you will like it and how you can adapt it to fit better your preference, dietary restrictions, your requests like seasonal, local, sustainable food...(and teach you more about food).

The service we want to develop isÿpersonalizing existing recipes. In this project a website to register your flavour profile and a Chrome plugin to visualize and personalise recipes online will be created.ÿ

Over the last 8 yearsÿFoodpairing has developed one of the world's largest flavour database containing chemical aroma analysis, taste analysis and texture profiles. Foodpairing is cooperating with universities all over Europe to analyze food ingredients. Up till now more than 1500 ingredients have been fully characterized. Also seasonality, local, nutrition has been added, but for this information we would rely on other webservices.

Algorithms based on this flavour database have been developed to calculate the best match, the best replacement,... One of our algorithms is able to replace an ingredient (and quantity) with the best matching alternative taking restrictions into account. We invest a lot of effort to continuously improve the data and the algorithms.

We will create a website to make a personal profile including dietary restrictions, ratings of dishes and ingredients (explicite information). The tool to assist during recipe search will be a Chrome plugin. From the usage and behaviour of searching recipes, the tool will learn and improve flavour profile of each user.

Whenever you visit a recipe online, your plug-in will be able to translate the recipe into a flavour (taste and aroma) description. This flavour description will be compared to your flavour profile and a liking score will be generated. By selecting an ingredient from the recipe, suggestions will appear with an indication how much they will improve your liking. In case ingredients you don' t like e.g. cilantro appear in the recipe or you have a gluten allergy, the automatic suggestion will indicate and suggest solutions. When an alternative is selected, the quantities of the recipe will be recalculated.

The Chrome plugin is a starting point for the services we want to develop, a proof of concept.ÿ",Service provider,,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Consumer application,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,www.foodpairing.com,SME,25000,foodpairing.com

ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ Industryÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ ÿÿÿÿÿÿOnline Event and Concert Promotions

ÿ

Gigdiving has identified huge market need and growth for the live music events and concerts industry across the globe. The revolutionary platform enable the fans drive the live music industry via using a pull-approach. The platform will be easily scalable such that any number of customers and features with high demand can be added to the platform without any inconvenience based on customer need
ÿ

Gigdiving (the ?Company?) is a young and vibrant platform in the online live event and concert industry. The headquarters of the company is located in Utrecht, the Netherlands. The focus will initially be on eight countries: the Netherlands, China, Taiwan and their neighbouring countries. The opportunity Gigdiving offers is to make the fans and bands finally reach each other, while currently they are struggling to find each other and make event happen. Gigdiving offers online platform which is primarily driven by the fan base (by the demand-side of the live music industry or called as pull approach) and stimulated and managed by the artists. ÿGigdiving has the first mover advantage, as there aren?t many platforms that enable the fans to drive or directly influence the live music industry. The platform will officially launch from January 2015 and will serve as a one-stop destination for all the stakeholders in the live music events and concert industry.
ÿ

During the first year of operation, Gigdiving will largely be focused on customer acquisition (by connecting the artists and fans), marketing, PR, and building a world-class technology team to sustain a rock solid infrastructure. Gigdiving will create a buzz and allow the company to give amazing top-notch service to the initial customers. The company will also target certain profitable segments and will expand in a phase approach.
ÿ

The company will partner with various strategic alliances (e.g. booking agents, other indie music platforms, sponsors, promoters, etc.) to provide quality services to its customers. The company is also very keen on providing the latest features on the online event and concert promotion industry backed up by lower prices and reliable services. We will stand out with high quality by using cutting edge technology, providing first-hand information, enhancing user experience, experienced management team and state-of-the-art customer care for its customers.
ÿ

The market demand for live music and concert has been growing across the globe. The current supply in the industry is given by a few large operators, servicing the demand from customers. Yet, there is no online platform provider that offers successful specialized services to serve the purpose for make fans and bands reach each other, eliminating the risk for the middleman in the live music and concert industry. Foreseeing a demand for these services across the globe, Gigdiving would like to penetrate into the market with a phased approach.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

22,CREA22,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Freelens,Freelens,"Dellestraat, 5, 3220 Holsbeek, Belgium",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Ben Wynants,"Freelens LLC is an enterprise aimed at creating Software as a Service for B2B selling. The software allows smartphone users to connect wirelessly with pre-installed camera?s at fixed points for new perspectives. This gives the smartphone user the ability to see what the external camera is seeing, have the ability to take pictures with the external camera that functions as a third lens to his/her smartphone, and receive these photos instantly on his/her device (smartphone/tablet). All of this with seamless integration of these photos into the cameraroll of the user.
ÿ

We will be selling predominantly B2B, more specifically we have zoomed in on a select handful of target customer segments: the event sector (festivals/conferences/?), clothing stores, urban experience, tourism, city-marketing and city games. Our pilot-projects are currently several small clothings stores and two larger festival events in Belgium. The ambitions are to become a global versatile player in the software as a service (SaaS) for the remote controlled cameras market.
ÿ
The value added is that all photos taken with these cameras will be branded with the logos and marketing content the B2B customer wishes to display on it.

For music festivals this can be the sponsors or the festival itself, for clothing stores their brand, for cities the cityname and touristic referrals, etc.ÿ This is explained more precisely in the PDF with supporting materials
In the segment of events we help the organisors or sponsors with:
Content creation (own content + user generated content) and we optimalise the conversation potential surrounding their brand/event.
We increase their visibility, during the event as well as after the event.
The pictures with branded tag are uploaded to social media, businesses can use this opportunity to promote their brand.
Business can generate data from their customers.
ÿ
In the segment of clothing stores we offer the owners of the stores:
A unique way to integrate social media management

The ability to allow their customers to discuss doubtful purchases with their soundboard (partner, friends, parents, ?) in real-time with feedback on visual (branded) content of the customer trying on the clothes.
Increased shopping impulse for the soundboard.
An extra in-store shop experience pulling customers into the stores.
ÿ

It is important to notice that the user is not the buyer. The users are the festival visitors or the customers buying clothes in stores and taking head-to-toe pictures. The buyers are the event organisers and clothing stores trying to expand their brand reach and visibility.
ÿ

The technical implementation of this wireless connection builds on Bluetooth for 1o1 relations and close proximity. For one-to-many relationships (multiple users at the same time) Wi-fi connectivity is enabled, being carried on a local Wi-Fi network or 3G (or higher) data connection.
ÿ

We started of as a manufacturer of hardware, having built a few minimum viable products (prototypes) for this third lens to your smartphone application. However, recently we shifted gears to focussing on the software enabling this remote wireless communication with cameras leveraging on the existing cameras of Sony. Here we are building on an open API beta SDK Sony has licensed. This gives us a faster time to market projection, less resources required and cheaper overall production.
ÿ
Extra: We do not exclude selling directly to individuals but are aiming at businesses for their bigger market size.
Link:
https://developer.sony.com/downloads/camera-file/sony-camera-remote-api-beta-sdk/",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

24,CREA24,CREA,CREAtiFi,Germany,HearDis! Corporate Sound GmbH,PLAYERMAKER,"Eberhardstraáe 61, 70173 Stuttgart, Germany",BUSINESS SERVICES,B2B,4,10,YES,IN,Daniel Artur Schindler,"Basic Idea

For over ten years now our SME defines the sound of brands and corporations and provides them with tailor-made music - be it a simple ringtone, the song for a commercial or the curated soundtrack for hundreds of stores. In short: we do Corporate Design for the Ear. Our work is closely linked to an extensive archive, filled with tagged music files ranging from little known underground tracks to mainstream hits. Our idea is to make this archive accessible to our brand clients with a closed platform named PLAYERMAKER, offering scalable services for 3 major scenarios. Thus brands will be allowed to present music in a clearly defined way to dedicated customer groups - think of Soundcloud with a dedicated business-to-business use.
ÿ

One might immediately have the impression that such services already exist in abundance. However the very opposite is true, since all current applications (Spotify etc) had been developed for end consumers. Companies at the backend though completely lack means to control the actual distribution of music. To date no commercial application is available, which offers to businesses eg. one of the following 3 services:
allow for a specified number of free downloads of tracks (eg. first 666 for a gothic album)
offer novel/niche music we hold valid licenses for, but which are not yet licensed by the cloud service itself and are hence systematically blocked
offer dedicated 24h radio program as promotional gift to business clients instead of the usual ashtrays/umbrellas (eg. ?Lavazza Radio? for coffee bars)

Soundcloud offers single track / playlists sharing, Deezer and Spotify enable continuous streams. Our past cooperations with these well-established platforms though proved their inadequacy for sophisticated services for the above reasons. Our envisioned platform specifically aims at business to business use, the focus is on a creative agency?s needs to overcome such restrictions.
ÿ
Target Market
We particularly want to enhance and improve typical business cases like the following for brands using music in marketing activities:
Selecting music for clients that they can licence for their video productions. We call this use ?Compilation Player?.
Supplying clients with reviews of record releases or interviews, supplemented by a stream and/or download of a song. We call this use ?Embedding Player?.
Selling to our clients a 24h streaming radio which they can offer as a sponsored marketing tool to various outlets. We call this use ?Radio Player?. (cf. 4.1)
Advantages / Business Model
Commercial advantages on several levels:
ÿ
Immediate: Saving time resources
Undue portions of working time no longer ?wasted? by disproving copyright infringement claims from Soundcloud for tracks legally licenced by us
Smoothening of workflows
ÿ
Near future: Decisive product portfolio expansion
Advanced streaming service functionalities
Ability to deliver fresh, little known content (eg ?new releases radio?)
Deliver to shop owners a ready-made, emotionally engaging radio program without repetition, geared to their target group
Sell this service to brands that sponsor it to be used by smaller outlets (eg. beer brewery can sponsor a ?Beer Radio? for bars)

In contrast to Spotify?s new ?Soundtrack Your Brand? approach our service will not rely on the small portion of music-savvy shop/bar owners, but will address the majority, who are no music specialists. We will concentrate on this main use case to explain our sales strategy and evaluate challenges and risks (5.4).
ÿ
Future: Licensing
Grant platform access to other audio branding agencies and editorial teams

Sell a package license of the platform to be installed on their cloud servers",Tech provider,,X,X,X,0,0,,Software,Content management,Applications,Content Applications,1,X,http://heardis.com/,SME,50000,heardis.com

column2: Jacobs Gesellschaft fr audiovisuelle Medien und Kommunikationstechnologien mbH,Social Graphics Connected TV,"Kantstraáe 43, 04275 Leipzig, Germany",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Hoferichter &amp
column3: Jacobs GmbH,"We are a professional and experienced media production company always seeking for the maximum quality on tv and on second screen devices. ÿWith the project ""Social Graphics Connected TV"" we develop a multi-screen Connected TV service for factual TV formats with a customizable tile-based design on TV and tablet. It supports standard content types (text, video, social feeds), as well as multi-screen interactive infographics and multimedia documentary shorts.

column1: With this we react to the changes of our core partners, the broadcasters. They changed their story telling from a solely linear structure to an interactive platform.
ÿ
ÿ

The tool will be a useful device for the audience to interact with non-fiction content. They can take part in questionnaires, can discuss about the topic and furthermore have the chance to get more information on specific topics. Our example is based on the interaction with a non-ficition tv series called ?Exakt ? So leben wir!? by the MDR. This series works with many graphics and data. This way our prototype has the opportunity and the very special potencial to really take part in an interactive programm and to suppport the existing brand.
ÿ

Creating a second screen concept will enhance the audience experience with this kind of format. The audience has the chance to take part in a topic which affects them in their life as well. The content of the audiovisual concept is close to the lifestyle of their audience. This urges the user to tell their experiences or to be part of the discussing community. The special chance we have is to ipmlement our submitted project within a working tv brand such as ""So leben wir"" to reach many users. Each episode of ""So leben wir!"" has about 700.000-1.000.000 viewers nation wide.
ÿ
Within this submitted project we want to work together with graphic designers, developers and programmers to create the needed programming for those two devices.

Broadcasters have a high demand for such solutions to connect more intense with their audience. Still their budgets are tight. Our flexible solution avoids from-scratch software development and is marketed as part of a holistic content concept. Broadcasters outsource the majority of their productions to external companies. We have a long-standing business relationship with several broadcasters on the German market. Their editorial departments are increasingly faced with the need to develop interactive concepts, but have only scarce experience in interactive content and application development. This is why it is hard for technology companies to sell service concepts. We are now able to build a network with experienced technical staff to create the needed interactive programms. This submitted solution can be the first step in integrating smart interactive solutions within non-fiktion tv experiences. It has the potential to create a new way of projects and contents for a new generation of hosts or broadcasters and interactive platforms.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

27,CREA27,CREA,CREAtiFi,Switzerland,idezo GmbH,Ghosts of Venice,"Stampfenbachstrasse 32, 8006 Zurich, Switzerland","Consumer education/culture, Consumer leisure/gaming",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Mark Melnykowycz,"Ghosts of Venice is an augmented reality application focused on delivering a combination of ghost story adventure and mobile game experience in Venice, Italy. After a successufl launch of the application in Venice, we plan to offer expansion to other cities, but each app will be tailored to the specific history and elements of those locations. This enhances the value of the location of each project, as they can only be experienced fully in the cities they take place in. Ghosts of Venice is seen as a progenitor to further AR ghost applications in other cities throughout the world.

Ghosts of Venice will tell ghost stories, which are based on the history and unique architectural features of Venice. Operating through a smartphone (and later through AR glasses), users will be able to search for and view ghosts while following stories through the city.

The ghosts are defined as 3D models in the application. These ghost are created in different ways by mixing traditional filming in a studio with 3D modeling technologies. Ghosts can be represented as a 2D video layer, which is played as a 3D texture layer on the architecture of buildings in Venice. Additionally, we will use 3D scanning technology and animate the ghost models. This can be done by creating the 3D scan of an actor and then rigging the virtual bond structure (for example with Mixamo) and animating it. Additionally, by using the RGB-D toolkit, ghosts can be created by filming actors with the combination of a Microsft Kinect and a HD video camera (2D image). The result is a depth map of 3D data with video texture from the 2D camera.

As an AR app and mixed-reality film, Ghosts of Venice also includes elements of gameplay to enhance the way users follow ghosts through the city. By implementing different FIWARE specific enablers, we are able to integrate social interaction and game play into the experience.

Ghosts of Venice will be sold as a stand-alone application in the Apple and Android app stores. The primary revenue source will be the cost of the app to users, with a target price of 5-10 Euros, similar to the cost of an ebook or interactive app. Beyond the direct revenue source, the opportunity will develop for relational sales to local businesses, or integration with cultural entities such as museums to increase their visitor volume and sales.

As a location-based storytelling experience, the application can increase the value of locations to users. This allows the ability for local businesses and cultural organizations to benefit from having the app in their locality. It is foreseen that partnerships can be developed to allow for integration with local businesses as part of the ghost stories, and increase their sales.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

Why is this product unique - there is no software product on the market which offers the key functionality in one product - EASY TO USE without having trained an expert!
ÿ

iLogic is scalable with worldwide demand. Transportation and logistics is a global industry. The reduction of trade barriers internationally has led to rapid growth in the logistics market. And as world trade grows, so do challenges for the transportation and logistics industry. Worldwide, more than $1.4 trillion is spent annually on logistics and the amount will grow with the continued expansion of the global marketplace. 29,CREA29,CREA,CREAtiFi,Greece,Innovators SA,makerstack.org,"Antheon 1, 17456 Alimos, Greece",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Petros Makris,"Makerstack aims to be a community-driven, web-based platform that will enable makers to co-create or promote projects and ideas through information sharing and crowd-funding by minimizing requirements for fully functioning prototypes and time-consuming prototype promotion campaigns. Makerstack will accelerate the process of instantiating a new business idea by a maker or a team of makers applauding collaboration and allowing community funding even when a project prototype might not have been completed.
ÿ
In order to promote an innovative idea, makers typically 1) develop prototypes which prove their idea's validity
column2: 2) search for funding opportunities in order to reproduce the prototype applying large-scale manufacturing methods and bulk supplying of raw materials thus minimizing production cost.ÿMakerstack is addressing this problem by creating a web-platform, supported by a network of makers, whose rank and reputation is the key factor for a community-based fund raising. The rank and reputation system, is a key component which is usually missing in today's crowd founding web-platforms
column3: a maker is required or even obliged to present a prototype of a business idea in order to start or join a crowd funding campaign which is usually time-consuming and requires resources which may not be accessible by any maker.ÿ

column1: ÿ
Makerstack as a service providing platform is designed as a two-component system
column2: the first component comprises a domain-oriented, tag-based information sharing and exchange library while the second component is a crowd founding enabled project presentation section which will promote makers' projects and prototypes based on makers' reputation and skills. The information exchange service is the core component of Makerstack which is to be a modern, maker-oriented, tag supporting, question-and-answer-based library which aims at enabling makers sharing knowledge, skills and experiences as well as getting feedback and further elaborate or expand creative ideas and projects. ÿInformation exchange will operate on a membership basis
column3: each member is building reputation and acceptance by the community, during his/her involvement, utilising a sophisticated ranking system.ÿ

column1: ÿ

The crowd-funding component enables the funding of a maker or creator counting in the reputation gained. Highly accepted and trust-worthy makers can easily form teams that may pursue community funding avoiding the time and resource consuming step of creating detailed prototypes or analyzing challenges and risks that may not be obvious/visible when starting a new project. The Makerstack's sophisticated member ranking system is mainly based on the members' participation in the information sharing library by utilizing a community voting system but it will also exploit metrics, data and sources of external web sites when available. These data and metrics that are correlated to members
column2: such as Stack-overflow user's reputation, Github.com activity for software developers or Etsy.com reviews and sales for Etsy members etc, hackaday.io skulls will accelerate building presentable experience and reputation.

column1: ÿ
Makerstack is planned as two phase project comprised byÿ
ÿ
Development, testing and deployment of the public access information library which is to enable the makers' community building
Implementation and deployment of the makers collaboration and fund supporting platform that relies on an established networking of makers (Phase 1)
ÿ

31,CREA31,CREA,CREAtiFi,Germany,Baufeld plus Projektentwicklung GmbH,ITEMSO - cloud storage of physical goods,"Sternstraáe 67, 20357 Hamburg, Germany",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Oliver Ritzmann,"THE IDEA
ÿ

The idea of ITEMSO was born at home - the wardrobe is filled up with cloth, the storeroom is filled up with Christmas decoration and other items which are not of daily use, the cabinets are full of old exams which ned to be kept ring binders are piling up with tax declarations, records of completed projects and other documents which need to be kept due to tax legislation. We consume constantly and day by day more items are filling up our homes. For sure, this is not an individual problem ? this is THE problem of the urban population in metropolitan areas. YOU NEED SPACE!
ÿ
What to do with items you want to keep, but do not need (at the moment)?
ÿ

Public self-storage warehouses are not the solution ? too time consuming and rather for large items and space problems. Further it requires time to organize cardboard boxes and to deliver and pick up your items.
ÿ
THE ISSUE?
ÿ

Real estate prices are climbing up in major metropolitan areas, rent is increasing and floor space of apartments is decreasing. Lifestyle increases and for hobbies we always need the right gear and equipment ? biking, hiking, snowboarding, kite surfing ? you name it!
We all talk about paperless office, but we still need to keep tax records, don?t want to throw our bachelor theses away and love to hold a book in our hands from time to time?
We own 1000 CD?s, but have all our music in a cloud ? available on any device!
Every year before Christmas and Easter we decorate our home with passion and love, but where to put it afterwards?
We consume day by day ? buy things we must have and items we don?t need!
Things are piling up ? we need space to fill space to keep things we don?t need!
ÿ
THE SOLUTION
ÿ
ITEMSO - cloud storage of physical goods. ITEMSO is the new way of urban storage ? you box it ? we store it!

Simply go online, register instantly with your Facebook account, select the number of boxes you need for the items you want to store and select a delivery day / time / service which is convenient to you ? done!

As requested the empty storage boxes are delivered ? to your door! You decide how long it takes you to box it. Keep an online inventory of your items you store, so that you can trace them easily in case you need them. Schedule a pick up once you are done or drop it conveniently at one of the drop off points of the parcel providers.ÿ
Storage has never been easier and the best thing ? you decide when and where and don?t have to leave your home!

Self storage is nothing new ? just in UKit is a 355 million pound market. More and more public self storage warehouses opening their doors to customers renting out minimum space of 1 square meter. Even those providers are offering their customers rental vans to attract them ? customers need to move their things to storage and pick them up. For bulky items it is a good solution ? but not for the everyday items.

ITEMSO is covering the gap between storing items at home and at public storage ? cloud storage of physical goods! This is the outstanding concept of remote storage ? the customer orders a standard storage box which is delivered within 24 hours and is returned full! This can be done conveniently at home. For all boxes an inventory is kept online in order to trace the items boxed.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

32,CREA32,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,Esplori Societ? a responsabilit? limitata semplificata,Konoz,"Via Bachelet, 4, Fondazione Democenter - Sede di Spilamberto Via Bachelet, 41057 Spilamberto (MO), Italy",EDUCATION,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Federico Pistono,"Konoz is an e-learning platform where YouTube creators can publish and crowdfund their courses.
ÿ

Education is on the three fastest growing categories on YouTube, accounting for hundreds of thousands of education creators in 61 languages and 80% of the traffic outside the US. Although YouTube has proven to be the best website for sharing videos, it is not a good place for learning. Its business model is based on advertising, which tend to value videos that attract a lot of views regardless of their quality. On the video creator?s side, it is difficult to earn enough revenue from educational content as they usually don?t draw as much attention as entertainment content. On the viewer?s side, there are no e-learning tools that could grant them a real learning experience and they are constantly faced with disturbing and intrusive ads.
ÿ

Konoz approach is to bring YouTube creators of educational content to an e-learning platform where they can turn their videos into structured courses and be monthly supported by their audience. The video creation is made through the integration of pre-made YouTube playlists with further category and language selection. The contributions to courses are made either monthly or one time, in exchange by perks offered by the course creators, such as: downloadable material, skype calls, etc, and will be editable by the creators. All courses are free of charge and embedded with additional e-learning tools, such as: course progress, course breakdown, study groups, student creations, and commenting system.
ÿ

Konoz technology is available for free for both course creators and students. Our business model is based on revenue share from crowdfunding (10%).",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

33,CREA33,CREA,CREAtiFi,UK,LastMile Technologies Ltd,treev - a product from LastMile Technologies Ltd,"20-22 Wenlock Road , N17GU London, United Kingdom",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,2,1,YES,IN,Alexander Weidauer,"treev is a solution that bridges the gaps between web apps used in the workplace like Gmail, Dropbox, and many more (i.e. ?enterprise web?).
ÿ

Today, SMBs typically use over 10 different web apps. This proliferation of web apps creates new problems. A major time-consuming problem for employees and businesses is finding information within these ?silos? and transferring data between them.

Our vision is to connect the enterprise web with easy-to-use software seamlessly integrated into the workflow of the modern knowledge worker. Our USP is created through our user experience and technology (e.g. Natural Language Processing).
ÿ

treev?s first product lets users find and share files across multiple cloud storage solutions like Dropbox, Google Drive and Box. It will be available as a browser plugin. Based on feedback and usage,we will iterate quickly and bring treev to other platforms such as mobile phones and tablets. Moreover, we plan to provide third party developers with the ""treevAPI"" so that they can integrate treev straight into their products.
ÿ

treev operates on a freemium model: knowledge workers use the product for free while business licenses (6?/month/user) drive revenue. The latter will include different benefits for businesses such as advanced security (e.g. hosting on own servers) and analytics (e.g. identification of experts among co-workers). Freemium is a proven business model for SaaS solutions. We expect revenues from open beta onwards (see financial plan). However, we do not expect to break even before 2017.
ÿ

Our target audience contains customers and users. We have identified SMBs (e.g. Startups) using modern web apps like Gmail, Salesforce and Dropbox as our initial group of customers. In fact, such customers have proven to be willing to invest in solutions that make their employees more productive. Knowledge workers (e.g. sales reps) within such businesses are our target users. As proliferation of web apps reaches corporations, large businesses will be added to our customer group at a later stage.
ÿ",Tech provider,,X,0,X,0,0,,Software,File Synchronization and Sharing Software,Applications,Collaborative Applications,1,X,http://treev.co,Startup,50000,treev.co

35,CREA35,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Nuboid bvba,Trizorg.TV,"KLEITKALSEIDE 89, 1-01, 9990 MALDEGEM, Belgium",HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Kurt Claeys,"Solution for social interactivity between elderly and their relatives or caregivers and mental health condition monitoring through TV
ÿ
http://www.trizorg.tv
ÿ

TRIZORG.TV is an open platform for social interaction between elderly in care homes and their caregivers and relatives through TV and mobile applications resulting in monitoring and increasing mental health conditions.
ÿ
The purpose is:
To gather content supporting the mental wellbeing of the elderly from various sources (family and caregivers) towards one single medium the elderly is familiar to use: their TV set.
Stimulate elderly in social web participation by using TV.
Remotely connecting family with elderly relative.
Maintaining/Increasing the mental health condition of the elderly.
ÿ
Ask the elderly about his/her well-being by having a personalized set of social oriented questions to get a better view of their mental conditions.
ÿ
To detect potential negative trends in their mental health condition by monitoring the usage of the content and the feedback/answers to the questions on a time scale.
ÿ
ÿ
Elderly and their relative will like this solution as it stimulates elderly in social web participation and remotely connects the family.

There is a great value for the home care organization: TRIZORG.TV prevents the elderly from being hospitalized outside the care center as potential aging issues caused by decreasing mental conditions can be detected early through the social interaction and treated proactively by fine-tuning the content.

TRIZORG.TV supports the creation of a set of questions to be answered by the elderly through the TV channel using a simplified remote control. These answers are valuable data to detect trends in metal health conditions.

Use cases:

People having mother/father staying in care homes can compose a personalized TV Channel with the content they like to share. This content can be video messages from them or a set of pictures of the grandchildren. This content will always make the elderly happy.

Caregivers offering a set of exercises videos for keeping the elderly both physically and mentally healthy.
3th party content providers that publish videos helping in particular aging issues like dementia.
Care homes publishing videos about the care center which makes to elderly more comforably : where to find what, what in case of emergency ?
ÿ
Another use case which makes the most value for the caregiver organizations.

Asking simple questions every day like ?how do you feel today? and reporting this over time gives a great insight in mental health evolution. This insight allows to help elderly proactive and avoid hospitalization caused by mental issues.

Open platform:

Trizorg.TV is based on open technologies and will therefore also be very open.
