37,CREA37,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Palaplu BVBA,bbblz,"Sleepstraat 80, 9000 Gent",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Palaplu BVBA,"bbbl? bbblz? Elaba!? What?s what?
a bbbl is a popup social network app that mirrors the unique &amp
column2: intense feeling of a community or event

column1: bbblz is an open-source framework to create countless unique popup social network apps
Elaba! 2015 is a prototype bbbl app we wish to create using the bbblz framework, that will be launched at the 10 day-street festival ?Gentse Feesten? in Belgium, in July 2015
ÿ
USP of the bbblz framework
bbblz is an open-source framework for iOS and Android that you can use to create a unique popup social network app.ÿ
ÿ
Why would you want to use a bbbl?
That true digital ?summer camp feeling?

Everyone remembers that unique group of friends at their first summer camp and that unique atmosphere at the latest music festival. Today?s most popular digital social networks don?t reflect that ephemeral intensity and unique feeling of real life?s ?popup connections?.

A bbbl enables its users to digitally enhance the fun of an event or a community, since the popup network app digitally connects people who are physically together at the same time. While posting is only possible from within the party zone and during the duration of the event, reading &amp
column2: commenting is possible from anywhere. Thus, a bbbl also allows those who can?t be there physically, to share the fun virtually.

column1: ÿ
Share with those who care
With your best friend, you like to meet up at home, to share joys and sorrows. With the guys from the soccer team, you like to hang out at the pub &amp
column2: share a few beers. Today?s social networks hardly allow users to make distinctions between these types of communication. Sharing your thoughts, activities, or feelings on Facebook or Twitter may feel as sharing your most intimate feelings with the guys from the soccer team. You get it: awkward?

column1: When you share a post on a bbbl you know you share only with those who care. Every post you see on a bbbl will be related tot the specific atmosphere of the event, creating an enjoyable and unique feeling of togetherness.
ÿ
Live in the digital moment

When you visit a real life event, you might want to connect with people digitally as well, and share the fun. But do you, at the same time, want to read about global warming, and rising tax rates? Existing social networks make it hard to let go of the daily strains of life.
When you post in a bbbl, you stay in the momentum of the event or community. Every bbbl breathes the cultural history, typical characteristics &amp
column2: unique atmosphere of the event or community it is made for. The user interface (UI) design suits the event?s design, the custom stories refer to the activities of the event, and the custom made stickers allow you to season your pictures with quotes in the typical slang or dialect of the event. ÿÿ

column1: ÿ
Connect with the in-crowd

Today?s social networks never just connect you with a specific group who?s gathered at the same time, at the same place, for the same real-life experience. Quick communication with this specific group through social networks is hard.

By integrating location services into the app, a bbbl allows the event?s organisers to communicate directly with their audiences through the visitors? smartphones. Organisers can advertise a happy hour to the people standing right in front of their bar. In case of emergencies, people in certain areas can quickly be notified to take the necessary actions.
ÿ
Our goal

Our goal is to build a prototype of the bbblz frontend framework and apply it to the development of the Elaba! prototype app, available for iOS and Android, during the 10 day-street festival ?Gentse Feesten? in Belgium, in July 2015. The Elaba! app will serve as an important use case and market validation for the bbblz framework.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

39,CREA39,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Possibly Pixels BVBA,The Improver Platform - Health Coaching through Internet and Gaming,"Toekomststraat 6, 3583 Beringen-Paal, Belgium",Consumer health/wellness,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jeroen Wauters,"The opportunity
ÿ

Due to our increasingly hectic lifestyles, the aging population and the rising cost of health care, physical and mental health have become a booming business. Personal trainers are helping people to get fit, nutritionists are teaching everyone to respect a healthy diet, and people turn to psychologists to help them battle stress or depression.

Ready2improve is a Flemish SME that has built a business around this. It unites specialists from all of the aforementioned fields and more, to provide clients with an integrated solution for all their health coaching needs. Using techniques from motivational psychology, such as self-determination theory andÿ gamification, each client is provided with a custom and personalized face-to-face coaching experience to maximize their personal benefit. This approach has been successfully used by R2i for several years, not only for private persons, but also for companies aiming to improve the wellbeing of their employees.
ÿ
The problem
ÿ

However, this personalized approach also has downsides. Not only is it very time-consuming for the coaches to manage their users, the many-to-many relationship between coaches and clients (coaches will be assigned to many clients, but clients can also have multiple coaches, each with their own unique specialization) also creates a significant administrative overhead.
ÿ

In addition, the reliance on personal contact between coach and coachee means that users lack continuous feedback, and can only be guided during their infrequent (usually weekly) coaching sessions. This is especially problematic considering corrective feedback about undesirable behavior is most efficient when provided at the instant the undesirable behavior occurs.
ÿ
Our solution
ÿ

We want to tackle both of these problems at once by creating a unified web platform, to be used by coaches and coachees alike. We will gather relevant data from coachees using a variety of sensors, both general (smart phones and watches) and dedicated (fitness bracelets etc), filter and process this data and present it to the user in a comprehensible and clear format. Initially we will measure number of steps, active minutes, calorie intake and calories burned, heart rate, sleep patterns, and more, but this will be extended in the future as technology allows. At the same time, coaches can access the data of their clients and provide feedback accordingly, much faster and more accurately than they could before.
ÿ
For the coaches, the platform will also represent an all-in solution to their business needs: they can get an overview of all their clients
column2: store personal notes about their clients and share them with other coaches or with clients
column3: track invoices
column4: send mails, articles, recipes or other useful info
column5: manage their agendas
column6: and more, all through a single piece of software that is accessible anywhere, at any time. All that?s required is an internet connection.

column1: ÿ

For coachees, the platform will provide new ways of motivation for and engagement with managing their health. The availability of sensor-collected data and the more direct interaction with coaches are only the first step towards this goal. In the longer term, we will also include multiple full-blown health games about a variety of topics (movements, healthy eating, stress management, quitting smoking?) for interested users.
ÿ

Important to note is that the platform is not intended as a replacement for face-to-face coaching, but rather an extension of it. We strongly believe in a vision where health professionals are responsible for mentoring and motivating people to optimize their health, and we want to provide them with the tools to make that job easier.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
40,CREA40,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,RaceAlerts,RaceAlerts,"Bampslaan 21, Bus 3.01, 3500 Hasselt, Belgium","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,koen Huybrechts,"Everybody likes winning.
Our clients are racing teams and tuners who want their car to win the race! They worked hard on their car and damage to it, must be avoided.
ÿ
RaceAlerts is an Internet of Things (IoT) service for racing teams that alerts the team when their car has an increased risk of getting damaged and losing the race or generating unforseen costs.
We collect live sensor data on our IoT platform and continuously monitor data and generate a variety of alerts to the user if values reach a critical point.
ÿ

In the BeNeLux, there are ? 200 semi-professional racing teams. They operate a few cars each and keeping them in best condition, is very important. Our market research has shown there is no service like RaceAlerts available for our target group. The existing systems aim for the professional racing teams with similar budget.
We aim to sell RaceAlerts to 50% of them (100 racing teams). They represent a first market of at least 374 000 EUR.
ÿ
During the 24h of Zolder, we performed a market research amongst potential clients (including teamchefs, teamowners) about RaceAlerts. All of them acknowledge there is no service like RaceAlerts.
Only datalogging products are available on the market. The team can download data when they have physical access to the car.
RaceAlerts sends its data wireless over existing m2m infrastructure to our cloud infrastructure.
ÿ

We developed 2 working prototypes and had them installed in cars of different racing teams during the Menzo 24h of Zolder. Both cars finished the race and gathered data. Together there are more than 500 000 datapoints that we visualised on multiple graphs. Nobody is interested in just the data. Only if there is an alert!
ÿ

Based on the experience with the prototype, we continue development of RaceAlerts, but also important, we already sold 2 RaceAlert systems. This year, we?d like to expand our network and build a list of leads, so we can boost sales. The first sales will be made by direct sale in the BeNeLux region, while we setup a website to do online sales. Furthermore, we are getting in contact with potential resellers.
ÿ

RaceAlerts was invented and developed by a team of 3 with a complementary set of skills. Eddy focussed on providing input on features and keeping contact with multiple racing teams. Toon designed and developed the platform, while Koen did project management and business development. On a regular basis we discussed progress with a connected racing team to make sure we are heading in the right direction. Recently, we got in touch with Wouter Moons to guide us on the business side of the project.
ÿ

At this moment, we invested 50 000 EUR to develop a working prototype. Now it?s time to take a step back and take a look at the bigger picture. We have to start thinking on further development of business around RaceAlerts. In the near future, we are looking for an operating line of 125 000 EUR to finance our first year. The biggest share of this budget is required to work on the business plan and encounter opportunities that will boost our sales. We estimate to sell RaceAlerts to 20 racing teams in our first year.
Once we have successfully launched RaceAlerts, we will develop a derived product to launch this in other markets.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

CONTEXT:
ÿ

More and more content is shared on social networks and it has become a challenge for media site to identify what kind of information will trigger high volumes of social interactions on their sites and on their social profiles.
ÿ
Facebook displays more proiminently what generates the more interactions per impression. To be visible in the NewsFeed, community managers must find engaging content to post.

Many tools now make it possible to know the performance of websites and their impact on the social networks (Google Analytics, Hootsuite, ...). They all have their limitations per platform or per number of sources and we decided to go further with Graphystories.ÿ

OUR SOLUTION
ÿ
Graphystories is a new tool that analyzes the news and their social ranking. It performs the intelligent analysis of large volumes of data from leading media sites and social networks.ÿ

With real-time monitoring of the main sites and media facebook pages, the tool notifies content creators of topics and provides related articles that have attracted most social networks. Graphystories analyzes the impact of social interactions of media websites.ÿA predefined list of sites is provided by our tool. Graphystories allows information monitoring:

Graphystories allows users to access all the subjects that make the buzz on the internet. Our tool combines data from Google Trends to suggest keywords than can help our customers increase their visibility in the Google News Search index.

42,CREA42,CREA,CREAtiFi,The Netherlands,ReSnap BV,Deep learning photo data,"Toernooiveld 216, Mercator 1, 6525EC Nijmegen, Netherlands",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Erik-Jan Schreurs,"ÿ

Everyday more than 100 million photos are made. All those content is spread across the Internet. The challenge for a consumer is to keep track of all the online content containing great memories. People are looking for ways to collect all this content back at one place to relive these memories and to share it with family and friends, both in the digital and physical world. The best way to share a collection of the best memories is a photo book. Therefore the photo book market is a big growing market worldwide. For example it is a billion euro market in both Western Europe and The United States. Creating a photo book is quite a hassle. Besides the creation steps for making a photo book are too complicated, the biggest problem is it takes you several days to gather all the photos out of all the different data sources and afterwards selecting your best moments out of this. This is not the only problem consumers are facing when making photo books, but also when they just want to gather all their online moments and relive and share the best ones.
ÿ
More abstract it can be stated that there are three major problems/challenges when making (tangible) personalized products out of big data:
1.ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ Gather all the content out of several big data sources
2.ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ Select the best content out of big data
3.ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ Transform this selection into an online experience, which can also be ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ printed/tangalized.
An extra challenge is to do the three things below, within a short amount of time.
ÿ

ReSnap is going to develop the perfect solution for these three challenges, using the newest deep learning and machine learning techniques. ReSnap will give a new dimension at creating and sharing (online) photo stories and the creation of photo albums will never be a problem anymore. Users will never need to spend time with gathering all the photos out of all the data sources anymore, nor with selecting the best ones.
ÿ

The service that we will offer, will be the perfect way to gather all you best online moments and store and share them in a new way of an online photo story, which also can be ordered in a tangible product. ReSnap will be the solution, because our selection algorithms can always select the best content within 1 minute and place it in an online photo story perfectly. This means that social media will not be the only data source the system will use, but the system will also be able to select the best 100 pictures out of (for example) 1000 on every desired data source like desktop or mobile.
ÿ

The smart selection can be done through the use of a neural networks and the newest deep learning and machine learning techniques. Because of this services, the ReSnap tool will be the smartest photo tool there is. This is the service, which we will develop during this project.

ÿ
Goalÿ

We want to create good-looking, responsive interactions. Content creators don't want to code and spend time perfecting the user experience. We've done the hard part. Our experiences adapt to all devices, work on Facebook, as an interactive Twitter card or on the creators' website. We provide the tools for the content creators to add challenges, moderate them and visualize the results on any medium (TV, app, social networks, websites...). We provide them with the necessary metrics to analyze the results of their challenges.ÿ
ÿ
Problemÿ
Currentlyÿcontent creators, broadcasters, retailers and brands produce custom apps. This introduces the following problems:
This custom solution isn't cost efficient and offers limited ROI
Budget and time limits result in half-baked apps
User participation is limited, unless good challenges are called for
The apps are hardly ever integrated with existing content platformsÿ
ÿ
Solution
ÿ
1. Content creators can choose from a selection of rich interactive challenges that can be quickly published to any online platformÿ
2. They can track all user contributions in realtime with powerful moderator tools that can manage thousands of challenge contributions in realtime.
3. The content creator can visualize the best challenge contributions on-air (eg. live TV-show) , on smart TV's, on their apps, social networks or websites.ÿ
4. Every challenge is carefully monitored and generates realtime metrics and insights so content producers can immediately analyze the impact of their challenges
5. Based on the impact insights, the concept of the challenges can be tweaked for upcoming content.ÿ
6.ÿContributions can also be disclosed within the client's apps, social networks or websites, thus generating brand loyalty and user retention

Functionality. E.g. creative challenges, social challenges, monetization challenge, educational challenges...

Devices. E.g. tablets, smartphones, TV studio's, cars, smartwatches...

# users
# challenges / month
# contributions / month

47,CREA47,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Small Town Heroes,Quizshow,"Vlaanderenstraat, 78, 9000 Gent, Belgium",TELECOM AND MEDIA,B2B,8,4,YES,OUT,Hendrik Dacquin,"Quizshow is a totally new media format. It's an online, live, participative quiz experience for mass audiences. It enables content creators to create live, daily quiz shows online and enable their viewers to be really part of the show.ÿ
ÿ
Goalÿ

Content consumption is undergoing a radical change to over-the-top content delivery. We can help content creators to jump onto the next wave of content consumption and participation: the second screen becomes the first screen.

(Audiovisual) Content creators will no longer be limited to TV/Radio makers. New media production companies will arrive (universities, cinema's. brands, agencies). We want to provide them with the right set of tools to create participatory content for mass audiences

Content creators can easily create live, participatory Quiz shows for consumption online. They can add quizes, fine-tune the gameflow to their format and integrate the data of the interactive quiz in their live content. We provide them with the necessary metrics to analyze the results and scores and help them monetize the usage by their users, by means of user payments and interactive commercials.ÿ
ÿ
Problemÿ

Content creators are losing market share to innovative companies, monetizing the over-the-top experiences. Our solution helps broadcasters, brands and educational institutions to transform to great content creators online. They will be able to create quiz formats that are interactive by nature.ÿ
Content creators would be able to create a custom solution but thisÿwouldn't be cost efficient and would offer limited ROI.
ÿ
Solution
We thought of a media format solutiom for a new kind of Quizshow that is aired live and over-the-top. With live participation of candidates all over the world.ÿ
ÿ
Content creators can schedule and broadcast their live Quiz shows. They can create a gameflow that matches their own format. ÿ
Viewers can really become part of the show as they compete live against each other every day.ÿ
The content creator can integrate the actions of his users immediately in his content
The Quizshow can be powered with an interactive commercial where users can bid in realtime on e.g. the special offer of the day.ÿ
Business Planÿ
We're looking at monthly subscription plans.ÿParameters that will/could influence the monthly price:ÿ
# users
# quizes / month
# contributions / month
Pre-defined, good looking templates or custom templates
Integration with ad networks and existing CRM systemsÿ
Monetization tools (Realtime Buying/Bidding, user payments) are enabled for enterprise customers. We would purchase a split revenue model for this plan.ÿ
ÿ
Sales and marketing
We're targeting a B2B market of TV makers, cinema vendors. brands and educational institutesÿworldwide.
Partnerships with international content production houses, who specialise in selling media formatsÿ
ÿ
Competition
Although there are several interactive quiz game makers, there is no service platform that would enable content creators to jump on this new wave of content engagement online.ÿ
Although we see existing companies (Applicater, Zentrick) offering similar tools, they are not focused on Quiz formats.
ÿ
Advantageÿ
We have allready developed over 25 apps for TV/radio shows and events.

Our biggest advantage is that we not only offer a technology solution but a mix of creative experiences and advanced tools for content makers. Some of our apps had over 230K download",Tech provider,,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Authoring and Publishing Software,Applications,Content Applications,1,X,http://www.smalltownheroes.be,SME,25000,smalltownheroes.be

49,CREA49,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Startup,Hatchoe,"Korenhof, 14-1, 3550 Zolder, Belgium",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jeroen Reynders,"We are developing a platform that will make it easier for everybody to meet up with people that matter to them. ÿYou can see if your friends or family members are available to have drink, go for a run, or watch a movie instantly. ÿYou can share your ""status"" (I want to go for a run) with your close friends circle, or share it publicly so you can go for a run with other people in your neighbourhood. ÿWe want to make it easier for people with similar interests to find each other in a spontaneous way.

Spontaneous is the key word. ÿWe don't want to be an ""event planner"" but a way to connect with people around you, when you have the time for it. ÿPlease watch the movie we made for Creatifi and the PDF files to convince you of the problem, and of course our solution.ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
50,CREA50,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Startup,MagicWander,"Koolsveldlaan 118, 2110 Wijnegem, Belgium",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Tom Mertens,"NOTICE:
Please view the supplemented VIDEO for a 2-minute introduction of my business idea
Please read my document FIWARE2014_v5.pdf supplemented in section 3.2 which contains the complete motivation for the value my product will offer.
ÿ
MagicWander makes it easy to create and share 3D navigable snapshots of real-world spaces.
ÿ

I will offer a content creation tool that enables people to photograph indoor or outdoor spaces and share them with other people as 3D online experiences. Spaces are captured by taking pictures with smartphones and consumer cameras. These pictures are then automatically processed into a 3D representation that can be explored using a mobile or desktop device by the end-user.ÿ
ÿ

The end-user?s experience is contained in aÿso-called ?viewer? which is similar to an online video player like YouTube?s. The viewer can be embedded and shared in web and mobile environments and even in virtual reality (VR) applications. The end-user will be able to navigate through the captured space by moving and looking in all directions. The experience will inherently be photo-realistic because everything is based on photographs, yet rendered smartly to give a 3D impression.ÿ
ÿ

MagicWander will enable people to effectively convey what a real-world scene or environment looks and feels like through an online experience, and it will serve as an interactive platform for novel commercial applications that is more engaging than existing ones.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
51,CREA51,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,COMATE BVBA,JAAB,"Kapucijnenvoer 101 , 3000 Leuven, Belgium",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Koen Van Roy,"JAAB is the acronym for Journalism as a Brand.ÿ
ÿ
JAAB is an international news platform where individual journalists kan build their personal branding and develop news content monetized in single formats to its personal reader audience.

JAAB has the ambition to be a sustainable alternative for classic business models in news media around the world. We no longer depart from the newspaper or newsgroup as major brand, but instead we depart from the individual journalist as a brand en source for journalistic credibility.
ÿ

JAAB aims at providing a platform for individual journalists to start selling their personal opinions, investigative journalism etc. End user will be able to follow, like and buy individual news pieces via micro payments. Journalists will be able to sell directly to its audience, but also be able to market their work to institutional news corporations, thus providing a de facto freelance network for news gathering for old business model newspapers.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

52,CREA52,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Startup,Workanywhere,"Robbroek 2, 2801 Mechelen, Belgium",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Vincent De Dobbeleer,"WorkAnyWhere is the ""AirBnB for Office Spaces""
ÿ

WorkAnyWhere is a platform allowing companies to rent office space for their commuting employees by the hour, day, week, month or year from other parties with excess office space. These other parties are companies, public venues or residential consumers.
ÿ

In the current model employees typically have two locations to work from: at home or at their company's offices. Both locations have (dis)advantages of their own. WorkAnyWhere will combine the best aspects of both locations and make work more efficient, fun and easy. This benefits the employee (work-life balance, happiness) and the company (productiveness, cost efficiency).
ÿ

The platform allows employees to find a professional office space close(r) to home without being ""home alone"". Employees living closer to each other than to the company's offices can arrange meetings at meeting rooms on the WorkAnyWhere platform. This allows mixing with employees from other companies (through networking) at these WorkAnyWhere spaces, reducing commuting times and avoiding suboptimal working at home.
ÿ

Companies or individuals with excess space can rent out those spaces to WorkAnyWhere users, generating new revenue, optimizing office space costs and enabling networking with other companies and industries.
WorkAnyWhere will be a great tool for start-up companies, employees travelling abroad and sales representatives in between client visits.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

53,CREA53,CREA,CREAtiFi,France,ATACAMA,GURU : The social cloud,"199, chemin des Campeaux, 83560 Saint-Julien, France",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Tournier Julien,"It is said that we only use 10% of our brain capacity...
ÿ

Memory... Processing power... Bandwidth... It is the same for our personal computers...We only use 10% of their potential. So it's time to change the paradigm.ÿWe aim at bulding a cloud based infrastructure using millions of personal computers (and later mobile devices) as nodes instead of servers... this is what we call, the social cloud ! A huge potential unused yet !
ÿ
How can the social cloud helps the creative industry ?
ÿ

The goal of the social cloud is to share and monetize unused resources.ÿToday's rendering issues costs a lot of time to creative studios (videogame, motionmakers, 3D). Most of the time, they outsource these jobs to rendering farms or cloud services (i.e. huge data centers), working as supercomputers dedicated to rendering. It's complicated it can take time and it's expensive !
ÿ
We can make it easier, faster and cheaper
ÿ

Our prototype will offer a plugin for the famous opensource software Blender3D (Shrek, Spiderman 2,...), but we can later develop solutions for video editing softwares such as Adobe After Effects and many more. Our ultimate goal ? To implement our service directly in the operating systems? Our solution can provide additional resource for any creative company in need. Because everyone is connected, any potential customer may also be a potential ressource.ÿ
ÿ
How does it work ?
ÿ

Cloud technology allows to dispatch any calculation job (render is one among many others) through several different clusters of machines. Most of the cloud solutions are server based clusters, let?s create PC based clusters !ÿ

First step, we need potential nodes to monitor their computer in order to measure their unused resources, we have a á version software for that purpose : GURU MONITOR. GURU stands for Global Unused Resources Unit.

Second, we monitor potential nodes for 30 days in order to establish a global ranking. Selected nodes are invited to instal our VM on their computers?so we can use them as effective nodes? later we will distribute a secured encryption USB device for security purpose.
Third, all the shared ressources are measured and can be monetized, but they also can be exchanged with consumed ones. It is a virtuous circle.
ÿ

54,CREA54,CREA,CREAtiFi,France,Startup,Make Your 3D Shape,"8 chemin des champs boyers, 85200 Pissotte, France",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,etienne mallard,"p { margin-bottom: 0.25cm
column2: line-height: 120%

column1: I want to develop an easy to use 3D modelling software so people can use it to print their own ideas in 3D. The website is online at http://www.makeyour3dshape.com
ÿ

This is not the kind of service you use everyday, so you can't afford to learn the software every time you want to use it. There are two main ideas. You can draw freely as if you were in a regular 2D paint program. You can also import svg files to use the curves as constraints. For example you can create your logo from 2D to 3D in a few minutes. And finally you can choose to print on-line, or download the file on your computer.
ÿ
Customer problemÿ:
ÿ

There are tools for people to customize objects prepared by designers. But when people come with their ideas, they don't have a lot of choices. They need to learn a complicated software. In the main approach used by on-line service, they need to learn how to create primitives, do boolean operations, and do extrusions. It's too complicated for people who are new to 3D modelling.
ÿ
Product or service that you will offerÿ:
ÿ

The main service is the 3d modelling software. Around that, we will offer some private account to save projects, and to share a user gallery. User will learn the service using an extensive set of interactive tutorials.
ÿ
Target market / customers :
ÿ
The business is clearly B2C. The main target is 3D first time users. They have never used 3d software, and they want to use the power of 3D printers.
ÿ
Sales &amp
column2: marketing strategy :

column1: ÿ
I need to go to FabLabs, where people are already interested in 3D printing. I want to go to schools, to cultural associations, and 3D printing events.
ÿ
Business model :
ÿ

The user is free to create objects and use all the provided tools. He will pay only when he prints, or downloads the 3D object file. With on-line 3D printers like sculpteo.com, you can get a percentage fee on every object printed from your account.
ÿ
Competitors :
ÿ
www.tinkercad.com From Autodesk, this is the most intuitive on-line service right now.
www.leopoly.com They have exactly the same goal, but they used other ergonomics.
www.jewel.com They also imagined a new way to create 3D objects. They are jewelry oriented.
ÿ
Competitive advantage :
ÿ

My advantage is about software development. I can use any research paper on algorithms, every time there is a user request. I'm also the backend developer, so prototypes can be brought on-line very quickly.
ÿ
Challenges and risks :
ÿ

Business is based on a new user interface. It may not fit the users expectations. The challenge is to adapt to the feedback very quickly. And finally you can't patent ergonomics, so the idea can be easily stolen.
ÿ
Management of the team :
ÿ
After a first try with a potential co-founder, I'm currently alone. My primary concern right now to find someone to work with.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

55,CREA55,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Startup,C? - Collaborating Community Center,"Albert Termotelaan 10, 8810 LICHTERVELDE, Belgium",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Frederik Santens,"Mission statement
Empower &amp
column2: unlock the power of communities through collaboration, co-creation, crowd funding &amp
column3: crowdsourcing.

column1: ÿ
Description
Communities &amp
column2: interest groups have become popular the last few years. Lots of people investÿa largeÿpart of their free timeÿto connect with like-mindedÿpeople, to learn, to networkÿ&amp
column3: to co-create.ÿ

column1: A lot of theseÿinitiatives have found their way to social media sites like Facebook orÿgeneral-purposeÿmeetÿup sites like Meetup.com or Groupspaces, butÿmostÿrun against the limits of these platforms, resulting in:
The misuseÿof the platform
Use of separate online tools lacking any integrationÿbetween them.ÿ
These inefficiencies lead to communities failing to reach their full potential. It is a pain we, as founders of the IoTBE user group, are confronted with every day.ÿ
ÿ
How will the C? platform empower communities?
ÿ
A platform for the community.

C? recognizes the true nature of the community. Instead of offering a general purpose, one-size fits all web CMS with community features, we incorporate the needs of the different community stakeholders in the core of the platform. Running a community is a lot like running an enterprise and therefor needs the appropriate tools, like a public website, a member intranet site, voting systems, e-commerce, task management, inventory management, sponsor management, ... .

Different types of communities needs different tools. Each community will be able to choose which tools to use. Community templates will be provided to ease this process. If the other (online) tools are already in use, integration will be made possible through the C? API?s.
ÿ
A platform by the community.

We will build a community SaaS platform that will be extensible through an app store. Apps ? widgets, applications, services, integrations ? will be built by development communities in close collaboration with the end-user community of the apps. The collaboration could be initiated through crowd funding allowing the ?financial sponsor? to take up its role as end user in vertical open innovation trajectory.
ÿ
A community of communities
Communities need collaboration more &amp
column2: more in order to achieve their goals. C? will provide communities with the dedicated tools to support different kinds of collaboration in a structured manner (in contrast to current internal messaging systems or email).

column1: Communities will be able to link with each other and in the process share (give access to) their resources (news, calendar, events, ?) and overlay them with their own.

Collaboration goes one step further than sharing. During collaboration, two or more communities will be able to setup a dedicated collaboration space (= collaboration community) to execute their common activities. E.g.:
Organizing events together and distribute the revenue and cost among participating communities.
Start-ups could create a user community or developer community around their product.
Innovative companies that lack specific skills to develop their idea could setup a crowd sourcing collaboration for creative companies to join.
These collaboration tools will empower communities both towards reaching their goals as well as support them financially.
ÿ
The platform as a community

All users participating in a C? community become part of the global C? community. C? will engage its user base through gamification. This user base will form the basis for bringing communities together. Collaboration between communities will also be stimulated by introducing communities with one another by means of a recommendation engine. Matches would be found based on the type of community, its goals, its members &amp
column2: their interest and the activities of the community.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

column1: 56,CREA56,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Startup,Everybodylocal.com,"Roedenstraat 23, 3600 Genk, Belgium",ACCOMMODATION AND FOOD SERVICE ACTIVITIES,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Ann Maria Dries,"Business idea: a service to connect tourists with local individuals who offer an authentic experience in the community where the tourist is staying.
Technology (a platform) is the bridge between offer and demand.

The unique selling point is that the platform is open for any local willing to offer a good quality program in the field of creativity and culture.ÿToday there are already offers in this field, but there is a large fragmantation because all different initiatives that have their own website.
The platform bundles all the offers and brings them to the market through integrating the platform on the websites of hotels, b&amp
ÿ
In the supporting materials you find a powerpoint explaining additional information

57,CREA57,CREA,CREAtiFi,UK,Suite5 Ltd.,Abareza,"20-22 Wenlock Road, N1 7GU London, United Kingdom",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Iosif Alvertis,"Abareza is an online community platform for people who look to share their creative activities with friends or strangers in their city, bringing people with same interests together allowing co-creation and collaboration. In particular, users can create events based on creative activities (e.g. social activities, sports, fun &amp
column2: entertainment), look for participants or invite friends, but also manage and share content created during the events
column3: e.g. photos that people captured, comments or relative digital content that they would like to remember. At the end of each event, they can rate the event, promoting the organizer of the event to a trusted, well-known event organizer. The goal of the service is to help people living in urban areas become more open, meet people with similar interests and organize better sharing content under a similar event. Abareza leverages the lack of communities organizing &amp
column4: sharing events outside the strict management of companies, groups and agents. It can be described alternatively as ?a Spotify for events?, where people will find the most interesting events in proximity, based on their mood and interests. Abareza has a multi-segment business model
column5: customers for the free service and premium accounts, while businesses can promote their events through the platform. Basic customers can create and look for events based on activities of their interest get recommended events, invite friends or allow strangers to join them, and become reputed hosts. Premium accounts with monthly subscription will be introduced and will allow participants to use advanced features in their events and become reputed event organizers. In parallel, affiliated marketing will be used to allow business accounts to promote events in broader geographical areas and get visibility through the main page of the service. Abareza would be positioned in multiple markets, as it is both an event-planning platform that allows not only users but also companies to create and promote events, and a community of users who create and share content. The focus is on the social media industry, as Abareza at its current form is primarily considered a user-generated content-based platform. Even if Facebook is the central point of reference when it comes for users? identity, many youth users turn into new networks that look fresh, are mobile based and provide more engaging characteristics, like Snapchat or Instagram, or they focus on chatting applications, like WhatsApp. This trend towards new services has created a new opportunity in mobile, social services
column6: we expect the mobile advertising market to more than double during the next two years and to increase twelvefold by 2015 to $20.6 billion worldwide, while revenue generated by consumer location-based services is forecast to reach $13.5 billion in 2015. On the other hand, the market of social events looks quite stable, with companies like Meetup, Eventora and Eventbrite focusing on groups and organizations rather than end-users to organize and run events. We plan to reach our customers through dedicated campaigns on existing social media platforms and mobile marketplaces. Social accounts will be used to sign up to the platform and share messages towards friends of existing users, in order to invite them to the platform. When the application is out as a beta version, we will target technology magazines and blogs, such as TechCrunch, Wired, Mashable, Co.Design, but also well-known bloggers while communities conducting events will be invited onboard. All these community-building techniques will be supported with continuous social, posting blog posts and promoted messages in Facebook and Google Ads.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

column1: 58,CREA58,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Talentina BVBA,"Talentina, a private coaching cloud for every organization.","Groefstraat 13, 3000 Leuven, Belgium",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Adriaan Walpot,"Summary ÿ
Talentina is an eBay for online coaching, with Skype-like video sessions that the client can replay in the cloud.
With our public platform prototype, our team proves to master FIWARE technology such as Kurento.
However, to have a direct impact on this ? 2.5B market with 5% growth, organizations ask us to provide their own instant, private coaching platforms.
Because this is an innovative cloud solution, with no set-up for the client, we must overcome 3 key issues: (1) security, (2) scalability and (3) usability.
The FIWARE cloud and technology give us access to this, such as locally stored data (vs. AWS).
We aim to support FIWARE's success this way.
ÿ
Platform

Our team builds a social marketplace that makes coaching more accessible, because it makes the value of a Coaching Session more transparent. This helps to increase the 5% growth in this part of the Creative Industry.
ÿ

That is why we have built an advanced prototype of a public marketplace (web + app) that brings online coaching at your fingertips. Talentina is an ""eBay for online coaching, with Skype and cloud recording of Coaching Sessions built into it"". This prototype is entirely self-financed, and tested with Coaches and Clients (see video).
ÿ

Through our sales efforts, we discovered that we must allow organizations to run instant, private marketplaces (as instances of our platform) in the cloud. Big clients like VDAB want this. With FIWARE, we can build it, while we continue to grow our public platform as-is.
ÿ
This allows those private marketplaces to:
active and scale up automatically with FIWARE technology,
securely share sensitive data, on the FIWARE cloud based in the EU,
provide 'accessibility for life' to (ex-)employees via the public platform through advanced FIWARE technology, such as Access Control and ID Mgt.
ÿ
With FIWARE technology and our participation in the FIWARE network, we can unlock these 'coaching silos'.
ÿ
Market
ÿ
The Personal Coaching business is a ? 2.4 billion market that is growing at more than 5% per year, according to PWC.
However, the growth is hampered by a lack of transaparency with privacy,
Online competitors like Google Helpouts or Skype do not provide this,
eBay shows that a social marketplace creates new jobs (like Talentina), as it provides transparency to a given market.
ÿ

Our business model gives Coaches free access in return for a Success Fee of 13,8%. We deliver free quality leads for a 20' online sales pitch, because the Client pays us ? 9,99. Clients pay to record a Session.
ÿ
With the serious challenges to the economy in Europe, personal coaching provides a solid answer to significant changes in society.
Coaching does create more growth in the fast changing economy, directly and indirectly, as well-trained employees who also receive coaching increase their future employment chances.
(Source: McInness and Ozturk (2007): Predicting Employment Effects of Job Coaching)
ÿ
The stimulus to the economy is also direct, by helping Coaches:
creating more jobs for Coaches,
increasing the yield by filling the available coaching slots (towards full-time employment), and,
increasing the income, reflecting the real value added.
ÿ
Indirectly, coaching stimulates our economy and helps to create better bonds in society, when individuals learn to grow and become more cost effective.
ÿ
Conclusion
ÿ

By making coaching instantly accessible, our platform creates real value that has a direct impact on society. Our team has proven it masters technology such as FIWARE Kurento, by building an advanced prototype. As such, we will enrich the success of the FIWARE community.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
59,CREA59,CREA,CREAtiFi,Denmark,Techtiles,The Logos,"Engvej 154, st th, 2300 Copenhagen S, Denmark",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Ture Strange Nilsson,"Brief
A pan-European aggregation platform for hyper-local citizen journalism, run completely as a user-driven social news network.

In this way, we decentralise information and democratise news on a micro level, engaging local communities and fostering knowledge- and information sharing across Europe. We facilitate aÿtransnational cultural, social, political, business etc. awareness and understanding, while giving access to on-the-ground information by local people.

At the same time, we are a virtual lab for testing new disruptive revenue-sharing business models, and by incorporating technology as a fundament for online democracy, we truly differentiate to be more than a ?news media?.
ÿ
Concept

For end users (news consumers), the platform is intended to quickly and effortlessly keep up to date with local European news, where, when and in what shape they desire. News content can be sorted according to Topic, Location and Popular. Browsing by Location opens a heat-map showing areas of high activity, as well as amount of content creators by region. News consumers are encouraged to participate in creation, augmentation and sharing of news, as well as securing quality and relevance of the content. End users can source accurate traceable information from a broad range of local medias, completely personalised, depending on interest of place and topics, while deciding in a democratic way, how to shape the interface and divide the revenues.
ÿ

For content creators (Local news media, freelance journalists, local activists, NGOs, bloggers, regular people etc), making a profile to contribute to the news information flow and have their voice and cases heard, will never have been easier. Geo-location based news content can be text, pictures, videos, and podcasts and live streaming.
ÿ

The site is designed across all devices, and we will follow up with an app, to make content creation a smooth and seamless activity. All original material is added on the content creators profile, as well as shown on the front page in chronological order, and sorted according to the consumers selection of Topic, Location and Popular.
ÿ
Content creators can also be local government, organisations and businesses, see business model chapter.
ÿ
Why

News and media are among the most disrupted industries, but the sector is increasingly centralised, and big news corporations are monopolising the information we receive, in a product dominant logic, rather than a service dominant logic of mutual inclusion and co-creation. While the music and movie industry is adapting to the new technological landscape and investigating new business models, journalism and newsvendors are still clinging on to bygone models. This results in a non-flexible up-down approach and rigid one-way communication flow. Paradoxically, many online news outlets have an engaged community of readers (ready to comment, augment, like and share their content), whose contribution would be considered invaluable for other more agile private businesses.

The traditional press have neither the resources nor the knowledge to cover the micro challenges of local communities. They are reporting on global geo-political issues, often exclusively with an Anglo-Saxon angle, ignoring the smaller regions within Europe, thus neglecting one of the essential European values, that of diversity and freethinking. In this manner, lots of important local information never leave their region, resulting in news consumers not being able to see and connect international trends, movements and ideas, not getting the big picture. Local people and press will also usually be first on the spot of interest, offering exclusive breaking news content before it is news.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
60,CREA60,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Tell About Me,Tell About Me,"Halderbosstraat 121, 1653 Dworp, Belgium",Consumer Undefined,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Dominique van Doormaal,"General idea
Tell about Me will enableÿpeople to archive on a daily basis as much details of someones life as they choose.
We will launch an online platform for parents who will be administrators of their newly born.
They can assign Privileged admins like grand parents, uncles, nieces, godparents and friends.
All of them will be able to save in many details facts about the child?s life from his birth till he or she turns 13.
Pictures and video?s off course but also news-facts you want him to remember, music, children?s drawings,
important documents like birth certificate, medical documents, school reports, diploma?s, vaccinations etc.
There will be a public and a secure part. Once a year, before his or her birth- day a book will be proposed with allÿthe content
that was saved and will be automatically layouted in chronological order. ÿ
One can get that book in physical form and collect all 13 volumes as a precious gift for the child.
Once the child reaches his or hers 13th birthday he will get a code that will make him the sole administrator of this TaM page.
13 is the legal age where one can open a social account.
Then he can choose to keep the other admins or assign new ones like his friends and become an admin on his friends pages too.
Because TAM has a qualitative audience, advertisers can target with precision with meaningful messages.
Pampers, Zwitsal, toys, baby-food, clothing. ÿ
But because the TAM page has many admins, they also will be receptive to well targeted ads.ÿ
ÿ
Pricingÿ
There will be a free version, which will allow to use the base functionalities and to upload a minimum set of photo?s, for example about 20 photo?s.
For an annual subscription fee of 30? the main admin can invite 10 admins which can upload a high amount of photos, video?s, ... ÿ
ÿ
The book
Every year the admin(s) can buy a book containing in chronological order the highlights of the year.
The admin(s) can edit the book as he (they) pleases. ÿThe book will be sold at normal competitive prices.ÿ
ÿ
A memory network
?A new way to mark moments in time.
ÿNever lose any important document anymore like birth-certificate, blood-type, school diploma?s, immunizations, medical records etc...ÿ
?Keep track of all his school mates and later he will be able to contact them at his convenience when he feels up to it.
?Make him discover where he came from. Who his parents were, his grand parents, his uncles and nieces...
?Connect with people around the world with the same name as your godchild.
?Or were born on the same day, the same minute, second. Wherever around the world. and be able to track them via Google earth.
?Don?t be alone to archive. Invite up to 10 admin?s like grand parents, godparents, uncles, nieces, sisters, brothers orfriendstohelparchiveasmuchas they want for their godchild.
?The archiving part being completely private and secure there will also be a public area where anyone can choose for themselves what they want to share.
?Once 13 your child inherits the whole lot!
?After he recovered from his emotions receiving the 13 volumes of his life in 13 books he becomes the sole administrator.
ÿFor him to choose to keep some as fellow admin?s or not.
?And this is where he can start his own precious intimate social network. Inviting close friends to continue keeping track of his whereabouts.
?In return he will be one of the admin?s for his friends.
ÿAldus they will be creating a whole new concept of social networking.ÿ
ÿ

61,CREA61,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,The Fridge bvba,AtEx ( AssetExchange),"Gentsesteenweg 265-267, 1081 Brussels, Belgium",TELECOM AND MEDIA,B2B,8,8,YES,IN,Jan Hameeuw,"The aim is to develop a project independent (web based) service that will enable rapid prototyping and transformation of motion picture and tv series 3D scenes into usable assets for a game engine environment. The goal is the monetizing of this service and the acceleration and better monetization of 3D assets for our clients and the entertainment industry as a whole.
ÿ
The concept:

The idea started from a clear need to enhance interoperability between traditional media production and the converging media production. This need has become clear to us in collaborating with many clients within the film, animation and advertising industry. One of our clients defines this need as follows:
ÿ
&lt
column2: The media industry is looking for new revenue models better adapted to ?the age of free? and the ?screen-hopping generation?. Transmedia, releasing content across media, is a powerful way to generate additional income ... how they can best be exploited and how they can be developed in the most cost-efficient way, both technologically and creatively? &gt

column1: ÿ

AtEx aims to greatly reduce the existing barrier between 3D Design packages, multi platform game engines and HTML5 WebGL based solutions. This will result in either a web based service (FIWARE enabled) or a combination of a web based service with stand alone plug-ins. We are certain that this prototyping phase will give us the necessary insights to decide on the final marketable form of our solution.
ÿ
The customers problem:
The media industry is challenged ÿto answer the increasing need of consumers as they are getting more used and demanding to consume content anywhere, anytime and anyhow.

But the content?s adapation to enable a max of benefit from all types of media consumption, increases the cost of that adaptation. Well adapted content sells better, but comes to a higher cost. Adapting content is a creative challenge, decreasing the cost a technical one. In fact, lowering the technical cost enables a higher ROI and releases more budget for creative development of content. It is exactly this need we are trying to resolve with AtEx.
On a technical and operational level we can identify the problems as follows.

Game developers and 3D artists have issues achieving proper interoperability of 3D sets/scenes between 3D Design packages and game engines. As for simple objects the interoperability is almost guaranteed, for complex scenes there still is an issue:
e.g : typical headache: http://answers.unity3d.com/questions/158164/unity-importing-instances-wrong-via-fbx.html
ÿ

As a Movie and Animation Studio, we are often asked to deliver 3D assets to gaming companies. Currently we are working closely together with a gaming company on a couple of projects. We encounter a lot of issues while trying to transfer our 3D scenes seamlessly into a 3D game engine (Unity or WebGL). These issues take time to be resolved and consume consequently a lot of money.
ÿ
This is not only an expensive process for our clients (Game and Film producers) but also for the directors of the production companies and the creative directors at studios around the world.
Therefore the ?added value? we offer answers the need from an international and dynamic market, open to innovative approaches.
Possible Clients and competitive advantage:

The possible clients for our service are producers, post-production/game companies and app developers. Our software considerably improves the workflow between these parties. It allows them to connect the different software they use and synchronize their workflows. It even helps to build a bridge between the cultures of game development and audiovisual post-production.

In att.( 3.2) a clear view of the needs of the industry.",Tech provider,,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Authoring and Publishing Software,Applications,Content Applications,1,X,http://www.thefridge.tv/,SME,50000,thefridge.tv
62,CREA62,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,ThinkNexT bvba,SpeedView,"Engels Plein 35 box 01.01, 3000 Leuven, Belgium",PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND DEFENCE
column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITYÿÿÿ,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Thomas Van Durme,"SpeedView is a compact autonomous speed detector able to register speeding violations. SpeedView uses image processing techniques to calculate the velocity of passing vehicles. In doing so, its approach is radically different from the classical techniques of calculating vehicle velocity, which are based on radar or induction loops that are embedded in the road surface. ÿ

column1: ÿ

The change in technology alone will reduce the product cost of speed detection systems. But SpeedView goes even a step further in cost reduction by making the device fully autonomous with regards to power supply and data transmission.ÿ By coupling the device with a high yield solar panel, the SpeedView camera no longer requires any connection with the power grid.ÿ SpeedView sends it captured data to a central platform using a mobile data connection. That way, no physical connection to a transmission grid is needed. ÿ This autonomy makes it very easy to quickly install SpeedView cameras and maintain them with little effort.ÿ
ÿ

Combining the use of image processing with the autonomy of the camera is the reason we believe that with SpeedView it is possible to reduce the total cost of ownership by a factor 10. This will be a huge deal for local and federal police departments. For them it means that for the price of 1 classical speed detector, they can now monitor 10 places in a flexible way with a SpeedView camera.
ÿ

Our ambition is to grow this innovation beyond speed detection alone. We are firm believers in open systems and as soon as the first results are promising, we will open up our platform to other developers. That way, SpeedView cameras can be used for various other applications such as the monitoring of dangerous crossings, theft prevention, smart parking, ....ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
63,CREA63,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,ThinkNexT bvba,Cities of Faith,"Petermannenstraat 2B bus 205, 3000 Leuven, Belgium",Consumer leisure/gaming,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Thomas Van Durme,"CITIES of FAITH

Imagine the huge multiplayer interaction one can find in online text-based games combined with smooth graphix and strategic gameplay from games as Age of Empires? and Civilization?: the result is the massive online multiplayer strategy game called Cities of Faith.ÿ

Cities of Faith, or CoF, is an online multiplayer game combining the best elements of strategy, adventure and politics. In this game of conquest, players employ strategic and tactical skills to command troops in capturing vital locations and defeating enemies. One must try their very best to stand their ground in worlds with over 200 other human players. You can join your friends by creating alliances and unite them within your everlasting empire...
ÿ
HISTORY
CoF is the result of the combined effort of two engineers. During the past year they conceived the gameplay ideas behind Cities of Faith and drafted conceptual mockups and graphics. ÿ
ÿ
COMMERCIALIZATION

Playing CoF is free. No monthly subscription fee or other payment is required. The frequent player on the other hand, has the opportunity to purchase credits via micro-payments, allowing him to access more features. For an estimated 3 to 5 EUR, ÿone receives 1000 credits, a sufficient amount for an average player to last a month.
ÿ
COMMERCIAL PLAN

CoF targets gamers between the age of 10 and 35. That group can be subdivided in hardcore and casual gamers. The commercialization of CoF proceeds in two phases. The first phase targets the hardcore gamers by posting messages on specialized gaming forums and communities. That should provide CoF with a stable base of frequent players. To further enlarge the user base, casual gamers are targetted using Google Ads? and advertisement in online public places like Facebook?. Along with all this, mouth-to-mouth commercialization attributes its part in providing CoF with fresh players.
ÿ
STRENGTHS &amp
column2: OPPORTUNITIES

column1: 1) ÿ unique in its genre: massive multiplayer combined with solid strategic gameplay
2) ÿ runs on both Windows?, Mac OS X? and Linux? ÿthanks to Java? technology
3) ÿ high profit opportunity, profit per player is much larger than the cost per player
4) ÿ initial investement cost is very low, because of the online nature
5) ÿ the game is in English and is suited for an international community
6) ÿ management of CoF is fully automated: registration, billing, game control, servers,...
7) ÿ people nowadays are more inclined to buy through use of micro-payments
8) ÿ more and more people are interested in online gaming
ÿ
RISKS &amp
column2: THREATS

column1: 1) ÿ pioneering a new game genre has an implicit risk
2) ÿ a sufficient amount of paying players is required to be financially self-sustaining
3) ÿ game complexity may negatively affect the joining of new players
4) ÿ the game itself is required to remaining challenging for experienced players
5) ÿ Travian is market leader in online strategy gaming, and targets the same gaming population",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
64,CREA64,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,ThinkNexT bvba,Eventis,"Petermannenstraat 2B bus 205, 3000 Leuven, Belgium","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jelle Van Gompel,"Eventis

Eventis is an online ticketing platform that allows organizers of an event to fully create their event online. This gives them a channel to promote their event online and manage the ticket sales end-to-end. Visitors of the event can buy their tickets using credit card, debit card or homebanking solutions. After succesful payment, they receive their tickets directly in their inbox or passbook. Managing and promoting your event was never easier!
ÿ
Problem
1. Selling tickets
Small and medium sized events have a very ad-hoc way of selling tickets
often just via email: ?order your tickets at john.doe@skynet.com?
tickets are sold through intermediaries (i.e. members, affiliates,... of the organizer)
payments need to be re-collect from intermediaries
effectiveness of intermediaries varies
ÿ
2. Access control
Getting your tickets and controlling access is often messy
a single excel file that has to be checked for names
many envelopes containing tickets laying at the reception which have to be searched
who already paid and who did not?
at the door tickets are often not added to that excel...
In general: no complete overview of all ordered tickets
ÿ
3. Reporting back
The event went well ... or not?
incomplete information on how many tickets were sold in totalÿ(at which stage, what time and the kind of ticket)
no metric information on how to do better next event
no centralized mailing database
In general: lack of information makes ineffective organization for next event
ÿ
Solution
Eventis allows you to:
1. Configure your event
venue / time / concept
types / price of tickets payment methods
payment methods
2. Manage your sales
your own personal event page
track your orders in real-time
3. Control the access at your event
iPhone/Android application with integrated scanner
Easy to use online application
4. Gather event statistics
Sales statistics
Customer insights
ÿ
Why Eventis?ÿ
easy to start your event
no special equipment for access control needed
focus on user-friendliness
online payment
centralized and instant
easy and complete reports
receive your tickets in Passbook or email

column1: 66,CREA66,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Trackathon,Trackathon (not yet the final name),"rue Vanderschrick, 13, 1060 Brussels, Belgium","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Philippe de Liedekerke,"What is Trackathon?ÿ
Trackathon is a song incubator which helps musicians to create and achieve songs. As a standard incubator, Trackathon offers services such as :ÿ
- accelerating the creativity process
- matching talents thanks to a collaboration friendly network providing user feedback
- coaching sessions by real expertsÿ
ÿ
As a ""song incubator"", Trackathon is specificallyÿcommittedÿto turning unachieved songs into potential commerciallyÿsuccessfulÿsongsÿ
ÿ
What is our secret sauce?ÿ

Tracakthon is not only a website service with digital functions. Tracakthon strives to offer real creativity challenges through a coaching service with real experts. This is done with digital functions fostering music collaborations all around the world.ÿ
ÿ
What is our business model?ÿ

As standard incubators, Trackathon's value proposition is based on ensuring commercial success for new projects brought on the market. Indeed, in the music industry, less than 0,001% of song creation actually materializes into commercial life. Hence, the ambition of this song incubator is to boost this rate up to 0,1%.ÿIn this respect, we have designed a freemium service for our website members that will allow them to find the most relevant coaching service by choosing between the following packages :ÿ

1. free access, open to anyone who is motivated to participate in song creation and is looking for new collaboration opportunities. This free accessÿallowsÿto upload songs, to meet with other musicians and to collaborate on other songs.

2. an intermediate package moreÿspecificallyÿdedicated to experienced musicians seeking to stimulate their creativity and be challenged by expert coaching. This paying access allows for more upload options,ÿaccess to accurate stats and functions to master their song, as well as the opportunity to participate in creativeÿcontests ( ""Trackathons"").
3. a professional package with increased digital options, more intensive coaching sessions and the opportunity to participate in Trackathon contests as a influencer.ÿ

68,CREA68,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,UXprobe BVBA,UXVue,"Schaffelberg 12, 2220 Heist-op-den-Berg, Belgium",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,2,2,YES,IN,Jan Moons,"Software As A Service (SaaS) allowing product teams to record onscreen activity within mobile apps and web applications and even record the user's face and voice, so users can explain what they are doing with the app when they encounter a bug or a user interface / user experience problem.
ÿ

By using the SaaS, users of the app do not have to come to a user experience or usability lab anymore where they are given scenarios telling them what to do with the software.ÿBut they can rather use the application by themselves, on their own device and in their own natural environment. The solution provides product teams an app library that they can just plug into their app and capture the user's screen, the interactions with the app and the end user behind the screen using the front-facing camera of the smartphone, tablet or even laptop. Product teams don't have to setup an expensive usability lab anymore with specialized hard- and software, which is also very intrusive to use by the user. See usability lab of Center of User Experience Design in Leuven.
ÿ

The product team of the app can just follow remotely in real-time what the user is doing with the app, where they encounter problems and how they feel about the app just by looking at their facial expressions and their verbal and body language. Product teams can remotely follow what their users are doing on the screen, hear what they are saying and even see their reactions. In the meanwhile they can make notes that are added to the video stream which will help them at a later time e.g. to replay problematic parts of the session to better understand what happened and how they could eventually improve the design of the app. The product team members who are observing can even use chat to discus or even consult with each other what is going on. When they want they can even use the voice channel to interact with the user to even better understand why she is using the app the way she does or can even help her when she is completely stuck in the app and does not even know anymore what to do.
ÿ

Every session will be recorded and made ready for replay afterwards, not only showing the recorded screen and audio and video but also visualizing the different interactions and problems the user encountered during the session as well as the notes the observers made while following.
ÿ

Even after all usability tests are performed and the app is put into production, the service could still be used by the customer service department to interact with users who have problems with the app. When users need help they could start the service itself which will contact customer service and the user could show customer service what they are trying to do with the app and where they have problems are get stuck. Customer service on their side can just see in their web browser the screencast of what the user is doing with app and in the meanwhile hear the users explanation and see their facial expressions. Customer service can then just use the audio channel to guide the user through the app.
ÿ

UXprobe would like to add this concept to their current user experience analytics offering. There is already a lot of interesting insights we are getting from our analytics service that is absolutely indispensible. But really seeing and hearing users struggle with an app is of an enormous value to convince developers and other stakeholders that a redesign of a specific part of the app is really necessary and worthwhile.",Tech provider,,X,0,X,0,0,,Software,Problem Management Software,System Infrastructure Software,System Management Software,"1, and 2",X,www.uxpro.be,Startup,50000,uxpro.be

column2: D B.V.,Vicancy,"herenstraat 33a, 6701DH Wageningen, Netherlands",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,10,2,YES,IN,Loet rammelsberg,"Due to the advent of social media recruiting and new software tools over the past years there have been major disruptions in the recruitment industry. One aspect of the recruiting process has not changed at all: the job description. Marketers realised long-ago that video is far more memorable and emotionally engaging.

column1: ÿ

Vicancy is changing the future of job advertising. We boost job postings using animated video job ads on the largest professional network - LinkedIn. This helps companies and recruiters to stand out, get their message across and improve their employer branding in order to recruit the best talent. So far we have clients all over the world ranging from innovative SME?s to multinationals such as Ahold, SCA and HP.ÿOur animation software gives us the benefits of online video (visibility, engagement, branding &amp
column2: conversion) without the delivery time and costs of production. We turn text based jobs into a customised video ads within 24 hours including a target linkedIn campaign for ?479. ÿ

column1: ÿ

Currently we grow at around 30% in sales month over month. Taking the projections into account it seems that within half a year we will be reaching a considerable volume of around 250 video job ads per month. This scale puts us in a position where the current distinctiveness of the ads will not be sufficient anymore.ÿIn order to avoid the commoditization of our product we aim to choose the same strategy as a company called Envato. Offering a marketplace for freelance animators and in our case recruiters sell and purchase job ad templates. To make this marketplace work we need to build the following components using both own knowledge as well as FIWARE specific enablers:
ÿ
Marketplace for both third party content providers ÿ
Interface where recruiters can easily fill out their job posting
Automated cloud rendering of job animations (30 seconds
Automated uploading and publishing to all major video hosting and ad platform

As a result in the end of July 2015 with the help of freelance animators we will be able to set the standard regarding to quality of video job ads and avoid commoditization of our product. In addition we will also create a much stronger unfair advantage as rendering, uploading and publishing is automated and we can really take the advantage of economies of scale in online video.

column2: Conferences,"Wayra / 26 Sir John Rogersons Quay, Dublin 2, Co. Dublin Dublin, Ireland",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,5,2,YES,IN,Frederic Herrera,"Videobot wants to develop a mobile video playback/recording app for festivals and conferences. Such white-label technology solution for both festival and conference organizers increase engagement before, during and beyond festivals and conferences. Engagement via Videobot app will be designed and centered on videos enabled by the app itself: interviews sponsored by event organizers, user-generated videos from music fans and conference attendees (comments, opinions, video logs, questions to artists/speakers), archive videos from past festivals and conferences, related videos from social networks (facebook, twitter, instagram, linked in,...)

column1: The Videobot video app brings the following benefits to festival and conference organizers: 1. Development of online and mobile audience for festival and conference organizers that can be monetized via paid premium advert insertions in curated user-generated video recordings and video views. 2. Development of fan base for artists and community for conference speakers.
ÿ

The Video app proposed as part of this Creati FI call for prototypes will be a fully-configurable app (visual design and features-set) for iOS, Android and Windows smartphones and tablets. The video app will be enabled by Videobot white-label Content Management System (CMS) - VBOT - that is currently used by the EU Best Practice Network Europeana Space to linked video archives to smart tv applications in real-time. The proposed video app for festivals and conferences will use FI-WARE generic enablers in regards to user authorizations and streaming services and overlay insertions making the the viewing experience more engaging and interactive standard video streams to smartphones and tablets.
ÿ

The app prototyped in this proposal addresses the following problems for the clients: 1. Easy to use technology solution that doesnt need an in-house technical team for installation, 2. Technology solution that can be scaled based on the number of recording/views and priced accordingly for most festival and conference organizers, 3. Detailed reporting on how the app is used before, during and beyond events so that organizers can monetize the app and its content via a sponsored or subscription model.
ÿ
The target market for Videobot mobile video recording app for festivals and conferences can be extrapolated from the mobile video stats showed in supporting material.
ÿ
Large national festivals - arts &amp
column2: music - and national conferences (start-up/ICT/health-care) will be targeted by Videobot to focus on maximizing the number of interactions - views, user generated videos, shares, subscriptions, archive content ingestion - centered on videos. The analytics of these interactions will allow Videobot to price its platform and related video apps for festivals and conferences using two pricing plans. Videobot hosts video and apps for its customers based on a cloud-based SaaS model. Both platform and app frameworks are priced to customers based on monthly/quarterly license fee in addition to integration services fees related to design and third-party back-end integration.

column1: ÿ

Competitors in app development for festivals and conferences dont usually rely on automated video publishing platform to power apps to clients. Its mainly bespoke expensive and lenghty consultative developments that represent the only solution for festivals and conferences. Bespoke development is done by a mix of advertising agengies and technology partners.
