71,CREA71,CREA,CREAtiFi,Ireland,"Videodossier, S.L.",Videodossier,"Calle Dante Alighieri, 59, Bajos, 08032 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Ed Gal,"In order to develop theÿ Service we want to offer, we first have to develop an intelligentÿ product consisting on an inexpensive multicamera System Set that allows anybody to record a conference at anytime. The portable System Set, already developed and functioning in laboratory environment,ÿ is composed of several ?Docking Plates? above which are attached the different cameras and audio recorders involved in the video recording session. The inexpensiveÿ servo-assited Docking Plates allow the cameras to automatically frame and focusÿ the person(s)ÿ talking in the conference. The main achievement of the System Set resides, besides in its low price,ÿ in the fact of beingÿ able to collectÿ information generated in the room (movements, noise, light shifts, etc) and convert it into parameters (metadata) which then make possible an automated edition with all the recorded material. Manual edition costs become therfore inexistent. Furthermore, after the video edition has been automaticallyÿ accomplished, the conferencesÿ areÿ directly uploaded to a server where the collaborative serviceÿÿ is offered.

ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ The Service ?basically? consists on a web platform that motivates collaborative transcriptions and translations of the videos by means of involving stakeholders of cultural entities. The intellectual involvement is accomplishedÿ by offering different types of remuneration (not only ÿeconomical) to the targetedÿ stakeholders.ÿ From tiny chops of transcriptions to complete translations, Stakeholders (Users, visitors, workers from the different cultural entities...) are invited to collaborate on an always growing legate of well indexed cultural videos.

ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ Theÿ collaborative spiritÿ shall only be possible if the videos of the different entities are all in the same web page thus making the one site a reference for all human beings who look for well indexed videos from experts willing to share their knowledge. In order to gather the different and diverse cultural entities in the same videoÿ platform, several studied issues have been taken into consideration. The three and most important opportunities that have to be clearly given to the potential Users (Corporations, Cultural entities and their stakeholders) are:
1) an undeniableÿ money saver method in the recording and edition workflow for the corporations
2) an undeniable time saver method in the process of both indexing material (Entities) and finding interesting material (Users)
3) an elegant method for corporations to demonstrate to the public their concern for cultural issues (canalisation of CSR).
ÿ

While the recording and edition workflow is certainly optimised by the ""Docking Plates"",ÿ the indexing process isÿ facilitated as follows:ÿÿ the adoption by the Cultural Entities of the web video platform does not begin in the process of assisting the uploading of the media but rather in a much earlier stage, that is, from the moment the Entity is planning the Event. Thus, by the time the video is ready to be uploaded, there is no need to fill in again all the data involved in that item in order to have all the data well indexed (authors, sponsors, language, place...): The metadata is already in the video file when it?s time to show it online.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

72,CREA72,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,VIDEOLAB NV,KarmaScope,"Dorpsstraat, 51D, 3945 HAM, Belgium","BUSINESS  SERVICES, TELECOM AND MEDIA",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Koen Stevens,"Out-Of-Scope work in creative industries is costing individuals and companies tons of money each year.ÿ

between creative freelancers and their clients.

73,CREA73,CREA,CREAtiFi,Belgium,Wethinkonline,Buzwebconnect,"Zeedijk 250, bus 35 , 8400 Oostende, Belgium",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Joram Declerck,"Business owners are more and more involved with online media. Research from the Belgian organization Unizo shows that almost fifty percent of all entrepreneurs use social media (august 2014). Large players such as Twitter, Google and Youtube currently play a big role in online communication. However, these communication channels evolve, and other players might come into view in the next years. It is foreseeable that forms of online communication will keep on evolving in the near future.
ÿ

In addition to social media, web publishing remains very important to a successful communication strategy. This means that a business owner needs to know about his or her website, e-mail, social media? Managing all these communication streams is undoable. Often one needs to contact different technical partners for online media, hosting, e-mail services? These tasks lay on the business shoulders without having the necessary time or knowledge to do them.
ÿ

Buzwebconnect is determined to resolve this problem by investing in the development of software tools. Tools that support creative communication over social networks and the web. A software tool should allow a business owner to manage information streams from one central platform. Web content management, social media channels, email campaigns and online reputation management can be managed from one place. The Buzwebconnect software suite will implement several use cases which are described in this document to support this strategy.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

74,CREA74,CREA,CREAtiFi,Portugal,YUCCA LDA.,ExoSpells - Exhibition of Spells,"Praceta Jos‚ Saramago, n.? 3, C/v Esq., 2630-291 Arruda dos Vinhos, Portugal",Consumer leisure/gaming,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Nuno Cunha,"The product we want to develop are 2 augmented reality serious games, the business idea is to place them for online entertainment and in exhibitions and conferences. Serious games (SG) are computer games with another purpose beyond entertainment e.g. marketing or learning. Augmented Reality (AR) is a live direct or indirect view of a physical, real-world environment whose elements are augmented e.g. by computer-generated elements like sound, video or graphics.
We want to develop and test 2 augmented reality (AR) entertaining games, based of FIWARE, using the same technology base (a common core to both games).

One games is a classic battle of spells AR-style, the player is a Wizard and his mobile device (phone or tablet) is a magic wand with spells to use against other wizards. The goal of the game is to collect new spells and defeat opponents to achieve a Master Wizard status. There are attack and protective spells, while AR Wizards, spells and creatures are rendered in the mobile device display. The learning edge is based on the recognition of real world objects with the device camera and including them in the game e.g. real world ingredients for a potion, or components to make a robotic AR creature. As an example a nitro-glycerine or dynamite potion making would require finding and recognizing in the real world ingredients (resembling) the real ones, providing a learning experience to the player in chemistry (and other areas: biology, agriculture, engineering etc.). Creatures will be animated via artificial intelligence techniques. This will be a light SG meaning that it is meant as an introduction to real-life systems and mechanisms, therefore the main purpose is entertainment with some light high level learning.

The other game, Exhibition Mission, is a networking game, its goal is to network, entertain (and support the goals of) any professional participating or attending any kind of exhibition, or conference with exhibition spaces. Each visitor will be invited to look for and perform missions available in the exhibition floor, like a treasure hunt. Some missions will be about meeting any or specific people (networking) or detecting products or displays of a specific brand (sponsored). Missions can be e.g. to solve brain puzzles or questions related with some exhibitors, having a virtual passport that is ?stamped? in some sponsor stands, and finding prizes and goodies with AR locator clues in the device. The most basic mission is to find and talk to another visitor that is also playing the game. Sponsored prize rewards are a possible incentive. Some missions will be sponsored, others defined by the organizers. The use of the game should be anonymous until any face to face conversation and optionally allow e.g. Linkedin connections.

The possibility to create mini TV clips of the battles or the missions, including the AR elements, to upload e.g. in video streaming sites like Youtube is also planned. These gaming clips are a recent trend and several gaming TV online streaming channels are popular. The use of these is meant to be as a dissemination tool for games viral marketing.

The company plans, as a business case, to create a common core platform to develop several AR serious games in the future. The target costumers for these games will be online and mobile players, with a revenue model based on online advertising (for entertaining games like Battle of Spells) and professional conference and exhibition organizers that wish to have a more engaging experience for their visitors, with a revenue model based on sponsorships and advertising (all games will promote each other hence exposing each player to all Yucca games).",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

75,CREA75,CREA,CREAtiFi,Luxembourg,"Zeitcloud S.? r.l., Soci‚t‚ ? responsabilit‚ limit‚e.",LogiTime,"30, Esplanade de la Moselle., L-6637 Wasserbillig, Luxembourg",Consumer Undefined,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Christian Wilhelm,"The project idea came to me at the beginning of the year, due to the fact that I constantly had to chase after the parcels ordered in web shops (e.g. Amazon, eBay, Zalando, etc.) at Christmas time. This made me realise that consumers always play a passive part in the delivery process and are therefore reliant on other people to receive their goods. As virtual market places attract more and more customers, it is now time for a more efficient and customer-friendly delivery process. My experience in the logistics sector should be a great asset in the realisation of this goal.
ÿ

LogiTime is a Social Logistics Platform which focuses on last mile delivery ensuring a ZERO FAILURE process. Users no longer play a passive part in the delivery process, but are actively involved in it.
ÿ

Users influence the delivery process directly by customizing their time and place of delivery. Even though some suppliers have started specifying the delivery time of parcels, users still have no influence on the place of delivery. LogiTime enables the user to take charge of their deliveries, by specifying the time frame and the location for the goods to be delivered. This customized solution will ensure a hassle-free online shopping experience.
ÿ

Target / Consequence / How ÿ * Goods purchased on a virtual marketplace are delivered at the preferred time and to the preferred location. * Zero failure delivery process * Reduction of CO2 emissions * Empowerment of the consumer = active involvement in the process inspires confidence in secure and punctual delivery of goods * Enormous benefits for customers, KEP and online retailers alike * Consumers specify availabity and most suitable location for receiving goods = well-defined and structured process with gates ensures delivery first time every time.
ÿ
ÿ ÿ VALUE PROPOSITION OF LOGITIME:
Delivery of goods on theÿ preferred day at the preferred time considerably increases customer satisfaction when shopping online.
ÿ
GREEN LOGISTICS Environmentally-friendly solution which significantly reduces CO?-emission to less than 500 grams per parcel.
ÿ

The flexibility to choose a date (and time of day) for the delivery of their purchases keeps customers happy. Likewise, the consumersï ability to pick up their parcels a convenient location can also play a key role when it comes to customer satisfaction.
ÿ
The recent hype of medication and fresh food online sales demands logistics rethinking, given that it is now more important than ever to guarntee a zero failure delivery process.
ÿ
Significant reduction of the risk of cart abandonment leads to improved sales figures.
ÿ
Increased delivery quota and decreased administrative effort result in major cost reductions for retailers and Logistics Service Providers.
ÿ
Optimisation of the supply chain due to bundling of volumes creates synergies, which enable a more flexible, efficient and cost-effective process.
ÿ
Artificial intelligence in the digital retailing sphere

LogiTime makes predictions about their customersï preferences on the basis of precise customer data. Thanks to LogiTimeïs comprehensive gathering of user information, retailers are enabled to send out goods ? in some cases via automated solutions such as drones ? even before they are ordered.
ÿ
FUTURE PROSPECTS:
1. Return process
2. Track and Trace system
76,CREA76,CREA,CREAtiFi,Cyprus,ISTOGNOSIS LTD,Virtual Interactive Market - VIM," Vasili Hatzigianni 15, 2042, Strovolos Nicosia, Cyprus","MANUFACTURING, WHOLESALE AND RETAIL TRADE
column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,ISTOGNOSIS LTD,"The idea: An augmented reality web-based application, with the option of immersive virtual reality experience, for the design and remodeling of interior spaces using products and materials from different retailers.

column1: Customer segments: 1. Manufacturers and retailers of interior design products (e.g. furniture, wallpapers, flooring materials etc.)ÿ 2. Individual consumers (or the app users) wishing to design a new or remodel an existing interior environment.

Basic functionalities: a) Add virtual objects and materials to existing or newly-designed spaces (the latter presented as graphics-based models) by selecting them from a database of various manufacturers/retailers. b) An efficient search tool with filtering options (see mockup). c) Computing the total cost for the user?s selections. d) Future inclusion of a social platform is considered to allow interaction across users (e.g., feedback and ratings on selections from friends and others).

The Core value for the consumers: Promotion of a confident decision-making by allowing the preview of products (from multiple retailers) in one?s environment ahead of purchase, the computation of costs and evaluation of alternatives, and the consideration of other users? feedback and suggestions on products. The use of the app is expected to reduce uncertainty in the purchase of household products and to allow users to create and evaluate comprehensive solutions for their spaces without sacrificing much time in visiting multiple stores for browsing.

The Core value for the retailers will be (1) the presence of a new avenue for showcasing products to a large market (2) the reduction in product returns as a consequence of the more informed decision making by consumers.

The innovation of the idea is multifaceted. First, the technical innovation is the use of the FI-WARE platform and the relevant GEs and SEs. Second, the scientific innovation is the use of novel computer vision algorithms developed by the Graphics and Hypermedia Lab for real-time rendering and foreground-background segregation. This will allow overcoming difficulties in existing apps (i.e. differentiating automatically a wall from an object that stands in front of it). Third, the business innovation is the marketing of an app that will involve products from multiple retailers. ÿThis will be in stark contrast to the attempts of various retailers to build their own proprietary apps for their products. The proposed app is placing down the foundation for a network effect (i.e., the initial inclusion of popular retailers will attract more app users which will in turn attract more retailers).
ÿ

The competitive advantage: To our knowledge, no other existing application uses augmented reality to allow the public to preview products from multiple retailers. Although certain retailers have developed their own apps, these exhibit severe limitations, mainly with foreground-background segregation. Here, we propose an app that will incorporate novel computer vision algorithms developed in-house to provide a better solution to this problem. In addition our team has years of experience in immersive Virtual Reality (VR) that is currently experimenting with affordable gear (e.g., the Oculus Rift, the Durovis Dive) that could be used with mobile devices. ÿGiven the large investments in VR hardware (e.g., Facebook Inc?s ÿ$2bn ÿacquisition of start-up Oculus VR, the recent collaboration of Oculus VR with Samsung to produce an HMD for the Note 4 smart phone etc.) we expect that mobile VR will become ubiquitous very soon. ÿThus, we aim to build in to our app the compatibility with mobile VR gear and provide first an augmented-reality immersive experience to consumers.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

78,CREA78,CREA,CREAtiFi,France,TAGES SOLIDSHIELD,Links2Gamer,"83 Boulevard Sadi Carnot, 06110 le cannet, France",BUSINESS SERVICES,B2B,2,5,YES,IN,Vincent Ghislain Lefebvre,"Our Links2Gamer business idea is aimed at independant PC game developers and it shall facilitate the final crunch stage of the game development. It also enables them to sales directly their games on their own website.
ÿ

The links it refers are the direct link to anonymous testers and to contributing players (for getting analytic data from their experience in oder to improve the game accordingly) as well as the direct link for compensation (payment solution) since developers will be their own distributor.ÿThis solution shall bring a major change on the way a game is completed in its final phase, optimised (for improved playability) and sold to gamers. It aims at improving game quality (less bugs) and fun and at optimizing sales. All these taken together shall greatly boost developer financial sustainability.ÿ
ÿ

With Links2Gamer, developers are fully secured for sharing their Work-In-Progress release and to speed up the release date of their game, with bug-free and enriched releases. Links2Gamers delivers to small independant developers a more-than-equivalent solution that only a very few major game publishers have developed internally. Actually, it brings extra fonctionalities brought by our total embedded security. Security means that they have much more manoeuvre to create their game traction, have the game tested by their community.ÿFor an independant game developer, visibility of its game is the master word. Links2Gamer is the best tool to enhance it. Links2Gamer enables to feed the community around the game (from crowd-funders, free testers, early access volonteers, ...) with Work-In-Progress releases without limitation ( (no need to make a brided version) since our security is total. As a matter of fact, Links2Gamers is based on CLOUDSHIFT disruptive technology which deliver security by its key principle of extracting a portion of the game for executing it in a remote server, leaving no access to the potential pirates.ÿWithÿLinks2Gamer, total security is providing more freedom to developers, not less to gamers. It also reduces time to market for less bugged and more funny games.
ÿ

Links2Gamer also automatically forges all new and various releases that developers wish to offer its audience which paves the commercial life of the title: early-access, outright sale, rental, Trial and Buy, Ads-on freemium ...Here again, itÿexceeds what indie marketplaces offer with their outright buy version only. Additionally, becoming their own distributors, indie developers gain a lot in profit, pro-activity (price fixing policy) and get rid of heavy distributor retainer. This extra profitabiliiÿ
ÿ
In short, Indie developers concerntrate on what they are good at: making narrative and creative-rich new game experience and get more from it. Here are the main benefits for the developers are:
Get rid of piracy concern for sharing freely work-in-progress, create game visibility and get it tested freely.ÿ
??Get freedom to define the commercialisation policy through various instantly set monetization schemes.
Make a very big step in profitabiltiy (no more game test costs, no more heavy distribution retainer).
Get control on user database for a more targeted marketing.
ÿ
The business model is a royalty to be set at 10 % on sales (versus 15 to 40% for VALVE and others).ÿ
ÿ
The marketing is based on:
Create our audience with empathic and content-rich blog with targeted email subscribers.
Meet indie developers on various fairs and have a conference there (GDC)ÿ
Communicate on ""Gamasutra"" and other specialized media
Google Ads
Game development schools special offerings

79,CREA79,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,IKS TN srl,SymbioGate,"Corso Rosmini, 8, 2nd  floor, 38068 Rovereto, Italy","Consumer other, PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND DEFENCE
column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITYÿÿÿ",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,IKS TN srl,"SYMBIOGATE Proposal

column1: Our proposal aims to improve the collaboration between citizens and the local municipalities.

Citizens are often not actively involved by the initiatives proposed by the institutions and, although that could be of interest for them, there are still several barriers in communication with authorities.
We have identified some of these barriers amplified in this time of economic crisis involving Italyand Europe and we focused on them the object of our proposal.
The problems that we would like to solve are the following:
give citizens the opportunity to speak out their own ideas concerning their town and ask for a collective participation to finance them
give institutions the possibility to provide funds to support citizens in need
provide a tool to book shared municipal services (pools, parks, theaters, events) and be able to pay without having to waste time in useless queues
identify and tag assets, points of interest, access to services using NFC/RFID technology to allow citizens to report failures, to be authorized to use a service, to access to an area / building
We believe that applications useful to solve the above matters should be developed for the Internet and mobile architectures through the Web Oriented Architecture paradigm.
This means that it is necessary to develop applications integrating services that expose data and functionalities without having to rewrite them.
In the same way other applications can access data and services that will be made available as modules developed in this project.
The above activities will be provided through the development of the following innovative services:
Crowd-in-Social
VirtuaPocket
TaggedPOI
The services provided by these brand new modules can be considered and used independently butÿ in this project they will be integrated in a real mobile APP to increase its functionalities.
The APP is Linko MyCity developed by IKS.ÿ
ÿ
SYMBIOGATE Service Modules
ÿ
Crowd-in-Social service module:

Giving citizens and local institutions the opportunity to share ideas, initiatives, projects and social aid. The added value is to be able to actively involve citizens, the regional associations, the artisans to participate in their funding.ÿ
ÿ
VirtuaPocket service module:
This module manages ? tokens? - the virtualÿ equivalent of an amount of money that the citizen entrusts to the municipality to access various services.
ÿ
TaggedPOI service module:

This module allows the institution to tag the territorial points of interest (POI). These points could be streets, monuments, public assets or the accesses to the services.ÿ Modern technology permits to have cheap and secure tags ÿ(RFID write at once, QRcode) and they can be read simply by smartphone.

81,CREA81,CREA,CREAtiFi,Austria,BLITAB Technology GmbH,BLITAB - Feelings get visible,"Gatterburggasse 16/2, 1190 Vienna, Austria","Consumer health/wellness, HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES",B2B/B2C,2,0,YES,IN,Kristina Ognyanova Tsvetanova,"BLITAB- Feelings get VISIBLE
ÿ
Every 5 seconds someone somewhere in this world goes Blind.
ÿ
Every minute a Child goes Blind.
ÿ

Worldwide, there are 39.8 million blind people and 285.3 million people are estimated to be visually impaired (WHO, 2013). 153 million people are visually impaired only because they lack a visual aid. In Europe there are estimated to be over 30 million people, whose visual impairment is severe enough to cause significant impact on the course of their daily living. ÿPopular belief has always contended that blindness leads directly to deficiency and incapacity. Research shows that in the case of children, this is likely to impede many areas of development that can ultimately result in unemployment, social isolation, lack of participation in the community, psychological maladjustment.
ÿ

The high-tech era and modern electronic devices, e.g., laptops, tablets, e- has left behind blind and visually impaired. This is due to the fact that visual display units are the heart of all modern communication and information systems including the Internet. This especially affects those impaired individuals in the technical fields. The IT sector appears to lack a comprehension of the unique strengths and challenges facing blind people.ÿ

In general the Braille notetakers currently developed represent a classic type of assistive technology product: with only one line Braille text, no enough power for audio editing, scanning and recognizing print documents.
Braille notetakers are closed platforms, so what you see, is what you get. There is little if any possibility for software expansion and capabilities of the device. They are bulky and heavy
column2: cannot be adapted for different applications and cannot ?display? technical, accounting, spreadsheets, or other specialized forms of display which are not a basic textual document. In addition it is very difficult for the blind person to make a buy decision because Braille notetakers? price ranges from ?4,000 to nearly ?13ÿ000 (Friedom Scientific Ltd., HIMS Ltd., HumanWare Ltd., Baum Retec AG). Overall they are poorly supported, expensive and often developed and designed in isolation from users, leading to inefficient use.ÿ

column1: ÿ
BLITAB Technology GmbH developed a unique solution (in IP procedure) to address these issues based on an integration of innovative technology, ecological psychology and social design.
ÿ
Let me introduce you the future of involving blind and visually impaired people in the modern social community we are living today! BLITAB is the World?s first tablet for Blind people.
ÿ

BLITAB is a next curve Braille device for reading and writing that displays one whole page Braille text, without mechanical elements. It provides an innovative design concept of a Braille multimedia device based on open discussions with blind people and absolutely new technology based on liquid smart materials which instead of using a screen form small physical bubbles. They rise and fall on demand, composing a whole page in Braille code. The developed technology has not been used till now in this market niche. And together with a leading Nordic R&amp
column2: D lab we are going to implement it in BLITAB. And this is the reason why we are already in patent procedure.

column1: ÿ

The positive impact of BLITAB can change million lives.ÿIt engenders confidence and knowledge of world which is critical to better quality of social life.ÿIt will open the way for blind and visually impaired to be part of a modern social era. BLITAB will give blind and visually impaired the confidence and motivation to learn skills and expertise that will better enable them to maintain gainful employment.ÿ",Tech provider,,0,0,0,0,0,,Hardware,0,#N/A,#N/A,"1, and 2",0,http://blitab.com/,0,50000,blitab.com
82,CREA82,CREA,CREAtiFi,Cyprus,R.P. GoldenNet LTD.,Client View,"Ipparchou, 17, 3027 Limassol, Cyprus",BUSINESS SERVICES,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Petros Savva,"Software Overview

The software our company is intending to develop is an idea generated by the need to satisfy a directive issued by the Council of the Institute of Certified Public Accountants of Cyprus (ICPAC). This law, in line with Directive 2005/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 October 2005 and Commission Directive 2006/70/EC of 1 August 2006, constitutes the obligations and responsibilities for implementation by professionals, including auditors, external accountants, tax advisors and trust and company service providers, of measures against money laundering and combating the financing of terrorism.
ÿ

For this reason firms are required to establish and maintain policies, procedures and systems to prevent money laundering or terrorist financing, and to ensure the reporting of any that may be known or suspected.
ÿ

Our system will be a database driven application that will assist firms keep records of the necessary client information in order to be able to assess accurately the risk of each client and report back to the relevant authorities.
ÿ

The main function of the system is to implement a ?Know your client? procedure which will enable a firm to form a reasonable picture of the true identity of each client, and with an appropriate degree of confidence, know the types of business and transactions the client is likely to undertake.
ÿ
The software will employ a poll system in order to collect and store vital information about each client, in a structured and methodical way. The information stored in the database will:
ÿ
Prove and verify the identity of each client on the basis of documents, data or information obtained from a reliable and independent source
Prove the identity of the ultimate beneficial owners
Prove the true nature of the client?s business and products/services offered
Indicate the level of business transactions and expected turnover
Track changes in beneficial ownership and/or control of the company
Demonstrate compliance with local and European laws
Demonstrate that all financial obligations, such as VAT and taxation, are fulfilled
Show the duration of the business.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

84,CREA84,CREA,CREAtiFi,Switzerland,Nissatech,"cRUNchy, Creative Engagement for Better Running Performances through Real-time Data Crunching","Kajmakcalanska 8, 18 000 Nis, Serbia. Switzerland",Consumer health/wellness,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Nenad Stojanovic,"Regular performing physical activities, like running or cycling, is a prerequisite for a healthy and balanced lifestyle. Nowadays there are plenty of apps for tracking users during physical activities and providing different statistics about performed activities (distance, calories burned, ?). There is an extremely positive trend: installations of sports and fitness apps will grow to 248 million in 2017, up from 156 million in 2012

However, two main challenges for ensuring healthy lifestyle are related to how to keep people to stay active and to improve their performances (or at least not to degrade). Only by ensuring that these problems are resolved properly, the benefits of being active will be sustainable. Based on our comprehensive overview of related systems we have found only a few mobile systems which are oriented toward motivating people during the run, focused on collecting reward points for performed activities in the form of very simple gamification (e.g. Zombies, Run!). Therefore, there is a gap between the need for a more intensive motivation (i.e. engagement) during exercising and current apps offering. We plan to close that gap by exploiting the creative potential of engagement process. Indeed, there are many evidences from the research experiments that the real effects in keeping trying to be better in exercising are achieved with working on willpower and positive attitude, that will boost the flow of positive energy which is required for overcoming inner temptation.

We propose a new approach for engaging people through a mobile service that combines excitement for being physically active with the positive energy for being creative. The main component is the mobile app that monitors performing a physical activity (based on a training plan, or free-style exercising) and engages the user in a proper way in the case that she/he is deviating from the plan, or expressing other evidences that the willpower is going down. The main advantage is related to the possibility to detect automatically a deviation in exercising (by exploiting a novel technology for real-time processing on mobile) and getting creative, more-engaging recommendations, based on user?s preferences and updated regularly, that will ensure the long-term effect of the changes in the lifestyle, leading to behavioral changes, which is the ultimate goal in this type of solutions. The system will be able to learn from the usage feedback, ensuring the continual improvement of the system.

Such an engagement will be provided through a mobile solution consisting of a) mobile app which represents an activty monitor and serves as a sensor for collecting real-time data and a detector of situations when the user can be engaged, b) server where all user data is stored and processed through analytics module in order to update users profiles and personalize services for engaging the user (past data to define the dynamic user engagement plan) and c) web portal for enabling users to provide their preferences and trainers/business ÿto configure and publish their plans.

The system detects the real-time situations where the motivation should be improved through creative engagement based on the recommendations for achieving short term goals. Creative engagement means that the user will be dynamicaly challenged with some ?creative? tasks that will motivate her/him to run faster/longer
The system will be provided as an app to the individual users (B2C model), or as a Service to business customer (B2B2C model)",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

85,CREA85,CREA,CREAtiFi,Greece,DOTSOFT OLOKLIROMENES EFARMOGES DIADIKTIOU KAI VASEON DEDOMENON,MyCultureTrip,"Kountouriotou 3 Str., 54625 Thessaloniki, Greece",Consumer education/culture,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Dimitra Perperidou,"MyCultureTrip
ÿ

MyCultreTrip?s goal is to enrich the representation of cultural entities (from a monument to a historic path, to festivals and other events), understand the impact of city culture on people, and create compelling and engaging experiences for both travelers and citizens.

It brings together a set of technologies that leverage open and crowdsourced data, curated content by expert users, as well as social media content and achieves its goal by building upon three basic blocks:
ÿ

Cultural content mining and extraction, for collecting culture-related content from various sources such as open data, crowdsourced data and social networks and other web sources and linking it to content and data from official cultural sources.

Visit modelling and personalisation, for understanding the patterns and preferences of tourists and individuals and devise appropriate recommendation mechanisms to assist the planning and execution of cultural visits.
User engagement and interaction, for motivating people to explore cultural resources and share their experiences and content with the online community.
ÿ

The local or regional scope of MyCultreTrip helps the visitor, or even a resident, to discover different aspects of the city. Depending on the trip phase (planning, actual visit, post-visit), MyCultreTrip assists the city culture exploration in different ways:
ÿ

Planning: Offers a rich web-based interface and tools for browsing landmarks and events of a particular place. Moving beyond existing POI browsing interfaces, MyCultreTrip supports exploration and search, itinerary presentation (i.e. popular/thematic routes through the city), and scheduling/planning facilities. The latter can be used in combination with the MyCultreTrip mobile app, a necessary tool during the visit. MyCultreTrip platform will provide personalised recommendations based on the user's interests and preferences. The user's cultural tourism preferences will be extracted by our framework from the user's multimedia trip records and they will be used in order to propose relevant cultural artefacts and events and to aggregate them into itineraries. Abstract matching is supported, exploiting the user?s social profile. Multimedia presentation of the city will allow visitors to quickly go through landmarks, popular sights etc and get additional information on each. The outcome of the planning process will be a full itinerary taking into consideration also the travelling time, the opening hours, the walking, the recommended time to spend in every venue.

Actual Visit: The application helps visitors keep track of what they are interested in visiting and provides contextual information for each POI. Storytelling (e.g. route narratives) and gamification (e.g. point gathering) features, encourage the visitor to put more attention to the visited cultural entities and to explore further aspects of the city. Recommendations provided, will be dynamically adapted around the planned visit and the user?s location, habits and history.

Post-visit: We all want to preserve our precious moments. We cherish them and we want to revisit them and share them with our friends. MyCultreTrip offers personal archiving and ?retracing? mechanisms. In that way, visitors are provided with tools to ?replay? their cultural experiences (through a web-based or/and mobile interface). Particular emphasis is put on the motivation of visitors through gamification mechanisms to provide feedback and content, documenting their experiences. In that way, it will be possible to enrich even further the representation of cultural entities accessible through the platform of MyCultreTrip.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

86,CREA86,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,Starsystem IT Srl,Web Appointment,"Localit? Fratte 49, 38057 Pergine Valsugana (TN), Italy",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Silvano Samaretz,"Our idea begins from a product of ours that we developed some years ago. This product is an Outlook alike calendar (www.webappointment.it). This represents an old concept of reservation management and is thought only for companies that need to manage a lot of appointments. This system does not take into account user needs: users have to call company booking offices during opening hours, they need to go to the office to hand documents and the workflow is not optimize that means time loss. We think that systems like this are exceeded.

Our submission will improve the classical reservation process. We want to create a new advanced system to manage reservations/appointments, for all those companies that offer services through booking/request process. We will develop a big central framework that manages all companies and allows them to process all client requests (reservation, documents, customer assistance). On the other side, the final user will use a dedicated mobile app. Through it he can make reservations 24/24 hours every day of the week, scan and upload documents and ask for assistance/informations using the chat.
ÿ
The actual reservation process:

Users, who need an appointment, call the company booking office and the operator that receives the phone-call asks for user's profile and needs and usually reserves the appointment for the first avaliable time-slot with the desired characteristics. Then the user have to go to the office to hand all requested documents.
ÿ
Our innovative idea:

The system we submit is composed by a mobile app and an administration panel (used by companies for manage user requests). The app will optimize the process described above. In order to use this app, the user has to enroll into the system: it essentially asks some personal informations like name, surname, address, birth date, etc. These data will be memorized in our cloud through a safe procedure. After the registration step, the user is allowed to make reservations autonomously. He will search a suitable date and hour in the desired office and he will send a request for a particular service. The system will process it. If the request is eligible, the time-slot will be reserved and the app will guide the user through some other functionalities related to the requested service. If the request is rejected, the user will be notified: he now can choose to send another request or eventually contact an operator for assistance. The strength of our projects that user can use the mobile app for all those companies that will purchase our software. Our goal is to expand as more as possible the set of companies that use it, in order to offer a full service to the final users. One app for many services.
All communications between user and company will be managed through internal messages, chat and emails.
The app will integrate a live chat for operator assistance. There will also be an online guide, to lead the user throught the correct procedure for reserving the appointment.

An interesting document scanner will be integrated to upload documents and photos: for particular service (for example examinations or financial assistance) it will be useful submit additional documentation to optimize time during the appointment. User can also synchronize his calendar with external account (Google, iCloud, ...) to correctly manage future appointments and consult the history of his past appointments.

The potential of our project is that the app may be used with all companies that have our web system and entire booking process will be really fast.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
87,CREA87,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,Xtensa Srl,uLook,"Salita dei molini 2, Villazzano, 38123 Trento, Italy",WHOLESALE AND RETAIL TRADE
column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Mattia Daldoss,"uLook will exploit the opportunities offered by ICT to develop innovative street-retail marketing strategies, thanks to the possibility of seizing the interest of customers. The key idea is to make shop windows dynamically adapt, and customizing the offer by matching the individual users' taste.

column1: ÿ

In fact, traditional shop windows display only a limited number of items, selected a priori and regarded as the most attractive for the average customer. This requires time and effort by window-dressers to effectively render the prominent collection of the shop at a single glance. At the same time, only a subset of the whole collection is presented, with a limited number of colours and appositions, which may not be exhaustive to capture and satisfyÿ the interest of the entire potential customers portfolio.
ÿ

By exploiting an innovative technology able to track in real-time the gaze of a customer looking at a shop window, our system will gather users? preferences and enhance the experience of the window-shopper according to what attracts his/her attention. This will be achieved in different ways, including the chance of presenting a set of related products on a background video-wall, or in other colour nuances, combinations, reporting fashion shows or famous people dressing similar clothes, and also including personalized discounts and offers. More complex settings may also provide animations, in order to capture the user?s silhouette and showing him/her dressed with that particular item.
ÿ
The core of the system consists of two main components: (i) an affordable customized imaging system (the ?Shop?s Eye?, SE) able to track the gaze of the client and to map it into the retail window
column2: (ii) a smart engine based on a set of customizable rules (the ?Window Salesperson?, WS), which pilots the output devices based on the identified customer?s interests. The SE will be a low-cost architecture made of a RGB+D camera connected with a processing unit able to track in real-time the gaze of multiple persons in front of the shop window. The WS will be a rule-based engine, driven by the visual keywords received by the SE, and providing different sets of outputs according to the available actuators (e.g., retrieving and showing images and video stored in a server, activating automation functions, managing a simple interaction with the user).

column1: ÿ

It is worth mentioning that the system would not bring in any privacy ? related issue, as no sensitive information is retained. Instead, uLook will collect many precious information regarding the most attractive items, anonymized users? preferences, relatedness between items displayed and sold, correlations between disposition and attractiveness, etc.
ÿ

uLook will fulfil different needs, from big stores that need to make their offer more attractive, to shops or chains that want to extend their customers portfolio by complementing each other in the offer, to online stores willing to invest in shop windows to better advertise their products. On the users' side, it will provide customers with a completely new window-shopping experience, by seamlessly merging traditional shopping with ?web browsing-like? capabilities.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

88,CREA88,CREA,CREAtiFi,Greece,GEORGIOS OIKONOMIDIS KAI AFOI O.E.,"WePublish - bringing authors, readers and publishers together","Skiathou 3, 16346 Helioupolis, Greece",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Anastasios Oikonomidis,"The business idea is to create an individualised platform around connected publishing houses supporting ideation, crowdfunding and publishing and bringing together authors, customers and publishers. Important functionality includes crowdfunding, selection and rating of ideas, books or processes and community building exploiting widely accepted social platforms.
WePublish follows a novel approach, based on the latest developments in the publishing industry:

the digital transition in the sector is transforming all links in the value chain, from authoring, editing, production and printing till marketing and distribution. Smaller publishing houses have to cope with these changes.
while very large publishing houses are dominating the global market, smaller houses in national markets are organising themselves vertically, often with considerable success.
social media and stakeholder participation as well as crowdfunding approaches for project financing are getting increasingly important for today?s economy.
ÿ

After the tremendous success of the first crowdfunding platforms, including the US market leader Kickstarter, the first vertical solutions have appeared. In the publishing sector, there are three vertical crowdfunding platforms, UNBOUND.COM (UK), PUBLUSH.COM (US), AUTHR.COM (US).
ÿ
Compared to the business approach of the existing crowdfunding , WePublish comes with the following two innovations:
it will be offered as ?glocalised? solution, following the cultural concets of a region or a domain.
it will connect publishers, authors and readers, using a novel approach.
In fact, current crowdfunding models are sharing a common main process: (1) author has book concept -&gt
column2: (2) author describes book concept -&gt
column3: (3) readers fund book concept.

column1: ÿ
WePublish will involve the publishers in the chain, allowing, in a flexible manner, several alternative processes:
ÿ
(1) publishers describe his open project(s) -&gt
column2: (2) readers fund book concept -&gt
column3: (3) publishers publishes selected projects,ÿorÿ

column1: (1) author has book concept -&gt
column2: (2) publishers apply for the project -&gt
column3: (3) readers fund book concept.

column1: ÿ

Even more advanced scenarios might also be implemented, e.g. publisher driven (publisher seeks for author) or reader driven (reader suggests book concepts, publisher publishes reader commissioned books). Business model will depend on the finally selected scenarios, probably a small percentage of the raised capital.
ÿ
From the technical perspective, WePublish will stand on four pillars that represent the main functionality:
(a) crowdfunding marketplace
(b) social module: interfaces to social media, blogs, ratings
(c) analysis module: detects trends and compiles statistics
(d) matchmaking component: seeks for suitable publishers or authors.
ÿ

The project is in the experimentation phase. We have implemented a first tailored crowdfunding module for the publishing house Kondyli (www.kondyli.gr). In parallel, during the last months we have performed a first qualitative survey, including over 20 publishing houses (15 in Greece, 5 in Germany) and 6 authors (4 in Greece, 1 in Germany, 1 in UK). The idea has been more than well accepted and we have collected valuable feedback.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

89,CREA89,CREA,CREAtiFi,Germany,Egoberg Media UG (haftungsbeschr„nkt),Egoberg,"Theresienhoehe 6b, 80339 Munich, Germany",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Milko Filipov,"What? A social network turning the information flow of the traditional social networks and media upside down. Egoberg will enable its users to find out how their friends and acquaintances perceive them, to present themselves and their qualities objectively from another point of view and without any bias. The users will be also able to speak their mind on other people publicly. Egoberg can also be used by creative individuals. After the initial registration on Egoberg they can get feedback about their individual creativity Why? The main purpose of Egoberg will be the improvement of one?s self-assessment, the motivation for self-perfection of the individual and the improvement of the relationships between the people in a given society. This will be achieved through a better transparency which will motivate the users to build their reputation and to have higher morality. How? In the first stage Egoberg will be based on a mobile app with limited functionality ? a minimum vialble product (MVP). The reason for the limited functionality of the app will be an easier usability for new users and the building of the user?s loyalty without making the use of the platform too difficult integrating too many features. After creating an own profile the two main features for the users of Egoberg will be writing comments and scoring 10 characteristics of other users. In the second stage we will develop the web frontend and many new features.ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

90,CREA90,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,Interplay Software Srl,Teach.Me.Now - Professional Remote Coaching,"Via 4 Novembre 1918 n. 95, 38121 Trento, Italy",Consumer education/culture,B2C,8,9,YES,IN,Interplay Software SRL (giovanni cortese),"Introduction
Here we present the main points of the business idea ofÿTeach.Me.Now.ÿ

Please start from here or from the supportingÿvideo presentation ÿattached (file TEACHMENOW_IDEA+HL_MOCKUP.mp4), which explains the business idea in simple terms - for end users and prospective customers. The second part of the video also introduces 'How it works', which shows functionalities and screens and is also relevant to the 'Mockup'.
For the complete description of our business model - based on Business Model Canvas methodology - please see the attached Business Model Canvas document (TEACH_ME_KNOW Business Plan.pdf)
ÿ
Product overview
We will develop Teach.Me.Now, a solution for effective Remote Coaching over the Internet.

The product will have a focus on effective teaching of performing arts (such as music and dance), which require realistic audio-visual interaction and continuous feedback between coach and student. However it will not be limited to music and dance - teaching fitness and other disciplines related to well-being is also an important use case for the product.
ÿ
Why Teach.Me.Now! ?

If you are a music (or other art) student wishing to find the best teacher fitting your skills/ musical goals, or you want to find a teacher near you for an unconventional instrument (say bagpipes), or your life is busy and you cannot travel weekly to the music school to meet your teacher, then you likely need remote coaching. ÿAlso, you could save money if you ÿwould take part in group lessons....
And if you are an artist/ performer/ personal trainer, and make your living out of teaching/ coaching, you need a way to reach more students, make the more out of your time, and have an easier life
reach new students/ clients, even for occasional lessons
improve your service and make more money (for example, offering a daily checkup lesson in addition to weekly face-to-face lessons)
make more money by selling and running group lessons, or creating and publishing video recordings of your lessons
improve your service, using modern teaching techniques based on multimedia (recording, reviewing together performance)
ÿ
Remote coaching for performative arts over the Internet is just at its beginnings.
Today most of this business goes through a generic technology such as Skype, and there is much room for improvement ?
So ? HERE IS TEACH.ME.NOW!!!
ÿ
What and howÿ

The driver for our project will be ?Remote Coaching beyond Skype?. Skype-based lessons are becoming popular - see http://www.takelessons.com. We will create a product which is much more compelling to coaches and student and is best aligned with the practice of how teaching happens in the real world.
We will develop an application which allows teachers and students to find one another, run lessons as in a real class, share content and assignments, and more.

The app (in the final product) will be available on different devices (tablet, desktop, smartphone, smart TV, ...), so as to be usable by everyone in her preferred setting. The prototype will focus on the Web version + app for one mobile platform.
WebRTC technology and its implementation in FI-WARE will be a fundamental component of the product we will implement.
The service will be available in Italian and English language first, and then possibly extended to other EU languages according to market opportunities.
We expect revenues for our product to come from two main sources
subscription fees paid by coaches
a transaction fee paid as a percentage of each lesson run on the platformÿ
ÿ",Tech provider,,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Instant Communications Applications,Applications,Collaborative Applications,1,0,http://www.ipsoft.it,SME,50000,ipsoft.it

91,CREA91,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,Interplay Software srl,BeThere - the conference enhancer,"Via 4 novembre 1918, 95, 38121 Trento, Italy",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Stefano Scotton,"BeThere - the conference enhancer
Brief description of the solution
Our objective is to develop a solution for the remote attendance of live events over the internet.
The solution will focus on managing events like workshop or conference but also cultural and artistic events will be taken into account during the development.
This technology makes it possible to share in real-time content, ideas and experiences with attendees across multiple geographies and time zones.
Features will be provided to better engage and involve the remote audience in the overall event experience.
The solution will give the user the possibility to explore content related to the event (during but also after the end of it) at any time.
Problem to be solved
if you have been a participant in a conference ?
How many times have you not take part in a conference because too far away or to expensive?ÿ
How many times have you had to give up to participate in a conference for other work commitments?
How many times would you have wanted to talk with the speaker and there was not enough time?
And moreover? how many times don't you remember the participants and what were discussed after the conference?
If you have been a speaker in a conference...
How many times have you found difficulties to maintain high the attention of your audience?
How many times could you not answer all the questions you have been asked for lack of time?
And how many times would you have wanted to continue a dialogue with the participants for your business?
Our solution is designed to resolve these issues through a dedicated application for speakers and participants of an event.
How do it?
There are few solutions on the market that accompany the speaker and the audience during and after the event.
Our solution will bridge this gap. How?

By allowing the remote participation through registration to a ""virtual room"" connected to the live event and by using an application for mobile devices, which allows you to hear or see the presentation of the speaker, follow the slide presentation and additional content (audio, video, documents, ...) shown during the speech.

By providing a feature/function thanks to which users and speaker will be able to interact with each other submitting questions, comments, impressions. No longer a one-way communication but a bi-directional one.
By allowing a speaker to submit live questions or survey to the public, in order to collect the results and show them on the big screen
By sharing on large screen the more interesting questions or comments of the event
By providing the participants, whether they are physically present or remote attendees, a library of content related to the event always available both during and after the event
By providing a new business model to sell online recorded event speech
Our solution allows you to go beyond a normal videoconferencing application providing features of innovative presentation interactionÿ and a new business model to sell event participation.
Technologies like WebRT and webconferencing technologies with the implementations in FI-WARE and the FI-Lab Cloud environment will be key components of the solution.

We believe that FI-WARE and FI-LAB are fundamental enablers for the phases of the prototype of the solution being able to provide an environment infrastructure tested and versatile. The ability to instantiate virtual machines with tier already preconfigured and technical documentation of Generic Enabler provided, greatly reduces startup times on the technologies used.
ÿ
The business idea will be further treated in the enclosed materials",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

92,CREA92,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,motorialab,HI-FIS The new HIgh-FIdelity  experience for outdoor Sport,"via alla cascata 56/c, 38121 Trento, Italy","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION",B2B,4,1,YES,IN,riccardo de filippi,"The ÿHI-FIS project aims at developing an innovative ICT environment for Ski Slopes and Snow-Parks, offering access to personalized services with full support to integration of multimedia, high throughput fitness sensor data (e.g. activity profiles, heart rate, ski performance evaluation in real time), and sharing onto personal spaces and social media). Based on a combination of FI-WARE solutions and MotoriaLab services, ski area users at any levels will be able to track their performance, store personal data and get individualized profiles. The personalization of the outdoor sport experience will be also offered with physical sites (sport rooms), also managed by the ski-areas. The HI-FIS infrastructure will be modular and deployable also in minor skiing resort, e.g. covering a sector for ski school training, competitive athletes, new aggregation areas for winter sports. The project ÿtimely addresses a potential critical risk for Alpine economy, of a decreasing access to ski areas, a key resource for the tourism ecosystem. Ski areas need to redesign their offer, with a specific attention to the new generations. Here we are envisioning a structured set of solutions that offers more competitiveness, with new approaches that will better sell their product: the experience of one day spent on the ski slopes. ÿMoreover the market of smartphones and wearable sensors (WS) is growing fast. WS market has an estimated yearly CGAR of 30% in the next 3 years, market projections indicate that by 2018 137.27 million units of WS will be delivered. This project is remarkably valid in Trentino, where a major investment in the last years has led to the ÿconstruction of a 800 km optical fiber network. Such infrastructure is currently not exploited by the tourism industry, and in particular novel services are lacking for the national and international customers. The FI-WARE framework will give the opportunity to build new fast ICT infrastructures for data and web services, also in remote places, with a specific focus to ski slopes and snow parks which are the new centre of interest for young people within ski areas. ÿ

In the first phase of the project, MotoriaLab will develop HI-FIS hardware infrastructure and services as B2B product for ski-areas, delivering WIFI mesh network, video cameras set up, WS to be used plug and play and an entertainment booth at the end of the slope where to deliver the processed output (video, 3d mapping, georeferenced data coming form WS) to the user. The idea is to create a ?take home your performance? video and statistics like in a real entertainment fun park setup. A video of an experimental run performed last season on the Donei slope in Cermis is attached as documentation. A definite market interest on this product has already been indicated by two Ski Areas in Trentino: the San Martino di Castrozza - Tognola (for the snow park) and Cermis ski area (for the ski slope). A letter of interest for the product by the Tognola ski area manager can be found as attached external file.

Secondly, HIFIS B2B services will be developed to provide measures and feedback as in a real outdoor laboratory: we aim to sell services for all those interested into having high resolution data about athletes performances (ski national teams, ski schools, ski clubs) and products or prototypes of the sport equipment industry. Remarkably, the University of Padova?s Sports Research group (Prof. Petrone - School of Engineering) has already commissioned a HI-FIS prototype system o be used for the world conference ISSS 2015 in San Vito di Cadore (March 8-13 2015
column2: ÿinfo at http://www.isss2015.com/). Third, for the B2C market, motorialab will deliver web/mobile services connecting HI-FIS services to its Skilo web/app platform (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=eu.fbk.mpba.skilo) to revolutionate and improve skiers skiing experience and entertainment. The final goal in this case is to enable for all HI-FIS users high resolution geospatial personal services as for example quantified self-tracking and self-evaluation, performance optimization. In terms of market expansion, we wish to offer HI-FIS?s users a complete new skiing experience starting from Trentino and then marketing the product and its services at alpine scale and then around the world. Remarkably, the same infrastructure and business model could be used also for summer outdoor activities, as example downhill biking, mountain biking and bike parks.

93,CREA93,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,U-Hopper srl,"SoLoMoN (Social, Local, Mobile omNichannel marketing)","via Antonio da Trento 8/2, 38122 Trento, Italy",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,8,4,YES,IN,Daniele Miorandi,"SoLoMoN provides solutions for personalised, multi-device, context-aware interactive marketing and advertising. SoLoMoN is a toolkit that allows brands and retailers to easily, quickly and safely design and deploy mobile, context-aware, interactive and social applications aimed at enhancing the shoppers? experience and at more effectively engaging them. SoLoMoN takes advantage of the emerging wave of wearable devices that together with the increasing capabilities of smartphones can take shopping applications? user experience to the next level.

SoLoMoN connects to: (i) a variety of wearable devices, including but not limited to smart glasses, iWatch, activity-tracking bracelets (ii) a large number of indoor and outdoor localization technologies (including but not limited to: WiFi, BLE/iBeacons, GPS etc.) (iii) social networking platforms and social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, Vine). Data from all such channels is gathered and processed and context cues are used to enhance the user experience and target advertising and offers.

SoLoMoN is made available in the form of a cloud-based platform and a Software Development Toolkit (SDK) that allow developers to quickly prototype and deploy their app. The SDK allows to define complex event triggers (E.g., Google Glass within 10m from position (x,y,z) is in front of an ad of brand QW, and two of my friends like the QW page on Facebook), and to define corresponding actions (E.g., Send a notification on the user?s iWatch that she has a time-limited discount of 20% and that in case she uses it within the next 4 hours her Facebook friends will get a similar voucher). SoLoMoN allows application designers and marketing agencies to focus on the creative aspects of the design of engaging, interactive advertising, and hinders the complexity related to processing in real-time and in a scalable way streams of data coming from different channels and devices.

Target customers of SoLoMoN are marketing companies and brands? in-house advertising agencies, which can leverage the SoLoMoN platform and SDK to substantially reduce the time (and money) required to design, develop and deploy interactive shopping applications.

The business model underpinning SoLoMoN includes two main streams of revenues. The first revenue stream is a one-time setup fee, which is required to access the SDK for commercial purposes and provides also the ability to setup indoor environments in case they are part of the advertising campaign (including, e.g., providing maps of the environment and/or registration of beaconing devices etc.). The other revenue stream is a recurrent one, based on a monthly fee, for accessing, through the SDK, the services provided by the SoLoMoN platform where all data processing will take place. Three tiers are foreseen for the service fee, depending on the number of users foreseen for the app.

SoLoMoN will include a number of generic FI-WARE enablers, mostly focused on the processing of contextual data and the triggering of application-level actions. Further, various specific FI-CONTENT2 enablers will be integrated to provide means for supporting interaction patterns. FI-WARE enablers will be at the core of the SoLoMoN SDK. Their use will enable the applicant to speed up significantly the design, development and integration processes while achieving significant cost savings. The SoLoMoN platform will be hosted on FI-LAB and will have open APIs. The applicant is committed to contribute to the FI-WARE Community by releasing as open source any enhancement of the FI-WARE GEs/FI-CONTENT2 SEs that will be developed within the scope of the project.ÿÿ",Tech provider,,X,X,X,0,X,,Software,Marketing,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,X,www.u-hopper.com,SME,50000,u-hopper.com

94,CREA94,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,SIBA STUDIO INFORMATICO E COMUNICAZIONE DI BEDESCHI ANDREA,BOOKING SERVICE,"VIA BOCCACCIO, 6, 42018 SAN MARTINO IN RIO (RE), Italy",BUSINESS SERVICES,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Andrea Bedeschi,"How many times have you tried to book telephonically an appointment to the hair-dresser, masseur, beautician, veterinarian or the tire repairer and find the lines constantly busy? 95,CREA95,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,MIVOQ SRL,Personalizable TTS,"VIA BORTOLO SACCHI 9/11, 36061 BASSANO DEL GRAPPA, Italy",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Fabio Tesser,"Text To Speech (TTS) systems are able to automatically generate speech from the corresponding text. They are currently used widely in the ICT field (train stations speech announcements, robots, avatars, call center, audiobooks, GPS navigation systems).ÿ However, the use of TTS in creative or artistic context is still limited nowadays.
ÿ
The goal of Personalizable TTS is to add the personalization dimension to TTS technology and to make it easy to use. In this way, a creative and personal use of TTS technology will be possible.
ÿ
Personalizable TTS is a web application service capable of creating the personal voice model of any human speaker, taking as input the audio recording of a few utterances.
ÿ

The user just needs to connect to the MIVOQ service (using any internet connected device with a microphone, e.g.: smart-phone, desktop PC) and read aloud a few dozens of sentences. Personalizable TTS algorithms will create a digital model of the author's voice.
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ

The voice model will possess the vocal characteristics (timbre, prosody) of the target speaker.ÿ Moreover, if the speaker uses special speech styles when recording (shouting, whisper, happy-voice, sad-voice, ...), also the resulting models will possess such expressive features.
ÿ
This functionality will be employed by users who want to experiment with new and creative applications of speech synthesis.

Once created, the voice models will be loaded by the TTS web services in order to generate personalised synthetic speech.ÿ The ability of creating voices with creative speech styles, the ease of use and the possibility of automating the voice building procedure opens the doors to the entertainment markets, making feasible the characterization ofÿ synthetic voices for video games, online role playing games, special effects, animation movies.
ÿ
ÿ
The value proposition of MIVOQ consists on offering much more flexible synthetic voices in terms of prosody and lower prices for its personalization or the creation of new voices.

This is due to the innovative technologies adopted and optimized by MIVOQ. These technologies, called Statistical Parametric Speech Synthesis (SPSS) and Speaker Adaptation, are known in the research field of speech synthesis but unprecedented in the business world.
ÿ
Such a personal, creative use of this technology is original and innovative and it will breed a new generation of applications.
Personalizable TTS can be applied to social media, web 2.0, domotics, video games, ebook, e-learning, movie industries.
A few examples:
Automatically create an audio podcast from the contents of a blog
Create a version of the voice messages from the Facebook wall, with ÿ the authors' voices
Automatic services that give different voices to animation movies characters
Customization of video games (MMORPG games, cloud games, ...) characters voices
Services that read SMS and emails with the author's voice
Telephone answering services, in addition to customization of auto-reply text messages, also require the feature of voice personalization
MIVOQ Personalizable TTS is able to meet all this needs.
ÿ
Furthermore, thanks to the ability of creating a TTS voice from few speech recordings, Personalizable TTS should be used in the social area (aid for speech impairment - voice preservation).

96,CREA96,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,Abertech s.n.c.,Smart Attention Tracker (S.A.T.),"Via Dante 48, first floor, 38068 Rovereto, Italy","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION",B2B,3,26,YES,OUT,Abertech snc,"Theÿbundleÿofÿproductsÿandÿservicesÿwhichÿourÿteamÿaimsÿtoÿbuildÿhasÿitsÿcoreÿinÿtheÿ?SmartÿAttentionÿTracker?ÿ(S.A.T.),ÿaÿFIWAREÿbasedÿsolutionÿthatÿmeasuresÿtheÿtimeÿspentÿbyÿpeopleÿeitherÿphysicallyÿinÿfrontÿofÿanÿartworkÿatÿaÿdesignÿexpo, orÿaÿpaintingÿatÿaÿmuseumÿetc.ÿMoreÿgenerally,ÿitÿisÿaÿtoolÿthatÿregistersÿhowÿmanyÿpeopleÿpassÿinÿfrontÿofÿsomethingÿandÿhowÿmuchÿtimeÿtheyÿspendÿlookingÿatÿit.
Whyÿisÿitÿusefulÿtoÿkeepÿtrackÿofÿtheÿtimeÿspentÿbyÿpeopleÿlookingÿatÿsomething?ÿ
Becauseÿitÿisÿundoubtedlyÿaÿusefulÿinformation,ÿwhichÿhasÿtoÿbeÿinterpretedÿaccordingÿtoÿtheÿcontext.ÿÿ

Forÿinstance,ÿifÿtheÿcontextÿisÿaÿmuseumÿtheÿtimeÿspentÿinÿfrontÿofÿeachÿpaintingÿisÿaÿlikingÿindicator.ÿInÿtheÿcaseÿofÿaÿmarketÿtheÿtimeÿspentÿbyÿpeopleÿlookingÿatÿcertainÿproductsÿonÿaÿshelfÿinsteadÿofÿothersÿisÿclearlyÿanÿindicatorÿofÿsalesÿpotential.

Usuallyÿtheÿtraditionalÿmarketingÿmeasuresÿtheÿeffectivenessÿinÿrelationÿtoÿtheÿnumberÿofÿvisitorsÿorÿsalesÿresults,ÿandÿthisÿisÿaÿlateÿbinding.ÿS.A.T.,ÿinstead,ÿprovidesÿanÿindicatorÿthatÿallowsÿanÿearlyÿbindingÿwithÿtheÿstuffÿexposedÿwhateverÿtheÿcontextÿmayÿbe.
S.A.T.ÿisÿmadeÿofÿhardwareÿ&amp

weÿidentifiedÿthreeÿcustomerÿsegments.

Furthermore,ÿtheÿsameÿarchitectureÿofÿS.A.T.ÿcanÿbeÿusedÿforÿanotherÿdiversifiedÿcustomerÿsegment:ÿbigÿfornitureÿchains,ÿretailÿchains.ÿObviouslyÿtheyÿneedÿaÿdistinctÿofferÿbutÿtheyÿcanÿshareÿmostÿofÿtheÿarchitectureÿwithÿslightÿdifferences.ÿ

98,CREA98,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,Foneclay Italia srl,FoneSmart,Via delle Conce 20, 00154 Roma, Italy",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,10,0,YES,IN,Marco Carosi,"The company has built a web based application that allows anyone to easily and rapidly design/create/test and deploy mobile applications for smart phones in the world.

column1: The interface is based on a visual language paradigm where the user assembles the various visual elements (text, buttons, images, lists and grids) and build the application logic using a drag and drop paradigm.
It is possible to simulate/preview the app before testing and finally deploying it on the actual devices.

Even though no programming experience is required, the tool can be profitably used by professional developers and software houses as well, to accelerate development for applications that are suited for our framework or for rapid prototyping.
ÿ
The objective of this proposal is to expand Foneclay scope to support Internet of Things (IoT) application.

We believe that the initial deployment of the IoT will be quite fragmented in terms of standards, systems and types of objects. In this environment, our goal is to accelerate IoT adoption by providing a development framework that simplifies app design/development and deployment.
ÿ

So far, the Foneclay platform has been used by artists and brand to implement creative and amazing user interfaces. We would like to provide a similar tool in the frame of IoT, to allow everybody to develop creative and innovative apps using a simple and intuitive designer tool. In this way, we are reducing the knowledge barrier needed to create innovative IoT applications, thus increasing the number of potential users and innovators.
ÿ

FI-WARE platforms feature early and rich implementation of new IoT technologies and standards. This represents a unique worldwide opportunity to implement and fine tune support for next generation IoT applications.

For example, the FIWARE IoT Service Enablement GEs could be used to connect Context Entities in a Smart Home scenario, including a remotely controllable coffee maker, smart TV, climate controller, etc. Then, the Foneclay framework will manage the app queries, say, for the coffee machine in the IoT network and provide the user with our visual language for creating powerful constructs, based on which our software building features will create the native code running on actual devices and giving the desired performances.
ÿ

Eventually, this activity could also pave the way for another FIWARE enabler, and we would be happy to provide Foneclay services to the FIWARE community through FI-Lab for developing innovative apps within the FI-WARE.

ÿ",Tech provider,,0,0,X,0,X,,Software,"Development Languages, Environments, and Tools",Application Development & Deployment,Application Development Software,1,X,http://www.foneclay.it,Startup,50000,foneclay.it

99,CREA99,CREA,CREAtiFi,Italy,HWA srl - Spin Off UNIRC,Artenna,"Via F. Zeni 8, 38068 Rovereto, Italy",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Antonella Macheda,"RF energy harvesting is rapidly developing as a future source of energy for extremely low power devices.ÿ
Wireless sensors that act as nodes detection without power supplies, could be very interesting considering applications in the field of the Internet of Things and in smart home and building.

In several applications a growing demand for more accurate measurements about goods and their valuable dynamic parameters is paving the way to more accurate traceability devices able to make also some basic computational evaluation directly within the goods.

For example, the so-called ""luxury food"" cold-chain monitoring, paintings and sculptures preservation conditions, historical and art environment surveillance are ideal candidates to be equipped with high performance electronic devices able to monitoring and data logging parameter's measurements and to evaluate dynamic information to assure accessibility, safety and privacy compliance.

Billions of e-things that need to be recharged while are moving faster or entering different locations or are attached to, if not even encapsulated within the goods they are monitoring, show a nightmare scenario in which the so-called Internet of Things could become the Internet of Things with Dead Batteries, with billions of devices never responding and never uploading vital data.
In this scenario, we propose the Artenna project.

Artenna is an electronic ""smart"" panel made of an antenna embedded in a medium or printed over the surface that can be used as an artwork and, at the same time, paves the way to the Internet of Things. Artenna is realized by a deposition of metallic paint on a panel of low cost material, such as acrylic or PVC.

The electronic inside the Artenna is able to query a series of microcircuits equipped with sensors placed on the panel with different features and able to be powered by the RF signal collected by the main antenna.
The design of the panel is at the same time, electronic and art. The antenna can be or not in view in order to adapt to a modern or classical design.
The sensors, removable from the panel, can be arranged also close to the panel to distances of the order of a few meters.
Artenna can integrate several sensors as:
- Temperature, humidity
- UV, IRÿ
- Smoke detector
- Air quality detector
- Proximity
The antenna formed on the panel is able to:
- Obtain energy from RF signals (RF energy harvesting), particularly in the UHF band in which there are numerous sources commonly available
- Interrogate smart RFID tags on the panel or in the vicinity acquiring parameters and measurement data
- Send data via Wi-Fi or BLE to Internet
- Through the use of technology FI-WARE it is possible categorize, analyze and make available information and events generated by the system.
ÿ

Artenna system implements IoT Orion Context Broker for devices observations, send commands, and publish context information. Artenna publish context information on the Context Broker that can be retrieved by smartphones or a web interface that can subscribe to notification of updated context.

Artenna can integrate a number of ambient sensors with context-awareness and can connect to other RFID sensors tags in the proximity, acting as a gateway. The user can personalize e.g. the location of the Artenna, allowing providing context-awareness of the sensors data.

For example Artenna, as context producer, registers its sensors within a room, and update context information by updating sensors values to the Context Broker server. The user can be notified on smartphone/web-site when there is a change on context information (e.g. a temperature variation in a specific room). The user will have a dashboard to monitor sensors data.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
