169,CREA169,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Path 4More Oy,Accumulating uniqueness - TellAbout ArtWork,"Karrinkuja 2, 00760 Helsinki, Finland","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Mia L„hteenm„ki,"Idea

TellAbout ArtWork is a cloud-based service and application for creative people who make physical art, handicrafts or collector items for sale. The solution enables them to increase the value and appreciation of the crafted item by providing means to accumulate its uniqueness by capturing information about its creation process, the quality of work and making this information available to buyers and audience.
The accumulation of the uniqueness can then be continued during the later phases of item?s lifetime by adding history and background from exhibitions, ownerships, usage and reviews of the item. ÿ
The information is collected and stored to a rich digital story album that stays as a digital part of the physical item.
ÿ
Target audience

TellAbout ArtWork can be used by artists and craftsmen of various fields. The solution is used also by buyers, sellers, agents, galleries, exhibition organizers and public audience related to the piece. The solution suits for global market and can be scaled fast when product/market fit is found. The solution can be fine-tuned to different market segments of handicrafts and creative industries. At the low end this can be a mass-market product for hobbyists.
ÿ
Solution in more detail

The story album allows artists and handicrafters to very easily and without any special skills to tell about the creating of their physical art piece, handicraft or unique collector item during the creation process.
ÿ

The telling can be done with whatever device (mobile, tablet, pc) artist feels most confident and without any need to understand any web technology. They can just add a story to the story album dedicated for the item. Artist does not need to concentrate on the looks, or formatting of the content she or he inputs, just capture when she or he wants to do it.
ÿ

Confidence is increased with the fact that story albums are not published on the web as such immediately, but are private and artist can keep it as a journal of the creation process. ÿThe sketches, source of inspirations, materials, work methods, flow of the work, interesting details can be included in the form (video, audio, text, pictures) that artist wishes.
ÿ

The album can have invited members who can collaborate, so artist can invite his representative e.g., art dealer or gallery for comments or for to add list of exhibitions the piece has visited. In case of ordered handicraft, the existing customer can see how the piece is being constructed and communicate on the details.
ÿ

Album is private until owner decides to open it. Typically this would be wanted for exhibitions, and when put for sale. ÿSo artist can publish the album and give a link to the album for the audience to view it. The link can be attached to the item. Album is viewable with all devices. Album can also be printed to a physical booklet if so wished for.
ÿ

The story album follows the physical piece, so the ownership of the album is forwarded to the each new owner. ÿThe previous owners and artist stay by default as members of the album if they want to and the new owner does not deny. The nice thing about this is that this way the artist stays in contact with her/his piece and its current owners and new stories possibly added to the piece.
Benefits for artist
+ Get more interest towards the piece (media, public)
+ Helps audience to enjoy the piece and appreciate it
+ Get better price for the piece that has unique history
+ No need to learn new skills, no need to change creative process
+ Collaboration where artist is in control: can use common story album for having dialog with customers, sellers, audience, if wants to.
+ History, previous and current owners known and accessible for artist also after sales",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

171,CREA171,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,FRUCT Oy,Open Museum Platform,"Kissankellontie, 20B, 00930 Helsinki, Finland","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, Consumer leisure/gaming, PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND DEFENCE
column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITYÿÿÿ",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Sergey Balandin,"Over the last decades we have seen dramatic increase of tourism activity. More and more people could afford tourism outside of their home region. The top tourist destinations, e.g., Rome, Paris, London, see increase of tourist inflow from all around the world, especially from Asia. An interesting new trend identified by some recent tourist reviews, e.g., review done in the countries of ex-USSR, illustrating that after visiting major attractions most of tourists want to see local regional specifics. However, unlike most well known tourist spots, majority of regional destinations are almost unknown to public. This creates demand for new ways of promoting not so well known tourist destinations, and for this task it is especially critical to deliver tourist information in most clear and attractive form.

column1: The last two years of cooperation with museums and regional tourist offices convinced us that there is huge market potential. We already received some support via regional programs, e.g., ENPI CBC Karelia, as well as get direct contracts from local museums. We see clear interest in discussed type of solution in many regions, and we are targeting to create mass-market tourism platform, which will specifically address needs and specifics of regional tourism. For example, instead of making tourism offer around a single ?world-top attraction?, we have to deal with a series of attractions, museums and points of interests, which are grouped according to multiple parameters to best meet personal preferences of the tourist. The developed solution is open source platform and we positioning ourselves as a service company. Regional tourist centers and museums already now are ready to give us small contracts on design of some specific functions and modules for the system. The second source of income is B2C sales. One of our services is a client for accessing museum content (including audio guide functionality) and it has been preliminary discussed already with two museums that they could allow (and even recommend) direct sale of this service to visitors, as long as the price will be affordable (currently it is discussed on the level of 0.3-1.0 EUR for the service). Also we are discussing idea of adding function for purchasing museum and excursion tickets online via our service and then we can keep some commission.

All these ideas are still under development and this is why we apply for this project ? to support our development. Moreover, we are planning to enhance our solution by the new tool for promoting regions and for this purpose we see huge potential of 3D Internet and realXtend platform. We already discussed with one regional tourist office and they would be interested to create 3D Internet models of most attractive places and install 3D Internet demo booth in partner tourist offices in other regions, as well as promote it via Internet and network of hotel chains that have special deals in the region. We see great potential in combining Geo2Tag and realXtend platform and have potential customers interested to order solutions based on this combination.ÿOur competitiveness is based on the new business model that was created specifically to take into account specifics of the target market, and on existing of ready solutions, which are already used by 12 museums (Open Karelia network) and deals with a few museums are in pipeline.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES, Consumer other",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Minna Hannele Pura,"We want to develop a new method for reaching consumers, creating consumer insight, and engaging customers into a meaningful relationship with products, services and brands. The contextual inquiry platform in connection with an iBeacon technology would enable organizations to trigger invitations to consumers who visit a physical location/store. The invitation to visit the platform would happen at specific hot spots where iBeacons are located. iBeacon sends the signal to nearby devices via Bluetooth connection to personal devices such as smart phones and tablets consumers carry along, the device then accesses the Internet page that includes the contextual inquiry platform. Within the platform, consumers can add e.g. photos taken at the location, write text, rate items, vote for best art exhibits, or answer questions presented in the inquiry. In addition to insight collection, the platform can also be used to guide consumers to do tasks that will engage them in interaction with the brand, activate them to read about the designers, buy similar products, visit other stores or exhibitions just to name a few ideas.ÿÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

column1: 173,CREA173,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Daagon Oy,NextUrban Recycling,"Kutomotie 18 B, 5 krs, 00380 Helsinki, Finland","Consumer other, PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND DEFENCE
column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITYÿÿÿ",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Munir Bakieh,"Offering context-aware mobile interaction solution (based on GPS and beacons) may satisfy functional needs of businesses with physical presence, helping to connect (refer) their products or services to consumers in a more efficient way. More specifically, solution can improve service/product-related marketing by providing direct means for consumers/community to get more information as a self-service. Another possible need may be involvement in a fashionable way of introducing products and services. More specific needs may be satisfied as well, like giving customers more comfortable service, making dealing with them speedier and personalized.

column1: ÿ

In the context of environmental services, provided by private companies and municipalities alike, there is a specific need for closer engagement, and even community engagement. Suggested solution ""NextUrban Recycling"" is going to address environmental awareness of the population by giving physical-context aware tools for businesses, individuals and community, facilitating re-use, recycling, repurposing material, which otherwise is treated as waste and not always disposed of responsibly.
ÿ

Solution is mainly targeted at enterprises and municipalities, whose duty is to care for the environment, but there may be side revenue channels involved as well (advertisement, facilitating second-hand market and recycle-related services).
ÿ
There are several use cases for the physical context-aware technology:
tools to engage local community in environmental matters (monitoring, exchanging goods, informing, reporting of problems)
novel, tangible way to raise environmental awareness
facilitate and streamline recycling centers' operation, including on the spot guidance
provide municipality with data on people's environmental behaviour to improve related services
Future development may include environmental sensors as well as beacons, giving more background information.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

175,CREA175,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Moblasted Ltd.,Tessera,"Laajasalontie 61B, 00870 Helsinki, Finland",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Gian-Luca Cioletti,"Tessera - The ?Swiss knife? mobile event management and ticketing solution for creative persons
ÿ
Vision

To create an extremTo create an extremely easy way for performing artists and amateur artists to generate, issue, purchase and validate tickets with your mobile for any kind of small and medium-sized events
ÿ

Tessera aims to make creating events and selling tickets or raising funds simple, intuitive, less time consuming and inexpensive for everyoneely easy way for performing artists and amateur artists to generate, issue, purchase and validate tickets with your mobile for any kind of small and medium-sized events
ÿ
Idea
Simplifies the complex process of sale of entrance tickets and payment execution
Small and medium-sized events management andÿ ticketing system
Facilitates also fundraising for small medium-sized organization, like amateur theatre or sports clubs
Contracts preparation for the event organizer as easy as possible
A powerful tools for the event organizer to communicate directly to the customers
ÿ
Gaps in the market

It is apparent that there is a need for making creating small and medium-sized events and raise small funds easier and simpler ? the current ticketing systems are too complicate and too expensive for organizing small and medium-sized events (long tail) and also there are no solutions available to raise easily small funds for small organisations like amateur theatre or sport clubs.
ÿ
Moreover, people are looking for new, intuitive and social ways to create personalized events and share their experiences.ÿ
ÿ
Solution
Tessera aims to utilise this trend to create an incredible convenience for both organizers and participants.
How? In just 4 easy steps you can create your own event with your mobile!ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ
-ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ Enter your contact information and the event name.
-ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ Enter the account where you want to receive the money.
-ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ Enter the venue and the date for the event.
-ÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿÿ Send the invitation and it?s done!
ÿ
Business opportunity

Tessera?s business model is based on the creation of events, on the validation of the tickets, on a very small transaction fee from the sold tickets and on the possibility to gain revenues from advertising.
If the event organizer wants to sell the tickets, then the creation of an event will cost 1?.
If the event organizers wants validate the tickets at the entrance, then the activation of the ticket?s validation app and any additional validation activates cost 1? / event

This business model creates the main revenue stream for Tessera. It also allows Tessera to offer its services for free, which in turn will induce customer acquisition and reach a critical user mass for Tessera.
ÿ
Milestones and execution plan
Tessera?s concept has been built on the already proved Riskpointer technology.
The same technology is already in use for public transportation, the system is issuing hundreds of tickets on a daily basis.
Built-in anti-fraud Technology for the identification of user.
Automatic settlement process, decrease the costs dramatically.
Location awareness Built-in the system.
Ready scalable for millions of users.
ÿ

The funds will be used for marketing activities and for developing supporting features enhancing the user experience app development (Android, IOS, Tablets) to continue matching the needs of the changing market.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

176,CREA176,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Kurio Oy,"Vstories, a matchmaker-service for creative video artists, videobloggers, production and clients","Laivurinkatu 43, 00150 Helsinki, Finland",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,"Tommi Opas, Partner, PhD, MBA","ÿ
Project: Vstories, a Matchmaker-service for creative video artists, production and clients
ÿ
Customer problem
ÿ

Videoartists and videoblogger (vloggers) are able to produce highly interesting content that is distributed through video services such as Youtube and Vimeo. However, for videoartists it would be highly interesting to find commercial projects and clients to work for.ÿ On the other hand brands constantly look for ?authentic? user-generated content to promote their products and brands.
ÿ
Product or service we will offer
ÿ

The platform enables video content production in collaboration with videoartists / vloggers without any additional middleman. Instead of advertising we talk about branded content and entertainment that can be anything between vlog challenge to manuscripted mini series based on a given brief by brand.
ÿ

For marketers the service offers mainly two options: video content produced by social media content professionals, i.e. vloggers, and possible quality consumer contacts. For vloggers it offers a channel to discuss straight with marketers and find the most suitable collaboration models and partners.
ÿ
The mission is to raise the level of digital advertising by connecting brands seamlessly with social media content professionals without any media networks or standard ad formats.
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ
Target market / customers
ÿ

Target market for the service is 1. Videoartists and vloggers that produce interesting and ?authentic? video content. 2. Companies, clients and brands that are constantly searching for interesting and authentic user-generated content about their products to be shared in various digital channels and social media.
ÿ
For brands:
ÿ

Are you interested in producing video content in collaboration with social media professionals, without any middleman? After logging in into the service you can leave your brief that will be shared to the vlogger pool either anonymously or with the brand name. Based on Kurio?s know-how in digital marketing and social media best 2-3 matches are presented to you and we take care of the contract with the vlogger. We charge 500? + VAT for each contract.
ÿ
For vloggers:
ÿ

We offer a channel to discuss directly with marketers. After logging in into the service you get access to a selection of briefs. Based on your own interest and creative ambitious you can apply to each one of them. For the selected persons we contact personally after the brief deadline closes. If you get selected the stage is all yours - we give artistic freedom within the brief limits. We believe and trust you have the best know-how and understanding what works for the audience best. For concept planning and production help and assistance is available if needed.
ÿ
Sales &amp
column2: Marketing strategy

column1: ÿ

The product will be sold and marketed by empowering various social networks that are already in use by the viedo artists and vloggers such as Youtube, Instagram, Facebook abd Vine.ÿ Kurio also shall contact a massive client pool personally to introduce this new service most effectively. Various digital campaigning options shall also be considered.
ÿ
Business model
ÿ

Kurio acts as the matchmaker for the videoartist / vlogger and the brand client / company and Based on Kurio?s know-how in digital marketing and social media best 2-3 matches are presented to you and we take care of the contract with the vlogger. We charge 500? + VAT for each contract.
ÿ
The process is highly automated and scalable also globally providing huge global potential.

177,CREA177,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Viima Solutions Oy,Team Viima,"Lakiaukio 3 B 10, 02770 Espoo, Finland","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Erkka Isom„ki,"Viima wants to build a software service that can be used to engage the company's customers or employees. The same software platform can be applied to both contexts with only slight alterations that can be done with built in settings (editable by the customer company). Viima's software allows the end users to collaborate in a visual, social and fun user interface that has already been validated with production customers.
ÿ

When Viima's software is used in the context of the company's customers, the most common use case is collecting feedback. For instance a B2C clothing company could ask consumers how they perceive the current line of jeans and what modifications or improvement suggestions do they have. The customers can then transparently voice their opinions by inputting so called ""suggestions"" to Viima's software. They can also like or comment on suggestions inputted by other users. The software works as a communication channel between the company and the customers so the company can also take part in the discussions. The phenominal effect that Viima's tool provides is that it makes feedback collections or other such customer facing questionnaires transparent to all stakeholders and it automatically pinpoints the most significant content that the customers have inputted. These have been validated ÿwith production customers to not only increase customer satisfaction, but also generate new additions to the company's line of offering. The latter part also has an already evaluated market potential since the customers who wanted the particular product or service are known in advance.
ÿ

When using Viima's software in the context of the companys employees, the most common cases are internal ideation or innovation processes. Here Viima allows for different people from all around the company's value chain to come together, share insights and come up with innovations. The innovations based on Viima's experience with using the software for internal ideation use can be small changes to everyday working routines or even new radical product ideas. Often times these great ideas that can be born by connecting people from different backgrounds either don't ever get born or are discussed over coffee breaks, but then forgotten as they don't get documented. With Viima, all of the content is documented and structured so that no brilliant idea gets lost.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

178,CREA178,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Lume Games Oy,PetSpot,"Lapinlahdenkatu 1 C, 4th floor, 00180 Helsinki, Finland",Consumer leisure/gaming,B2C,6,3,YES,IN,Riku Suomela,"Lume games creates Mixed Reality Games, i,e, games that have a link to the real world. We aim for the broadest possible market and we will only use technologies that are available to the majority of mobile device users.ÿ
ÿ

We have already developed our first game, Hidden Heroes, that is now in soft launch. The game is based on barcode and QR code scanning: Players scan products, receive a land and fight for the ownership of the products. This first game has validated our platform, and helps us to start understanding player behaviour in the real world. The product is primarily aimed at 13-39 year old male audience and the game sessions range from around a minute to tens of minutes. We want to broaden the audience and aim for much shorter game sessions and a more broad audience.
ÿ

In the CreatiFI project we want to develop PetSpot, our next game in planning, that is aimed at everyone aged 9 and up. It is a no barrier to entry Mixed Reality game where the goal of the game is for the real world to adapt the game experience to the player and not requiring the player to do anything.
ÿ

Current mobile games answer the basic consumer need to be entertained in the short moments they have available. Mobile games have done a fantastic job in this, but bringing the real world elements to games has not yet taken off. The main reason is the barrier to entry they impose as for example Ingress, the location based game, requires the players to physically go to a location to complete tasks. This is a serious barrier to entry for the players, as the cannot really be picked up anywhere.
ÿ

We are creating a unique new product, that does not impose any new barriers to entry. Pet Spot is a simple game of collecting animals from the real world. The game is a mixed reality game, where players can at any point try to spot and catch animals from a fantasy world that is overlapping with ours. The game works as follows (subject to further prototyping next year):

1. As players start the game, the game checks what animals roam around this location. There are always the same animals roaming at the same location, so if a player wants to catch a special animal and knows where it has been seen, it is always there. This will allow the game to have viral effects as well - i.e. tell friends that at the Piccadilly Circus there is a lion roaming!
2. Players may try to catch an animal with ?the catcher? and they are always awarded with a new animal. Players get the animals based on rarity, so a rarer animal is caught less often.
3. With the animals, players can engage in fun activities, that will be protyped in the first phase of the project and further defined throughout the lifetime of the product.
ÿ

The product is a mobile game that is made available in application store(s), and a game service running the game world. The product offers true differentiation and innovation in an era where most mobile games fiercely copy each other!
ÿ
The core business of PetSpot is two fold.
First, the game is a free to play game that is aimed at a wide target audience. We want to entertain players where ever they are and always offer an interesting snack of a game!

Second, the interaction with the real world offers a very large opportunity to tie in the brands and advertisement in a totally new way. To make this effective, we need to first gather a large number of players into the game.",Tech provider,,0,0,X,0,0,,Software,Authoring and Publishing Software,Applications,Content Applications,"1, and 2",0,http://www.lumegames.com,0,0,lumegames.com

181,CREA181,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,FINNAY Ltd.,FINNAY - Walk This Way!,"Leskirouva Freytaginkuja , 13c20, 00790 Helsinki, Finland",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Riikka Lindstr”m,"Finnayïs Walk This Way - An explorative navigation for users on foot. The product is a mobile application, which allows people to create and use different routes created by the community. Routes can range from a group of friends sharing a path they wish to take on their trek, all the way to companies and charities wishing to provide treasure hunt experiences for their participants. There are also plans to integrate this as part of tourism services, guiding people through different sights or interesting shopping locations. Even utilizing the application in geo caching is an option.
ÿ

User guidance is designed to be extensible with few different models supported. Two that are planned for prototype are the basic map-based guidance, and a modification based on the current version of Finnay?s Wayfinder. Map-based guidance would show your basic map view, telling you the distance and showing the location of your next waypoint. Creator can choose whether the entire route is shown immediately, or a single waypoint at a time. Wayfinders compass shows a graphical view of the direction you should take, and the distance from the target. This encompasses some gamified elements, and thus is more suitable for a treasure hunt / geo caching scenarios.
ÿ

User can browse through a list of created routes. These can be user-made content, or sponsored routes created by different companies. These are distinguished in the browsing phase. After finding a route they find interesting, they are able to add them to their own collection. This makes it easier to bookmark them for later use.
Users are able to create their own groups, with which to share private routes that are not available to public.

Along the chosen routes, application can highlight different Points Of Interest that have been entered into the system. They can be different sightseeing locations, or partner companies that have paid for visibility.
ÿ

Route creation is done by swiping through the map view, and tapping to add a waypoint. A single route can have 1-n waypoints, in addition to the starting location. Waypoint can have different functionality bound to them. You can add a custom message, activate the next waypoint etc.
ÿ

Application also has searchable events. These can be happenings in large fairs, charity events or just in general. Events are typically tied to a specific date, or a time period in which the search needs to be concluded.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
182,CREA182,CREA,CREAtiFi,Sweden,Plexical AB,Pleathub,"Lindholmspiren 5, 40278 Gothenburg, Sweden","MANUFACTURING, WHOLESALE AND RETAIL TRADE
column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES",B2B,2,3,YES,IN,Erik Larsson,"Pleathub is a two sided B2B marketplace connecting textile print designers with fashion &amp
column3: housewear retail companies buying print designs.

column1: ÿ
Pleathub mission

Our mission is to disrupt the ways that textile print designs are being sold and bought. The goal is that Pleathub does to the textile print industry what a marketplace like 99designs.com did for the graphic design industry.ÿ
ÿ
A textile design marketplace

Pleathub will operate the marketplace and act as the central piece between the sellers and the buyers. As marketplace operator our main role is to build and maintain the liquidity of the marketplace (ie having a healthy balance of supply and demand).
ÿ
B2B

Pleathub is not a C2C and ""open marketplace"" in the sense of for example eBay. Pleathub is a B2B marketplace connecting professional textile graphic designers with fashion retail companies (like Desigual, Primark, H&amp
column2: M, Zara etc).ÿThe goal is to create a modern two sided niche marketplace where we as operators tightly control the experience. From payment, customer support, inventory management, item curation, payment processing to legal issues. We see Pleathub as operating as a ""full stack operator"".

column1: ÿ

The quality and simplicity of the user experience, of the support and of the buying process will be at the heart of the Pleathub. In order to remove as much friction as possible in the user experience, background checks etc of both designers and buyers will be done by Pleathub.
ÿ
Business model for the marketplace
Pleathub will on the behalf of the designers sell licenses to their designs:
ÿ
Licensed stock design (the prints can be used a limited amount of time)
Licensed extended stock designs (the prints can be used unlimited amount of time)
Licensed premium designs (the prints have a one-off exclusive license and can only be bought once)

Option 1 and 2 will be open to all while option three will be Premium access where membership will be background checked by Pleathub. Designs sold in the premium area will be more expensive and we expect the majority of the revenue will take place there.
Revenue model for Pleathub
The revenue model is percentage based and membership based:
ÿ
Pleathub takes a percentage on each sale
Pleathub charges ""VIP"" buyers a monthly fee for access to premium textile design patternsÿ
ÿ",Service provider,,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Business-to-Business Middleware,Application Development & Deployment,Integration and Orchestration Middleware,1,0,http://plexical.com,0,0,plexical.com

183,CREA183,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Alshain Oy,Map Ranger,"Linnankoskenkatu 17 B, 00260 Helsinki, Finland",Consumer education/culture,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Krista Paasonen,"Map Ranger is an app / game which puts together real world exploration, excercise and a game map.
ÿ

Player can only see clearly the parts of the map where he has visited in the real world while the app is running and tracking the players moves. Second stage app would have tasks and information on landmarks and places the player currently is.
ÿ

People don't always know even their very own neighborhood and exploring your surroundings is easily forgotten. With a map, that only reveals the places you have already been, will give you more motivation to see locations you may not normally visit and see your neighborhood. App is meant for everyone but mainly for people interested in outdoors and for people who want more motivation for example to their weekly walking/running routes. App also services tourist with landmark and other information. App also gives a possibility to add tasks to it (this feature is aimed for tourist offices).
ÿ
Marketing is done by Facebook, grapevine and hopefully by cities that would make more content in form of taks and local information (e.g. their newspapers, websites).

Competitors: currently none.

184,CREA184,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,LeeLuu Nightlights,LeeLuu Nightlights,"Lontoonkatu 6, a 9, 00560 Helsinki, Finland",Consumer education/culture,B2C,5,1,YES,IN,Emmi Pouta,"Customer segments
ÿ

We are creating value for parents with children between the age of 3 and 12. These parents belong to our most important customers together with groups buying LeeLuus as presents including grandparents, friends and relatives. Our typical future customer values high-quality design and technology and cares about ethicality and aesthetics. Our customers are also interested in wellness and using self-tracking data to improve daily functioning.
ÿ
Value proposition
ÿ

Our aim is to support parenting. We help parents to teach their children to sleep in their own beds. LeeLuu nightlight works as a tool helping parents to empower their children. The data collected with LeeLuu nightlights helps parents to track their kids? sleep time. This data combined with other tools helps creating the desired sleep quality and rhythm. At the same time the soft interactive nightlight helps kids fight monsters with light. Parents get better sleep, more own time and feeling of being a good parents. Children get better sleep and feel supported.
ÿ
Customer relationships
ÿ

Customer relationships will be established and maintained through various channels, providing tools and training supporting parenting. Content of the channels creates an understanding of being a parent. This content includes articles, videos, storytelling and sleep data. The aim is to create a lively online community around LeeLuu Nightlights.
ÿ
Channels
ÿ

Our customers will be mainly reached through various social media channels. In the early phase these channels include for example Facebook, Twitter and different blogs. First LeeLuus will be sold single or in sets via our LeeLuu online store. The sleep data collected through LeeLuu nightlights can be used through LeeLuu website and a mobile application. Awareness of our products will be created also in different wellbeing and family related events.
ÿ
Key activities
ÿ

There are four key activities required by our business model. Engineering refers to creation and maintenance of the sleep data collection and analysis system. Design activities include development of LeeLuu nightlights and preparations for launching the next generation of physical and digital products around LeeLuu. Content creation includes effective management of the communication channels to our customers and building networks with other relevant partners in the network. Finally, sales activities focus on building viable and scalable sales channels for LeeLuu nighlights.
ÿ
Key partners
ÿ
Our key partners are electronics manufacturers, textile manufacturers, textile producers and online content providers.
ÿ
Key resources
ÿ

Our key resources are our design team, our interactive textile technology and the online community. Design team develops LeeLuu nightlights on continuous iteration rounds using the user-centered design methods. The patented interactive textile technology combined with an integrated and exceptional approach to sleep tracking will create a unique resource for the company. The lively online community around LeeLuu nightlights will help the design team develop products that solve real needs.
ÿ
Cost structure
ÿ

The most important costs inherent in our business model involve engineering, manufacturing, delivery and content creation costs. The estimated cost structure division is following: engineering costs 20 %, manufacturing costs 30 %, digital content creation costs 15%, other costs 35%.
ÿ
Revenue streams
ÿ

The main revenue streams will be based on the sales of LeeLuus and providing digital content. The estimated price will be 40-100 ? per LeeLuu (sold single or in sets of three) and the estimated monthly subscription fees will be 5?/month for the digital content.",Tech provider,,0,X,0,X,0,,Hardware,Consumer application,#N/A,#N/A,"1, and 2",0,http://www.leeluu.fi/,0,0,leeluu.fi

185,CREA185,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Finternet Group Oy,Kickgifter,"Lummetie 43 f 26, 01300 Vantaa, Finland",Consumer leisure/gaming,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Hien Le,"Kickgifter platform provides consumers the easiest way to create gift projects, chip in friends, pool the money and give the lucky recipients the gifts they really love. Kickgifter is much more than an ordinary group-gifting platform
column2: Kickgifter also offers an innovative payment gateway for retailer as a means to create added value and leverage customers? shopping experience.

column1: ÿ

With regard to consumers, ÿKickgifter enables the gift organizer to start the gift project and send invitation to their friends by SMS within minutes. Their friends, in return, can easily confirm their participation and contribute their share only by replying ?OK? via SMS to our system. They money will be later charged to their next phone bill. The gift organizer is able to manage the contribution process by using our user-friendly dashboard. Once the money is collected, we will send the notification to the recipient, allowing him/her to choose the wanted gift from our huge selection. The recipient can adopt either online or physical gift cards. The online gift card will be sent right away to him/her by SMS. The physical gift card will be delivered to his/her door within 24 hours.
ÿ

Our solution not only eases up customer?s life but also equips retailers with a potent tool to create added values for their customers. By integrating our white label product into their web shop, retailers allow their customers to chip in friends, collect money and give gift card to the lucky recipient in special occasions. The recipients, then, can use to gift card to buy anything they love from the retailers. In this sense, retailers receive precious opportunities to leverage customers? shopping experience, drive more traffic to both their web shop and physical stores, and thereby generate more sales and revenue.
ÿ

We also offer white label product for local media and directory companies to create additional values for their customers. Our product serves as a new revenue stream and a new business model for them to differentiate themselves among others players of the field. In today?s competitive online advertising world, transforming businesses from offline to online is not enough to increase their share in customers? shrinking wallet. Local media and directory companies are in need of innovative business models to stay ahead of the competition. Our product will give them a safe ticket to get on success stage.
ÿ
ÿ

186,CREA186,CREA,CREAtiFi,Sweden,OnSpotStory AB,Fun@Museum - Indoor Navigation System for Museums,"Malmg?rdsv„gen 63, 2tr, 11638 Stockholm, Sweden","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, Consumer education/culture, PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND DEFENCE
column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITYÿÿÿ",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Staffan Gerl”w,"We want to develop an indoor navigation system (based on iBeacons technology) for museums that complies with the highest accessibility standards.

column1: ÿ

Currently museums have extensive exhibitions with a large quantity of information of variety of different artefacts. The information is not personalized taking into account the visitors interests and needs. Many times this leads to exhausting experience for the visitors
column2: it is difficult to digest all the information and sometimes it is irrelevant or impossible to understand (if you are not familiar with the context). Another problem the visitor is faced with is how to spend the time wisely - where is the information that interests him or her the most.ÿ

column1: ÿ

The idea is to provide a fully funtional indoor navigation system for museums based on iBeacons technology. The iBeacon technology is a low-cost and low-powered and easy to deploy solution for museums to solve the problem of custom guided tours and artefact information.ÿ
ÿ

In the long term the aim is to provide a personalised museum exprience for visitors that not only includes the exhibition experience but also all the services (restaurant, cafes, interactive games and quizzes etc) that a museum can offer, including the payment for these services (Apple Pay?).
ÿ

Furthermore, museums as public institutions have also a specific responsibility of making their exhibitions accessible and to enable all citizens, regardles of disabilities, to take part in their history and cultural heritage. Thus the application we wish to develop within the project will comply to the highest accessibility standards. This will be ensured with the iterative development process with rigorous user-testing of the application based on the methods developed by Funka Nu AB (market leader in accessibility in the Nordics) and with the cooperation of the Gothenburg Natural History Museum (Sweden) providing the test-bed / living lab environment. ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
187,CREA187,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Sanoste Oy,Invitation 2 Creative Interaction 4 Elderly (ICI-e),"Mariantie 15, 02700 Kauniainen, Finland",Consumer leisure/gaming,B2C,3,1,YES,IN,Sanoste Oy,"ÿ

The majority of homecare customers are not able to leave their home without assistance. For this reason they have little or no chance to attend cultural activities. We intend to bring these services to their own homes. Our business idea is to provide interactive, innovative and versatile cultural services to home-dwelling elderly with poor functional capacity. Our services will be co-created together with the end-users to better meet their true cultural needs and wishes.
ÿ

In addition to the integration of the cultural services, the project includes a special focus on developing an interface that will be comfortable for elderly with only a little, if any, experience with modern technology.
ÿ
A wide range of creative industry professionals (e.g. musicians, dancers, circus and theatre professionals) is also participating in the service design.
ÿ

The nature of cultural services can be versatile (e.g. karaoke, citing poems, worship sessions, guiding through art exhibition) and they will be produced by professionals. The cultural services can be transferred to the end-users either online or as recordings with a volunteer supplying the interactive group discussions. According to our preliminary survey, numerous professional artists are willing to present their work with a symbolic fee - or even free of charge, at least during the test use - for an audience of elderly citizens.
ÿ

The technology brought to the home of the elderly is an easy-to-use touch screen with a microphone, camera and video connection. We will not develop the technology as it is already available. For us the technology is only a platform to integrate our services.
ÿ
In developing our services we are making the use of the following FIWARE enablers: Object Storage and BigData Analysis.
ÿ

The business idea will be executed by our experienced professional team with excellent skills and vast professional networks. It has over 80 years of combined experience in user-driven service design, science, technology and business.
ÿ

Our competitive edge derives partly from the design of easy-to-use services suitable for elderly people and from the efficient and professional production of services through the management of a large network of professionals. To be able to scale our service production we intend to utilize an open-source based tool, which enables us to recruit, schedule and manage our large network of artists and volunteers.
ÿ

Our main competitors are other evolving organizations providing virtual arts. The present providers are mainly web-based and their services are not targeted to the elderly with significantly declined functional capacity. ÿThe present user-interfaces are also far too complex and unattractive for this target group.
ÿ

Numerous studies are published showing the positive effects of arts and culture to a variety of health-related outcomes. Even an association with up to three years longer life span has been found. In addition to its recreational effects, participation and involvement in cultural events promotes health, social inclusion and networks.
ÿ
The creative industry benefits from our product being able to reach an audience otherwise unreachable.
ÿ

Our business idea is to meet the need for novel strategies for delivering new services for elderly care. The demand is growing due to the rapidly aging population and the simultaneous lack of financial and human resources. There is also a growing necessity to decrease the expensive institutionalized care and convert it to homecare, even for those who are increasingly frail and suffering from immobility, loneliness, fear, and isolation. To cope at home they need novel easy-to-use services delivered to their home.",Service provider,,0,0,0,X,0,,Hardware,0,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,0,0,0

190,CREA190,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Ferus Bestia Oy,LionCrypt mobile,"Melkonkatu, 22a, 00210 Helsinki, Finland","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, TELECOM AND MEDIA",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Tuukka Korhonen,"An artists work is the bread and butter of making an artist a living and making sure this work is not circulated outside of his/her control is imperative to a sustainable career.ÿ Our idea focuses on keeping work safe from getting into the wrong hands to make sure creative industries carry on thriving.ÿ

The ios app would use FIWARE technology to create software that means that items stored in the cloud e.g. drop box could be viewed on a phone without compromising the creative work. The creative works would be encrypted before entering the cloud and the customer would hold all the passcodes to make sure that it is safe.ÿ

Artists often need to show their work to people in order to sell it. So we would want to evaluate other security measures such as watermarks to prevent their work from being sold onwards without their knowledge. We also would like to include a log to show who has accessed it, from what device and when and where.ÿ We want to research the possibility of making sure even if you share the work with another individual the software blocks the possibility of being downloaded. However for added protection as people nowadays could just take a picture with their phone. The document could have a timer so that after a short period of time from opening the document it is deleted to stop the receiver making copies.

For the software to be efficient and secure, management of users is a crucial part of our application and could be solved using the Keyrock FIWARE technology.ÿ Also it is important to make the software easy to use to make sure the encryption program is accessible to as many people as possible, even those with not so much technology experience. Therefore we would like to investigate the possibility of using the Fiware interface designer and virtual characters to make it as clear as possible.ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

column1: Launzer.com is #1 Marketplace for branded and 3D pprinted merchandise. Company behind the service - 3D Online Factory Ltd - was established in laten 2013 by serial entrepreneur and TV&amp
column2: Media veterian Kari Voutila to solve the problem of merchandise: Too many gate keepers and and too slow reaction for what's happening in the markets.

column1: Launzer is build for brands and their core fans. The idea is provide fast, safe and profitable channel for brands to make merchandise and build up engagement with their fans. For fans Launzer is the place to show their commitment for their favourite brands and get new kind of immediate customer experience with 3D Printing. The focus is in Gaming and in Entertainment.

Launzer is not a 3D Printing service. There are two ways to get the merchandise: Downloading the file and printing it with consumers' own devices or using printing services. The main business line is to get merchandise through i.materialise - the world's largest industrial 3D printing service - to which Launzer full integration.

Launzer's beta version was released in November 2014 at launzer.com. Untill now 30 brands are signed to use Launzer as their new merchandise channel, whichÿcome in step by step. The target is to crease the mount of brands up to 100 by end of 2015.
ÿ
The Idea: Play &amp
column2: Launz - experience

column1: In the digital world consumers want to express their feelings and actions immediately. One of the ways to show this is to buy different kind of merchandise around the brand to which consumers have strong emotionals relatoins. Specially this goes with Gaming and Entertainment.

Idea is to create an API for mobile and browser games which allows players to ÿpurchase objects inside the games while their are playing, without leaving the game just pushing the ""Launz"" buttom. In the first API (which is to be funded through Creati FI) there are ready objects (databases) inside the games and accordingly in Launzer.com. The printing can take place in several printing services or with player's own device if the brand owner allows that.
The API offers first to 3D Online Facoty/Launzer a remarkable competition advantage in the field of 3D Printed e-commerce services and is the main focus in company's development map for 2015.

For Gaming Brands the API offers a totally new way to make digital merhcandise with better profits and gives additional value to build up better and stronger engagement with their players. API can be used also as a reward, e.g. players get chance to get free/or with payment different kind of merchandise after their have reached certain level of the game.
For Players API offers a totally new experience inside the gaming and gives them immediate consumer experince and a possibility to engage with their favourite brands.
The road map for the project is planned that API would be available in Q3/2015.
ÿ
The possible beta partners for development would be at the moment:
Legendary Games, browser based (UK)
Behaviour Interactive, Android &amp
column2: IOS (Can)

column1: ÿ
The next step after Play&amp
column2: Launz epxperience to continue the development with co-creation and modification tools for players which allows to them create their own e.g. figurines inside the the game and then ""Launz"" them into the real world. The target for the second step is to get that API out live in Q1/2016.

column1: ÿ

column1: ÿ

column2: events not promoted in mass media. The service learns to recommend you personalized tips new exciting attractions based on profile and use history. Users of MyKontiki are the consumers, organizations and commercial attraction companies.

column1: ÿ

195,CREA195,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Adwith Oy,Adwith Oy,"Perhonkatu, 1 B 20, 00100 Helsinki, Finland",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jevgeni Peltola,"Adwith is an advertising network which helps companies to get more clients through affordable advertising. We make the advertising affordable, cheap and available to more businesses.
ÿ
We are going to increase the amount of the available digital screens by allowing any company with digital screen in a suitable physical location to make money by showing advertisements.ÿ
ÿ

Firstly, we help advertising agencies to earn more money by letting them quickly setup white labelled service via our API where their customers can easily launch advertising campaigns based on the geolocation and the interests independently.ÿ
ÿ

Secondly, we make it easy for internet connected digital out-of-home screens owners to earn extra money by broadcasting our advertisements in the unique physical locations such as airports, busy streets, co-working spaces, hospitals, shopping malls.
ÿ

We get the advertisements from our partner advertisement networks. Which are then available on our platform so that the screen owners could freely choose the most value bringing advertisements to be shown on their screens.
ÿ

FIWARE service enablers provide suitable ecosystem for the Adwith Platform. Adwith.org Platform will be built using two generic enablers (GE) from FIWARE platform. Communication between out-of-home digital screens and the platform will be constructed using scalable Publish/Subscribe Context Broker for fast and reliable message passing. On the business side Store - WStore component will be used to match the buyers and sellers of digital screen advertisement space.
ÿ

Publish/Subscribe Context Broker - Orion Context Broker will be used for exchanging information between digital out-of-home screens, media agencies and the Adwith.org advertisement platform. It will relay information such as advertisement display schedules, media content and uptime &amp
column2: heartbeat information between the devices. Publisher and subscriber model will be used extensively: screen is consumer of ad information and publisher of device uptime and heartbeat information while platform is the publisher and consumer of these.

column1: ÿ

Store - WStore will be used for matching offerings from digital screen owners to the needs of media agencies. The digital screen owner will place and publish offering of its screen real-estate to the store. Ad agency looking for ad space then searches the store and after finding suitable offering then buys it. Store handles all charging and billing duties for Adwith while flexible pricing models will be used to deliver the exact needs of the buyer. The platform will provide user interface for both buyers and sellers that in turn communicate with the Store using its provided REST API.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
196,CREA196,CREA,CREAtiFi,Estonia,Lib Oš,LibPlanet,"Peterburi tee, 16-54, 11411 Tallinn, Estonia",WHOLESALE AND RETAIL TRADE
column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Maria Stsukina,"LibPlanet is an new marketplace that makes it easy for local booksellers around the world to reach their customers online. It provides local businesses additional sales channel and readers convenient searching and buying tool that enables them to find any book in the world. LibPlanet makes unreachable reachable.ÿ

column1: ÿ
We make unreachable reachable on books' market by solving:
1. Booksellers' problem of low sales and not being able to reach their customer online
2. Private persons' problem of reaching the needed book on local markets and also expats' problem of reaching a book in any language in any corner of the world.
We also create a positive impact on books recycling and deforestation problem by applying used books and keeping them in continuous usage cycle.ÿ
ÿ

Our LibPlanet marketplace is an online platform designed for a convenient use for sellers and buyers. Thousands of booksellers can easily and quickly upload and update their inventory data online through our convenient tool, manage and market their goods through our search and advert modules.
LibPlanet sales channel enables them to go global with their small and medium business and sell their goods on international markets not just in their local stores.

Buyers can search across the listings of many independent booksellers, thereby allowing small, independent players to compete with books selling superstores. Books are presented in different languages, with different topics, condition and prices from thousand different sellers within the country and also internationally in one online place. Our system and customer support allows to get buyer any book in the world in any language in any location.
Private people can also sell or donate their unneeded books to those who need them on our platform, instead of trashing them by this creating a positive impact on environment and society.
Our specially designed IT tools in marketplace are being developed to an extent that bookstores every day activities would be fully automatised and synchronised with our marketplace.ÿ

197,CREA197,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Hai Art ry,Hailuoto App,"P”ll„ntie 455, 90480 Hailuoto, Finland","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, Consumer health/wellness",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Antye Greie-Ripatti,"We want to develop an exemplary App for the island Hailuoto.

Pondering on smart cities - we argue rural or remote places must become smart too. But the smartness of a rural place is very different form the urban one. We are great defenders of the rural quality of life and we are convinced that technology can contribute to making rural life extremely rewarding in 21st century.

With our arts program we have proven that we can be highly innovative and can compete with urban institutions like a Contemporary Arts Museums in a capital of a country. We are saying that remoteness is an advantage and holds so much unexplored potential to grow, which we don?t even know yet.

For example: What happens when we connect all food producers in an area and make it visible to locals and visitors. What happens if we synch the ferry schedules with peoples smart phones to signal what ferry one is taking? What happens when we list and categorize all local businesses? What happens when we show all the horses that live on the island? We are thinking of visualizing property in colors, show accommodations for tourism, implement a high quality hiking map? We suggest hiking routes which include historical visiting points, where we explain special places and its stories. Hailuoto is a migration point for birds, we collaborate with the local bird association and implement a Hailuoto bird map. Many subjects can be looked at and considered for its potential on smart phones: Farming, foresting, ship harbors, fishing, recreation, history, education etc.
By programming and designing an App for this island we see a huge potential not only for tourism but also for inspiration, development and well being for locals.
To be able to hold all info of the island Hailuoto in one hand could improve the accessibility and the experience for visitors and offer locals more sufficiency and visibility.

Important is that we know Hailuoto very well and we employ artists and designers to realize our visions excellently. We will collaborate with everybody represented on a personal level and face to face and interview all businesses and officials of the island. We use open source methods to realize the app and work 100% inclusive.

We are thinking represent of all generations, children as well as elderly in our advisory team to listen to their point of views and ideas too. Every idea implemented must hold an improvement in practicality and usefulness to the traditional way-of-doing-things.

Involving many layers of the islands reality and society like list services, create a business network, show interconnectivity, visualize history, provide extensive and very mature nature information, implement arts &amp
column2: culture, provide open source for input of citizens and visitors, resolve infrastructure improvements and more, we only begin to understand the potential of such an interface in a rural place.

column1: The app will tell about the place how it really is and it will also tell about the past, future and fiction in an intriguing way. It will deliver high value content practically and culturally. By involving our artists and creatives it will include progressive technological skills of visualization, sonification and interactive story telling. And will provide improvement for locals, visitors and tourists.

The idea is in the beginning, we have to develop the exact way to realize the App technically and also how to maintain and update it in the future frequently, which is a natural consequence of such an app. We must develop a concrete business model for the launch and after the launch. There is no competitors to our knowledge. We will use consultation and outsource to third parties in areas we lack expertise.
ÿÿ
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ

199,CREA199,CREA,CREAtiFi,Denmark,Startuptravels IVS,Startuptravels,"Porcel?nshaven, 26, 2000 K?benhavn, Denmark",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Anders Hasselstr?m,"Startuptravels is a professional social network allowing you to meet and connect with local entrepreneurs while traveling. You can look for a place to stay, a desk to work at or just arrange a meet up for coffee. Startuptravels is also a platform where the entire entrepreneurial landscape is mapped for you based on geographical location. You can find co-working spaces, accelerators or in the city you are traveling to but also search for entrepreneurs with specific skills you are looking for.
ÿ

What makes Startuptravels new and exciting is that the purpose of the platform is to find new contacts based on geographical location. The conversation starts because one person is visiting another country and wants to connect with a likeminded person.
ÿ
Users can find entrepreneurs based on their geographical location and are capable of reaching out to them even though they have no previous connection.
ÿ

Most entrepreneurs today resort to LinkedIn, Facebook or their personal network when they want to find local entrepreneurs to meet while traveling. However, LinkedIn and Facebook are not made for reaching out to new people to meet - it is made for networking and interaction with current contacts. Both Facebook and LinkedIn try to limit the ""approach behavior"" by using paid InMails and the ""Other"" folder.
ÿ
On Startuptravels it is legitimate behavior to reach out to other people for the sake of reaching out and arrange a meet-up, which is behavior we have seen to a great extent already on the platform.
ÿ
This way we can interconnect the world of entrepreneurs!
ÿ
Screencast:ÿhttp://youtu.be/4dxHq1qPHbc
ÿ

We started working on Startuptravels in the beginning of June and began signing up users via our landing page in the beginning of July. Since July we have had more than 250 Skype interview with early adopters and signed up 10.000 entrepreneurs from 130 countries and 1200 cities worldwide.
ÿ

We have been featured in various media and followed a strict LEAN process with emphasis on customer discovery in the first 3 months. The design and features of the platform is the result of co-creation with early adopters. We have been working closely with 25 entrepreneurs to shape the platform.ÿ
ÿ
Please see supporting material here:ÿhttp://youtu.be/eibl6TXub34ÿsince upload did not work with file format.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

200,CREA200,CREA,CREAtiFi,Poland,BI ARCHITECTS SP. Z O.O. SP.K.,My House 3D - collaborative online 3D tool for interior designers and their clients,"Puˆawska 257, 4, 02769 Warsaw, Poland",BUSINESS SERVICES,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Tomasz Kucharski,"My House 3D is a virtual space that brings together interior designers and clients in the form of an interactive website designed to ease the strenuous process of designing or re-designing a space in one?s home.
ÿ

Our company will use a commission-based business model, which will generate a fee from a transaction between the interior designer and the client, facilitated by our website. We chose this model because the website, acting as the agent, is an intrinsic part of the sales process ? it is a business model designed for close cooperation. The fee will be charged to the client if they wish to access the data of the designer in case of a portfolio search, and to the designer if the designer wished to respond to an advertisement posted by a prospective client.
ÿ

The website will feature online portfolios from interior designers, giving them a virtual space in which they can showcase their work and style, allowing new potential customers to see their work. The site will allow clients to browse our database of designer portfolios, based on keywords and tags, allowing them to find exactly what they are after in their design project. Prospective clients can then contact the designer through the website and collaborate online in our 3D studio.
ÿ

We will also incorporate a home repair space ÿwhere consumers can find home-improvement experts, and an online store, where consumers may purchase selected pieces for their home and incorporate them into the designs of the interior designers.
ÿ

The website will also allow users to post advertisements about upcoming design projects, which allows designers to submit bids for each project in the form of an online form. The client can then select the designer they like and contact them through the website.
ÿ

As mentioned above, we will create an online 3D studio, based on FiWare technology, which will allow the designer to showcase their work on each project to their clients, and allow the client to provide valuable input into the development of the design idea.
ÿ

Thus the website will greatly contribute to the optimization of workflows in the design process and allow clients to find the perfect designer by either posting an ad or browsing our database of online portfolios.

201,CREA201,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Motere Oy,CogFut ? Learning Cognitive Football Skills,"Puutarhatie 9 A as 2, 02710 Espoo, Finland","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, Consumer health/wellness",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jari  Takatalo,"CogFut is a browser-based digital edugame that teaches basics about football and develops players? perceptual-cognitive skills. CogFut is designed to combine young athletes (7-15 years) entertainment video gaming and their sport. In addition, CogFut provides a tool for team coaches to teach their players football tactics and new concepts in a digital environment that is familiar for the players. Coaches can present new drills through CogFut prior to physical practices (i.e., flipped class room), follow player?s performance and virtual practices (pinpoint difficulties and motivation), evaluate their player?s baseline in their cognitive functioning, for example, and follow player?s overall progression during the season. As a social platform, CogFut provides players means to communicate with each others in addition to their coaches.
ÿ

The first step is to develop an edutainment version of the CogFut. The annual world-wide edutainment market-size is more than $9 billion (2012). The market for an edugame like CogFut is huge. There are approximately 1,000 registered football clubs in Finland and thousands more in Europe (e.g., England 40,000, Germany26,000, France 18,200) and world-wide. Possible revenue stream in Finland could be following: in boy?s age-group born in 2007 (7-years-old) there are approximately 60 players in the biggest teams, which gives an average of about 20 players per club nation-wide. Approximately 800 clubs have 07 boy?s team, which makes a total of 16,000 players. If 40% of these players purchase a 10? yearly CogFut licence, the cash flow would be approximately 64,000?. With a CogFut licence a player can create a user-account that records all the achievements, play the game, and is eligible for new levels that are introduced during the year (the number of these is not yet decided). Parents would surely prefer CogFut over an entertainment game.
ÿ

The above example describes cash-flow only in one boy?s age-group in Finland. Such potential cash-flow would enable developing new levels for the game and to market it around the world. Additionally cash-flow could be attained from girl players, coach/club licences (possibility to get a company sponsorships for a club or an individual team), and other age-groups (8-15 years). Not to forget that a new player generation starts playing football every year.
ÿ

The future vision of CogFut is that the fundamental game mechanics are utilized to develop similar edutainment games for different sports, such as ice-hockey and basketball. In addition, the edutainment version provides CogFut team valuable data that shows the re-play value of each level and enables us to predicting the longevity of play in each level produced. The hottest levels are then combined into an entertainment CogFut, namely FunFut. In this point, different versions for multiple platforms (iOS, Android, etc.) will be developed and distributed through application market places such as AppStore. Again, markets for such a product do exist in the form of hundreds of millions of people interested in football around the world.
ÿ
In the current CreatiFI application the focus is on developing the prototype of the football edugame version of the CogFut.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
202,CREA202,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Siebe Projects Oy,Spaceitup,"Rakentajantie, 2C 36, 00370 Helsinki, Finland",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Siebe Projects Oy,"Business idea

Spaceitup is the first Space-sharing platform in the world that allows anybody to personalize locations and share them with others. Spaceitup is an innovative way of combining maps, location interests and communications.
ÿ
Mobile app
Spaceitup provides a mobile app to Space up anything people do and share it with others. Follow these three simple steps to create your first Space:
ÿ
Create a Space - a Space consist of a name, location and size, the size can be anything from your backyard to the Amazon rainforest.

Spice it up - spice up your Space with location based information, i.e. where the parking area is or where it is safe to swim, show nearby POIs (FI-Ware POI Data Provider). The cooler your Space the more people will use it.
Share it - once you have created a Space it is time to share it with others. Similar to Youtube movie you can share your Space with everybody, your friends or keep it private.
ÿ

Once a Space is shared, it may be used by people simultaneously. People using the same Space can chat and see each others location and use the information stored inside that Space. With the mobile app you can create as many Spaces you like or find and use Spaces made by others.
ÿ
What makes it special

Spaces are personal, they reflect actual values and interests of what people do at a certain location, Spaces are more accurate than traditional mobile maps that are often advertising driven. Spaceitup is a new generation of location services, based on the principles of openness, usability and collaboration.
ÿ
Tourism
Spaceitup is the perfect solution for companies providing tourist services. Providing campsite locations, showing touristic tour routes and contacting people have never been easier.
ÿ

Because tourism is all about locations and with Spaceitup - locations with their relevant information are always available at your fingertips, even abroad. However the range of applications are nearly unlimited. The Spaceitup platform can be used by local communities, businesses and NGOs to provide location information and communicate with end-users.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

80% of health problems for pets could be prevented when aknowledged or noticed in early stage as pets do not speak the human language and health issues are generally noticed only when they become severe.

We are developing an expert system that creates a personalized health profile and health record for the pet owner telling what, when and which measures to take for the animal to stay healthy. The system also keeps track of events and actions related to pet health that can be shared with veterinarian, thereby improving the quality of diagnosis and cure when needed.

Our vision is to create unified and standardized digital health record for pets on a global scale. The system is based on veterinary expert knowledge and cannot be easily copied or replicated. Lean Canvas is included in p3.2.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

205,CREA205,CREA,CREAtiFi,Estonia,Kujustus Ltd.,Kujustus,"Rohuneeme tee 56, 74001 Viimsi vald, Estonia",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Ian Oja,"Kujustus will develop a motivational app for people, who have been long away from labor market. It will help disabled people, other risk groups or regular workers whoïs social skills, motivation and self esteem have been diminishing due to years away (or never entered) from labor market.

The app includes several small games and taska, you have to fulfill. Completing each one gives you praise and bonuses. Bonus can be fraction of your future income - when all tasks completed you will be working and the real money is the final reward.
There is an organizer included to the app, so you can keep track of your duties and monitor the overall process.

Social field is one of the largest tax-money consumer in each northern-European countries. Most of those countries aim to sending people to work instead of keeping them on allowances. Millions of euros are spent on that annually. Usually the hardest thing to overcome is not outside factor - working positions, skills and educational programs can be financed and organized. The inner motivation is the hardest part to shange. Even psychologists and therapy groups count as ""external"" measures, but your own smartphone is individual and intimate device, who will not be blamed for ""bossing around"". So is our motivational app is working to some extent it has large scale social and monetary benefit.

In 2015 Estonian government is preparing social reform for helping all of the disabled people to enter labor market. The reform itself will start in 2016. Currently Estonia will be perfect testing ground to develop the best product.

As our team leader Ian Oja has almost 10 years experience in working with disabled people in Estonia. He is currently engaged with Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor Market office projects, so he has best connections to initiate the testing of our software.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
