207,CREA207,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Vulpine Games Oy,Vulpine Games deep analytics platform,"Sepetlahdentie 2-4, H63, 02230 Espoo, Finland","BUSINESS SERVICES, MANUFACTURING",B2B,3,1,YES,IN,Toni Aleksi Nylund,"Vulpine Games deep analysis system
ÿ

Our custom design metric system will be used for logging and processing user gameplay data for analysis. The analysis results will help our development team create better gameplay and enhance the user experience of players. Empirical evidence from the game industry has shown that implementing changes in accordance with user analytics has substantially improved game monetization and overall enjoyment of users. Thus this system will bring considerable value to our company.

The system architecture contains 3 modules: logging user data, processing user data (crunching) and displaying analysis result. All the 3 modules will be implemented using FIWARE technologies and enablers.
ÿ

Module 1: Logging user data. In this module, a RESTful web service will be developed for listening to user data collection from the game. User gameplay information will be gathered and stored in Database server in the cloud. The web service will be implemented using FIWARE cloud hosting enabler.
ÿ

Module 2: Processing user data. The data collected will be periodically crunched using Big Data Analysis tools from a cloud server. The same cloud server will receive the crunched result and store it in a different database. This module will use both Cloud Hosting and Data/Context Management Enablers.
ÿ

Module 3: Displaying analysis result. The crunched data will be displayed visually to the game development team via this module. The module's implementation will be a web service using FIWARE cloud hosting enabler.
ÿ

Our custom deep analysis system will give us a much deeper understanding of our player base than what pre made sample based analytics tools provide. This will allow us to fine tune our game to a much greater extent. In any business one of the most important factors is understading your customers. This has never been more true than with mobile apps and games where supply is plentiful and removing a frustrating piece of software is just a tap away.
ÿ

We are also hoping to invite other developers to our platform after the prototype stage to offer them a better way to understand the needs and desires of their user base. This would start to provide us with direct monetary benefit from the system in additon to the value it creates through our games.
ÿ

Taking into account recent privacy concerns this system will also allow us to own our data and better protect the privacy of our users instead of submitting everything to third parties which may end up being a strategical advantage.",Tech provider,,X,0,0,X,0,,Software,Advanced and Predictive Analytics Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,0,www.vulpinegames.com,0,0,vulpinegames.com

208,CREA208,CREA,CREAtiFi,Denmark,Skarpline,Skarpline,"Skovdiget 3, 3460 Birkerod, Denmark",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Dan Storbaek,"According to Cisco chief strategy officer and CTO, only 0,6% of what can be connected, is connected. 99,4% remain unconnected. There will be a huge need for communicating with devices in so many new ways and in so many places. By 2020, it's expected that we will have 50 billion connected devices. We need simple and secure ways to communicate with gate sensors, cars, smart buildings, drones, network sensors and cameras, logistical systems, smart machines etc.
ÿ

Skarpline aims to provide real-time communication with any FIWARE enabled device. Simply text a device from Skarpline to start, engage or end an operation. All done remotely from one central communication hub. Write a simple text message to start a smart logistical machine, turn on the vacuum cleaner, start network monitoring, close the printer etc. All done remotely using a real-time communication tool.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A
209,CREA209,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Stereoscape Oy,Mobile Treasure Hunt,"Sorvaajankatu 11 A, 00880 Helsinki, Finland",WHOLESALE AND RETAIL TRADE
column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Stereoscape Oy,"In the project we will develop a mobile software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform with a working title ""Mobile Treasure Hunt"". The platform will consist of a mobile app that works with a cloud-based back end. At first the app is targeted for shopping centers that want to provide engaging experiences for customers so that they spend more time and money in shopping centers. We have already signed a deal with Citycon, one of the leading shopping center operators in Northern Europe, so that they will roll out the ""Buttefly Hunt"" concept (as this first service instance is called) in January 2015. We foresee huge global potential for the solution and intend to develop it into a scalable concept for ultimately for global markets. For example, BLE beacon adoption with US retailers is expected to raise to 85% by the year 2016. In the US alone mCommerce market is expected to exceed 100 billion dollars during the year 2017.ÿ

column1: ÿ

The solution will be packaged as a service with monthly fee with different service levels and volumes. In the early stage tur clients are shopping centres, but we will later market the solution to other public spaces later, such as point-of-sale locations, event parks and sports stadiums to name a few.
ÿ

The solution is disruptive as it combines several state-of-the-art technologies with strong concept planning. We use smart BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) beacons for location-based services and Augmented Reality to create a ""virtual layer"" on top of the physical environment in shopping centers.
ÿ
In addition, we plan to employ Fiware technologies to shorten the development cycle and leverage cloud infrastructure already in place.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

210,CREA210,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Nemesol Oy,Unidle.me,"Sulkapolku 3, 00370 Helsinki, Finland","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, BUSINESS SERVICES, TELECOM AND MEDIA",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Sam Engstr”m,"Unidle.me is a team collaboration platform for people in creative industries. It simplifies freelance work and lets users focus on what they are doing and be creative. Unidle.me's unique activity centered approach lets users easily work in multiple teams and switch between them quickly.1. Management team

Sam Engstr”m, business and product development, marketing and sales. Markus Sepp„l„, information security, databases and project management. Tom Engstr”m, user experience and interaction design. We've worked together long and our skill sets complement each other to form a comprehensive spectrum. See also the attached file (and the previous section in the form).2. Customer problem

People in creative industries often work as freelancers and in a variety of teams simultaneously. This makes work complicated, because you have to be able to share content you've created with the correct team and track your time for billing. With previous solutions you also have to share different types of content (photos, videos, e-mails and files) separately. This overhead wastes time and can have a negative impact on creativity.3. Our solution

With one click or tap, Unidle.me switches from one project and team to another and tracks your time. It gathers and shares all types of content you've created automatically in the background and organises it intuitively. It gives you a report of how you've spent your time for billing easily.
Unidle.me will be implemented as a web app and cloud service, smartphone app and smartwatch app so that it is available wherever creative work is done.4. Target market

Our target market is freelance workers, entrepreneurs and small businesses, because individuals have more control over what tools and apps they use. Also hobbyists will find the product useful.5. Sales &amp
column2: marketing strategy

column1: Content marketing via social media, marketing to freelancers, entrepreneurs and hobbyist groups. Business-to-business (and employee-to-employee) viral marketing. Unidle.me works seamlessly with multiple teams, so users can easily invite other users, who in turn can invite others.6. Business model

Unidle.me's business model is a freemium model. We will give a small amount of resources (such as data transfer) for free and offer a reasonable price for greater resource use. Depending on feasibility, the pricing model for Unidle.me may be a fixed fee or pay-as-you-go. The price per user will likely be in the range of 1-5?/month. We may also offer paid features, such as improved reporting and billing capabilities.7. Competitors

Our competitors are the likes of Evernote and Slack. We are integrating with tools that are currently used in teamwork such as Gmail and Dropbox, so it will be easy for users to start using Unidle.me.8. Competitive advantage

Our competitive advantages include the unique activity based approach and better planning and media storage capabilities. Our payment model lets people who want more also pay more, which leads to a higher ARPU.9. Challenges and risks

Inability to get the uniqueness of the product across to get enough traction and user base growth. Inability to secure outside financing and having to rely on own money to fund the development. Not being able to offer enough free features to go viral.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

212,CREA212,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,SirWay Ltd.,Cloud-Based Road Asset Management System,"Suvilahdenkatu 3-5 A, 00500 Helsinki, Finland","BUSINESS SERVICES, PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND DEFENCE
column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITYÿÿÿ",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Konsta Mikael Sirvio,"Background

column1: ÿ

Since 1980s Road Agencies have been developing Road Asset Management Systems and Pavement Management Systems in order to better manage the most valuable assets of the country. The value of Finnish road network managed by the Transport Agency is around 15 billion euros and almost 1 billion euros is annually used for road maintenance. Even that data collection methods and road management systems have evolved since the 1980s the road maintenance is not well optimised since implementation of novel machine learning forecasting and optimisation algorithms has been slow and computational capacity has only recently enabled solving such data intensive combinatorial optimisation problems in practice. Also, lifecycles of public sector IT systems tend to be long and implementation of new methods is not therefore continuous.
ÿ
Current problems and need
ÿ

We have identified several problems with the current practice of road asset management both in developed and developing countries. In developing countries a common problem is lack of funding and understanding of the importance of maintenance. Funding is available through international financiers such as the World Bank and Asian Development Bank, but it is mainly targeted at road construction and reconstruction and not so much on preventive and routine maintenance. Although there are support systems on the market such as very commonly used HDM-4 pavement management system the problem is the complexity of such systems. Another problem is massive requirements for data. Even if these problems are solved the system does not allow real optimisation of multi-year maintenance programmes. When such systems are in place there is a need for data management and IT knowhow. Often this is limited at Road Agencies in developing countries since salaries in the public sector is low and IT experts get employed by more lucrative private sector. As data collection is expensive the valuable data should be at a secure place, but due to neglected IT management backup processes are not in place and data can be permanently lost. Also, the valuable data could be useful for several stakeholders in the country, but it is not opened as it is stored in old systems that run in Local Area Networks. On top of these problems external financing is project-based and lacks maintenance and support budget for the IT systems beyond the project lifetime.
ÿ

In developed countries the problems are different. Road Agencies are often prisons of the old systems that have been gradually improved and they have become rather massive. Also, there can be several subsystems while a more integrated solution would be more practical and manageable. The same problem is shared with the developing countries that the systems are not really updated during their lifecycle and current research with possibly better algorithms are not implemented in the systems. In the road sector it is also common that the data is not fully opened to the public. Some general basic data is available on web-based GIS such as the road network with weight restrictions, traffic and incidents, but raw data of traffic and condition for example are not opened to the developers.
ÿ
Our approach and solution
ÿ

The purpose of this project is to develop a cloud-based road asset management system that has integrated geographic information system and pavement management system. The idea is that instead of existing desktop applications the system will be web-based, where the backend would be running on a cloud server and front-end runs on a web browser. Figure 1 illustrates the change from the current system architecture with the new system.
ÿ
Figure 1. Old and new system architecture.
ÿ
Benefits
ÿ
The following benefits to our clients are foreseen:
ÿ
Increased data security
Possibility for Open Data and data sharing between organisations
Improved data management
Decreased dependence on software technology providers such as single operating system
Real optimisation of multi-year maintenance programmes
Continuous upgrades of the system
Straightforward software updates
Increased user-friendliness due to GIS and PMS integration",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

column1: ÿ

The product works primarily as a table lamp - so it does not cause users to feel uneasy in adopting a novel form or function. The design features of ?Corona? lamp are timeless and more or less universal. You can use the lamp in living room or in kitchen, in bedroom or in study, in office on in homeoffice.
ÿ

Product?s essential feature, however, is its compatibility with Bluetooth and/or Wi-Fi network, enabling it to display a moving animation and information according real-time weather, that is based on GPS location of the users smartphone. On the front and rear displays of the device are illustrative animations, that imitate real-time weather conditions (snow, rain, wind, sun or a cloudness). In addition, it is possible to display the external temperature readings (and optionally also the geographical position).
ÿ

Product?s light element is solved in two parts. The bottom half of the lamp works classically as a table lamp light source, which light intensity can be adjusted via touch sensory dimmable switch on the foot of the lamp. The top half light element can be individually switched on and it is related to the real-time sun activity (sunrise to sunset). According to the sun time variation, the upper element changes the intensity and color of the light. This is a characteristic whereby the product has also received its name ?Corona?, which means the glowing spherical crown around sun. Thereby, the top light element also performs as a kind of therapeutic light mood generator for the environment.
ÿ

The additional feature of the top light element, is possibility to use it as an color therapeutic alarm clock, which you can set up with the smartphone to softly lighten up in right time with a mellow sound signal.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

217,CREA217,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Frozen Vision,Cybersailing,"Torikatu 19, 6.krs., 90100 OULU, Finland",EDUCATION,B2B,6,1,YES,IN,Asmo Saloranta,"Multiplayer 3D boating simulation game aimed at educating the public on the marine traffic rules and regulations.
ÿ

Various courses exist for the education and certification of students on marine traffic rules and regulations. The courses focus on theoretical guidelines on how to navigate in archipelagos, coastal areas and in the high seas, including local and international marine traffic rules and legislation, the use of navigation equipment, and the principles of celestial navigation. Some courses include practical sessions, where students experiment the learnings in the real-world.
ÿ

Due to the principally theoretical nature of the training, the new boat owner often feels unsure on his/her grasp of the subject matter, and launching his/her potentially expensive boat can be a daunting task. Unexperienced, unconfident new seafarers easily find themselves in potentially dangerous situations, posing a risk of material and bodily damage for themselves and others, even loss of life .
ÿ

Though experimenting in the real world is arguably the best way to learn, practicing the theories in a virtual simulation based on real-world scenarios, the users of the proposed software can gain a deeper understanding and master their skills in a safe enviroment. The official requlated curriculum for certification (where applicable) is used as a foundation for the software.
ÿ

In the past, seafaring was a common means of transportation for people in all social groups. Due to the high cost and increasing regulations, it's no longer as popular as it used to be. The software can potentially boost the popularity of boating hobby by means of providing an easy-to-access, multiplatform solution for learning the key skills, especially suitable for the gaming generation. Due to it's regulatory focus, it's a suitable platform for training and refreshing the basics for professional seafarers.
ÿ
ÿ
Business model
- Sold for various governments for educational purposes, with an additional project inteded for making a local variant, where local legislation is applied, and the software language localized.
ÿ
- Sold through organizations providing training (avoid competion and gaining support for the software)
- Local variants (access license) sold for organizations and residents in supported areas.
ÿ
Re-Usability
The same model and solution would apply for e.g ground-based car traffic simulation, or aviation, but would potentially require more effort and verified high performance and lower network lag.ÿ

220,CREA220,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Unitc Oy,Online geospatial map for realistic 3d-laser scan visualisations,"V„limerenkatu 4 B 18, 00220 Helsinki, Finland",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,5,2,YES,OUT,Tommi Juhani Lehtonen,"Internet and digital technologies in the development of the visual image and the virtual environments in the other hand, become possible and on the other hand the demand for them is growing rapidly. Computer-based imaging can also be produced by an entirely new kind of visual content, which also opens up opportunities for new business models. 3D scanning means a computer model of the production of the real world. 3D scanning is different from, for example, Google Street View of the technique used, which provides a point-panoramic images. These panoramic images, therefore, do not constitute eligible for further processing of the computer model. It can be said that the 3D scan takes real-world virtual imaging to a whole new level of quality. The continuous development of technology follows that the 3D images and modeling the quality level continues to rise and recovery of demand will continue to grow strongly. Until now, the most important 3D image content production method has been to the contents of computer modeling, ie models of the production model of the night people at a time. 3D scanning technology has now reached a level where it becomes a competitive alternative to the traditional computer modeling. 3-D scanning allows for faster 3D modeling than traditional methods, and in addition to the final result is more realistic compared to the traditional methods.
ÿ
It this project, the central idea is to create an online platform for geospatially tagged 3D LIDAR scans, whereÿ
the user can access and visualise the scans using a standard web browser.
The service is similar to ?Google Streetview?, but the main difference is in allowing the users full access to 3D data.ÿ
The data access serves all 3D data based applications, such as 3D visualisation, environmentÿ

planning and real-estate business. Especially this kind of technique gives benefits to movie and entertainment business for looking new locations, ordering hi-resolution backgrounds and/or using ready locations in production as a backplates. For example, scene in movie, what takes place in different country could plan their shooting day in millimetre accurate, or they could use our data as a background while staying in their own country and saving a lot money when shooting this scene in studio. Now days Hollywood uses LIDAR technique almost in all sceneïs.ÿ
ÿ
When a customer orders a 3D scan, the team will enter the site and measure it using a Riegl scanner. The data is preprocessed andÿ
uploaded to a cloud. The customer can access data using standard web browser and see the acquired model with great visual detail. In case the
customer wants to use the data, he buys the model and downloads it. With precise 3D data the customer can measure
distances, plan new infrastructure to the environment and create new 3D assets, that can be uploaded to cloud for
further use. In future, the third-party generated data and models are also accessible via the same platform.

221,CREA221,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,MIPsoft Oy,BlindSquare LandMarkers,"Vesalantie 67 A, 00940 HELSINKI, Finland","Consumer health/wellness, HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES",B2B/B2C,2,25,YES,IN,Ilkka Pirttimaa,"Overview
ÿ

MIPsoft has been very successful creating BlindSquare, a GPS orientation aid for blind and partially sighted people used in more than 130 countries. Because the app depends on GPS signals, its reliability inside of buildings is limited. BlindSquare LandMarkers is an indoor navigation system using Bluetooth beacons, which can send signals to modern smartphones. It will help blind and partially sighted users to explore buildings virtually and to locate and navigate to POI inside of buildings.
ÿ
Problem
ÿ

Navigating inside of public buildings (Stations, malls, office buildings) poses different challenges to blind and partially sighted people than travelling in the streets. Outside, visually impaired people often find more landmarks (pavement, tactile paving, different echoes of walls, trees, bushes, fences, audible traffic lights) than are available inside of buildings. Inside office buildings, doors and corridors are similar. In shopping malls, paths are often blocked by signs or decoration, constant background music masks echoes, and other audible clues are lacking. Printed signs are inaccessible to blind individuals. GPS reception generally is too poor to compensate these difficulties using smartphones.
ÿ
Project Description
ÿ

MIPsoft has not only developed BlindSquare, but also CLIS, the Customized Location Information Service. Clis allows organisations to provide customised information about their premises to blind and partially sighted guests, clients, students, or staff who use an iOS-device running BlindSquare or BlindSquare Event. CLIS is already being used successfully at the University of Iowa.
BlindSquare LandMarkers will make CLIS available indoors. Bluetooth beacons will be placed at certain points to provide information or directions.
ÿ
Advantages

Up to now, most indoor mapping approaches determine the user's position in a building through triangulation. They rely on WiFi, magnetic fields, or beacons to map the building. If WiFi or magnetic fields are used, the location of different places inside a building first have to be entered on the map. Only then can the user be located on the map and receive directions. BlindSquare LandMarkers are simply placed inside the building and are linked to cloud data that can be edited at any time if required. It is not necessary to fingerprint a building and create a map.
Other approaches using beacons require that the range of beacons cover all of the building, so it is possible to create a map and use triangulation.

We estimate that BlindSquare LandMarkers will require ten times fewer beacons, because this method does not use triangulation. The beacons are placed at important points, like signs or signposts used by sighted people. The user is then guided from beacon to beacon until they reach their destination. Messages received at each beacon depend on the user's direction and the beacons last detected by the user's device. This makes BlindSquare LandMarkers more affordable and easier to install than other systems.

There have been other attempts to map indoor locations for blind and partially sighted people. Step-Hear requires that the user wear a special bracelet that vibrates when a transmitter is approached. In contrast to this approach, BlindSquare LandMarkers uses the devices many visually impaired people already own, their smartphones. Bluetooth Beacons are also being produced for the mainstream market. Because BlindSquare LandMarkers does not require custom-made equipment, it is more cost effective than methods that use components specifically designed for visually impaired users.

ÿ",Tech provider,X,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Spatial Information Management Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,0,http://blindsquare.com,Startup,0,blindsquare.com

Enlive gathers activities, experiences and trial opportunities under one service and helps service providers market their services. The service itself will be simple and easy to use, for the customers as well as for the service providers. We are eager to gather the most interesting small and independent service providers to our selection, and also encourage new service providers.

We will get rid of poor findability. When someone decides to find new things to do, it is frustrating and complicated to consider exactly what one is looking for. Google needs a specific search word to show relevant results. One might find big service providers with limited offering but other options are hidden. Smaller service providers are neither marketing nor IT professionals. Thus, they do not have fancy websites, if they happen to have any. Service providers and seekers do not reach each other. We aim to change this.

We believe that the world is full of experiences anxiously waiting to happen. We want to give everyone an opportunity to enliven their lives. Especially, we want families and friends to be able to enjoy the best moments together.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

226,CREA226,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,SinunParkki,SinunParkki,"Anjankuja 3 A, 50, 02230 Espoo, Finland",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Maria Clara da Costa Carvalho,"Founders: Maria Carvalho - Marketing and Sales expertise. Nga Nguyen- Marketing and design expertise.
Customer Problem

Parking space owners: ""I own a parking space but my car is there only 12 hours per hour and sometimes it's unused for couple days in a row when I'm away. How could I use it more efficiently?"" Car drivers: ""I hate it when I have to drive somewhere and I've got no clue where to park. Where can easily find parking spaces when I'm on the road, especially in city centers?""
Products &amp
column2: Services

column1: A website (later with a mobile application) that enables drivers to type in an address and find parking spaces that they can rent for an hour or more. Via the website the drivers can choose which place they want to rent and when. Owners on the other hand can list their parking spaces to be available at certain times.
Target Market

Geographically the biggest opportunity lies in cities where parking space is difficult to find and/or expensive. In Finland areas like Helsinki, Espoo, Vantaa, Kauniainen, Tampere, Oulu, Jyv„skyl„ and Turku are the most potential ones. Target customers are ones with technical capability to use the service.

Customers can be divided into two sides: owners and drivers. From the owner side the main customers are individuals who own parking spaces, real estate companies that have vacant parking spaces or who want to use the spaces more efficiently and owners of large parking areas. From the other side the customers are the end-users, the drivers, who want an easier and in some cases cheaper way to park their car when they need to.
Sales &amp
column2: Marketing Strategy

column1: Sinunparkki.fi is a classic example of a business that first needs early adopters who can then be followed by the masses. In order to keep both owners and drivers as loyal users of the service it needs to function seamlessly in all ways. The first users can be found via social media, flyers, word-of-mouth, and by targeting real estate companies. Providing real, measurable value for both owners and drivers enables loyalty to form.
Business Model

The business model is based on building an easy to use and reliable web service that connects owners and drivers. When both ends get value from the service it will drive network effects further and enhance the company value in the meantime. Using professionals to code the website by the specs detailed by the founders will result in a service that will deliver the value for owners and drivers.
Competitors

Currently in Finland there isn't this kind of service available, even though it exists for example in the U.S. and the U.K. Therefore the main competitors could be seen in commercial parking garages, which are often located in good places but with very high prices.
Competitive Advantage

Sinunparkki.fi gets the first mover advantage in Finland by being the first one to offer this service. The ÿfounders work at a company that possess expertise in various areas such as parking technology, finance and entrepreneurship. Also, they have a good network of professionals in different areas that can prove to be helpful in the process of developing the service.

Sinunparkki.fi is a platform that connects parking space owners, who want to earn money from the time their space is not used by themselves, and car drivers who want an easy way to find a space to park their cars where ever they may be, without paying ridiculous amounts of money.
Creating value for both car drivers and parking space owners by providing a platform that connects both drivers and owners.
The main challenge is to be the first company to enter the market and make it not only profitable, but a long-term business. Possible changes in legislation or customer behavior are risks.

231,CREA231,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,GetMoving,GetMoving,"Ruism„enkatu 27, D7, 33340 Tampere, Finland","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, Consumer health/wellness",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Juha Korju,"Business Idea: To motivate people into exercise by means of games, and tap into the consumption potential in sporting equipment, personal training services, sporting events, sports nutrition supplements and health and wellness services.
ÿ

The product: An application that turns physical exercise into social online gaming experience. The mobile application is free to use for consumers, and professional trainer versions and retailer versions are licenced. Professional trainers can manage groups and create games for their customers, retailers can create challenge games that come with monetary rewards such as discounts for sporting equipment or supplements, free passes to gyms etc. Income is generated by licensing fees, advertising and possibly through in-game purchases.
ÿ
Key concept:ÿ Gamified Self
The approach is a mix quantified personal exercise and gamificationÿ that motivates people to improve their personal health &amp
column2: well-being. Motivation comesÿthrough game-like challenges and achievements, social aspect and monetary benefits (discounts, freebies, gifts, prices) that measure and reward players' progress. Key factors in the game are motivation, rewarding and sharing. Rewarding &amp
column3: sharing bring in the business of sports equipment retail and sporting events as well as personal training and guided exercise services. Physical exercise itself is the game. This involves starting point (in terms of the player's initial fitness level) and completing a set of milestones/levels/trophies in order to reach specific goals within some feasible time window. The games can be customized to fit the end users skills and capabilities thus making it feasible for all users from beginners to advanced. The actual physical exercise in the game can be any sport that allows measuring individual's performance in some meaningful way, including, but not limited to GPS tracking, heart rate monitoring, self-reporting, and potentially other means of measurement as well.

column1: ÿ
The applications:

- The basic mobile app will be free of charge. Free version has some limitation such as game creation and customization. Paid version of the app unlocks all limitations and allows unlimited personal use. Web-based access to the game account will also be needed

- Commercial personal trainers/gyms can get a subscription license for the service of creating gaming events for groups of people. The licence pricing will depend on the number of people allowed in groups. Web access for creating and managing these groups and monitoring and rewarding progress.

- Sports equipment retailers get a subscription license for product and service promotion. Retailers can push advertising messages back to mobile app users (free version users). Retailers can also create gaming events that come with rewards. Users get messages from the retailers about the upcoming rewards. The rewards are ""fit"" to match the player profile and the game.
ÿ
Example use scenario:
- A mobile app user selects from one of the publicly available exercise programs and follows it, gaining points and rewards, tracking their own progress
- Several users take on the same challenge and compare their progress in the challenge, engageing in friendly competition
- A personal trainer creates an exercise program for a group of people. The game is the same for everyone, but achievements may be customized based on group members' personal fitness level.
- A retailer creates a challenge for users, with prizes such as running shoes for the winner or a year's worth of sporting supplements, randomly given to 10 people who finish a given challenge.
ÿ
Social aspect:
People can share their progress and invite each other to challenges and in-game competitions.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

With Giffee you can choose from various gift options provided by merchants in our platform. The gifts can vary from restaurant/food, entertainment and physical products. The ideology of Giffee is that you can send small treats to your friend to make their day. Giffee is all about positive experiences and very positive customer engagement.

Imagine you see on Facebook that your friend is having a birthday and you are abroad on a business trip. Buying and sending a gift is not possible and writing a message to their wall doesn?t feel like enough. With Giffee you can choose your friend favorite treat and when you send it forward they will receive a QR code to her phone and/or e-mail, which they use when collecting the gift from the shop. Let?s say your friend loves the Cappuchino and a cupcake at the local cafeteria on their way to work. They will be extremely happy of your gift! And when they are collecting the gift the cafeteria is getting very positive customer engagement. They will be so happy about this that they will send it forward to their friend. So it is creating virality.
Market

Odiously the market of buying gifts is huge. There is no reference point to compare to get accurate figures about the market size for our solution, since there is no similar solution on the markets at this moment. Our target market is going to be in Europe, where we are aiming to have comprehensive presence in five years. 236,CREA236,CREA,CREAtiFi,Estonia,Startup,GOT Go Out Tonight,"Vabriku 19, 10, 10411 Tallinn, Estonia","ACCOMMODATION AND FOOD SERVICE ACTIVITIES, Consumer leisure/gaming",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jakob J?gisuu,"Overview
ÿ

Our service solves two main problems: where to go and and possibility to pay via mobileÿwithout leaving the table and leaving the company of friends. This will give more time to enjoy night-out experience.
ÿ

Communication between clients and target group service providers will be organized through smart devices, for example smartphones, smartwatches or tablets. Through our application we can provide additional information to clients from the service providers, including for example evening programmes, events, customer campaigns. This will attract more customers and will generate more profit to the service provider. For clients who use this application will get first more information which place to choose and more enjoyable night because of better solution for ordering and paying.
ÿ
Idea
ÿ

Main target is to use this service on different nightclubs, restaurants, pubs and fast-food restaurants, where it has the greatest impact making the experience more pleasurable and faster for both the clients and provider. Additionally our service can make target group of providers business more profitable and smoother. At the moment there is a bottle neck problem, meaning that for example when the house is full, waiters and barmen cannot fulfill the demand. As a client it is frustrating to order more when the place is overcrowded and there is a need to stand in the long line for ordering. It will reduce the hesitation for client to order more giving extra income for service providers. As an side opportunity via this application customers can also order drinks and sweets to other tables, for example to make a romantic gesture to a beautiful lady/gentleman. It will be managed using the floor plan and table locations of specific service provider.
ÿ
The process will look like this:

We will work out appropriate solution for specifc business, cooperating with owner of the placeÿ(our client)ÿwho provides all the relevant information needed - floor plan, locations of the tables, menu, pricing, discounts, information of events
Customer downloads our application, places order and pays via smart device
Service provider gets the detailed information of the order

Order will be executed fast and precisely - wihtout handling any physical cash.ÿInsertion of orders is fully digital, fast and cash-free (optional), which would exclude mistakes and sets waiters free of very time consuming billing of clients. This way it leaves more time for waiter to concentrate to the needs of customer and communicating quality
ÿ

Our service gives better opportunitiesÿfor the client to enjoy the evening, local programme (artists, live musicians), socializing with friends and acquaintances. Client does not need to stand up from the table, go and wait in the line - which all in together can be very time consuming and stressful.

Our application may drastically reshape culture of visiting restaurants and pubs. We can apply our service in very wide scale of service providers and in different cities globally. First target is to occupy market in Estonia and Scandinavia.

ÿ
Superkids uses Alternate Reality to allow the player to use their attributes and skills (long lashes, burps, climbing, etc.) as superpowers to tackle challenges in their own environment.
ÿ

The game is aimed at 6 to 11 year old children and their parents. It?s in the heart of a larger children?s entertainment concept, empowering everyone to find their unique abilities and strengths and turn them into superpowers using their imagination. The concept extends over multiple media to convey the story, e.g. books, board games and a TV-series.
ÿ
Through the mobile game, the players get to experience having superpowers in a real and relatable way and see the magic of the everyday.
?You ARE a Superkid!?
238,CREA238,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Startup,Level App,"Tyynenmerenkatu 7, A 52, 00220 Helsinki, Finland",Consumer health/wellness,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Tom Himanen,"Current State

There is a growing niche emerging around physical skills, such as gymnastics, parkour and tricking. The practitioners of any physical skills? sub-niche are usually interested in other related sub-niches.

Those interested in physical skills typically form local groups and share their expertise in the Internet using forums, YouTube, social media and websites. A good example is a YouTube video which shows how to learn a certain move or skill, step by step.

Physical skills enthusiasts suffer from dispersion and low quality of tutorials. Content providers have difficulties in reaching their potential customers, and this makes it difficult to commercialize and monetize their content efficiently.
The Solution

The dispersion of quality content and difficulties with monetization are a problem both to consumers and content providers. That?s why we have decided to create a virtual shopping centre for physical skills enthusiasts. We provide a centralized mobile platform, which gathers all physical skills enthusiasts together and enables content providers to sell their expertise.

Our platform will not only be the ultimate marketplace for learning physical skills, but also creates a whole new way of learning these skills. The skills are learned progressively, step by step, and the learning process is gamified. We have adapted elements and terminology from role-playing video games, such as skilltrees and levels. This clear, visual and immersive learning method makes learning new skills extremely fun, even intoxicating.

The user can access the most relevant content ? in the form of a game-like skilltree ? straight from the home screen of the app instead of spending hours surfing around the internet, which is time-consuming and frankly a pain in the ass. In addition, the user doesn?t need a constant internet connection to access the tutorials since the content can be downloaded on user?s device to be accessed offline.

Our goal is to make our platform the new standard of providing high quality physical-skills-related content to potential customers. Those content creators who want to make themselves stand out the way they deserve will never want to use any other delivery system again. The reasons end-users choose Level App are large supply combined with great user-experience.
Where Does the Money Come From?

We help the seller meet their client, and we do it fast. We provide the marketplace, concept and tools toÿtransform their content into gamified form, and we take a provision of all transactions performed using our platform.

To the end customers we provide an unique, immersive and gamified user-experience. To the content producers we provide the largest audience available and the tools to transform their new or already existing content into top-quality information products which sell for a great price in the most wanted format known in the physical skills niche ? it is skilltrees.

Skilltree is a group of challenges put in the form of the tree. The skilltree climax is the final challenge, such as backflip. In order to reach the final challenge, the user has to accomplish easier challenges. This mechanism is familiar from role-playing video games and makes leveling up rewarding. The result is gamified step-by-step learning process made available by our platform.
Content provider can create a skilltree just dragging and dropping the content in its place using our skilltree editor, and skilltree editor transforms the content into a skilltree.

The skilltree format and audience centralization are factors that make content providers want to forget about YouTube and Facebook, and sell their expertise as skilltrees using Level App platform.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

We will combine the power of discovery and communication to create the best marketplace experience out there. Our vision is to change the way we experience marketplaces now and forever. Zaou is going to be fast, fun and free.
ÿ

By personal experience we noticed that current marketplaces aren't utilizing the power of mobile technology to their benefit and we came to a conclusion to build a better product and make it more flawless to exchange with the users.
ÿ

We plan to use the platform in second hand market, providing users a way to exchange goods much more efficiently. We plan to make the exchanging process faster by utilizing the instant user to user messaging, taking advantage of the GPS and intuative user interface.
ÿ
Our plan is to implement the platform in iOS and Android devices.
ÿ

240,CREA240,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Startup,Reality show in startup genre,0,TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Mikael Sepp„l„,Reality show based on the life in a start up,0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

241,CREA241,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Startup,Vision2Venture by VentureNorth (non-profit),"Airikinkatu 1 G, as 49, 20100 Turku, Finland",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Roope Marttila,"V2V by VentureNorth is a Non-Profit Market Entry Portal and Community for startups in creative industries and gaming. After providing the required coaching we help the startups to connect to the markets around them while making available multiple free and charged support services for the startups (we are getting lots of experienced advisors, investors and consulting partners aboard). Our business is creating value around us both for investors, vendors, startups and the community in general.
ÿ

We have now acquired some considerable high profile partners for our project already. We have acquired (TBP) big partners with whom we have close and joint efforts to kick-start our platform. We have one of the biggest startup sites in northern Europe with us to help us reach our target audience. The other partner is a Finnish company listed in NASDAQOMXH stock exchange and who will provide some software support and business consulting services to be added on the platform. We describe our business model as a win-win-win-win for all joining the V2V community
column2: everybody wins from service providers to the startups and their projects.

column1: ÿ

We tackle the two biggest obstacles for startups scaling up their business: raising capital and entering new unfamiliar markets. It is extremely challenging for European startups and small enterprises to take the first step and to enter these new bigger markets (even within the still not-too-integrated European markets). Moreover, it is even more difficult and expensive to do it from your home location if you didn?t start in some of the business capitals of the world. Global scale (or at least regional markets) however should be the target market from the get-go for every reasonably scalable business. Finland is simply too small for most of the new ideas to get the required traction to lift off the ground even
column2: building a startup is never easy and doing it only (e.g.) in Finland and your small local market is 100 times more difficult

column1: ÿ

As said, it is costly and too much of leap for most of the startups to have the full physical presence to succeed in a foreign market, even after they receive seed funding. You need something between ?the ignoring the big markets altogether? and on the other hand ?having a local office and sales operations abroad?. We can provide that ?something between? through our online portal and physical go-to-market integration. There is an unquestionable demand for this kind of service connecting the required pieces when taking the next steps commercializing your project and building the company around your vision. Our portal and p2p-community becomes extreme helpful when entering the new not-too-familiar markets. Export industry is an old term that describes old heavy industries, in creative industries you have to be local and global at the same time. Export describes just a fraction what entering to new market means, you have to be global and local -- ?glocal?.
ÿ

We have seen which market entry models work and which do not. To do business, for example, in US you will need a physical presence of some sort, and the minimum requirements can be achieved with the combination of online preparations and some physical tools. V2V portal and community can provide you the minimum physical presence as well through the mail/call forwarding and conference room services as well as an easy access to local industry contacts.
ÿ

At the same time, we tackle the problem from another direction. As funding is the biggest obstacle for many startups -- and it is even bigger problem in terms of executing overseas operations (in any extent) -- we will (and already have) team up with some VCs, business angels (networks) and crowdfunding platforms to crop the most potential startups. Nevertheless, our goal is to provide holistic solutions, so we must be able to fund our member startups and their market ambitions. Moreover, elementary level of physical presence in the market is practically the only way to attract early investments from abroad for your startup (generally, 5 times easier at least according to a few sources). So we are in the business of tackling the most important obstacles startups usually have to counter.
ÿ

In general the portal is an instrument to facilitate commerce by bringing together service providers and our startup members.ÿSome basic services will be offered for free and some are negotiated to be discounted but the idea is to bring value for everyone joining the community, for the member startups, the investors and the consulting and coaching services alike. The core functionality of the portal is to create a total package of market entry support while creating a marketplace to provide a uniform service interface to discover and match different needs from different sides of the table.
ÿ

The core functionalities provide a basis for extended services, such as office and conference room and specific market entry services (e.g. legal). FIWARE enabler Marketplace SAP IR looks to provide a very promising match to build the service portal on, although we might have to fix it to fit our needs a little bit first and to build it more community-based. FIWARE enablers, WStore and Revenue Settlement and Sharing system would have to be integrated into that as well. All in all, using these few selected FIWARE enablers appears to be the most sensible and efficient approach available for us considering our resources and timeline. (We are planning to build the presales and crowdfunding components out of the aforementioned WStore and RSS components in a way or another. Other enablers have not been excluded at this point.)",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

242,CREA242,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Startup,GBerry,"Keih„stie 10, 33960 Pirkkala, Finland",Consumer leisure/gaming,B2C,1,0,YES,OUT,Tero Vuorela,"GBerry is open game platform built on top of cheap Raspberry Pi hardware. GBerry utilizes equipment found from ordinary homes: TV screens with audio devices, tablets and mobile phones. TV is used for showing main game events while mobile devices are used for controlling game and showing possible secret information for each player. Free GBerry application can be downloaded into mobile devices from mobile application stores. This general purpose application is used with all games. With these concepts GBerry attacks especially to niches of multiplayer and family games.
ÿ

Like hardware also the gaming platform software will be available under open source. Essential part of GBerry ecosystem is a webstore from where games can be bought. Everyone is welcome to develop a game and sell it in GBerry webstore. In fact GBerry encourages young developers into game development by providing easy to use programming environment. On the other side of ecosystem there is co-operation platform where artists, musicians and developers can join their forces to build a game and share revenue. In addition to games GBerry webstore is used also for selling game resources ? graphics, sounds, music ? and game libraries for game developers.
ÿ

Other essential part of GBerry ecosystem are credits ? micro payment system. Customers can buy bundles of credits and actual games are paid using these credits. This way games can be low cost, like from few cents to 1?, and different licensing models can be easily innovated. For example paying for each day that game is actually used. A credit wallet is also easy to share with other family members. This way children don't need to have own payment methods. And even better, children can't overspend as credit wallet can have limits.",Tech provider,,0,0,X,0,0,,Software,"Development Languages, Environments, and Tools",Application Development & Deployment,Application Development Software,1,0,#N/A,0,0,0

243,CREA243,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Startup,Rounders Game,"Ratakatu 21 a 5, 00120 Helsinki, Finland",Consumer education/culture,B2C,5,1,YES,IN,Mari Johanna Korkeam„ki,"ROUNDERS is a new world for children from ages 0 ti 10. It will consist of digital games, books, educational material, animations, stuffed animals and other merchandise.
ÿ

Rounders are animal characters with round figures. The characters are easily approachable. They each have their own unique personality traits.The adventures of the Rounders are fun and entertaining for children of all ages. In the heart of the stories you can always find a lesson of socio-emotional skills.Rounders live in Sunny Cloud. It is a magical place where anything can and will happen.ÿ
ÿ

Rounders game is an educational and entertaining game for young children, teaching emotional intelligence. The game is for both solo play and social activity. The game connects the physical world and the virtual world by using geotagged Open Data streams. The introduction of real-world places and phenomena will bring the experience closer to real life and enhance the transfer of learned emotional skills to everyday life. By matching players by physical proximity has also the potential to connect children with real-life social groups.
ÿ

The Rounders game is an online multiplayer game for children aged 4 to 10. But instead of fighting wars or battling in dungeons, children will share emotions and learn how to cope better with negative emotions like anger or jealousy. Sharing emotions with Rounders characters and other players the child will learn positive solutions for everyday situations e.g. how to get over temper tantrums.
ÿ

For example Cranky Crabbie has had a really difficult morning and you can help him by giving him emoticons of your choosing. E.g. if you give him hugs, it is easier for him to wake up. And if you add a few cheers emoticons you can see how Cranky Crappie?s day will turn into a happy one. But if you give him a hissy fit, his day will turn into a cranky one.
ÿ

All players will see what emoticons other players have given to the characters. The amount of emoticons will influence in witch path the character will go. Children will learn how their emotions and choices affect them.
ÿ

Children can create their own 3D characters with simple tools. (In the future, perhaps you can print your own character with a 3D printer.) With geolocation we bring players in physical proximity into the same environment in-game. E.g. Rounders can organize a dance competition or a pop concert in the physical world, and while attending the event, all players will share the same space inside the Rounders game.
ÿ

Game platform uses Open Data sources to enrich Rounders environment. E.g. Helsinki city has an Open Data source for landscaping information that provides detailed data about parks, forests, and the common environment. When the player is in Helsinki, the Rounders environment will mirror their physical location - if they are in park physically, their character in the game is inside a park (or forest). The game will eventually have APIs for 3rd party developers to connect external data sources to the game.ÿ
ÿ",Tech provider,,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Consumer application,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,0,0,0

244,CREA244,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Startup,Apprentice,"Norkkokuja 10, D, 00790 Helsinki, Finland",Consumer leisure/gaming,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Sampsa Fabritius,"What we offer is a meet-up hub for seeking people to play with. For inspiration one can thinking of services like tinder or such where people are seeking for a potential dating partner. This is a meeting hub for adults to find type of friendship or service they wish to have at a given point of time.
ÿ
Simplicity is key criteria to support impatient youth, busy mid-age people, and technically uncertain elderly people.
ÿ
Product offering will be created gradually in close collaboration with various youth communities. This is to ensure customer driven operations. This process is started in Helsinki.
ÿ

Phase 1 of the product offering consist of a peer to peer discovery for new friends to do things together. Second element of phase 1 is engagement of selected large volume hobby (incl sport) service providers. Business deals with the service providers gives them a linking with customers seeking suitable activity to play. For users trying an activity is free of charge. The motivation for business service providers is long term customer acquisition.
Each user will create a user profile which is the mechanism for learning the interests of the users and their habits.
ÿ

Phases 2 and 3 are outlined to engage 30-50 years old and over 50 years old age groups (which are fully recognized as heterogeneous groups). The first service planned for those age groups is learning and mentoring service for finding peers to learn with and acting as mentor for younger people. The second service is task planner which is a form of purchasing micro-tasks from suitable fellows of the same community.

The key activity for phases 2 and 3 is extended financial, governmental, and security functionalities. This is also the reason for not aiming to implement those features in phase 1 where focus is on core user experience. In those phases 2 and 3 individual users are encouraged to build their own business around service offering (following their high peer review ratings).",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

245,CREA245,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,Taganize,Taganize,"Pohjoiskaari 12 A 8, 00200 Helsinki, Finland",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,John Paavo Tengstr”m,"4G LTE network operators have an underutilized uplink that they are unable to fully exploit. Each day such operators lose hugh amounts of revenue because of this. Thus, they are open to conversation with parties that have viable business solutions which will positively drive revenue and growth.

Taganize is the market leader in activating NFC chips and QR codes. Our select partner, CloudStreet, is also a market leader in cloud based capacity exchange where Advertisers and TV production companies can buy mobile network capacity for their live events or transmission needs.
ÿ

CloudStreet's technology ties IP traffic priority with physical locations and time. CloudStreet prioritization technology enables mobile operators to provide network capacity for specific users at specific locations during a specific periods in time.

Although CloudStreets technology significantly reduces the production costs for live TV transmissions and broadcasting, a challenge exists in how to crowd source potential users into 'live' events including: concerts, advertising promotions or even sporting events?
ÿ

To solve this problem Taganize will create an Android app that can read specially coded Taganize NFC chips and QR codes. During any 'live' event mobile users will not have the required app and/or a correctly provisioned app needed to stream live video. By touching a Taganize NFC chip or scanning a QR code, users can download/provision the required app and/or settings needed in order to stream live video from the event. Not only will mobile users be able to start streaming live HD video from the event in real time but more importantly they WILL NOT have to fiddle with the challenges associated with provisioning an app and all its settings onto the network! Everything needing to happen will occur with touch and go Taganize simplicity.
ÿ

The implications of creating this app are enormous and widespread as it will enable Taganize to expand it's product portfolio in many ways! When we think of public safety for instance, Taganize will now be able to sell it's own line of security products that can be displayed in public and private places. Have You seen the ?See Something, Say Something? sign? Now when citizens see a crime in progress it can be automatically streamed and sent to authorities as it's happening in real time! The same can be done for the music industry, concerts, fairs, restaurants or even a city promoting itself internationally.ÿ The possibilities are limitless!",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

246,CREA246,CREA,CREAtiFi,Finland,TinyApp,TinyApp,"Birger Kaipiaisen katu , 4 B 15, 00560 Helsinki, Finland","EDUCATION, Consumer education/culture",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Taina Mikkola,"Tiny App is a ""making life easier"" kind of service for kindergartens and families. This virtual info board syncs your child's upcoming events to your calendar with couple of clicks and frees the fridge door for the children's drawings. With Tiny App, educators are finally free to focus on the work they were meant to do in the first place, to take care of and educate the children. www.tinyapp.biz/fi
ÿ

TinyApp offers a native mobile application (iOS and Android) and a web portal for the kindergarten teachers and the parents to share information with each other. Our offering will help them to communicate and share information efficiently and without time or location limitations. TinyApp creates one centralized place for important kindergarten related notes, leaflets etc. Both parties have the need and want to be up-to-date of what is happening in child?s life and remember the important events and things for the child. TinyApp provides a service to make every day life easier in the context of information sharing.
ÿ

TinyApp?s business model will, in the beginning, be freemium. The basic communication and information sharing functionalities will be free for kindergarten teachers and the parents. The additional functionalities, like photo/video view or kindergarten level reports will be charged. In longer term we are also open to discuss and review possible of advertisement co-operation with family/kindergarten related service or product providers.
ÿ

247,CREA247,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Notedlinks S.L.,Huballin," C/ Almog?vers 165, ,  Modulo 004, 08018 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,3,1,YES,IN,Xavier Amor¢s Berenguer,"Problem Solvedÿ

We want to help small businesses and creative writers to generate original and relevant content, like articles for a blog or website.ÿEven thoughÿContent Marketing is one of the best ways in the long runÿto generate online visibility, it requires some effort and expertise. We want toÿmake it easier and accesibleÿto everyone, allowing creative writers to write better content and small business to be more competitive.

Creative writers need to come up with new ideas on a weekly basis and need to produce optimized content to have good results. They need to use SEO Keywords in the body of the article, include compelling images and links to other sources of information to keep the attention of the readers and choose a title that is relevant and interesting enough to generate clicks.ÿ
Small companies and startups can't afford expensive content marketing agencies, and often donït have the expertise or the time to create original and quality content by themselves.
ÿ
Product presented

Our online Content Marketing platform allows content writers to find relevant topics for their work and to create a more optimized content with title, topic, SEO keywords and image recommendations. On the other hand we also help small business to create original content for their blog in an easy way. We allow companies to focus on their business while we give content recommendations and produce original articles for them. It's like having a content marketing agency working for you 24/7.
ÿ

We also include easy to understand analytics to help our users understand the performance of their content and measure the ROI of their content marketing efforts. With our analytics dashboard, writers will be able to analyze which topics perform better, while small business can take better decisions. ÿ
ÿ
How it works

Users enter their domain, we analyze it and make content recommendations about topics that are relevant to the website introduced, taking into account its competitors, social media trends, SEO rankings... In just one click these recommendations can be turned into an original article written by professional writers. We also give easy to understand analytics about the performance of their content.
ÿ

We analyze semantically the domain introduced to understand which topics are performing better and give better recommendations based on that. This is where the FiWare enablers ""Semantic Application Support"" and ""BigData Analysis - Cosmos"" come in handy. The big data analysis will allow us to extract useful insights from all the data extracted from the pages of the domain. Part of this information will be extracted from semantic analysis, ""Semantic Application Support""ÿcan help us organize and make sense of all this semantic information.
ÿ
Value
The value for our customers lies in two aspects:ÿ

-On one hand we make it easier for creative content writers to create content by giving recommendations about topics, SEO keywords, related images and even titles so they can focus on writing. They can also understand better their content performance with an easy to understand analytics dashboard.ÿÿ

-On the other hand we make it easier for small business to have quality content for their blogÿwithout having the expertise or the time to do it. We give content recommendations based on many different factors, ensuring that the recommendations are relevant for the user and their website audience.ÿ",Tech provider,,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,Content Management,Applications,Content Applications,1,0,www.huballin.com,Startup,50000,huballin.com

Ctra Valldemossa Km. 7,4, 07121 Palma de Mallorca, Spain","Consumer other, MANUFACTURING",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jos‚ Urios,"The artisans? collective presents significant flaws in transversal competences, especially in those related with business management, and in the use of the potentialities of new TICs in the field of production, mainly when concerning the design of pieces
column2: but ÿthe promotion of their products and market penetration is also scarce.

column1: After holding several meetings with artisans from the leather and footwear industry in Mallorca and once analysed their needs and requirements, at Mark Site we decided to work on creating a simple application, yet very comprehensive in its connection with social networks (massive markets) because European have to compete with semi-artisanal products produced in developing countries with a considerable reduction in production costs. ÿÿ
The Application

Craftsmapp intends to convince the Majorcan artisan industry, an industry that includes from self-employed artisans to internationally renowned artisan factories such as Camper (footware) or Munper (leather fashion), that by use of new technologies it is possible to reach a younger audience that requires a different kind of marketing that makes them feel like shopping in markets of factory outlets located around the island. Once the feasibility of the project is verified locally the idea is to implement it in other European municipalities famous for their highly valued artisanal products.

Craftsmapp is an application that links tourists to typical artisan products from different European municipalities. This connection will be possible exponentially thanks to propagation on social networks.
Its success is based on the simplicity of its use for both users and traders as well as the connection with social networks.

With two simple steps, tourists can visualize the product and its features, its history, price and where to buy it through geographic location. Users can also post it on their social networks and give it a score.
Created for IOS and Android. The app will be marketed via QR codes, posters, buses, public services ...ÿ
Producers may publish a limited number of pieces per day using a simple CMS and paying ? 1 for each piece",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

Users's age no matter for the source of their problem or severity because the tool is totaly suits to them. Their normal problems are physically disabled, hearing loss, visual impairment or epilepsy.In Spainwe find more than 800,000 adults with these problems according to the Nacional Institute of Statistics of Spain. For European cases the number increase to 5.7 million people, and if we focus our global target would increase to 11.5 million.A latent and obvious that today yet did't have an effective tool to solve or at least alleviate this problem as much as possible. ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

250,CREA250,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,"Mentha Augmented Experience, S.L.",Augmented Experience,"Av. Josep Tarradellas, 149 Pral. , Office, 08029 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,"Mentha Augmented Experience, S.L.","An Augmented Experience is a platform for mobile, tablets and in a near future augmented reality glasses that allows the user to experience a unique and immersive event thanks to a number of visual tools of ICT. This project is especially aimed to attract new visitors to a location with historical and cultural value and for promoting the turism, what we can afford mixing Augmented Reality, Geopositioning and Gamification.
ÿ

Each experience is unique and unrepeatable, created from a storyline and adapted according to the space and the history topic dedicated to go. These augmented experiences will be different in each place, but all have the same language: a way to use technology tools to achieve to telling a story surrounding the historical, patrimonial and cultural heritage, a mix of creativity and technology.
ÿ

There will be various audiovisual resources (graphics, 3D, audio, geolocation, etc.) applied to the Augmented Reality to discover the story in question and even more: all the context that surrounds it. This application is related to the television program ""The Place of the Facts?, for Catalan Television, establishing a synergy that will benefit both formats, platform and television show. However, this product can enjoy their own life and will likely create new experiences for assignment, to help revive those places with heritage interest and promote them.
ÿ

The second function of the platform is related to schools. Historiar creates a school system where students who are entered in the history of their people and from some simple programming tools to create their own experiences. So the students of the schools have the incentive to be able to view and enjoy a proposal that created themselves and that others may participate. With these activities it is ensured that students will be working in groups, learn the history of their towns and also begin to form in the world of computer programming, a wave that is increasing in the educational and labor dimensions. In fact, it is considered that learning computer language is a way to solve the problem of youth unemployment, since it is estimated that by 2020 is expected shortage of 900,000 professionals in ICT, as reported by the Commissioner Androulla Vassiliou European in a letter to all the Education Ministers of the EU. It should be noted here that the method and sources of research using journalist's television program can serve as reference for historical research students.
ÿ

To conclude, there are so many places like Augmented Experience of cultural, historical and heritage, not only in Spain, but in Europe too. Because of the adaptability of this format, it would be exportable and applicable for an infinite places. But the goal is always the same: to promote the culture, history and heritage of the region to achieve new and more visitors to these sites.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

251,CREA251,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Dylvian SL,SmartMeetingRoom,"Avda. In this team a service charge of receiving commands from the control application, whether to display the files sent to the right or to control screen runs.
