253,CREA253,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Visiona IP,Tsunami,"C/ Copenhague 12, Edificio TIFAN Oficina 201, 28232 Las Rozas de Madrid, Spain",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,David Jimenez,"Visiona envisages the end-user experience and user participation in the media co-creation process as a driving requirement for innovation, participating of the Future Internet as a network of active social users, while providing rich media content that is attracting more users to this kind of new conceptual services.
ÿ

Media and content have a strong influence on technological, societal and business strategies within the context of the Future Internet, taking into consideration the high social impact of the participation and interactivity of end users.
ÿ

One sector that is progressively entering this new paradigm is journalism and news gathering. News gathering is the process of creating a story, from finding sources and facts to coming up with a story angle. Different types of stories require different reporting processes, but all of them need to lay on four main pillars: truthfulness, closeness, appealing and quality.

TSUNAMI project aims at bringing together these two worlds, both Future Internet and journalism, by emphasizing on three key aspects: the user, the service and the content. Each one of them is a powerful force by itself, able to explain current evolution of media-based services consumption: content-centric services designed for improved targeted-user experience. ÿ

TSUNAMI is a content-driven news-oriented platform, where a content-specific service is tuned to cope with the content-centric paradigms offering, on-demand and live news-media distribution, news-content publishing and consumption.
ÿ

On the other hand, TSUNAMI will provide end-users with innovative tools which will allow them to acquire and deliver live video streams directly from their smart devices (i.e. smartphones and tablets), supporting both Android and iOS. The capability of transmitting content independently from the location is a priceless feature that will empower users to delivery real-time media in a highly efficient manner. Journalism is a clear use case where this technology may have a huge impact. TSUNAMI will offer an extremely easy-to-set-up bundle for quick video capturing ensuring high quality performance for the system.
ÿ

TSUNAMI integrates a live streaming application. It will be based on HLS (HTTP Live Streaming), a communications protocol that supports both live broadcast and pre-recorded content (i.e. video on-demand). HLS is capable of managing multiple alternate streams at different bit rates, allowing the client software to switch streams intelligently as the network bandwidth changes. Hence, TSUNAMI will be able to adapt the streaming process at run time attending the network conditions. Thus, the best quality will be always provided and the Quality of Services of professional environment will be covered.
In addition, HLS provides tools for media encryption and user authentication over HTTPS, allowing publishers to protect their inputs.

Additionally, TSUNAMI will be able to join the consumers and professionals in terms of content formats and content managing. TSUNAMI will offer automatic connectivity and compatibility of the platform contents and the streaming services with the state of the art workflows of professional video content generators as broadcasters and mass media. Any content from TSUNAMI can be ingested into CDN services for web delivery and in HD-SDI (coaxial or fiber) production environments. Finally, in terms of the property rights of the videos management, TSUNAMI will work through Creative Commons (CC) licenses. This makes the original authors the only ones to decide where, how or when others can use their videos.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

254,CREA254,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,"SITEM, Consultor¡a T‚cnica en Sistemas de Informaci¢n Geogr fica y Teledetecci¢n S.L.",Specialized tourism in urban areas: enhance access to culture and commerce using ICT Technologies,"C/. Proven‡a, 66, 5? 2?, 08029 Barcelona, Spain",Consumer health/wellness,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Oscar Miralles Ruich,"General information:

The project is based on the incorporation and integration to the goolTracking platform (web and mobile) of a set of tools to extend the current business (nowadays focus in the outdoor users: hiking, running, mountain biking, etc ...) to a urban profile, focusing on cultural and leisure tourism. Therefore, the project is presented as an evolution of an existing system to adapt to a new user profile and expand the ability of the company's business. For this reason, we need to develop four improvements to the current system:
ÿ
1. Increase the usability and aesthetics of web environment (currently only a map)
2. Incorporate artificial intelligence as filter and search engine information
3. Incorporate the ""Beacon Technology"" to enhance commerce-user interaction
4. Incorporate 360? spherical images to improve user experience.
ÿ
ÿ
Our solution
Boost visits and sales by establishing a link between the commerce and the potential buyer. This link would be established by using a low cost system combining web, mobile and beacons technology:
ÿ
Access to detailed information of the shop
Report of the establishment in real-time
Attracting customers through active messages using push technology ""Beacon""
Mapping the distribution of customers through technology ""Beacon""
ÿ

The data are incorporated through a CMS and nourish a site map (ready to be embedded in the web of each establishment) and a free app and multilanguage (Android and iPhone) with details of the different establishments: images on 360 degree, PDFs, videos, AR, QR code reader, etc. The most important point of this system would combine recommender algorithms based on artificial intelligence with technology ""Beacon"" (emitting device and a Bluetooth link that facilitateÿ a link ""type of establishment - user ""). This system will allow, for example, send notices about offers, coupons and other incentives. Additionally, it also allows to create distribution maps with variables such as time of stay in a particular sector or total users, without the need to open the app. The business model is based on a monthly or annual fee for each establishment incorporated entitling the installation of a ""Beacon"" in the shop, information management of each trade and access to the users distribution maps on the shaft commercial.
ÿ
Relevant degree at national and international level:

The ""Beacon Technology"" was presented by Apple in December 2013, ie, which has about 11 months. So, it's very new technology and it's in the first steps of its real implementation. In september 2014 will begin the commerce of the 360 degree cameras with ""popular"" prices (below 700 ?) and high level of usability. Currently, the systems to generate 360 degree images are very complex and the price can go up to around ? 3,000 at least.

Systems that respond and interact to users based on artificial intelligence algorithmsÿ only be able to start applying to the mobile environment from the onset of the latest generation of phones (more powerful and screens quality). Previously, the hardware and software of mobile devices did not allow the proper use of this technology raised.
ÿ
ÿ

255,CREA255,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Magicbox Television and Interactive Services SL,SAME - Emergency alert and message system for cross-platform television,"C/Malvarrosa 7, 28937 Mostoles, Spain",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Daniel Castro Garcia,"The project will allow citizens to receive alerts and emergency messages on their TVs using the European standard HbbTV, available in 100% of SmartTVs sold in Europe since 2012, and with an annual growing rate of 20%.

The messages are generated through FI-Ware sensors cloud scattered through the city, and supervised by security forces, emergency institutions and other public authorities to avoid false alarm triggering (police, firemen, health authorities, city council?) or directly generated by authorities.

These messages will be broadcasted OTA (Over The Air), through the same digital TV signal as the regular broadcast TV channels (including DVB-T/ISDB/ATSC digital television standards, and satellite transmission using the DVB-S/S2 standards), and without requiring an Internet connection. Alarms will be automatically received, filtered based on geographical area affected, risk level and severity, and instantly displayed on HbbTV SmartTV equipped homes.

Depending on the alert severity, the message could be displayed either as a brief message (press red key to receive an alert message), a banner at the bottom of the screen partially overlapping the broadcast emission, of a full-screen message in case of a high risk emergency situation.
ÿ

The emergency message will be also accompanied by additional information in form of an explicative audio or video, a web formatted page with more in-deep data related to the alert, etc. This information could come through OTA (Over The Air) or Internet, so that the HbbTV-compatible TV could receive information coming from both the broadcast antenna and the broadband channel if the TV is connected to the Internet.
ÿ

However, the service takes advantage of the broadcast nature of TV. Although it makes use of broadband access if available, it is not a requisite and is designed to allow alert triggering without Internet connection: In case of emergency, mobile networks usually suffer service outages and thus mobile devices are of no use. However, broadcast stations are usually less affected than mobile networks and are able to provide the service without interruption, effectively complementing tablets and smartphones.
ÿ
Example of alerts could include the following:
Weather alerts (hurricanes, storms, floods?)
Gas or water shut offs due to breakdown or planned works.
Anticipated electric power shut offs due to planned works
Nuclear or chemical hazards
Evacuation alerts, bomb or other terrorist attack warnings.
Traffic alerts related to severe accidents or road cutoffs
Recommendations in case of emergencies (evacuation routes, instructions on how to proceed, etc.)
Other alerts not necessarily provided by FI-Ware sensors, but leveraging on FI-Ware cloud infrastructure: food alerts, medical drugs or other product withdrawal, missing persons, etc.
ÿ

SAME provides a new service around connected TV that complements the traditional broadcast experience with alerts and related information using rich multimedia content such as professionally produced videos and other creative media, thus intensifying cooperation between creative industries such as broadcast and multimedia / Internet content developers.
ÿ

The system will also be extended to other worldwide standards: Ginga-J, SmartTV SDKs from Samsung, LG, Philips? , Android 4TV based devices, and proprietary interactive TV middlewares in use though IPTV and cable platforms.
ÿ
The project idea has already been presented to several potential customers that expressed their interest in the project:
City councils of Malaga, Seville and Santander
SAMUR (emergency services from Madrid - Spain)
Canal Sur, RTVE (Spanish broadcasters)
Secretariat of Telecommunications of the Mexican government
256,CREA256,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Alquimia.IO,Stoorm Flow,"c/moli , 47
column2: 4-1, 08950 esplugues del llobregat, Barcelona, Spain",BUSINESS SERVICES,B2B,5,1,YES,IN,Miguel-Angel Carralero Martinez,"The ideation of creative and original messages is the basis of the advertising business. This creative process has different problems and risks:

column1: ÿ
1) mental processes decrease in efficiency with time
2) there is a growing number of resources that experts follow for inspiration, most of which involve expensive team meetings (i.e. brainstorming or customer panels)
3) there are other potential bottlenecks like blank paper syndrome or mental blocks, which add uncertainty to the process.
ÿ
Creative experts need inspiration and agencies need more cost-effective and efficient workflows. ÿ
ÿ

The value proposition of Stoorm Flow is a digital-based process to generate and consume divergent ideas relevant to a project brief, such as a marketing campaign assignment. This process helps creative professionals to build ?research paths? to explore ideas from different angles (objectives, causes, everyday stories, metaphors, etc.), and then classify and filter them in order to find a creative solution. In essence, the Stoorm Flow engine is a generator of ideas that supports a divergent exploration of information, rather than a convergent search such as in search engines.
ÿ

The core technology of Stoorm Flow is a set of algorithms and methods that crawl the web through search engines and social media APIs, identifying and filtering creative and original ideas expressed in natural language. It includes semantic analysis algorithms to decompose phrases into iconic words and expressions, and look for representative images. Part of these algorithms are patentable and currently kept as industrial secret. Essentially, Stoorm Flow brainstorms the web relentlessly, divulging concrete ideas, and helping creatives to berrypick and organize them. It can also learn from its users and keep all the ideas it generates alongside user comments and their evaluation. In this manner, Stoorm Flow helps creatives in diversifying their creative paths and also helps them to converge efficiently onto the ?big idea?.
ÿ

The first product prototype planned is a personal APP that allows users create a brief, generate and rate ideas, and share them with their teammates collaborating on the search for a specific idea or theme (e.g. for a marketing campaign). Teammates store the ideas they generate in a shared portfolio to facilitate collaboration, they can also filter and grade the ideas they receive in order to pick the most adequate ones(s) collaboratively. Subsequently, we are planning to develop a series of specialized products, each addressing a different generic use case (e.g., searching for a marketing idea, a company name, a slogan, a motto for a political campaign, etc).
ÿ

The first business model adopted for this stage is a Business-to-Business Software-as-a-Service. Companies in the creative business (e.g., advertising agencies) buy brief* packages as credits, which are consumed by their creative teams as they use the APP to look for ideas. Companies own the ideas they generate, but our platform learns from successful cases to better its outcome in future cases. Our previous evaluation tests with the seven companies show that the use of our technology reduced the cost of the ideation process by 50%, made ideation more productive and enjoyable, and tended to democratize it.
ÿ

(*) a brief is a single creative assignment open for a maximum of one week, allowing unlimited search and users.ÿThe theme of the assignment is defined by at most three concepts.",Tech provider,,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Marketing,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,0,www.stoormflow.com,SME,50000,stoormflow.com

257,CREA257,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Videona Socialmedia SL,Videona,"C\ Maria Blanchard 2 , portal 7 bajo d, 28232 Las Rozas de Madrid, Spain",Consumer leisure/gaming,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Iago Fernandez Cedron,"Videona wants to become the new Video Social Network that will enable users to share in real time videos they record and edit using their mobile devices and taking advantage of the great features they have for recording and sharing high-quality videos.

column1: ÿ

Videona is empowering users by giving them the opportunity to select the most appropriate licence for the videos, enabling a Creative Commons approach. This makes the original authors the only ones to decide where, how or when others can use their videos.

This app is mainly addressed to digital natives, this is young people within 18 to 34 years old. Because cellphones are turning to be the device most used to connect to the Internet. For example, in Spainin 2013, more than 60% of users connected to the web did it through their cellphone. This social video app will have a basic free version that can be upgraded with other functionalities and small packages at very little cost. This way users will be able to add filters, avatars, the possibility of using the two cameras of the mobile device or even editing videos in real time.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

258,CREA258,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,EUROB CREATIVE SLNE,GxPAINT,"CALLE CIDRO 3, OFICINA 106, 28044 MADRID, Spain","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, TELECOM AND MEDIA",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Roberto Gimenez,"Arts represent an outlet of human expression, a physical representation of the internal human creative impulse. They are traditionally classified as seven, one per each muse: Painting, Architecture, Sculpture, Music, Poetry, Dance and Theater/Cinema. Although painting is one of the eldest art expressions a growing community of modern artists has extended the practice of using computers to paint color onto a digital canvas, which can be also printed onto traditional canvas.
ÿ

GxPaint addresses the development of new forms of pictorial art taking advantage of new technologies that are appearing on the market. Specially, immersive virtual reality technologies such as Oculus Rift.ÿOculus Rift is a new virtual reality headset that lets people step inside their favorite games and virtual worlds. Nowadays, with the advent of 3D computing and affordable headsets, it is already possible to walk around in virtual representations of buildings and cities. Inside these virtual worlds, physical constraints such as gravity or pressure are also virtual elements that can be removed.
ÿ

GxPaint aims to design and develop a virtual world in order to allow artists to create a new kind of art based on virtual reality techniques. Artists will be able to paint in a virtual environment using any type of texture, color, line, thickness and countless adjustments.
ÿ

GxPaint will be the very first tool that will transform the process of creating art into a 3D action. This new art creation will not be limited to a physical canvas, which is linked to material considerations and usual physics, allowing the artist to express her/his creativity in un unlimited way and also being able to incorporate elements from real world.
ÿ

GxPaint will also be a valuable tool for teaching drawing techniques. An artist will be able to save not only her/his artistic creation but also, most importantly from a student point of view, the exact process through which this artistic expression has been created. Students will be able to watch the whole process through GxPaint.
ÿ

Furthermore, GxPaint will change the rules of traditional painting. Before doing a paint stroke, artists will be able to see the exact consequences of that stroke onto the digital canvas. Artist will also have the possibility to undo or redo any previous action carried out onto the digital canvas. This feature will also help artists to paint digital drafts to try colors and techniques before painting an actual canvas.
ÿ

It will be thus possible to paint onto any kind of canvas. The size of the canvas will not be a problem anymore because in a virtual world, artists can get an endless mobility to reach every part of the canvas.
ÿ

GxPaint will allow artists to curate their creations and put them in an environment of their choosing. This will permit people from all over the world to visit an artist environment and see her/his pictures and other creations at closer range.
ÿ
Finally, with GxPaint, it might be possible to add sounds and interactivity to artistic creations. Therefore, artistic creations performed with GxPaint will actually become immersive virtual worlds.
ÿ

Thanks to FIWARE GxPaint will be able to benefit of a large number of capacities out of the box. Thanks to FIWARE, GxPaint will be able to store creations in the cloud and to build a community of artists and students sharing their painting knowledge. GxPaint will also provide streaming of videos of recorded experiences and real time streaming. FIWARE will help EUROB to reduce the infrastructure costs derived from the deployment of the needed algorithms which will process the services provided by GxPaint. At the same time, FIWARE will increase business continuity resilience.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,0,#N/A

259,CREA259,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Love Streams S.L.,Screenly: Smart Data for ?Cinema on Demand? in Theatres.,"Calle de l'Est 15 , entresuelo 3, 08001 Barcelona, Spain",TELECOM AND MEDIA,B2B,2,2,YES,IN,Alberto Tognazzi Drake,"Screenly per se, will be online platform for the audience to book a film screening in their local cinema through crowd ticketing, which means that film screenings are created and promoted by the audience itself. The platform also functions as a self-distribution tool for independent filmmakers and content owners. Revenues are split among the service provider, content owner and exhibitor with no financial risk.

With the addition of the FIWARE Enablers, which is the aim of this proposal, we will boost our productivity and service with Big Data analysis and revenue sharing tools among the multiple stakeholders (Movie Theaters, Right holders, VAT, SGAE, DAMA, AISGE, AIE as Right Management entities, Ymagis or Arts Alliance for the Virtual Print Fee, Admit One for the ticketing and choosing the seat, the bank for the TPV, the promoter that gets a 5% of the net incomes, and ourselves).
ÿ
This evolution of Screenly + the FIWARE Enablers is called: Screenly Big Data.

The Business idea for Screenly is to give to the audience the chance to participate in the programming of independent films which they may have missed or which were not offered nearby. For exhibitors and content owners, Screenly maximizes all the possible benefits for the sector that crowd ticketing offers in terms of feedback from users, visibility, community engagement, market research, and ticket management.
The goal is to become the reference platform of Cinema on Demand in the south of Europe, built on innovation and the participative economy.

Screenly provides a technological platform based on a ?Software as a Service? (SaaS) concept that brings innovation, transparency and a free financial risk tool to the film distribution sector. With the FIWARE enablers we will have the tools to deliver a better service to our different clients (either distribution companies, final user, or movie theaters) and have a distinctive analytics and marketing tools that makes ours an outstanding service compared to our competitors.

Screenly Big Data is the implementation of big data analysis tools, provided among the FIWARE enablers, that will allow us to improve the distribution of the content to the users. We will use the technology to process amounts of previously stored data in order to get relevant insights to suggest more relevant films and documentaries to our users. A better service for a happier user.

With the CREATIFI grant we will also develop a mobile app that allows, through a glanceable user interface (a Tinder type interface, to be clear) and gamification, a tool for selecting your favorited/hated movies. Swipe to the left you hate that one, swipe to the right, you love this one. After several decisions the user makes, we will be able to understand better is taste, thus being able to suggest and recomend movies.

Screenly Big Data will permit private access to the platform to content owners and exhibitors that allows them to experiment with different fees in order to obtain the maximum income possible depending on different factors such as the content itself, showtime and theatre room. As result of that, the technological platform will be able to automatically set the parameters on the minimum number of seats to be sold in every event. Therefore establishing the possibility for an event to be carried out without any financial risk to any of the parties.

With the FIWARE enablers we will be able to create visualizations for the ?content rights holders? (independent film makers, distribution companies) in order to simplify complex data and find better strategies of distribution for their content and a more satisfied end client that could have access to movies he likes.",Service provider,,X,0,X,X,0,,Software,Advanced and Predictive Analytics Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,0,Screen.ly,SME,50000,Screen.ly

260,CREA260,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,WINE VIEW ENTERPRISE SL,WIVI - Wine View,"Calle del Encanto, 5, Portal 4, 1? D, 28100 Alcobendas , Spain","ACCOMMODATION AND FOOD SERVICE ACTIVITIES, Consumer other, MANUFACTURING, WHOLESALE AND RETAIL TRADE
column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Francisco Javier Luque P‚rez,"WIVI is a mobile app created to provide wine info to the users and at the same time is a new channel where wineries can develop their marketing strategies in our new ad formats.

column1: WIVI is the wine app focus on users not wine experts but wine lovers. The main successful of this app is the way of how we provide the info (augmented reality search engine) and the kind of info (daily basics info) our target need to get more info according to their needs.

Although we are from Europe which is the mother house of wine culture we detect some business opportunities in this sector. On one side people who usually drinks wine has serious doubts to decide which bottle of wine they should buy in a shop or order in a bar, the thing is that they always associate wine time with plans (dinner with the couple, afterwork, family meeting, friends celebrating?). WIVI will recommend them a perfect bottle in real time filling several parameters as type of plan, food/wine pairing and quality rating preferred.

They will be able also to compare a few bottles of the shop to get ratings on the parameters above mentioned. To sum up we will make their decisions easier because what they can find until now is complicate info of each bottle described in an expert language and rating points of that wine, nothing else. We believe that wine culture should encompass more aspects like ?feelings? which are basic on the buying decision.
ÿ

This buying decision is what our clients?(wineries) needs to optimise with the aim of increasing their sales. WIVI will get users details, taste, location and their community?s info, all this data will make us the perfect channel for wineries to promote their wines, to connect with their clients, to offer another point of view of their product and to have the opportunity of influence at the time of their consumers buying decision. Our business opportunity is real due to the lack of wine platforms in mobile to develop marketing strategies, there are no mobile channels to invest in advertising formats. And in the other hand wineries are demanding more knowledge of their consumers, more contact with them, more control of their products and also platforms to show their hard daily work.
The app is also intended to serve as a showcase for small wineries which are not able to access to the mass media.

261,CREA261,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,"Voctro Labs, S.L.",VRITING - personalized voiced writing,"Carrer Almogavers, 165, desp 201, 08018 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jordi Janer,"VRITING aims to bring into the market an innovative media platform that allows any creator to automatically generate written content as a personalized synthetic speech. It targets creative writers, ranging from professional journalists to amateur bloggers and recreational Twitter users, who share the synthetic speech with wider digital audiences. Personalization represents a disruptive aspect of VRITING with respect to existing speech synthesis services.
ÿ

In terms of economic impact, big news corporations companies try today various forms of monetizing their information channels, e.g. premium content, advertising, etc. In parallel, new digital communicators reach larger audiences measured in number of followers. These audiences need to access written content from a myriad of smart devices in informal and mobile situations. By using the VRITING platform, our customers will benefit of a powerful way to distribute their content adapted to these audiences.
ÿ

The scope of VRITING is global and multilingual, which confirms the ambition of building a solid and long-standing business. Moreover our business model can be scaled in the future by targeting also general audiences by promoting a more recreational and artistic usages.
ÿ

Commercial speech synthesis systems are still today only found in reduced contexts and devices, which embed a reduced set of prototypical voices by studio voice talents. One reason of its limited acceptance can be due to the lack of familiarity of current synthetic voices.
ÿ

Our approach is inspired by the idea that users will empathize with voices that sound familiar. It has the potential to increase the acceptance of synthetic voices if they resemble real people they know. It represents a relevant novelty, even at the cost of losing overall synthesis quality caused by non-professional recordings in the preparation stage.
ÿ
VRITING?s approach is disruptive in allowing any creative user to build his own personalized speech synthesizer and share his voiced writings in social media.
ÿ

In terms of technology, probabilistic models of speech such as Hidden Markov Models (HMM) offer a good compromise between the required training data, computation time, personalization and intelligibility. Our framework will be based on existing statistical-based synthesis algorithms on top of our patented Kaleivoicecope technology for the audio rendering step.
ÿ
In terms of the platform architecture, we define three modules: 1) a Voice Recording App (records user voice excerpts)
column2: 2) Voice Model Creator Service (cloud-based online personalized model training)
column3: and 3) Synthesis Service (cloud-based online text-to-speech synthesis). Interoperability is managed by means of RESTful APIs, and dedicated cloud computing resources for the web services.

column1: ÿ

Privacy issues are very important when dealing with human voice content. Although with today state-of-the-art a synthetic voice will be hardly confused with a real human voice recording, it is very important to establish mechanism to protect users privacy. VRITING needs a robust permission policy to control how users authenticate to convert written content to synthetic speech recordings. ÿThere are specific FIWARE enablers that satisfy this demand.
ÿ

Scalability is also a crucial aspect in VRITING. The process of creating a personalized voice synthesizer for one user is computationally intensive. It requires both storage capacities for audio recordings, as well as processing power to run the algorithms. FIWARE Lab cloud computing services will facilitate and leverage the potential of VRITING.

266,CREA266,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,DRACO SYSTEMS SL,APOLLO eHEALTH,"Edifici CIM Valles of. 61-62, c/ calderi s/n parcela 13, 08130 Sta. Perpetua de Mogoda, Spain",Consumer health/wellness,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Meritxell  Gimeno,"Apollo eHealth aims to encourage citizens to practise exercise among public sport areas on the cities. Cities represent 85% of European PIB and the 75% of population. Both key factors for the economical growth.
ÿ
From childs to eldery people, Apollo eHealth ecosystem wants to track the sport activities that they do using smart sensors and IoT devices added to the already existent public furnishment and sport
machines. The autonomous and maintenance free smart sensors will report the information to the cloud, enabling other users to make games and applications to motivate people to practice sports
as well as promoting the use of public areas and increasing the social relationship.
ÿ

Apolo eHealth is a global platform implemented with IoT technology. It is a network of smart sensors that collect data about the activity performed on public sport machines already installed in public areas. It is a solution that promotes health through the sport practice expanding the possibilities of the current public areas in the cities.
ÿ
The solution focuses on health, sport and technology in order to provide a way to increase social relationships and the use of public areas by the citizens.
ÿ

The current sport machines installed on public areas are specific designed to promote the phisical activity to people. Apollo eHealth provides the collection of data thanks to a number of smart sensors installed on the machines. These information from the smart sensors could be used to make games or applications that promotes and encourage the activities to individual people and groups. The idea is to made games with objectives in order to do the exercises more funny and attractive.
ÿ
This solution solves the problematic of the activities tracking of people by doctors enabling a centralized system where the doctors can see the evolution or the activity of their patients.
ÿ

According to the data on some studies seniors believe that using machine sports on public areas of the cities contributes to their perceptions of promoting health by providing not only physical but also social and psychological profit.
ÿ

Apollo eHealth takes de advantage of public areas already equipped with some furnitures oriented to sport practice. These spaces are already available to the citizens and we extend the usability creating an ecosystems of smart sensors that collect data about the exercises. All that information
is sent to the cloud in a transparent way to the user. This is an important point due to one of the target group are seniors and the usability must be simple.
ÿ

Apollo eHealth promote healthy activities at the same time that encourage people to assume challenges. It is innovative the creation of a centralized source of data about the public spaces utilization in a totally transparent way to the user.

There is no any other global system that collect this kind of data. The smart sensors of Apollo eHealth ecosystem will be integrated with existing public machines that we can find nowdays in public areas of cities around the world. This is integration is simple and do not require complicated installations and even there is not needed any wired power supply. The smart sensors are completely autonomous and maintenance free. By using the enablers of FIWARE the smart sensors ecosystem can collect the activity data to the
cloud and third party applications can be developed promoting social relationships in the near future smart cities.
ÿ

We believe that Apollo eHealth ecosystem is an innovative idea and a completely new approach proposal for public areas helps the goverments and the public health servicies to get closer to citizens.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

267,CREA267,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Anticto Estudi Binari SL,CustomAvatars,"Fort Roig 14 2-3, 17007 Girona, Spain",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jordi Rovira i Bonet,"User-customisable 3D models as a service
ÿ
1) Introduction

The CustomAvatars project aims to create an API, server-side programs and content creation tools to help in the creation of visually cutting edge on-line 3D avatars to be embeded in any kind of online app. In the years of development experience of our team we have developed 3D character systems for console and PC on-line games, as well as 2D avatars for web-based games. The technological advances in server processing power, network bandwidth and mobile devices power has opened the possibility of having high quality 3D models embeded in any application currently using classic plain 2D avatars.
We propose the development of the set of tools and services to make this possible, easy and affordable for any project:
an API for the client software to easily embed customisable 3D models as an interactive widget in its user interface.
a set of tools for the creation of the customisable models, using standard open formats as input.
an efficient server that can be ran as a service implementing the API.
a set of examples including source data models, simple client programs and their documentation.

The product will be built on top of our character customisation technology that will be relicensed with an open compatible license. This technology has been proven by games on mobile and high end platforms and you can see an overview in the video at https://www.dropbox.com/s/hjpwluycuy9v1ot/Mutable.mp4?dl=0ÿ.
ÿ
2) Use case

Let's say a company is developing a web-based or mobile application which let's users have a custom profile visible to other users in their interactions. They want to promote the emotional attachment of the user to its image in their system so they want the user to be able to customise their avatar. The steps they can follow to do this are:
- They create 3D models for the different customization options they want to offer to the user, in any tool exporting to standard formats.
- With our tool pipeline they can put together all this data defining the customization effects including mesh merge, morphs, colour effects, lighting, etc.
- After that they can run our server that will provide an API to generate per-user 3D models and provide them to the company X application.ÿ
- They can use our example 3D viewers in their web application or mobile phones or develop their own systems to show the 3D model and offer the avatar customisation interface to the user.
The service of hosting the custom avatar server can be provided by an external company, or by X themselves since all technology will be available.
We will also offer artwork creation services and avatar creation advice, so that any company that doesn't have the required skillset can still use this system.
ÿ
3) Marketing strategy

The marketing strategy will consist of 2 phases: the first one will aim to getting one or two projects that embrace this technology and demonstrate its use and quality. The second stage will be to broaden the promotion of the system by using the applications in the first phase as flagship products. The marketing channels will be on-line promotion and specialise web-application conference presentations.ÿWe will be flexible on filling the gaps that the customers may have in the system pipeline: artwork creation, service execution, or end-user application development support.
ÿ
4) Competitors

This kind of systems for 3D avatars at the level of quality we will be providing have so far only been available in high-end consoles like Xbox Live, or Nintendo Mii, which cannot interoperate wor be reused outside of their closed ecosystem.
ÿ
We believe it is time web applications reach console games quality regarding avatar customization!",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

268,CREA268,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,TUERCO SCP,Tan-T n,"Gran Via, 600 4 2, 08007 Barcelona, Spain","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, BUSINESS SERVICES",B2B,2,1,YES,IN,Jorge A Luna Kuhn,"As a team who works in both IT and the art fields we get to understand the needs and context of the people who work in creative fields such as contemporary art. This made us decide to put our tech knowledge at the service of those needs.
ÿ

We have found that there is a lack of specialised, easy-to-use, online tools for people who work in contemporary art (or have jobs related related to it). This realisation came to us by our experience in our art practice and then reinforced by working and interviewing various artists and cultural managers.
ÿ

Tan-T n looks to fill that void by creating a platform where people in the art industry ?one of the most redituable creative economies on the global market? can work individually or in collaboration, communicate more efficiently, manage and show their work and create new dynamics, networks and projects for Europe and the rest of the world.
ÿ

This will be achieved by providing specialised tools for the different types of users in this industry: artists, curators, collectors, gallerists, private or public art-spaces/institutions and the general public
column2: unlike other platforms, we will not only focus in the well-known artists and institutions, we intend to gather emerging artists, non-institutional art spaces and freelance creatives.

column1: ÿ

Through the creation and usage of Tan-T n we will be building the organic and up-to-date database of the art-field. One that will help curators and institutions to find information about trends, relations between artists, cross-references among their work and key events in the art world in an specific time and space.
It will also give answers to questions like ?who is participating in this creative industry??, ?what do they do??, ?where do they live??
column2: answers that can help researchers and EU institutions ?such as cultural ministries? to get a better knowledge of the industry, it?s people and needs, and act accordingly.

column1: ÿ

On the tech front, the platform consists on a web-based application and a series of mobile apps that will take into account two key factors in the art-field: mobility and personalisation. Tan-T n will provide the user with access to the information within the platform from multiple locations and devices such as mobile phones or tablets through apps that will behave intelligently according to the user?s profile and field of work.

We are aware that art-making has surrounding activities that are not necessarily tech-related. On that front, the Tan-T n will also offer a series of community-related and seminars and gathering to provide non-technical tools such as craft tips, networking and a knowledge base about day-to-day tasks (e.g. how to hand out an invoice?).

Tan-T n has the potential to become the de-facto toolbox for the art industry and their needs. This translates into a global, very ambitious and complex project that will process massive amounts of data generated by end-user interaction both in the virtual and tangible world. ÿThis is where FI-ware comes into place as the provider of the technologies ?namely the ones in the Data/Context Management Architecture chapter? that will help us to achieve the needs of the enterprise.",Tech provider,,0,0,X,0,0,,Software,Content management,Applications,Content Applications,1,0,0,Startup,50000,tantan.ly

It expands creative environments allowing to combine sound and lights with a single multimedia nodule very easy to use: it can be programmed from the computer or from a smartphone to customize its features.
ÿ

monodo allows both individual and combined network use, creating more complex lighting and sound architectures. Connected to the Internet, it serves as a remote communication system between creators, or between the creator and his audience, with a great sound quality.
ÿ
monodo fits in a pocket, it is cheap and it is also compatible with traditional light and sound connectors for creation (Jack Audio IN &amp
column2: OUT, DMX) and the usual internet connections. monodo saves time and money to the creator: with it, he is able to control sound and light without mixers, or technical specialists, without the assembly and transportation high costs? monodo also facilitates the implementation of performances without the need of having control elements hidden or endless wiring. This fact allows the creator to perform almost anywhere, like spaces ÿnot prepared for complex lighting systems (the street, for example), or small unusual spaces (chapels), areas of special protection (historic buildings), singular architectures (classical symphonic spaces)...

column1: ÿ

His physical strength and technical stability gives durability, and its flexibility allows the use of potential complementary gadgets (special led lamps, batteries for monodo, amplifiers, specific software, sensors...), new improved versions (monodo for interactive, for visual, ...) and even new application environments such as artistic distance education or health creative therapies, for example. ÿÿ
ÿ

monodo generates community by opening its code and by boosting forums where users will have the freedom to download, to run, to copy, to distribute, to share, to change and to improve their software for any purpose without paying licensing fees.
monodo revolutionizes the scene making it accessible to everyone.
ÿ

The business plan of monodo project is therefore based on the technical simplification of the processes of creation and exhibition, and in expanding the expressive possibilities of different performing art practices such as contemporary music, classical music, theater, dance, performance. This technology is created for both amateurs and professional people, and both adults and children. Monodo will be available anywhere on the globe.
ÿ
A guitar player who controls the stage lights while playing the guitar. ÿ
A theatre and dance show in the street with a light and sound system easy to install.
A string quartet assaying together but everyone from their home.
A DJ who performs an electro session and who controls the disco lighting without being present.
A live and remote piano class with professional quality sound.
A complex light composition for a symphony orchestra in inflexible spaces.
A live show co-participated and exhibited from different countries and for different audiences.
ÿ

Potential customers are people who practice music, theater, dance and performance occasionally or regularly, also for stage professionals, educators and students. Thanks to its ease of use and its compatibility with traditional sound and lighting systems, monodo can be used by anyone easily and can be combined with their old systems.

monodo saves money and improves the creative experience, presenting a technological innovation that will change the day-to-day relationships in the process of the artistic expression. Like the iPod at its time, which facilitated the access to culture for everyone, monodo will contribute to increase creativity relations, allowing easier and simpler expression systems. Create is a human need and monodo facilitates this activity.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

271,CREA271,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Timepath,Timepath,"Joan Llobera, Consell de cent 381, 3er 2ona, 08009 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Joan Llobera,"There are several factors that have recently come together to make Virtual Reality a product available to the general public: cheaper displays, better sensors, improvements in interactive computer graphics and interactive sound design, etc.

In this project we will create the first prototype of Timepath Online. To do so, we willÿintegrate the core tools of Timepath with the CREATIFI Technologies. Timepath Online will be an online service helping creators of immersive virtual reality experiences to create content easily, publish it, and share it with content consumers.
ÿ

Currently, the Timepath experience is delivered with local standalone software. We will take advantage of the CREATIFI tools to transform this into an online experience, where multiple virtual reality consumers will be able to share a common Timepath experience, feeling part of a story plot rendered within an interactive virtual reality.ÿ
ÿ

ÿOn the content creators side, content creators will be able to use the Timepath production tools. The Timepathÿproduction pipeline leverage the expertise of a small theatre crew ÿtoÿdeliver a story rendered by smart interactive virtual characters within immersive virtual reality. The process of creating content is adapted from cinema and theatre: write a script, stage it with actors, and edit it through a standalone software with a graphical user interface. However, the result is not a video, but rather an immersive virtual reality where the end-user can become his favorite character by acting accordingly, and change one or another part of the plot, as a consequence of his actions. Alternatively, he can also adopt a more passive attitude and see how the story unfolds, with all the story roles adopted by different autonomous virtual characters. We call this the Timepath experience.
ÿ

Beyond this prototype stage, complementary services will also be available at Timepath online. Examples of such services can be the automated rigging of the virtual characters, the access to pre-implemented artificial intelligence modules taking care of commonly needed interactive functionality, or the analysis of the end-users reactions and preferences.ÿÿTo deliver these services the CREATIFI cloud infrastructure will be used for data storage and online behavioral analyses of the actions and reactions of the end-users.
ÿ

On the consumers side, Timepath online will be a website powered by a set of CREATIFI-enabled online services. It will be used to purchase, access and experience Virtual Reality experiences at home, as well as share them.ÿ
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ

274,CREA274,CREA,CREAtiFi,Portugal,"ArticaCC, Lda.",Visualino,"Madan Parque, Rua dos Inventores, Lote 4, 2825-182 Caparica, Portugal","BUSINESS SERVICES, Consumer leisure/gaming",B2B/B2C,5,4,YES,OUT,ArticaCC,"We are developing a web-based editor for behaviors and multimedia content.

It is aimed for the open web with standard sharing protocols and collaborative editing. So multiple people can be editing the same content and the content can be shared via link with other people for copying, cloning, referencing and cataloguing.
ÿ

The project was initally developed as part of a research for the future of education, allowing any user (kids or adults) to create behaviors for arduino based robots using simplified behavior tree paradigms. Behavior tree paradigms work differently from standard linear programming. It is often used in game development to construct behaviors for non player characters and can also be used to trigger multimedia content events (show images, play videos, expect triggers).
ÿ

With an early prototype we have done usability tests in a workshop environment to young kids to determine the usability of the editor comparing it to other robot behavior editors (lego mindstorms) and have obtained good results indicating that our tool is more intuitive for organizing robot behaviors.
ÿ

We are now developing a second prototype that extends this functionality to any kind of multimedia content, not just specific for robot behavior, but to allow the creation of interactive games, presentations,ÿetc.
ÿ

This proposal is to integrate this platform with FI-WARE services of cloud hosting and authentication brokering.",Tech provider,,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,"Development Languages, Environments, and Tools",Application Development & Deployment,Application Development Software,1,0,0,SME,0,artica.cc

276,CREA276,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Nora Business Technology and Services SL,Metadata Content Discovery in a BigData Environment,"Marie Curie, 8, Parc Tec. BarcelonaNord, 08042 Barcelona, Spain",Consumer leisure/gaming,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Carles Farrando,"Nowadays Television business is living one of the most important challenges since its creation. Internet has changed everything. People is watching television more than ever in total minutes consumption per day, but the traditional business models have not profit as Connect TV sets and internet content consumption rises and the total revenues have dropped.
ÿ

Users are sick of paying for 100 or more channels packages when they usually consume lest that a 20% of this offer, according to a recent Nielsen study. They become lost with so much offer and don?t appreciate it, penalizing these PayTV services and moving to low cost offers like Netflix or even illegal consumption of contents. Content consumption won?t be quantitative anymore but qualitative.
ÿ

The user doesn?t want so much content anymore but the right content in the right moment. An on demand content (Pushing for the content instead of pulling it from TV broadcasters). He/she is not following the traditional blanket TV listings with rigid time schedules but powerful search and recommendation tools depending on its profile and interests. Our solution will provide substantial progress in this recommendation tools developing a new Content Discovery not using just the user data consumption and content discovery to generate predictable recommendations like current solutions but also taking into account social network metadata and open data to create more accurate and surprising proposals to the user by user profile creations.
ÿ
ÿ

On the other hand, the company has already started to approach its current customers like Telef¢nica, Vodafone and Canal+ in order to know their acceptance of a solution like the one proposed and we have the door open with them to test our new Content Discovery development, which is a solution that with a quantitative and qualitative focus activity with users will provide the right data to quantify the value added to the PayTV operator in order to quantify the license fee to charge for the solution.ÿ

277,CREA277,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Fundaci¢ Privada Quepo,DatAWARE,"Monistrol, 16, Baixos, 08012 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Oriol Josa Fresno,"Our global society is everyday more and more interconnected, technologically, culturally, financially. Such interconnection brings a huge amount of data, complex and available (but yet supperficially exploited) . At the same time, such interconnection is linked to unacceptable social injustice and vulneration of human rights, and gives the power to change unfair social structures. The developers of DatAWARE, Quepo and Data?n?Press, believe that a tool that helps in the analysis of big data related to such topics will contribute to global knowledge and to a cultural change for more effective development, cultural and social policies.
ÿ

DatAWARE is an online system for institutions, media and researchers that allows to understand and analyse big data on public and development affairs, such as poverty reduction, food security and hunger, or peace and armed conflicts in the world. DatAWARE will allow to combine big data from public institutions (such as specific UN agencies, research institutes or international NGOs) and extract personalised analysis and visual reports according to the interest of the researcher.
ÿ

DatAWARE will be made available as a software, but also a specialised consultant team to apply the tool to each field of research will be offered to any organisation, institution or company willing to develop the tool for their own goals.
ÿ
The tool

DatAWARE is a system that will link existing data and offer crossed analysis and fundamental relevant indexed information to researchers according to their expressed interests, together with thought-stimulating visualisations of such data for their interest and use.
ÿ

DatAWARE will explore the big data gathered and provided by specialised institutions (UN agencies, international organisations, research institutes, universities, ?) and also the public internet available information in order to produce such data links, analysis and visualisation. This will ensure both specialised partnership and data, and flexibility and thorgouhness of the research.
ÿ

DatAWARE is a system that will be applied into specialised tools for specific thematics. For example, Quepo will use DatAWARE to create Hunger DATA, a refference tool that will allow users to extract fundamental analysis on the topic of the right to nourishment in the world. For this tool, cooperation with international organisations (FAO, OCHA, World Bank,...) will be developed, and also with big media like The Guardian Development Network or Planeta Futuro/ El Pa¡s. Such partnerships guarantee a wide visibility of the tool.
ÿ
The tool will offer to the researcher:
A specialised and centralised source for big data analysis
Possibility to cross diverse thematics and fields of interest (international economy with specific situation in a country
column2: climate evolution with crisis on a topic
column3: etc.) and obtain multiformat publishable reports.

column1: A visual layout for the results obtained, with complementary interactive narrative tools to increase the usefulness and comunicativeness of outputs
Guidance for complementary research, with suggestions for linked thematics that can be followed
The link of pure data with published pdf files available for research
ÿ
The development and consulting team
Quepo and Press?n?Data will offer a consultancy&amp
column2: development service for customers willing to develop a specialised tool based on DatAWARE.The team vision, the whole development process towards Hunger DATA, the institutional strategies, constitute key assets to be used by future customers/developers.

column1: Therefore, DatAWARE is an innovative opencode system adaptable to social, cultural research and development, added to a consultancy team ensuring a powerful tool everytime DatAWARE is used.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A
278,CREA278,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Evelyn Lopez,My wellness pocket,"Muntaner 171, 08036 Barcelona, Spain",Consumer health/wellness,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Evelyn Lopez,"BACKGROUND
ÿ

Increasingly, in our society there is a demand for issues related to prevention and antiaging. It is an increasing market. Many people go to alternative medicine and other methods of knowledge to know the state of their body and how to prevent diseases, as well as retard body?s oxidation, due to the passing of time and exposure to external contaminated agents.
In the US there is a big industry in preventative medicine, since there is no social security and people have to resort to supplements, micronutrients, microcosmethics, etc.
There are several techniques that prevent and inform us about the state of our body and what it needs to improve in all aspects.

One of these techniques is electroacupuncture of Voll (EAV), it is one of the most recognized and used by practitioners of integrative medicine methods. It is a diagnostic method that combines elements from disciplines such as Chinese acupuncture, homeopathy, conventional medicine and orthomolecular medicine.
ÿ
WHAT IT CONSISTS OF?
ÿ

Electroacupuncture of Voll involves measurement of the electrical resistance of certain points on the skin by means of an electrode or catheter. These points are called acupuncture meridians described by ancient Chinese doctors and are reflected in located specific points of the hands and feet.

Each of these points, also used in other therapies such as reflexology, connect directly to an organ or body part. Whereupon electroacupuncture can diagnose all kinds of ailments and diseases and see what we have materially affected, or what works for poor performance in our body.
Currently on the market there is an applicance called Kindling EAV-2000s, which is headed by the range of electroacupuncture devices.
The applicance contains a tool where you can see the measurements and a catheter which is what connects the patient to the meter.
ÿ
ÿ
ÿ
PROPOSAL
ÿ

The project idea isÿ a Fiware that processes data in real time. It is an adaptation of electroacupuncture of Voll machine, without being exactly the same, but works similarly. It is exactly an application that can be downloaded on a tablet, mobile phone or a computer.

This application requires a wireless external device, a measuring electrode and a third element that connects the user with the catheter and the application to make the circle system process the information.
Through our device (eg tablet) the application is entered and we can check if we have a part of the body or organ that is malfunctioning.
How do we do it? Through the catheter and the acupuncture points that are given to us through the screen of the device (mobile, tablet or computer), we state what we want.

Example: We are interested in knowing the state of our liver. The user enters into the application. Once inside, when the liver is selected, a screen immediately tells the acupuncture point, the foot or hand, you have to press the catheter to determine the state of your liver. A GO screen is activated! In which the user can press with the acupuncture point catheter. Immediately after knowing the state of the liver the meter does the same, EAV-Kindling is displayed. Through a mobile graph, we see the liver. If the values are below 50%, the liver is not in an optimal condition. Then, the application will give a series of recommendations to improve the state of this organ, indicating to the user the practice of sport, leaving no harmful substance to the liver, herbs, micronutrients, nutrition, etc.
It is an application that allows the user to have at his fingertips an analysis to determine the state which his body is in and what things can be done to improve its condition.

It is a tool for prevention and antiaging, where you can see through the different acupuncture points on the body condition, you can know the skin condition, through any organ or sense. Only an external device has to be connected via Bluetooth to the device where you have downloaded the application which is needed.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

280,CREA280,CREA,CREAtiFi,Turkey,Alictus Yaz?l?m Egitim Bilisim Teknolojileri Elektronik Sanayi ve Ticaret Anonim Sirketi,Darelist - Challenge your friends and yourself to discover around,"ODTU Teknokent, KOSGEB TEKMER SEM-2 No:B/9, 06800 Ankara, Turkey",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Arif Emre Ta­,"APP IDEA DESCRIPTION

Darelist is a geosocial challenge-discovery networking app that helps you to challenge your friends or simply to challenge yourself for fun or for a great cause such as ?shoot 6 second video while drinking X at Y? or ?show how brave you are by taking selfie while donating blood at Y? so that you give yourself and your friends reasons to move away from the routines, to discover around, to enjoy new experiences and even to be part of something remarkable and unique.
It is like our childhood game ?I dare you? meets ?Foursquare? meets ?Twitter?.

Darelist lets you be social, challenge yourself and get out from your routines. With Darelist, you can easily see the challenges on map, go and complete them or dare your friends to complete. You earn Dare Points (DP) when you complete a challenge or someone you dare to complete a challenge.

Dare Points makes your profile stand out. You start with Dearie level and make your way up to Dare Devil level by earning DP ? and maybe you make a few fans (Darelinks) along the way. When you complete a challenge, your Darelinks can see your accomplishment in their flow, applaud it and even share it with their own Darelinks. With the most interesting accomplishment photos and videos, you can have lots of Darelinks and be a phenomenon on Darelist!

As you level up, you will see more challenges on your map. To make things even more interesting, high-level challenges give you more than DP ? sometimes it is a discount at a restaurant or a free drink at a bar or even something you want to be proud of to wear such as a DareBlood Bracelet.

In Darelist, there is always a challenge waiting for you! Each week, Darelist Team renews the challenges in your city. You can also suggest challenges to earn extra DP and you can earn even more if your suggestion gets included in a weekly list.

Darelist is the most fun way to inspire people to go out, discover new places and share moments with the rest of world. Darelist is the only app you will need to decide what to do next from a handpicked list crafted by the professionals.
CUSTOMER PROBLEM

People find it hard to discover new places or find activities to enjoy their time. Most of the people we reached out told that they prefer same places or activities when they go out. The main reason stated by those is that they are not able to find diversity of places or activities around for their interest. They use different apps or websites to discover restaurants, movies, theaters or simply areas. Those channels of information provide popularity-biased and outdated information and that makes it hard to discover truly new places and activities.
TARGET CUSTOMERS
The target customers are millennials. They are active social media users. They want to share whatsoever is happening around them as well as they love to learn what others are doing.
SALES&amp
column2: MARKETING STRATEGY

column1: We will use unit model. We define one unit as a city. The marketing strategy will be focused on increasing the number of sales in one unit to reach the key metrics before starting marketing activities in a second unit. We are planning to start with Istanbul. We will work with popular bloggers/city explorers to create challenge lists and going to acquire first users among young professionals, university students and high school students who are active in social media, especially in Twitter.
REVENUE MODEL

Darelist will generate ad-revenue by helping businesses to find more customers by listing challenges related to them and charge only for people who really complete the challenge. Besides, Darelist will be a freemium app with in-app products such as boosters to gain more experience to climb up level ladder faster.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

281,CREA281,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,"BUMAYE COMMUNITY, SL",DESING ONLINE MARKET,"Parc Audiovisual de Catalunya Carretera BV-1274, Km1, 08225 Terrassa - Barcelona, Spain",BUSINESS SERVICES,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Josep Bu?uel,"An online shop dedicated to selling designer goods that are manufactured on demand. The idea was conceived to support new artists and emerging creators by not selling ready-made and stock products, instead the designer will manufacture once a minimum of unit sales has been reached, enabling them to produce and deliver on demand.
ÿ

The platform, which will be accessible from the web and from its own app, will enable the buying and selling of products in many different categories, directly between the designer and client. They are decorative objects, furniture, sports, games, technology, various gadgets, etc., that the creator should be able to supply, perfectly finished and on schedule, to the buyer.
ÿ

The project permits sales directly between creator and consumers, in order to test the acceptance of a new product before mass production. This can rule out projects that are unattractive to the market, while helping more viable initiatives to grow.
ÿ
At the same time, it allows consumers to obtain exclusive items, test, share opinions and be the first to purchase products before widespread commercialization.
ÿ

The platform enables a bidirectional relationship between users by providing a product page with information managed by its creator, which will house video content, photographs and texts explaining the advantages of the article, their motivations and expectations. This web space will allow user comments and the ability to share content on social networks. Thanks to the implementation of fiware technologies, the user experience is enhanced with 3D and/or augmented reality views, and price tracking is linked to the current demand. It is an original and entertaining experience that will bring together the creators and their followers and will help accelerate the projects involved.
ÿ

Any new product that is listed for sale on the platform will have a unit price, to be determined by its creator, after analysing the cost of production, distribution and other expenses associated with the process. As a major technological innovation, the selling price will be automatically reduced according to the number of units you have purchased. The website shows the minimum number of sales required to make production viable and an updated real-time price and permanent accumulated sales counter.
ÿ

The designer will face the challenge of selling the article to as many people as possible within a time limit of 60 days. During this period, the challenge is to develop a campaign to promote their product and reach a sufficient level of purchase commitments from customers. Buyers can also participate by ?spreading the word? and their bank accounts will not be charged until the campaign is complete and has reached the desired target.
ÿ

In addition to this ""challenge"" mode, obligatory for new projects, other products may be purchased in the traditional way with a fixed price and no time limit. This will be available for products that have passed the challenge stage and whose designers wish to keep them on sale for a longer shelf life.
ÿ

Transport and logistics are provided by the platform, with the seller assuming the cost. The platform supplies the packaging with a unified branding image and supervises quality control. The manufacturing system, deadlines and prices should be well established by the time an item is offered for sale on the web. The professionals who manage the platform will be permanently available to give free advice and guidance. Other services such as creating promotional photos and videos as well as legal management for the legal protection of the product, may be contracted separately.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

282,CREA282,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Studio 12 Creativos SL,AdFI: Your city in your pocket,"Patricio P‚rez, 29  tico, 03181 Torrevieja, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Katia Vila,"Nowadays, there are a lot of applications and services that provide us information on places we visit or we live in. Through them, business inform us on products and services we need, maps that help us to locate ourselves and reach those business, resources containing opinions from each business that allow us to make informed decisions. However, users face up with a pitfall: infoxication, i.e., the huge amount of information and the wide range of contents cause that users feel confused when looking for specific information. Furthermore, many cities have ÿlow quality resources to help in finding the leisure and business options that SMEs offer due to disperse, out-of-date or unavailable data. E.g., a misleading and incomplete list of shops in Torrevieja (Spain) is found in an official web page http://torrevieja.comercioscomunitatvalenciana.com

Advertisement information do not rid of this problem and marketing actions often do not reach the right potential customer at the right time to get a purchase action. Currently, advertising content is lost within the big amount of information and media that the potential customer must manage. Some tools such as Google AdSense (http://www.google.com/adsense/start) tries to personalize advertisement, but they usually fail in providing the right ad, to the right person at the right time and place. Therefore, advertisement becomes unuseful or, even worse, annoying.

Local SMEs need mechanisms to create and sharing multimodal content, taking advantage of the last IT in order to disseminate promotions, services and products, personalized ads, etc. These mechanisms allow customers (either a local, tourist or company) to connect up the city and all its opportunities (cultural, business and leisure) through a contextualized and multimodal advertisement. Our business idea provides these mechanisms through a multisided platform that will serve as channel for communication between final users (tourists, residents or local business) and business users (SMEs in the commercial and leisure business that want to advertise their products or services). The value propositions of our business idea for final users are as follows:
Free search on leisure and business options in the easiest and direct way.
Counting on action advisor (a recommender of spots that are available at the city). ÿ
Customers get personalized information according to their preferences and their context (geolocation), as follows:
Walking mode: a guided shopping in which the users start walking around and different useful ads ÿ(according to their preferences) are recommended.
Offline mode: push messages are used for providing ad content (depending on user preferences).
Coupon mode: users have the possibility to query active offers.
Business users will get the following value propositions:
Targeted ads in order to specifically advertise ideal content to connect the right final users.
Promotion by contextualization, augmented reality, geolocation, multimedia content, etc. Content will be more attractive for final user since the right content is provided at the right time and place
Advertisement management system as a web platform that allows business users to update information, manage offers or coupons, managing leisure schedule, etc.

Furthermore, other market segment has been detected (related to the multisided nature of our business idea): local and traditional mass media (newspaper, magazine, road maps, etc.), since they are still used by consumers and companies. We can offer more appealing and enriched content by using augmented reality as value proposition for this segment.
An initial business model canvas is shown in section 3.2.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

284,CREA284,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,ProtoPixel SCP,ProtoPixel,"Radas 9, 3-1, 08004 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,3,1,YES,IN,Alba Rosado,"For about five years, the founders of ProtoPixel have brought to life advanced interfaces for tangible, full-body and mobile interaction in both research and industrial domains. Over time, ProtoPixel strengthened its expertise towards Interactive Lighting Design (ILD), an emergent field that combines lighting engineering and interaction design with the aim of creating expressive and dynamic media content for luminic surfaces. In a way, it is all about manipulating and controlling light in a creative manner, as something more than switching bulbs on and off.
ÿ

Through an extended ILD practice, ProtoPixel developed a deep expertise in different aspects of ILD services, and became deeply aware of the needs that currently affect the field, as the lack of prototyping tools, the need of frameworks for content and interface development, cross-platforms solutions, compatibility with current industrial standards, among others.
ÿ

Fed by this industrial experience, Protopixel has started to develop ProtoLight, a product that will bridge the current creative and engineering gaps that exist between lighting and interaction design. In short, ProtoLight is a plug &amp
column2: play hardware and software framework that allows to create any type of lighting surface (from large scale media facades to wearable displays) out of most commercially available luminic artifacts (i.e. LEDs strips) and display media content that can be controlled in real time by different input methods, from mobile phones, to motion and wearable sensors, cameras, data from the internet, etc. With ProtoLight, designers can create highly expressive content without the need of learning specific programming skills, but at the same time, ILD engineers and developers will also find it compatible with current technical standards, which makes ProtoLight a perfect fit for existing ILD setting. ÿÿÿÿ

column1: ÿ

ProtoLight has been conceived as an interaction and design-driven tool for ILD practitioners, offering affordable and scalable solutions for creating interactive lighting environments, according to the following guidelines:
ÿ
- Multiplatform and compatible with current mobile (Android and iOS) and industrial standards (i.e. DMX, artnet, OPC, siphon)
ÿ
- Protocol for setting up and controlling LEDs structures in non-regular surfaces using standard network infrastructure.
ÿ

- Low floor, high ceiling: a tool suitable for both professional practitioners (i.e designers and developers) and Maker communities for developing an ecosystem based on current open standards such as Arduino and FadeCandy.
ÿ
- Graphic User Interface for content creation and visualization.
ÿ
- Automatic surface calibration and real time simulation of lighting structures.
ÿ
- Compatible with 3rd party application and plug-ins support.
ÿ
- Fast communication with chained LED structures via wired and wireless network protocols.
ÿ
- Seamless access to different sensors and online data such as social networks, big databases, etc.
ÿ
- Mobile app for in-place design, control and perspective correction for any LED scenario. (protolight software for mobile devices)

ProtoLight will take media content beyond traditional screens,making possible to create media facades and ephemeral luminic structures that can be seamlessly connected to the different sensors and the Internet of Things (IoT) to foster expressive interaction, public visualizations and social awareness, among others. ÿ",Tech provider,,0,0,X,0,X,,Hardware,Mechanical Computer-Aided Design,Applications,Engineering Applications,1,0,0,"SME, Startup",50000,protopixel.net

286,CREA286,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,IT TRAVEL SERVICES S.L.,Enjoy Travel Deals,"San Miquel, 79, 07002 Palma de Mallorca, Spain",TRANSPORTATION AND STORAGE,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Mar Munoz,"Enjoy Travel Deals it?s a tourism service software, based on Fi-Ware technology, designed to bring in an intelligent way to anyone the leisure opportunities that can be enjoyed anywhere in the world.
ÿ
This software may:

Identify, recognizing its geographical location, the leisure attractions, places of interest and other entertainment options, with sniffers that extract this information from the web and social media content.
Classify the extracted information according lifestyles profiles on a Big-Data platform.
Offer an functional and intuitive way capable of:
Determine user lifestyle profile.
Suggest to the user just destinations of their interest.
Learn from the suggestions to improve the behavior of the platform.

Provide a Visual Traveler Dictionary: a series of high quality microvideos that will show key elements of destination: gastronomy, culture, events, traditions... The videos will be filmed with a static shot from above, using stop motion, audio and augmented reality. It will have clarity of concepts, humor and connection to emotion, and they will be close related to leisure offered in the service.
ÿ
Who Is the target?

column3: CS - Cloud Social and Creative Services,"Torrelaguna 77, 28043 Madrid, Spain",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Lorena Bourg Arceo,"Cloud Social and Creative Services (CS&amp

column1: ÿ
CS&amp

column1: ÿ
CS&amp
