column1: 288,CREA288,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,CloudGuide SL,CloudGuide for Education,"Valencia 231 2-1, 08007 Barcelona, Spain","ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION",B2B,7,2,YES,IN,Cristina Perez Ferrer,"Cloudguide is a rapidly expanding company in the sphere of culture, museums and educative institutions. Our mission is to help cultural and educative organizations to spread their knowledge and legacy through different digital channels. We feature the world?s leading museums, monuments and art fairs, all in one place. More than 25% of the visits in Museums are students or school groups and often the way that Cultural institutions approach them doesn't fit their reality, since the returning rate among teenagers is lower than 3%. Audioguides or guided tours are not enough to understand the complexity of the legacy exposed in these cultural organizations. The channel that millenniums are using is based on their smartphones and tablets, that's why culture needs to start approaching them in this way.
ÿ

As a solution, CloudGuide offers a universal app and a platform for museums and art galleries, allowing them to communicate their heritage through multimedia guides. The CloudGuide appÿ already exists, but now we are aiming to develop the spin-off app called CloudGuide Education, just focused on the educative environment. The development itself would not be complicated, since CloudGuide Education maintains the same structure as its ""mother"" but with a completely new input of features specialized for this target. Moreover, the company has an already existing museum network willing to test it.ÿ This way we unite all the content of the museums around the world with the focus on interactivity and quizzes for the youngest.
ÿ

CloudGuide and CloudGuide Education will be a perfect complement for visitors (specially families), schools and cultural institution. With CloudGuide Education, Museums Education Department's will get an access to the platform allowing them to start creating multimedia and interactive guides without any investment. The traditional CloudGuide system supports audio, video, additional text, links, suggested routes, etc, but now with the new Education project they will get the possibility to transform this content into play&amp
column2: learn games/quizzes, social conversations and introduce interactive objects. Moreover, museums can examine all the related statistics gathered through our app.

column1: ÿ

Students, school groups and people with special needs will no longer have to carry around the old-fashioned unhygienic audioguide or download multiple apps per museum. Everything will be consultable from a single multi-lingual app that provides them with a new art and culture experience, CloudGuide for Education will allow them to interact with any exhibit (artwork, science experiment, design object), understand the real author motivation or simply get a better perspective of that exhibit background.
ÿ

These users will be able to tag and rate exhibits, leave comments and share their experience with friends on Facebook and Twitter, take part in conversations among each other, play and learn at the same tame, making the whole process of visiting museums more entertaining and interactive. Moreover, it is adjusted to the visitors' interests, providing them with preselections of popular routes they may be interested in. School and student groups will be able to enjoy the route created for them specifically by their professor, examine his comments, share notes and participate in discussions.
ÿ

Finally, CloudGuide Education will make technology and mobile applications in museums accessible to everyone, since we have already been contacted by he aws! Project (Art with Senses) an association devoted to make arts accessible to deaf / blind people and with few changes/adaptations we could make the app accessible to this and other collectives of people with special needs.",Tech provider,,0,X,X,0,0,,Software,Authoring and Publishing Software,Applications,Content Applications,1,0,0,Startup,50000,cloudguide.me
289,CREA289,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Geointeractiva,Geointeractiva,"Vallespir, 12, 08970 Sant Joan Desp¡, Spain",Consumer education/culture,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Daniel Onrubia,"Hi there,
ÿ
We are pleased to introduce Geointereactiva: an interactive platform which offers cartographic and geographic content tools, meant to serve teachers and students in the learning experience.
ÿ

Geointeractiva's main product, the digital map canvas, is based on information and communication technologies (ICT) for education. Through an on-line subscription fee Geointeractiva provides content and map tools for schools and universities of any level.
ÿ
Learning with Geointeractiva as in a new paradigm of ICT education, enhances the experience that students and teachers get from their ""Ed-Tech"" tools: Digital Boards (IDB), laptops and tablets &amp
column2: smartphones.

column1: ÿ
The maps are a 100% native ones, meaning that our designers and cartographers team designs and vectorizes the maps starting from zero to achieve a full interactive teaching/learning tool.
ÿ

Geointeractiva's maps are built up on our own design criteriaÿ we provide design and cartography within a conceptual and educational interface of software and data content. That means the main aesthetic difference with other map app's (as may be Google Maps).
ÿ

The cartographic base of each map is structured in two parts: planimetry and toponymy. The content of the Interactive resource is easy to use, smooth, friendly and intuitive, and is permanently updated in real time. Maps are available in different idiomatic versions.ÿ
ÿ

The Geointeractiva's user can enable or disable thematic layers on the maps of different thematic topics like demography, economy, etc. allowing him to compare the statistical data among diverse territories (countries, regions, municipalities, etc.).
ÿ

Geointeractiva allows students to customize their own maps and build up their own charts. And if the student or teacher wants to share what they have customize, Geointeractiva allows them to share and edit (if accepted) their maps and charts. Geointeractiva's digital map canvas are available to be synchronized (on-line &amp
column2: on-land). Customization and sync. enhances both, the educator'sÿ lecture and the students learning experience.

column1: ÿ

Students can interact not only by reading and learning the contents on the screen (referring to an old fashion way of learning) but also doing the proposed exercises and activities which are meant to enhance the student's creativity and own learning criteria (his own hermeneutic learning system).",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

290,CREA290,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,"AL PATI PRODUCCIONS, SL",?ORGULL DE BAIX? (PRIDE OF BEING FROM BAIX LLOBREGAT),"VENTALLO, n? 11, 1er, 08025 Barcelona, Spain",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Isabel Fern ndez,"ÿ?ORGULL DE BAIX? is a transmedia documentary project that creates a multiplatform service to help highlight the environmental treasure hidden in the region surrounding the big city of Barcelona,. A little-known reserve of agricultural land, that has survived the continuous real estate pressure coming from the city, and remains producing quality food that arrives every day to the Barcelona citizens? tables.The project includes a webpage with a web documentary, an interactive map, and a series of social media actions to promote knowledge and participation of the community. ÿÿ ÿ The project is developing a new media concept to complement the linear documentary film ?THE BACKYARD? which is already in production by AL PATI, for the public Catalan TV Broadcaster TV3. The documentary is a portrait of Baix Llobregat, the region surrounding Barcelona city, one of the most build up areas in Catalonia, that at the same time is the green lung of the city. This is the area with more density of infraestructures in the whole country (railways, motorways, port, airport?) but it?s also an important agricultural space that produces 15% of the vegetables consumed in Barcelona every day. Surprisingly, people from the city don?t know the key environmental role that this area plays in their daily life. The farmers from the zone live in a struggle to preserve their properties as agricultural land, and to communicate to the Barcelona?s citizens that they are important food producers, with a key role in terms of ÿthe city resilience to the 21st Century challenges. Meanwhile the real estate speculators treat to develop their housing an industrial plans in the zone. The scientists and technicians studying the zone, defend that Barcelona should stop considering this zonethe city?s backyard. ?ORGULL DE BAIX? is a platform designed to help to provoke this change, by highlighting the environmental values of the zone, empowering its population, and creating links between them and the inhabitants of Barcelona city. ÿ The mission of the project is to amplify the documentary impact by creating an online permanent space that will become a useful resource for the community living in that area, for the farmers, for the consumers living in the Barcelona city area, and for the researchers studying urban landscape architecture, future city developments, infrastructure plans, and environmental studies. ÿ We will produce the non linear documentary version of ?The Backyard? that will be hosted in the website ?ORGULL DE BAIX?. In the forefront of the website there will be the interactive documentary playing, while in the background the user will have access to an interactive map of the region that will allow them to navigate and discover the environmental richness of the zone. We will use the interactive map to display 3 minute video pieces on the different farms of the area. Through the navigation and this video-information, the user will have a clear picture on the agricultural production of the region (the type of vegetables, the farmers, their farming methods). Other icons in the interactive map will provide information about the farmers? markets available in the zone, leisure rutes for bird watching and other natural resources. ÿÿÿ For the launching of the web documentary the interactive map will be published with a small number of ÿvideo pieces portraying the farms of the region. A social media campaign will activate the population of the area, inviting them to collaborate in the task of mapping the zone by producing this short audiovisual pieces. By doing this the project will evolve to a collaborative work in progress produced for and by the community. ÿ The project has the interest of: the Cartographic and Geologic Institut of Catalonia that will help as a technical partner for the interactive map development. ÿ Televisi¢ de Catalunya which finances the linear documentary, and part of the web documentary, and will host the website on their own servers. The Center of Studies of Baix Llobregat, which will help with documentation, access to publications, research studies, and archive. They will also help to disseminate the project, and activate the community to be involved in it. They, as the majority of social organizations from this region, see this project as an opportunity to empower the population of the area, by showing the beauty of a land that has historically ÿbeen affected by the growing needs of the big city of Barcelona.ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

291,CREA291,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,AL PATI PRODUCCIONS S.L,ROAD TO THE NASRID WORLD,"VENTALLO, n?11, 1er, 08025 Barcelona, Spain",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Isabel Fern ndez,"?ROAD TO THE NASRID WORLD? is a data visualization tool to create a theme/story based environment to facilitate access to the biggest digital archive resources available on the internet, which can be used to increase the knowledge and studies on the civilization that built the Alhambra fort and palaces in Granada, Al Andalus, during the XII and XIV Centuries. ÿ

?Road to the Nasrid World? is the first element ofÿ?ALHAMBRA?S BUILDERS?, an ambitious transmedia documentary project that wants to break down barriers between culture and entertainment by producing a whole cultural experience mixing different technological platforms developments with real live events, to create an ecosystem in which the audience would experiment a journey to discover the history behind one of the most iconic buildings of Al-Andalus. ÿÿÿÿÿ
ÿ
ALHAMBRA?S BUILDERS: ROAD TO THE NASRID WORLD
Alhambra?s Builders is a project about men and women who planned, built and lived the most famous monument from Al-Andalus. ÿ

The Alhambra, the most visited monument of Spain, is one of the most beautiful buildings on the earth. It is very well known, but in a static way. We want to bring life to these beautiful walls, discover who built them, how and why they created it.

And at the same time, to deepen our knowledge of the whole conception of life of the Granada kingdom and the Nasrid society, in order to highlight the extraordinary value of this period in history when Islamic culture was a synonym for science, poetry, knowledge and innovation.

This will be the portrait of a forgotten and transcendent chapter of European history, the Silicon Valley of the XIII-XIV Century, the most innovative and advanced civilization of its time, making significant contributions in Mathematics, Engineering, Agriculture and Arts that had a lasting impact on our culture and will continue to do so for generations to come. And the construction of the Alhambra palaces, as a materialization of this intellectual power and sophistication.
ÿ

We will produce a produce a whole cultural and entertaining experience building a story universe that will develop through different technological platforms. The project is to create a big hub which will include a data visualization tool, a videogame, a mobile and tablet touristic app for visitors of the monument, a mobile and tablet app for kids, a book, a web documentary and a feature documentary. Each piece of the project will have its independent partnership structure and financial plan and funds.

ROAD TO THE NAZRI WORLD is the title of the data visualization tool, which is the first part of the project. The idea is to develop a data visualization tool over the online archive of the Alhambra (or over Europeana, if the Alhambra online archive can connect with Europeana -these conversations are open-) to facilitate the access to this big source of archive material, creating an attractive, meaningful and playful interface.
We will use this tool to:
- launch the project to public and create a first impact.

- connect with the first target group of audience (historians studying Al-Andalus and and their research teams), and to create engagement between them and the project, inviting them to help the writers team to find out the most interesting sources of information.
- facilitate the research process.
- make the research process of the creative team (documentarists, screenwriters) visible and more transparent.
- encourage historians to share their work.
ÿ

The mission of this development is to start building a community around the project, which will be at the same time our first engaged audience, active collaborators and curators. While we start the classic documentation and research process of an historical documentary scriptwriting, we build a public tool that creates an attractive path to the data on this subject. This will help historians to make their search work easier and that at the same, thanks to its playful and user friendly interface, will help visualize their work among a wider type of users. ÿÿÿ
The project has the support of the Patronato de la Alhambra y el Generalife, and the interest of Institut du Monde Arabe in Paris.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

We also plan to port Bee Invasion to smartphones and tablets to reach a wider audience and a more mature market.

Funky Whale Games?s success will be based on its innovative offering, unique technology usage, and expertise of its team within mobile gaming and wearables.",Service Provider,,0,X,X,0,0,,Software,Authoring and Publishing Software,Applications,Content Applications,1,0,0,Startup,50000,funkywhalegames.com

294,CREA294,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Peranoid Innovations SRL,MultiDub,0,TELECOM AND MEDIA,B2B,3,1,YES,IN,Juan Bautista Tom s Gabarr¢n,"MultiDub.ÿMultiLingual. MultiYou.
ÿ
MultiDub, synchronous multilingual dubbing in movie theaters.
ÿ

MultiDub is a smartphone app that allows cinema spectators to watch the movie being projected on the screen in the language of their choice. The procedure is simple: with a pair of earphones, the user enters the cinema and when the film begins, by just a single tap, the smartphone records a snippet of the ambient sound (i.e. from the loudspeakers). Technically, after this, MultiDub analyzes the spectral contents of the snippet and extracts a set of unique features that are transmitted to a remote server that will identify the film and the time position that corresponds to the moment when the fragment of audio was captured. This way, it is possible for the server to let the user know which languages are available. Next, the user chooses the language and the server provides him/her with the corresponding streaming audio. Then, MultiDub outputs it at the client-side by seamlessly synchronizing the sound with the images in motion that are projected on the cinema screen. Actually, and as one of our main unique selling propositions, the user still benefits from the acoustic conditions of the hall, without noticing the interference of the original dubbing emanating from the surrounding loudspeakers. This is carried out thanks to the support for specific digital processing techniques that allows MultiDub to combine the sound effects of the movie (only music and other effects from the ambient audio) with the dubbed conversations that are sent to MultiDub, while minimizing the interference due to the voices of the ambient sound. This way, the user transparently senses the audio as though he was not listening to any earphone, while profiting from the special acoustic conditions of the hall.
ÿ

As of MultiDub?s target market, Spainis one of the most powerful tourism economies in the world, receiving each year around 80 million foreign (non-Spanish-speaking) visitors who cannot have any access to movie theaters because of their limited knowledge of Spanish. Actually, only 1% of all cinemas in Spainprovide films in original version. Moreover, an increasing number of Spanish-speaking individuals prefer to watch multimedia contents in original version, due mainly to the richness and subtleties of real cast dialogues. As an archetypical MultiDub user, we can relate our target customer to the profile of a foreign tourist that does not speak the language of the movie. Around 30/40 years old, British nationality, single or married. In Spainfor holidays (non-resident) or for retirement (resident). She/he likes to attend cultural activities and loves watching movies. Note: the British community represents the third major group of resident foreigners after Rumanians and Moroccans, and the first non-resident foreign tourist segment.
ÿ

According to our Business Model, MultiDub makes money by relaying on micro-payments and advertising. The central product is the ?Dubble?, i.e. a packet of alternative dubbings that the user downloads to the mobile platform in order to enjoy the film according to his/her preferences. A user can have access to Dubbles according to two different modes: (1) By micro-paying for each Dubble directly (better sound quality, no advertisement, etc.), i.e. Dubble HiFi, and (2) Free (with sporadic ads supported commercially by a unit of advertising content, called ?DubAd?), i.e. Dubble Free. The advertisements that support Dubble Free financially correspond to the DubAd product, which can be described as a unit of advertising content offered to individuals or corporations.",Service Provider,,0,0,X,0,0,,Software,"Content Analytics, Discovery, and Cognitive Software",Applications,Content Applications,1,0,0,Startup,50000,multidub.com

The project consists to applyÿRFID technology, used in a lot of fields, to set in each car a RFID receptor linked to the car, so when the users park in a parking zone, they use an app to start paying for parking time. The ?ticket guard? doesn?t have to review ticket by ticket or car by car, he can just pass by with vehicle, without even stopping, to control if all the cars are paying for parking. ÿWith just a tablet, or computer with internet connection and an RFID antenna, the controller could easily see if all cars have paid for their parking or instead get an alert if someone hasn?t or has already ran out of time.

300,CREA300,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,ClipCare,ClipCare,"Plaza Lesseps, 12, Piso 08 Puerta 03, 08023 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Pau Vila,"Our project, ClipCare, is in the technological support and assistance field. During the last decades, the way customers obtain technological assistance has remained the same. Usually, if a customer has a question or problem related to a technology-oriented purchase, the only way to receive support is by calling the manufacturer, usually a call-center, or send an e-mail. It's very usual to find a scenario in which the buyer has to explain the problem multiple times to multiple agent, with long waiting times and a completely traditional setup (landline phone, e-mail or postal letter). We strongly feel that both sides, customer and company, could benefit enormously if the support experience was reinvented with the new technologies in mind, that is, by using unexplored channels such as support apps, interactive support websites and multi-platform solutions for connecting the companies and the customers.

We are focusing in two different markets. The first of them is the domestic market, in which we use the brand ClipCare. In this market, we focus in offering flat-rate, recurring subscriptions for obtaining multi-platform tech support. There is a very wide percentage of the society which, despite not being digital natives, have to use computers, tablets and other technological devices on a daily basis to perform their work, to communicate with they loved ones or to develop their daily tasks. It's very frequent for those people to have questions or problems related to the use of those devices and software, which are not covered by the manufacturer. In this context, the only way to obtain assistance is to auto-solve the problems or refer to a friend or family member who has a wider knowledge of that topic. The auto-solving is usually not a option because it requires ability to find understand technological workarounds which may not exactly fit the device, software version or environment used by the customer, who is not a digital native. Every ClipCare subscriber has an assigned agent, which can be contacted using any of our applications available for Windows, Mac, iOS, Android and standalone website. Those websites provide chat-style support and VoIP calling in an extremely intuitive manner.

The second area in which we are present is the enterprise market. We are offering, under the SocialEdge brand, a standalone version of our customer-to-company engagement technologies, especially suited to redefine the after sales experience, but also able to manage internal issue tracking.ÿ

Our technologies are in an advanced stage of development, including functional prototypes of all the applications and web technologies, as well as beta versions for early-adopters. We are very confident in our ability to finish the development on time and with a very high quality standard and, at the same time, meet our selling prospects which have been so far surpassed.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

304,CREA304,CREA,CREAtiFi,Portugal,IPCA,Vead - Feel it! Share it!,"Rua Fialho de Almeida,  N31, 2esquerdo, 4700-123 Braga, Portugal",Consumer health/wellness,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Pedro Rodrigues,"Vead is a high-tech wearable band containing a set of vibration units that are able to provide a handful of sensations to its user, according to the particular media content being watched, namely movies, music, digital games and mobile apps.

In a world where the vast majority of devices rely only on video and audio to provide feedback to users, Vead is a game-changer solution that opens an entirely new interaction dimension to the ever increasing markets of apps, digital games, and media content.

Vead comprises a high-level API which can be easily used by third-party developers to control the actuation of different vibration patterns directly to one or several body parts of its user, such as head, chest, arms and legs. ÿThe device integrates several vibration modules and one main processing unit capable of gathering the 3D device orientation, generate vibration patterns and transmit data through Bluetooth 4.0. In addition, Vead is also able of monitoring biological information such as heart rate, temperature and sweat level.

The most important success element of the entire entertainment industry relies on its ability to deliver sensations and emotions to its public, being it through music, movies, tv series, digital games or apps. People turn to this type of content in an expectation for truly deep and novel emotions, and the better the content is in providing such experience to users, the most impact and demand it will create in audiences. Vead focus exactly on the enhancement of emotions and sensations provided by entertainment content, thus providing a strong contribution to the impact and success of digital content.

The main application of Vead is to improve the experience of watching movies, listening to music and playing video games by giving vibration feedback about different events in entertainment content, such as explosions, collisions, fights, shots, crashes and music rhythms, among others. Besides providing feedback, Vead is also able to gather users? vital data about specific moments when watching, listening or playing media content. To this extent, this technology can classify users? reactions when experiencing frightening, heart-rending, suspense, altogether magical events.

In the media content world, Vead can attract people to specific content by enhancing realism into user experiences through stimulating the senses and allowing the user to feel the action and nuance of media content. On the other hand, Vead can also gather and transmit, to a cloud database, user senses data during the entire media content exhibition, allowing third-party services to classify or review its content. Since criticism is simply far too subjective, a multimedia content reviewing depends of the context of the viewing circumstances. Controversial reviewing always arises, where some people classify content as a masterpiece, but others absolutely disgust it. In such a context, Vead Analytics can add a new user-independent and detailed quality measure to be used not only by the critic but, most importantly, to be used by directors and producers for the development of ever more emotional and impactful content.

Similarly to what happens today with reusable 3D glasses, Vead can also be used as an add-on device in specific and controlled environments, such as amusement parks, videogame areas, interactive museums and cinema theaters. In such an application, Vead would not only provide a completely novel experience to its users but also provide critical data about their experiences, which may later be used to further improve the content.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

308,CREA308,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,KLADD,BCOM,"Indibil 5, 4? - apartment 422, 08004 Barcelona, Spain","ACCOMMODATION AND FOOD SERVICE ACTIVITIES, Consumer leisure/gaming",0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Maria - Gonzalez Lopez,"http://www.kladdonline.com/IBEACON/presentation.png

In recent years we listen frequently of theÿgeolocationÿof users via Internet or GPS and its great possibilities for recommendations of bars and restaurants, or just orient a map of the mobile over a certain direction.ÿPlatforms likeÿFoursquareÿhave tried to exploit these technologies to serve as guides for tourists in cities they found abundant information from museums or entertainment.ÿHowever, until now,ÿthe uses of geolocation have clashed with few adverse realities notÿlike spending the battery or the high cost ofÿdata roaming abroadÿ, among other problems.The ""beacons"", emitting signals Bluetooth short-range, could be the solutionÿ.ÿThere is even talk of them as substitutes for technologyÿNFCÿ.ÿ
Our BCOMÿits great potential and advantages over the geolocation by GPS.

A ""beacon"" is a small device size -of a coin 50 cents euro emitting a signal on shortwave Bluetooth technology, whose maximum range is 50 meters.ÿSignal, which is composed of three numeric values is unique for each device and can be located by another tracking device.

?Beacon"" is a term used in maritime transport to define the light signals emitted at night and boats can be used for reference.ÿIn digital technology, itsÿfunctionÿis equivalent to: define a location in space based on the signal emitted by the ""beacon"", so that from a smartphone that has a tracking application installed that signal is detected.ÿFrom this premise, you can configure the signal to detect them who is bound to a particular message (text, multimedia or combination of both) will appear on the mobile screen.

We are focusing in apply this technology in Europe because at the moment only Apple store and Macy's in New York has incorporated the ""beacons, the phone will find the deals and additional information on each product, when accessing the golf scope of the corresponding ""beacons"". Of course, these ""beacons"" have been shaped by the facility staff and placed in convenient locations.
But for now, few more examples of shops and SERVICES using ""beacons"" to provide additional information and offers. In Spain, for example, are nonexistent.
We want to use beacons across the city to works for the quality of citizen'e lives.
In the case of CULTURE, MONUMENTS, MUSEUMS, these devices could inform each artwork to the user closer to them.ÿ

In the ADMINISTRATION, could lead us to where we need to do a certain management, or we would INFORM PUBLIC TRANSPORT available within 50 meters from our position. In SHOPS, MARKET or even on the STREET , they could launch offers, advertising, or lead us to certain PLACES of INTEREST. But all this depends on the COMPANIES and INSTITUTIONS are encouraged to buy our BCOM, which is a hardware plus a configure software and you just need to place them in the right places.

The ""beacons"" have severalÿadvantagesÿcompared toÿGPS technologyÿfor geolocation in proximity.ÿThe first is that the activation of Bluetooth connectivityÿconsumes much less battery powerÿthan GPS mode, so if we are, tourism and away from the hotel, we will not go to recharge the battery.

The second is that, being anÿindependent technology data networkÿ-the GPS tracking on mobile is not-we can use abroad to inform us of events and attractions, without fear for the cost of roaming data.

Another advantage is that it is a technology that, unlike GPS, continues to operate inside buildings with high accuracy, which is known as""indoor"" geolocation . Also, thanks to its short range, can more accurately know the cultural and commercial offer around us , without having to view information on places that are too far from our range, as now happens with the geolocation by GPS.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

309,CREA309,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Laura Llim¢s,PopARbooks?,"Sant Pelegr¡ 32, 2n 2a, 08301 Matar¢, Spain",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Laura Llim¢s,"PopARbooks? A tool to develop apps for non-linear storytelling.
ÿ
Background

The project was born in Barcelona, smart-city model, where mobile technologies are causing profound changes in the reading habits. But there is a very limited supply of high-quality interactive multimedia content, and very few examples of books with gamification and links between physical and digital worlds. One reason for these shortcomings is the lack of affordable tools that allow content creators to access these technologies.
ÿ
Idea

We want to make resources available which will allow authors and publishers to provide interactive multimedia stories to a digital generation. These resources will let them incorporate image, video, audio, geolocation augmented reality and social networks to their productions easily, to achieve truly enhanced storytelling.
ÿ

The applicant has worked for the past two years developing this type of content, and has seen the lack of tools available firsthand, which compels us to use custom programming services for each product. Furthermore, she has also come to the conclusion that it is not necessary to develop a new technology, but to combine existing technologies in an innovative way.
ÿ

The launch of the CreatiFI program and FIWARE technologies represents a quantum leap, since it offers the possibility of building such a tool. Using them, a significant cost decrease is possible, thanks to open source resources and financial aid. The technology needed fits perfectly into the philosophy of FIWARE enablers, which will be integrated into a user-friendly online multimedia editing tool that we call PopARbooks?.
ÿ
This trademark, owned by the applicant, shows the bases of the business idea:
?Pop?, related to the traditional pop-up books, where a sheet of paper becomes a 3D object.
?AR?, related to Augmented Reality technologies and geolocation.
?books?, because the product provided is a new book concept.
ÿ
Tool

PopARbooks? is designed for authors and publishers without programming skills who want to integrate all kinds of digital formats. The tool allows a wide range of storytelling: from the non-linear (""choose your adventure"" stories where the user makes decisions that affect the plot) to simpler options, such as multimedia ebooks (interactive or not) and conventional books enhanced with extra content for mobile devices.
ÿ

Currently, even the simplest of these options requires custom programming for each product. On the contrary, PopARbooks? delivers mobile apps for iOS, Android and Windows, ready for sale, which use physical locations and objects to interact with. These apps can run offline (when content is stored in them), or online (using the cloud), depending on the amount of information. And no coding is required.
ÿ
Prototype and sample
We will deliver a tool prototype as well as an example made with it. They both will show the editing process of interactive multimedia storytelling, in both digital and paper enhanced editions.
ÿ
The grant will be entirely devoted to developing that tool, and it will also be useful to increase its visibility.
ÿ

The sample delivered will be an interactive ""choose your adventure"" story kind, that will use physical objects and geolocation to offer alternative plots when interacting. It is an adaptation of the novel titled ?Barcelona Roman Steampunk?, part of the transmedia universe called ?MNI?, created, registered and commercialized under the prize-winning brand Barcelona-Robot?, owned by the applicant.
ÿ

This story has been chosen for its ability to illustrate the scalability of the tool, which is useful in both local (Barcelona) and global (any city with cultural heritage) markets.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

311,CREA311,CREA,CREAtiFi,Portugal,Lost In Reality,Lost In Reality,"Rua 1o de Maio no21 4oAndar, Cruz Quebrada-Dafundo, 1495-745 Lisbon, Portugal",Consumer leisure/gaming,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Francisco Campelo,"Lost In Reality is a location-based storytelling mobile and web app platform for connecting people, emotions and locations. Stories are defined as story elements (text, audio, video, images) that are connected to GPS points. A web application allows easy authoring of location stories, which can then be published on the platform. Users can use the mobile app to search for stories in the cities they are visiting, and then follow those stories.
ÿ
Location-based Stories
ÿ

These location-based stories are stories that the user reads as he/she follows a path through a city or specific location. The path is defined by the story narrative. The platform focuses not only on content (or stories) delivery but also on content creation, so that users can either consume and create content as-they-go, contributing to a community of storytellers. In addition, the storyteller can sell their stories and build revenue out of their work.
ÿ

On the mobile app, users will follow the story elements of the stories, which are small chapters of the story containing text, audio and/or images and attached to a location by GPS tags. Users will also be able to create stories/document their trips as they visit the city with the mobile app.
ÿ

This allows travelers that have grown up with smartphones and the internet a more engaging way to discover and experience cities while traveling. Millennial travelers (aged 25-35) represent one of the main growth area of tourism and are looking for alternative ways to travel. In this way, LIR provides them an ideal platform for discoing cities in a more engaging and social way than simply reading Wikipedia or joining a tour group.
ÿ

With the web-app platform, users can create stories, or enhance the stories created with the mobile app with advanced editing options. Also, they will be able to manage their accounts and stories, including publishing stories to their friends privately or publicly and even sell the stories.
ÿ
Business Models
ÿ
LIR seeks to focus on three main business models: selling stories, location ads, and sponsored stories.
ÿ

The selling of stories would be similar to the business value of ebooks, with a cost of 3-10 Euros per story. From each story sold the author would retain 70% of the story price and LIR would be paid 30%. This price point is comparable to ebooks or tourist guides, and would give authors a clear idea of their revenue potential for planning and writing stories.
ÿ

Much as Google has monitized search, we view locations cities as entities which users browse through. By integrating ads into the stories, LIR can bring in revenue and also improve revenue for local businesses. Ads would be related to the story content as well as to the location, making them a natural extension of the story and not an element which users see as something to ignore.
ÿ

The sponsored story model is similar to the model of sponsorship in the movie industry. Brands or other institutions (tourist, museums, etc.) could provide custom stories which integrate with events such as concerts, exhibitions, etc. The sponsorship model essentially addresses the B2B possibility of brands paying to produce and feature content and boost the value of locations for their events.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

312,CREA312,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Niss Games,AR Tuit,"Girona street  77, local 1, 08380 Malgrat de Mar, Spain",Consumer other,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Ivan J. Mengibar,"AR Twit brings social microblogging to (augmented) reality near you! It is a new Social Networking Site (SNS) and Microblogging platform with a twist: writen messages are automatically tagged with the sender?s current geo-location and these can only be seen by nearby users. The way users see messages is through an Augmented Reality (AR) app for smartphones, tablets and smart glasses: the user?s device uses its own camera to show reality though its screen and, if any message is nearby the user?s current location, it?s overlayed on-screen in its tagged geo-location.
ÿ

This application comes in a moment where use of smart devices is totally accepted among population and wearables like smart glasses are around the corner. People are used to participate in social networks, to tweet his own thoughts, to tell a friend about a sponsored Facebook page and, also, an important base of mobile devices have incorporated tools like Twitter to their day-life. So, why not gave people a micro-blogging tool, easy to use, with the addition of seeing only nearby messages, overlayed on-screen in the view of the camera device.
ÿ

I.e., a user just lunched in a restaurant and, at the local entrance, opens AR Twit in his mobile phone, focus on the restaurant and writes ?Good lunch at a reasonable price! Must try it!?. He publishes his post and since this moment any other AR Twit user nearby will be able to read it. Not so after, another user opens his AR Twit app on his tablet and scans his surroundings and notices an icon over a restaurant at the end of the street. He touches the icon and a message appears on screen: ?Good lunch at a reasonable price! Must try it!?.Why don?t give it a try? After having a nice lunch at the same restaurant, the second user opens AR Twit and gives +1 points to the first user?s post. Who will be next? Maybe that girl with her smart glasses on, turning down the street?
ÿ
The main features of this business idea are:
A messaging service where users can share their thoughts (or content), listen to experts (or brands) they like, discover new places or follow the latest local trends.
The service uses an app for mobile devices that show on the camera view any message nearby, represented by an icon (and excerpt of it) in it?s tagged geo-location.
When the user touches a message, its full text can be read, its writter, its creation ÿ/ expiration date and, also its puntuation.
Users can sign-up for an account for free.
Users are able to follow other users.
Promoted accounts are available (for businesses, brands and celebrities) through Cost-Per-Follow (CPF).
Developers will be granted an API for integrating our messaging system with other (location based) applications.
About the messages:
Can only be published by registered users.
User name will be shown in the message.
Can be public (viewable by all users) or private (only for some / none users).
Can?t exceed 140 characters, as in Twitter.
Have an expiration date (eligible by user), up to 15 days. Once it?s reached, the message dissapears.*
Can be rated with +1 or -1, only once per user. By rating the message, it?s expiration day will be enlarged (+1) or enshortened (-1).
Can be promoted to have a further expiration date or a major range of detection through Cost-Per-Engagement (CPE).
If there?s a huge density of messages in a certain location, the system will show only the most relevant and / or the latest.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A
313,CREA313,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Notebloc,Notebloc App,"Carrer Calabria, 262,  1o 1a, 08029 Barcelona, Spain",EDUCATION,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Karin Bente Cornelia Malmberg,"EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
ÿ
We are applying to CreatiFI because we want to develop a FIWARE-based mobile app linked to our existing print advertising media, called Notebloc. We aim to digitally enhance our physical product.
ÿ

Notebloc is an A4-sized paper notebook, free for university students. It works as an advertising tool for brands which want to reach this target by placing their campaigns inside the most useful item that a student has: his notebook.
ÿ

The new Notebloc app will allow students to digitalize their class notes taken on their Notebloc notebook, align them (hence, to put the notes straight even though the student captures them from another angle), remove the grid-lined background, access notes from any device (computer, tablet and smartphone), store, print and share them online. At the same time, brands will have a new media to personalise campaigns based on data inferred from the app usage (Big Data), use augmented reality and location-based features.
ÿ
WHAT WE WANT TO DEVELOP
ÿ
In order to understand better the concept behind our CreatiFI applicantion, it is important to understand the context where Notebloc operates:
ÿ

Notebloc is a free, A4-sized, spiral paper notebook for university students in Spain. These notebooks are customized for each university we work with and distributed to its students twice per academic year. The notebooks contain pages of advertising from brands that want to reach and engage with the student target.
ÿ

The first university to adopt the Notebloc notebook was Universitat Ramon Llull, with 18,000 students. URL is one of the most prestigious, private universities in Spain(e.g. ESADE business school is part of this university). The first brand to believe in our idea and buy advertising space in Notebloc was Levi's, a world-renowned fashion brand. The first Notebloc edition turned out to be a success amongst students (who loved receiving free notebooks), the university (who got a new powerful, free branding tool) and the brands (who reached their target in a memorable, efficient and direct way while fulfilling their advertising goals).ÿ
ÿ

In less than 12 months since the first free notebook was released, we now reach more than 142,000 university students in Catalonia (Spain), who represent more than 70% of them in this Autonomous Community. On the clients side, we count with international brands such as Levi?s, Reebok, SuperDry, BBVA and Acer Computers. Regarding universities, Notebloc is working with Universitat de Barcelona (best ranked Spanish university worldwide), among others.
ÿ
This story of success happens in the midst of the Global Crisis, which has affected the Advertising and Print Media especially hard.
ÿ
In conversations with brands and students, we identified other needs that we could eventually cover:
ÿ
Brands:ÿThere are some brands that have shifted to a 100% online &amp
column2: mobile advertising strategy, meaning that they cannot participate in our notebook but would participate in a digital media for students. Some existing clients have shown interest in doing a 360-degree communication strategy through Notebloc, meaning that they would place more of their advertising investment in Notebloc if we had a digital channel for them to reach students.

column1: ÿ

Students:ÿOur surveys show that more than 95% of the students who got a Notebloc use it in class. On the other hand, though, an increasing percentage of students uses electronic devices for studying purposes (taking and sharing notes). At the same time, students show interest in receiving more targeted advertising and discounts from brands.
ÿ
Because of this yet unmet needs, we develop the Notebloc app, which will serve both brands and students on their short and long term goals.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

316,CREA316,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Startup,Map cinema listings / Cinema listings api and developers web,"Alfarr?s , n? 5 1? 1?, 08030 Bacelona, Spain",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Antonio Algarate Gim‚nez,"We include two projects that are related but they are two separate projects.
In all the sections we indicate the project is about.
(We do not know if they can be submit separately.)
ÿ
Project 1. Cinema listings map.
ÿ

Mobile and web application with cinema listings presented on an interactive map. A list of cinemas and films programmed in the area on a determined day are shown on the map. Are shown only the list of theaters and movies that are in the visible area of the map. The user can see on the map the schedule of a film in all theaters in an area at the same time.

The application is done as web prototype for Spain, there is a functional prototype / mockup in http://www.mapacines.es/inde_x.php (search barcelona, Spaineg). We believe that it is much more meaningful for mobile devices, as it uses maps and provides information related to the user's location at the time of use, which makes itÿ useful in order to gather the information inÿ and contextualised way based on the position and location of the user.
ÿ
See http://www.mapacines.es/inde_x.php please.
ÿ
Project 2. Cinema listings developers web.
Website for developers and webmasters, with a number of services based on Cinema listings data.
The website will contain:
1) An API with which can obtain the data of the cinema listings (theater showtimes and films).
2) Files in xml or json updated daily with the theater showtimes.
3) Widgets based in this data for blogs or websites.
4) A website for promotion, where are listed the applications developed with these data.
The model is the same as that of TMB developers and cineworld cinema chain:

317,CREA317,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Startup,NEWSKID,"Buenos Aires, 6, 08320 El Masnou (Barcelona), Spain",TELECOM AND MEDIA,B2B,4,0,YES,IN,Eva Dominguez,"The newspaper industry is struggling with a steadily decline in sales. Engaging young readers is one of the keys to assess this sector?s future. At a time when the press is facing its most volatile decline, catering for the journalistic needs of children seems one of the most sensible investments. While news services for the young audience are not a new idea, there is still a gap in the market for an innovative approach both in terms of the business model and in the concept and development of the idea.

NEWSKID is an independent and interactive visual media experience aimed at young audiences with the goal of making current affairs a fun and engaging experience, while empowering the use of media and information among the younger population. NEWSKID is designed for children from the ground up. It?s transmedia, immersive and participatory. ÿ

The transmedia strategy is based on the use of a print supplement, a web and physical object, and the integration of Augmented Reality technology. Rather than expanding one product across three platforms, each complementary platform has a specific purpose. This transmedia strategy aims to reach a native digital audience through different moments and situations (in school and/or home, online and offline).

This approach has a strong storytelling purpose. Current affairs are explored by a digital character in a way that transcends the borders of each platform. This main character undertakes a storytelling trip through a physical object, a print product and a digital screen.

The project is developed around monthly in-depth news coverage that generates a variety of digital participatory activities. The prototype will focus exclusively on the reporting and technological development of this main topic.
ÿ
NEWSKID?s customers are newspapers, while the target audience consists of children from 8 to 12 years old.

NEWSKID?s customer segment is regional newspapers around the world. While big media assets can include this type of service within their overall strategy, a project of this scope and technical innovation is all too often out of reach for regional newspapers. NEWSKID provides regional papers with the opportunity to reach young audience with an innovative approach at a very low or negligible risk.

Children aged from 8 to 12 years old make up our audience. Children of this age are interested about the world and are very participative. This digital generation is used to playing and learning with digital screens as well as with physical objects. NEWSKID utilizes both techniques in a game-like storytelling based on current events.
NEWSKID?s competitive advantage is based on the conjunction of three main characteristics:

- Licensing business model. The licensing model gives exclusivity to each media in their region at a very competitive price. Since the service is open to regional sponsorship, media companies could benefit from the project for free or even to be profitable if the sponsorship amount is higher than the license agreement cost.

- News core business focus. NEWSKID has a direct impact on the core business of the newspaper, by engaging children with the main role of a news media: reporting on current affairs. Children will associate news reporting with a brand that they might remain loyal to in the future, regardless of platform.

- Use of transmedia strategy and the Internet of Things. The transmedia approach and the use of Augmented Reality to report on current affairs is a highly innovative solution for the media industry. At this moment there is only one service aimed at children using this technology but it?s not related to news and it?s used in a outlying form.
ÿ",Tech provider,,0,0,0,0,X,,Software,Authoring and Publishing Software,Applications,Content Applications,1,0,0,Startup,50000,newskid.org

319,CREA319,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Startup,BESPOKE TROPHIES WEB APP,"Proven‡a 62-64 , bxs.10, 08029  Barcelona , Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,XAVIER TUTà,"The Bespoke Trophies web app project is a cloud-based platform that allows anyone to create 3D customizable trophies, from creation until product delivery through digital design and manufacturing. The project will give a place with a showcase of pre-established exclusive design trophies to involve any user in a co-creation process through an easy configurator to personalize some versions of these trophies and buy them.ÿ
ÿ

The awards for any kind of events and promotions have many market segments, from sports to scientific or cultural industries. Normally advertising agencies are involved as third parties to carry out the brand's campaign or event's organization, and the project will provide a clear solution for these agency's creatives with a full control over a range of customizable options, including color, shape, size and pattern, and also the option to add text to make a product more unique. ÿÿ
The customization platform will also be a solution for anyone who wants a personalized unique trophy, from one unit to hundreds.ÿ

Mass produced trophies can't satisfy all the requirements of a broad and heterogeneous market, it requires a new niche products to bring new solutions with high added value. Digital design and manufacturing has enabled a leap forwards in offer new customized products to many market segments, from custom phone cases and jewels to custom orthopedics among others.ÿ
ÿ

This project aims to be an innovative solution throughout the whole process to design and make a personalized trophy, a new competitive advantage against the conventional solutions on customized trophies. It will bring new disruptive designs exploiting the real possibilities of digital design and manufacturing, focused on Additive Manufacturing and 3D printing along with some subtractive processes and craftsmanship techniques. This business model may provide an unique customized trophy at a reasonable price, due the cost reduction in front the conventional creative cycle.
ÿ

New designs and manufacturing possibilities of trophies through digital manufacturing, open amazing challenges to reinvent how to design, develop, produce, market and deliver new customized trophies.ÿ

New ways have appeared, like mass customization and cloud manufacturing, all this are changing product development standards. Nowadays is perhaps beginning a new industrial revolution, and at same time Digital Manufacturing and related business models are in the early majority adoption curve with a great expectations to get an exponential growing in next years.ÿAccording to trends studies, new business models and micro-factories are emerging around the world, with growing innovative applications and opening great opportunities for design, materials, software, hardware, production &amp

321,CREA321,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Startup,Calliope Live Interaction Suite,"Murillo 17, 2-1, 08004 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,3,1,YES,IN,Pelayo M‚ndez Fl¢rez,"Calliope Live Interaction Suite consist on a set of software tools to enable live ÿcommunication and interaction with big audiences and spaces when performing live shows, events, stadiums, commercial centers... the communication/interaction is based on the use of smart phones (for machine to people communication) and sensors (for machine 2 machine communication).
ÿ

The Internet of Things"" trend is growing exponentially, together with the Smart City concept, more and more our environments are full of sensors and additional context information. However when we think about communication with users (people), we always think on different protocols and ways on communication, but what happen when we talk about big audiences? Can it be consider a group of sensors?
ÿ

Calliope Live Interaction Suite will take advantage of the maturity of the Internet of Things concept to enhance the way of communicating with people according to their context.ÿSensors travel nowadays in our pocket, and more and more the space is gathering information about their context, by this combination a close proximity and spatial contextualized communication can be done, by enabling automatic and/or manual messages (audio, video, text...) at any time to the smartphones, to segregate the users groups according to their context (position, information from sensors near them, group, name, age...).

Calliope system provides a concise and creative tool for deploying complex real time transmedia storytelling according to precise spatial contexts. Caliope will become the reference tool for connecting in a smart way with the new audience of the XXI century.
ÿ

The prototyping and concept idea come from and will be validated in the Performing Arts, by validating the platform with big audiences in a professional environment at the same time that the design and user requirements will be updated according to each iteration and feedback from users (both the ones that send content and those that receive it). However the system, once validated, will have a bigger market as it can be applied to any other event with big audiences (stadiums, concerts, city festivals?) and to other markets, as it can be use not only for leisure but also for second screen/connected TV interaction, advertising campaigns in a commercial center, city information services?
ÿ

To do that it is required the development of the set of tools/modules to enable this real time massive interaction with users and devices. To do that the core development will be based on the FIWARE Generic Enabler ?Orion Context Broker?, that offers us the possibility to easily and efficiently subscribe and public resources and events. The system is compatible with both smartphones and sensors, as we created a simple proof of concept in Fi-WARE Lab.

Also this publication/subscription mechanism easily enables the propagation through the network of interaction commands to create context, and a RESTful system that simplify the client software development. At the same time the ?IDAS? generic enabler will allow us to carried out the system in big scale environments (&gt

column1: 322,CREA322,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Startup,MareMostra App,"Son Nadal 20 1, 07008 Palma, Spain",TELECOM AND MEDIA,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Santiago Tonelli Punta,"MAREMOSTRA Palma International Film Festival is the reference cinematographic event in the Balearic Islands (Spain). It is a nonprofit event that tries to boost the economy, the culture and the knowledge of the environment through cinema. MAREMOSTRA is a thematic film festival, that shows from committed and cultural independent films to blockbusters and commercial cinema. As well, it goes through film sections related to science, activism, fantastic and horror cinema. Maremostra features the BEST INTERNATIONAL PRODUCTIONS, that are linked in some way to the sea.
MAREMOSTRA got to its third edition in 2014 with a succesful result. The festival wants to improve each edition, bringing new services and tools for a better audience support.
MareMostra App will permit to our spectators to experience the festival with updated information and innovative services. The main objectives of this digital tool are:
Real time information about what is going on in the Festival and around it
All the information (trailer, cast, sinopsis?) about the films and events with the possibility of making a wishlist/favorites.
All the information about the Schedule of films and events with the possibility of making your own Schedule.
Tickets and season tickets sale (integrated with social media).
Film rating (that audiences can share) and surveys that can be shared in social media
Recomendations by geolocalization and interests (about fims and festival events and other suggestion based on sponsor services).
Social networks and integrated communication.
Conversation with festival guests (directors, scientists, actors/actreses, surfers (and other athletes related to the sea). For example, Q&amp
column2: As).

Google Hangout for a m ximum of 10 participants related to the festival.

Torism guide about the festival, filmmakers related to Mallorca and cinema localizations (based on the sellection of films made by the user or after a small survey of five questions). It is known that cultural events atract toursim, this area will try to enagage this cultural tourists.

Besides the services for the festival audience, the app will be a sponsorship opportunity through advertising (banners, animated banners?) and branded content for sections of the app or contests (for companies, institutions and the guest country of the festival) based on the same story telling so we can create better matches between the sponsors and the festival, it will give value to the collaborators, and the tecnology will be available to be bought by other film festivals and cultural events around Europe.
As well, the app will be a tool for real-time reporting that includes audience engagement, calendar adds, ratings &amp
column2: reviews as well as ticket sales. When the festival is over, the app will be able to deliver an executive report with key performance indicators and demographic analysis to help you plan next editions and to inform to your sponsors about the value of their collaboration.

column1: The differenciation of this app to others is that the info will be in real time (information and conversation), will use gamification to engage audiences and will provide recommendations and contextualization by profile and geolocalization.
323,CREA323,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Startup,AdvertiFi,"c/ Ayala 53, 2 Derecha, 28001 Madrid, Spain",MARKETING,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Carlos Ignacio Gonz lez de Ubieta,"ÿÿ
Executive Summary

We seek to create an app tool to get instant prices of outdoor ad spaces, bringing more transparency into the environment of potential media buyers and business developers looking to give exposure to their products / services. This first physical ""traditional"" ad strategy is often contemplated by most initial stage entrepreneurs as a first affordable step to taste the market, the download and use of such app will get them familiarized with the use of a FI-WARE based app (and will increase the chances of them considering the use of its code to create their own app instead of Android's or Mac's).ÿWe believe this key profile's involvement with FI-WARE apps is an important step to ensure its widespread use in the future.ÿ

Outdoor Ad spaces surrounds and impact us in everyday life. This app would furthermore have the potential to create a less passive approach in every day ad receivers, bringing out the Marketing student in all of us.ÿ
ÿ
Detailed description

The real Marketing soon-to-be graduates will also of course be encouraged to toy with it in their everyday life, students who will in the future lead app projects and marketing campaigns. The existence of a whole education industry surrounding the science of Marketing and Advertising is a perfect lunch pad for such an app, filled with professionals actively looking for news tools to empower students in their path to become experts on such major. Such stakeholders will presumably be easy recruits in the mission of spreading the word about the app's existence and it's use since one of their main role is to get the industry up to speed with the new tools available in our technology based world.ÿ

The app will work through the user's GPS system to determine their location and matching it with the industry's ad display location database in order to inform the user of the different ad platforms surrounding him and their price tag.ÿThe app's development will entail a close collaboration with the industry's main players, who will benefit from the increased transparency of their offered products / services.ÿ

A different mechanism will be set up for locations where GPS is unavailable such as subway stations, indoor multi level buildings, etc.. linking the user to the station / building mapping of the different ad displays for him/her to be able to consult the price tag on such displayed ad spaces. We are also considering the insertion of NFC and QR contactless information sharing technology.ÿ

This detailed display of the industry's ad spaces (which is already mapped by the industry players) will serve to demonstrate the power of FIWARE and the never-ending applications that could be supported through its use, using this apparent complexity as a sort of ""brand"". ÿ

The business model we envision for this app consists of 3 fronts. First of all we think the target audience is a much praised price for some big firms. We would like to propose a sponsorship of the add to big packaging / mailing companies seeking to lure entrepreneur's businesses such as DHL, UPS or FedEx. We believe this to be a key audience for such companies since first step businesses usually entail a lot of samples mailing. Other possible suitors could be Google Adwords or Facebook but these kind of sponsors could be frown upon by the ad display companies we need to work with as they are competitors on a broad level. The second front would be charge per download of 2,99 euros or so. The third front would be to get some commission for sales from the main ad display companies to be discussed with them. This app's audience is not likely to become mass market but its target user is of key interest to numerous industries.ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

324,CREA324,CREA,CREAtiFi,Spain,Startup,Refaber,"Plaza Zurbar n 7-9, 3 13, 08035 Barcelona, Spain",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Joan Maroto Sales,"REFABER PLATFORM

Refaber is a web based collaborative network platform that enables responsible innovation with sustainable and local focus. A social network that brings together people with ideas and people who have the capacity to produce them.
Its aim is to establish sustainable local partnerships between design, technology and SMEs in order to generate products, processes and systems around the settlements where people live.
ÿ
ANTICIPATING NEW REALITIES
Internet should not be a tool used to perpetuate the life within the cities as we know them today
column2: instead, it should facilitate their reengineering. As seen within the contemporary debate, the economy of urban innovation is based on cities that will be productive again, with the industry and technology required to relocate the production of goods to where they are consumed. Within this model, new forms of business associated to traditional production will appear
column3: as well as new businesses focusing on value-added and the use of the resources we have.

column1: That is what Refaber reinforces
column2: encouraging the new local productive structures of the XXI century.

column1: ÿ
GOALS
Rebafer engages people to create new local communities and aims to build productive structures on the basis of a circular economy, with emphasis on using ecosystem-based logics and social revenue.

If we act as natural systems do, the creation of new jobs would be entirely possible, while productivity would increase and resources would optimized. The leading cities in the near future will be those that generate more value for their territory with the lowest resource consumption.
ÿ
IMPACT POTENTIAL

Refaber has a disruptive approach within the European scene, with joining the need to activate the creative local economies through the regeneration of our cities, creating clusters of creativity by using a social platform for innovation in the field of real smart cities.
We care about design, the challenges that the local communities are currently facing
column2: and local production towards innovation and ecosystem-based logics.

column1: It is clear that taking advantage during this moment of crisis is not only effective, but also essential for the government and industry leadership. Moreover, a new economic model will only succeed if it promotes the popular business initiatives.
ÿ
EASY AND EFECTIVE NETWORK
In one hand, Refaber platform is an open and free tool to be used to solve challenges where designers, FabLabs, SMEs, research centres and entrepreneurs are involved.
On the other hand, Refaber would have a team of experts that will manage and guide the platform to make it easy for users to find the best option for every challenge proposed.
ÿ
Key points of the success of the platform:
1. An open community of experts solving challenges through ÿinnovative ideas.
2. A network that works by feedbak of platform users (all actors give feedback on services, quality of solutions, prototyping working speed, etc). The community is thus evaluated at all times.
ÿ
A free virtual platform with a working area will be accessed by all participants of each case, which will further lead to a continuous flow of exchange within the users of the community.

Financial revenues of the platform will come from a commission on the fee of every challenge established as well as the recruitment of 'premium' services and workshops to solve challenges, the rental of Refaber facilities, and the Refaber certificate for ecosystem-based logic production.
ÿ
WHY CREATIFI
We ask Creatifi to develop and design the Refaber web-based platform. On parallel we will dimension and test Refaber in order to develop a pilot case, with real people and real economy.

Over the CreatiFI eight months work, we will be transferring the real experiences of the successful pilot case to the application, focusing on quality of the users relationship. Doing so, we ensure the validation of the processes that facilitate the future platform.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A
