1030,FICO21,FICO,FICO,Lithuania,"ARS LAB, LTD",Early food spoilage detector,"Mokslininku st. 2A, 08412 Vilnius, Lithuania",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"FoodSniffer ? the first electronic nose in the world that helps you to determine quality of meat, poultry and fish. FOODsniffer helps to determine are these products are sound and suitable to use - this reduces the risk of food poisoning. It?s a device that helps everyone who cares about nutrition of themselves and their loved ones to quickly evaluate what they are going to eat themselves or offer their family or quests. More than 100 different volatile organic compounds (VOCs) can be detected in the near vicinity of decomposing meat, poultry and fish, some of which can be used as indicators of freshness. The FOODsniffer device takes a sample of the air from the immediate headspace around the product. Its metal-oxide sensors detect volumes of VOCs ÿin the sample (CH, NO3 and O3), and readings are then adjusted, taking into account temperature and humidity. These data are used to calculate findings and results. The results are visualized on a mobile device in a dedicated application.

FOODsniffer prototype has been developed and demonstrated to work, though there is still some challenges to be solved in order to make it a full-blown product and one of them is a reliable and powerful platform for sensory data collection and analysis. This is where Fi-ware platform comes in. During this project we are going to develop cloud solution for input data gathering from the devices, data analysis, pattern matching and return of the calculated result.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A
1031,FICO22,FICO,FICO,Ireland,Artomatix Limited,Artomatix Cloud Project,"26A The Mews, Mount Eden, Donnybrook, Dublin 4 Dublin",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"ÿ

61% of the budget for producing the top console games is spent on creating art. In 2014, greater than $3bn will be spent on the generation of art assets for video games. This industry has identified the rising art costs as their largest problem.

The Artomatix solution is an automated art-creation software application that will significantly disrupt the content production process for video games. The goal is to halve the time and halve the cost to make a video game.

The overall objective of Artomatix is to deliver the next generation of graphics tools, based upon our proprietary A.I. (Artificial Intelligence) system that can mimic human-like artistic creativity and can semi-automate the process based on input examples.
By semi-automating the generation of art, Artomatix will expand the games market and significantly disrupt the current art creation process by:
Enabling digital graphic artists to focus on high-creativity tasks rather than spending time on mundane low-creativity tasks (e.g. painting each individual brick in a wall)
Improving art generation efficiency and consequently reducing project times and costs
Providing studios with the means to keep art creation in-house, thus reducing or eliminating their reliance on Asian Art outsourcers
In the longer term, this technology will enable people (e.g. game designers) who lack artistic training/talent to manifest their vision.
ÿ

The Artomatix Cloud Project is focused on porting the present 'stand-alone' prototype Artomatix technology to the Cloud, using FIWARE technology on the backend and also for the required 3D user interface.ÿ

We intend to aim for large clients pre-launch so as to provide them with an immediate opportunity to utilise the technology. A typical service offering will consist of integration and customisation services, post-implementation optimisation services, monitoring services, on-going consulting services, and training workshops.
Our initial customers will be mid-size to large web properties that serve user-specific content.
Users of SLIC can reduce the number of webservers and peripheral servers (database, API, datawarehouse and others) by a large number. Additionally, the speed of content delivery will improve vastly.

The reduction of the number servers will lead to a significant cost reduction, since fewer servers means less hardware replacement, less networking equipment, fewer man hours required to maintain the infrastructure, and last but not least reduced electricity consumption. 1061,FICO52,FICO,FICO,Greece,DOTSOFT OLOKLIROMENES EFARMOGES DIADIKTIOU KAI VASEON DEDOMENON,Promoting the environmental consciousness of pupils with an educational video game,"Kountourioti 3 Str., N/A, 54625 Thessaloniki, Greece",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Environmental degradation and natural resources? depletion plagues the humanity around the world. While efforts are being made at national and international levels to protect our environment, it is also the responsibility of every citizen to use our environmental resources with care and protect them from degradation. The promotion of environmental awareness can be made feasible through environmental education of pupils ? the citizens of tomorrow. GreenSchool will be an educational tool in the form of video game that promotes the environmental awareness of pupils about the impact that their activities pose on the environment. Via a map of a virtual school, players will be able to choose different places within the school and will be requested to fulfil simple tasks with as less as possible impact on the environment. Completing tasks, players will gain points and achieve a better ranking in the ?Green Pupils? leader board, while at the same time they will be provided with information on the environmental impacts that these actions would have in real-life conditions. Within the GreenSchool game, pupils will be more and more motivated to adopt a ?greener? behaviour by competing with each other for the title of the ?Greener Pupil?. Competition between different classes and among different schools will be escalated progressively. GreenSchool will be a mobile application that will promote pupils? behavioural change to a more sustainable lifestyle through gaming.ÿ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A
1062,FICO53,FICO,FICO,Belgium,Dough VOF,Sparker,"Daenenstraat 17, 2600 Berchem, Belgium",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"The need for an open flow of knowledge in the organization

Creativity and innovation are widely recognized as of crucial importance for the functioning of modern organizations, commercial and non-commercial alike. This is equally true for the ability of employees to solve problems and engage in informal learning. Each of these processes relies on the flow of knowledge between employees, which in turn is contingent on the social cohesion and the transparency of the knowledge distribution in the organization. Knowledge silos exist, often between departments, preventing many larger organizations to achieve a higher level of creativity and innovation through collaborative problem solving and informal learning.
The Sparker way

Sparker runs on a number of tables, placed at strategic social locations in the organization. The tablets are connected to an RFID reader. Employees can perform check-ins on the tablet using their Sparker RFID card to score points for their team. They can engage in a Sparker conversation, by checking in with another player of their team. Both players are presented with a number of conversation topics that are based on their user profiles. By performing these actions, players can score point for their teams. The overall state of the game and the recent activity can be followed through a responsively designed website. In addition, the website allows participants to perform missions that are tuned to organizational goals, like contributing ideas through a crowdsourced ideation campaign. As players need to fill out their profiles in order to participate, this data becomes available to the organizational leadership, who can query it and perform analysis using the Analytics dashboard. This yields insights in the interests and competencies of the employees, which can be used to e.g. find out what issues are alive in the organization or to create teams in a more targeted way, combining different areas of expertise. At its core, Sparker provides a new way of letting people meet in a meaningful way. It offers an experience that brings people together and stimulates them to build social contacts that are based on meaningful discussions. The ZWERM prototype, on which Sparker is based, produced design research knowledge on how to build systems that activate and consolidate the social fabric. Our paper ?ZWERM: a Modular Component Network Approach for an Urban Participation Game? won a ?SIGCHI Best of CHI Honorable Mention Award? at the CHI 2014 conference and we believe that it would be a missed opportunity not to bring this type of application to the market.
Primary market
The market and especially the ?Learning &amp
column2: Development? segment has sent out a number of positive signals, strengthening our belief that the concept has market potential. Nowadays, the vision on learning has changed from strictly formal to a combination of formal, informal and social learning. However, there is lack of clear insights and data on where knowledge is located in the organization and how knowledge can be exchanged between colleagues. Sparker solves these issues to a certain extent, making it a promising instrument for engaging in social learning and obtaining data on future needs and opportunities.

column1: We have engaged in a track at BNP-Paribas Fortis to implement Sparker for their 17.000 strong staff. In addition, we have received interest from Belfius bank to test the application when it is finished.
Secondary markets

Focusing on large organization with knowledge silo?s looking for ways to engage their employees in a playful way is the most promising marketing strategy at this time. However, we have also identified that the concept would be applicable to spark social cohesion at events (conferences, business fairs,...) in schools (to server educational content) or in cities (as was done in ZWERM).",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

The idea is to identify users? location (or to have users identify their locations of interest), and then:
- provide information on two bioclimatic indices (Air Quality Index - AQI and Discomfort Index - DI) in nearby areas
- present to users the real feeling of other people about the current environmental conditions in their vicinity via a crowdsourcing component.

Via ENVI4ALL users will have access to information on health-related environmental conditions, for any location of interest. For the indices? calculation, ENVI4ALL will use weather information and air quality data (when available), acquired from the authorities which have the selected locations under their jurisdiction. For locations in which there is lack of data, users will have access to the ENVI4ALL crowdsourcing component and they will receive information on other users? perceptions of the environmental conditions. This information will enable them to adapt their activities and behaviour in order to avoid health impairments.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

1067,FICO58,FICO,FICO,Germany,easierLife GmbH,Prediction and recommendation system using non-intrusive IoT for preventive health in home environments,"Sch”nfeldstr. 8, 76131 Karlsruhe, Germany",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"The project ?Prediction and recommendation system using non-intrusive IoT for preventive health in ÿhome environments? integrates the FIWARE Cosmos module using its Big Data technology in easierLife?s market-ready solutions.
ÿ

easierLife is an easy to install solution, which enables seniors to live autonomously in their homes. Unobstrusive sensors detect motion inside the rooms. The easierLife system compares this data with the residents habits, thus information about a resident?s well-being can be extracted. With easierLife relatives can be informed via text-message, mobile app or web-interface about the situation in the senior?s home, to know whether everything is alright.
ÿ

The technical basis for our system consists of real-time sensor data from the households of elderly people transferred to our cloud infrastructure for rule-based situation recognition. To provide additional long-term data analysis for the new preventive system machine learning modules and the FIWARE big data module - ?Cosmos? need to be integrated. Cosmos will analyze long-term sensor data from ambient Internet-of-Things (IoT) devices at home in combination with the latest tools in machine learning, e.g. SciKit-learn, and Big Data processing to cluster the data.
ÿ

With this project it becomes possible to provide early feedback about degradation in people?s activity level and health. As a result awareness, about possible health changes (e.g. beginning dementia) of seniors can be recognized at an early stage. This allows seniors and their relatives to take preventive action. In general health degradation can be stopped or slowed down significantly, which means a rise in people?s quality of life and even more it is an extraordinary efficient approach to counteract the problem of rising health care costs.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column2: medien, Gesellschaft fr Datenverarbeitung mbH",Smart Online Recommendation for Apps,"Probsteigasse 20, 50670 Cologne, Germany",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"With Smart Online Recommendation For Apps (SORA) we want app users help in finding the apps they need.

column1: ÿ

People are using smart phones all the time, app stores contain millions of apps. There are many apps that could be really helpful to people at their current location or in their current situation, if they just could find them.
ÿ
When searching for apps suited for their needs, users don't get much help from app stores.
By doing a textual search, users get results listed in an unstructured way ranked by mostly undocumented factors like downloads, price and user ratings.
Example: enter ""airport"" in the iPhone App Store when near Cologne and you get Utilities, Games, Taxi Apps, Translators, an app for the Munich Airport, more games and so on.
ÿ
SORA allows users to optionally fill their profile so that SORA knows about hometown, native language, age, gender, family status.
ÿ
SORA will assist users with a portal that provides smart app findings based on:
ÿ
- recommendation based on location and time
If you arrive at a location for the first time, a city guide and a translation app may be of interest, later you may want an app showing you restaurants nearby or events at this evening.
ÿ
- recommendation on profile
Based on your profile SORA gets smarter over time by offering choices of users with similar profiles.
ÿ
- smart textual search results by applying advanced text analysis
By applying advanced text analysis on all app descriptions in a store we will be able to detect the context to which apps belong and group the search results into categories.
Now the user can decide which category (public airports for example) is of interest, without the need watch thousands of apps that are not in focus.
Using this technology SORA can also present apps that don't match the search text but belong to the same group (category) as otherÿmatching apps.

1080,FICO71,FICO,FICO,Finland,Frozen Vision,Gobblin Gobblinz,"Torikatu 19, 6th floor, 90100 OULU, Finland",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Venue (genre and platform)
Gobblin? Goblinz is a mobile casual shoot em up for Android, iOS and Windows Phone devices.
Premise

The opposing parties of the game are goblins, or ?goblinzes? using the traditional goblin language. The two tribes are named Blz (more ball like goblins) and Blx (more angular goblins). Their most characteristic and shared trait is the voracious appetite for delicacies. Unlike Blz, Blx are readily willing to steal these goodies, especially from Blz
ÿ
Target audience
Target players are casual mobile game players in age group 7-20 (the same as with Angry Birds).
The game is targeted for all mobile devices with Android, iOS or Windows Phone, even ones with a bit older hardware.
Gameplay

The device is in portrait position. The paddle monsters sit on the bottom corners. The Blz roll on the paddle monsters? arms. Blx start falling from the top of the scene, trying to reach the bottom of the scene. The player starts tapping the paddle monsters to swing Blz at them. When a Blz hits a Blx, both are destroyed.
ÿ
In addition to generic SHMUPs, one can easily find similarities to games like Tetris (Blx falling from top screen) and pinball (paddle monsters? arms).
ÿ
Wave after wave the Blx attack in wildly varying forms and formations. Each wave is a fast paced puzzle for the player to solve. When destroyed, many special Blx provide special Blz to the player.
ÿ

When the player has destroyed all the Blx in one level, she can move to the next level. A single battle comprises about 10 levels. When all levels of a battle are overcome, the player can move to the next battle with a new theme and challenges. In total, the game contains a campaign with 10 battles.
ÿ
ÿ

This allows our customers to gather insights in near realtime, enabling them to anticipate rapidly on e.g. customer behaviour or trends across their touchpoints.

ÿ

The Experience Connector is a data tool that connects multiple technologies and protocols coming from online customer touchpoints where data is generated. Via the ?connector? the tool merges all gathered data into a unified dashboard pulling out and pushing in data in the central database. This allows organisations to quickly gather insights in a dynamic way enabling fast anticipation on e.g. customer behaviour or trends across many touchpoints running on all kinds of technology. The data streams with highly personalised contextual information can be used to generate customized experiences by assembling realtime frontends based on the data. All activities are new data input feeding the database and are again the start of new activities. A corresponding catalogue of marketing services that can be executed by external parties or inhouse staff is developed.

Our offering is assembled-to-measure by connecting a variety of data sources. The aim is to be as technology independent as possible, so organisations can avoid vendor lock-in and could replace or add components through time without losing their data and experiences in touchpoints. The solution offers full control over the data and the locations it is stored complying with most security and legal standards.

1107,FICO98,FICO,FICO,Spain,JOTAWEB RARE DESIGN SL,Osteotech,"Francos 34 , 1B, 41004 Seville, Spain",Consumer health/wellness,B2C,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,0,"Osteoporosis is characterized by reduced bone mass resulting in increased risk of fracture. It is a major public health problem,
affecting millions of people worldwide. The primary goal of osteoporosis treatment should be fracture prevention and non-
pharmacological strategies such as diet (mainly calcium, vitamin D and protein) and exercise (weight-bearing exercises that
cause force on the bones like jogging, stair climbing or resistance exercises) that can be modified to maintain bone and muscle
health throughout life.
Objectively measured activities using accelerometers are an accurate method for studying relationships between physical
exercise and bone. Recent studies have examined the relationships between levels of vertical impacts associated with exercise
and bone mineral density (BMD) in adolescents or premenopausal women. Taking it together with the fact that the age-related
declines in the intensity and quantity of exercise contribute to the increase in risk of osteoporotic fracture, this lead us to the
necessity to promote physical activity in order to maintain bone mass.
The use of technology to enhance exercise prescription and understanding the optimal exercise type and dose (duration,
frequency and intensity) that have the greatest effect on BMD are common issues that arise. Thus, to address these healthcare
needs, sensors can be integrated into wearable technologies and such, so that health information can be acquired in daily living.
Therefore, our aim is to develop a system able to acquire health information related to osteoporosis and fragility fractures
prevention, detecting accelerations in different activities and also UVB radiation received (important for vitamin D generation) in
order to implement an application that allows immediate feedback to the users, avoiding the lack of motivation.

1113,FICO104,FICO,FICO,Spain,KOIKI HOME SLU,KOIKI The Social Enterprise for Sustainable Urban Deliveries,"C/ FRASCUELO 34A, 28043 MADRID, Spain",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"A Disruptive model:

KOIKI changes the way we receive/send parcels from our homes. Nowadays, the transport companies (UPS, DHL,...), or the National Post Services (Royal Mail, La Poste, Correos,?), all of them, dictate the time at which the parcel is going to be delivered/picked up at your home
column2: it?s a PUSH strategy.

column1: ÿ
On the contrary, KOIKI?s solution allows you to define the time at which you want the parcel to be delivered/picked up at your home
column2: thus it?s a PULL strategy. The consumer is on command of the process.

column1: ÿ
A Carbon Free Delivery Service for our Cities

As our KOIKI Messengers live very near to the consumer?s home, they will deliver or pick up the parcels either walking or in bikes or in electric vehicles. Thus, reducing CO2 and traffic congestion in our cities.
ÿ
A Mobile Based Model

Our KOIKI Messenger will operate with a KOIKI Smart Mobile App, they will receive the parcels in their homes, garages or neighbourhood spaces. They will scan parcels? bar codes and send a message to the final consumer who will define the time at which he wants the parcel to be delivered or picked up.
ÿ
A Collaborative Consumption Model

Our KOIKI Messengers will be a crowdsourced community from our neighbourhoods. They will be mainly housewives, students, or unemployed people. KOIKI is a vertical transport marketplace in the Collaborative Commons Economy similar to projects like Airb&amp
column2: b, Blablacar, Taskrabbit,?

column1: ÿ
A Social Entrepreneurship Project

We will give always preference to minorities and disabled communities. Our KOIKI Messengers will be a reference and a respected profession in their neighborhoods. KOIKI?s trust message will be contagious and will spread quickly thru word of mouth.
ÿ
A Scalable Project
KOIKI can be replicated in any City in the world where Environmental and Social concerns are an issue.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

It is proven in concrete cases that broadening the channels by which citizens can provide feedback to the local goverment can vastly increase citizen involvement (e.g. use of the CitySKD Issue Reporting API by the city of Helsinki). CityTracker takes this concept further, by complementing the input from citizens by an active listening into multiple social media streams (e.g. twitter hashtags related to issues with the city infrastructure).",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 1123,FICO114,FICO,FICO,France,Lu-e-lou Films SAS,Film Making Mockups Arts,"85ter rue Nationale , 35235 Thorigne-Fouillard, France",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Feature films are one of the most popular cultural expressions worldwide, with an audience of 7.5 billion people per year. We propose an online collaborative tool for film makers to create mock-up of film projects in order to bring the risk on the actual production cost down.ÿ The primary function is to provide means to produce a preliminary version of a movie without early significant investments but allowing viewing of the film to get an objective impression of the narrative and film-making quality and value.

A 2nd powerful functionÿ comes from the creation of a growing film-makers network connected into a community of co-workers sharing their expertise, experiences and assets on a market place.ÿ Indeed, any film-making experienceÿ is close to setting-up a small enterprise and an organisation of people for the duration of the production project.

The platform is useful in the early stages of a project life, when there is a need to convince investors the project is worth by showing them exciting video material. It is also useful ÿin later stages, when production has started but more simulation is required before next shooting steps. The platform belongs to the category of Storyboarding tools commonly used for animation productions. But the differenciation comes from its ability for creators not used to sophisticated computer assisted development to produce a real animation with ease and comfort within a co-working social network.

Video and film making activities for cinema or TV involve in France 15 K enterprises sharing a turnover ofÿ 11,000 M?. The volumes of production stay at a stable level despite the current economical crisis. If 2% of these productions would allocate 2% of their budget to better prepare their film-making on this platform, a 3M? yearly turnover could be expected in short term.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

1124,FICO115,FICO,FICO,Belgium,LYCHEE BVBA,ATENDI Questionnaire,"Diestsesteenweg, 250, 3010 Leuven, Belgium",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"ATENDI is the brandname for the ATENDI Carelist (AC) centralised waiting-list management platform for Long Term Care Facilities (LTCF) in Belgium.
ÿ
ATENDI Questionnaire (AQ),ÿthe subject of this application, embodies the development of a Long Term Care Facility (LTC) Resident Satisfaction Questionnaire.
ÿ

After initial waiting-list registrations via ATENDI Carelist, and follow-up permanent resident admission for the LTCF choosen, each resident and/or it's family or legal representative gets a six-month post-admission survey via the contact information available based on ATENDI Carelist record information.ÿ
ÿ
The quastionnaire collects data about:
ÿ
Physical well-being and health
Generalÿliving and quality of life
Integration and social activities
Organisation user orientedness
Participation and negotiated care
ÿ

The goal for this questionnaire is to establish an objective and quantifiable measure for quality indicators in Long Term Care Facilities in Belgium, making LTCF-quality more comparable and transparent based on user satisfaction scores.
ÿ
ATENDI Carelist and ANTENDI Questionnaire have multiple EU-states potential for future development and implementation. Although the primary focus goes towards Belgian LTCF.
ÿ

ATENDI Questionnaire, combined with modern web-based communication technologies, makes the growing business of LTCF within the EU more transparent and objective in terms of Quality of Living (QoL) and general (commercial) exploitation.ÿCombined with our current centralized ATENDI Carelist waiting-list management solution, ATENDI Questionnaire provides an excellent user oriented transparency opportunity for the institutional elderly care in Europe.

1128,FICO119,FICO,FICO,Portugal,"Media Corp, lda",OurCity,"Rua Arlindo Vicente, Lote 22, 6 Frente Direito, 3030-298  Coimbra, Portugal",Consumer other,B2C,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Today there is a gap between citizens and local governments.

It is very hard for citizens to participate and contribute by reporting problems in their neighborhoods and cities or to take part in political discussions that shape the future of the places they love.
This leads to disinterest and apathy for decisions that affect everyone?s life.
OurCity is a project that aims to empower citizens to connect to their neighborhoods and cities, making democracy real and relevant in an urban world.

The service will empower people to report problems at street level and to provide ideas for the improvement of the quality of life in cities. It will make it cheaper and more effective for local government institutions to be aware of problems and take proper actions, while increasing the citizens? feelings of shared ownership while connected and belonging to a group. Local governments will also be able to reply to their citizens and inform them about the status of each pending issue, providing a more transparent and better service to their citizens.

OurCity will also create political involvement among communities, stimulating civic participation and a co-decision process between local governments and citizens.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

1129,FICO120,FICO,FICO,Spain,Milton Factory SL,FIcAPPaCITY - Removing information access barriers,"Calle Fuente del Berro, 4, 4 - IZDA, 28009 Madrid, Spain",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"FIcAPPaCITY is focused on removing information access barriers for people with disabilities, so that they can achieve a better quality of life by increasing independence, personal safety and self-confidence.
ÿ

We gather data from different open data sources and sensors (mainly sensors related to smart territories technologies), and we transform it into valuable and accessible information for people with different kinds of disabilities.
ÿ
Two examples of what our technology will do:
ÿ

There is a fire and a deaf person, who is sleeping, get informed through his smartphone about a ?fire situation in less than 200 meters? from his/her location and that emergency vehicles are approaching to the area.

A blind person get informed through his smartphone (via audio message) about incidents in public streets, such as street works in a specific street, so that he/she can change his/her route avoiding that street.
ÿ
All this information (regarding emergencies and incidents in public streets) is already accessible through open data or information systems managed by Public Administrations.
ÿ

On the other hand, local, regional and national governments have a duty to enforce laws that guarantee the access to useful information to people with disabilities. Thanks to our services they will be able to improve the quality of life of citizens with disabilities without having to make large investments.
ÿ

In summary, FIcAPPaCITY is a project of high societal impact, since it is focused on ensuring access to information on equal terms to all citizens.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

With this App, boat owners, service providers, and marinas will be able to communicate and work together in a much easier and efficient way:

2. ÿ Boat owners will be able to safely scan or take a photo of all relevant official documents related to the boat, its owner, etc and send this information to the corresponding marinas, using this app.

3. ÿ All information, data and files included in any user account will be stored in Nautic Advisor?s cloud, accessible anywhere and from any device, but with local copies of data while sailing due to the lack of coverage, and synchronized when getting network coverage again.

4. ÿ In order to realize an automated check-in before arriving to a marina, it is necessary to have a protocol for the exchange of information between the marina and the boat. Therefore setting up a standard is a must for the European marinas willing to improve their service to customers.

1136,FICO127,FICO,FICO,Portugal,"Netmust, Lda.","HUGaCity, creating unique, interactive visiting experiences? and sharing your emotions!","Rua Sapal de Castro Marim, 12 - Verdizela, 2855-654 Corroios, Portugal",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"How well do cities know their visitors? This is one of the questions that HUGaCity answers, through a platform that brings visitors, tourists and cities closer. HUGaCity also creates unique, intelligent, interactive and ""gamified"" visiting experiences for visitors, at the same time that integrates a business intelligence SaaS platform that empowers the cities? entities (tourist information centres, museums, stores, local businesses, travel agencies, tour operators and others) to make better informed decisions, through the access to an integrated and intelligent dashboard with information about tourists? profiles and the way they interact with their facilities, equipment?s and economical ecosystem.

The available knowledge of travellers? profile by the city?s entities and also private local companies and organizations (Hospitality Industry, for example), is very limited. At the moment, the only information available is mostly provided through the Hotel Occupancy Rate and the Number of Landed Passengers by Airport/City of Origin of the Flight. But cities want to know travellers? habits, preferences and feedback, in order to increase the number of their visitors, stimulate local economy and culture, and raise their visibility and reputation. In resume, they want to know visitors behaviour in their cities. The aim of HUGaCity will be fulfil and eliminate this lack of knowledge, by incorporate a business intelligence platform that empowers city?s agents to make better informed decisions, through the access to an integrated and intelligent information dashboard, where it will collected and processed data about the travellers and the way they interact with the city?s facilities. For the users, the platform enables the creation of an intelligent mobile application which will incorporate all the city?s points of interest and attractions, allowing unique tailored experiences to each user and his/her travel partners.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

Nowadays, in Europe, 80% of elder people do not use new communication technologies (Smartphones, Tablets or computers). On the other hand, using new technologies is democratized for families. The only one who is not taking advantage of this network is your elderÿ! Neveo tends to improve intergenerational communication by proposing an innovative digital solution dedicated to elder people suffering from isolation and their family.

Neveo box connects elder people and their family by using communication channels, which are familiar to each of them: fixed phone lines and televisions for the elders, Smartphone or web for their families. Videophone calls, photos, videos exchanges or messages are becoming extremely easy to use for everybody!

Moreover TravelWhiz users can record and organize their memories and experiences by associating photos, sound and text with the place they visit. 1140,FICO131,FICO,FICO,Serbia,"COMPANY FOR PROVISION OF SERVICES, RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT NISSATECH INNOVATION CENTRE DOO",xEngage,"KajmakŸalanska 8, 18 000 Nis, Serbia. Switzerland",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"This proposal aims to revolutionize the way how small businesses are engaging customers, especially those who are physically active, by exploiting the advantages of combining real-time location based services and customer loyalty programs. The business idea is motivated by the drawback of traditional punch card, like ?buy 10, get one free? programs for small businesses and their need to introduce more incentive for customer loyalty. Our approach postulates on the idea of customer loyalty through engaging with a business/merchant in a more sustainable way than only with reward points for each purchase. It means that an engaged customer should be motivated to identify with the business in different, daily life, situations she/he is involved in. Consequently, the customer should be rewarded for all such activities, usually through some kind of discount coupons or reward points.

In order to achieve such an engagement we propose a mobile solution consisting of a) mobile app which represents a mobile loyalty card and serves as a sensor for collecting real-time data and a detector of situations where the customer can be engaged, b) server where all customer data is stored and processed through analytics module in order to update customers profiles and personalize services for engaging the customer and c) web portal for enabling merchant to configure and publish their offers (punchcards) and interact with customers in a more explicit way.

The main advantage of our approach is that the merchant can define different types of services and methods for engaging customers on its own, using simple interface.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

1141,FICO132,FICO,FICO,Denmark,Nordic IoT Cluster,Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)  Internet of Things (IoT),"Daltoften 74, 8600 Silkeborg, Denmark",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"The ADHD (Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder) IoT project is intended to design, produce and market a comprehensive product suit related to real-time diagnostics and treatment monitoring of ADHD patients, especially for children between the ages 4 and 18. The neuro-brain scanner equipment along with the mobile device and several data processing apps are building a unique eHeath diagnostics and monitoring equipment with high business potential. In the ADHD IoT project we will work primarily to optimize and enhance the available diagnostic tools and devices available in the market and combine them over the unique IOT platform that will meet special requirements for ADHD patients monitoring. Through the utilization of personalised connected media we will find the ideal treatment for the patients in a timely manner.ÿ

This disruptive business idea opens up new eHealth business opportunities, as the mobile neuro-diagnostics devices are just about to become commercialized.ÿ The EEG neuro-feedback sensors will utilize a magneto encephalography (MEG) solution in order to decrease the size and complexity of the sensors. The data from the sensors placed on the head is transmitted via a LilyPad Arduino radio, which is fully embedded into the FiWare infrastructure.ÿ

This project has a major societal impact especially on ADHD patients, with special focus on ADHD children and their accurate real-time monitoring and treatment over the unified ADHD IoT platform. 1150,FICO141,FICO,FICO,Germany,Parkplatz-gesucht UG (haftungsbeschr„nkt),parkpocket,"Tuttlingerstr. 82, 78628 Rottweil, Germany",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"We are parkpocket and we solve the parking problem in times of growing urbanization. Park search traffic accounts for up to 40% of general traffic in cities and majorly contributes to pollution. For drivers parking a car in urban areas is expensive, time-consuming and nerve-racking.
Parkpocket provides a solution for quick and easy parking in an urban environment and close to airports.
So how do we do it?

We combine a shared parking model with a mobile parking guidance system, allowing for real-time discounts to B2B and B2C customers. With our shared parking marketplace, we enable owners of private parking spots to rent out to car drivers, seeking for easy and fair-priced parking options. This use case is especially relevant to parking close to airports.

In inner cities convenience is the number one priority. We display vacant parking space in car parks through our mobile parking guidance system enabling users to navigate to a vacant car park via location-based- services on smartphones. The real-time data we use for our parking guidance system is based on open data that we obtain from cities and municipalities and integrate with different parsers in our system. This feature is unique and brings price transparency to the parking market for the first time. ?By using RFID technology in cooperation with car parks, cashless payment and direct access to car parks are possible. That allows us to offer a parking solution to B2B customers that dispose of a vehicle fleet. Providing all cars of a vehicle fleet with an RFID tag, we will drastically reduce accounting costs related to parking since all parking transactions will be automatically billed to one company credit card.ÿ
ÿ
ÿ

1154,FICO145,FICO,FICO,Spain,"PCP Informatica Soft y Consultoria, S.L.",Interactive Collaboration in Welfare and Security,"Ctra. de Nuevo Naharros a Calvarrasa s/n, 37181 Nuevo Naharros (Salamanca), Spain",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"We believe that one of the main needs of the local police is to be able to ask for reliable collaboration in real time.
ÿ

When a child or an elderly person has disappeared, it might be very useful to their immediate location to be able to send information to citizens who are nearby. If a theft occurs or something similar, police can get help to find the thief or the car absconded, by sending information to citizens who are nearby.ÿIt's very important to verify the reliability of the aid having good feedbacks. You need to have system simulations and an artificial intelligence system that interprets all the answers, both collected by tests and real situations answers.
ÿ

We also believe that other necessity, for local governments, is to have a system for sending alerts and information which can help us to avoid something inevitable, e.g. to be in a traffic jam (due to traffic cut), to know a water cut service for tomorrow and so on. There are many applications that give us different types of information: useful, interesting, overall. Thus, for example, most websites offer directories of local services, cultural agendas, municipal events, etc. But in many cases, there is so much information and we treat this information as advertising, discarding it. Our project does not handle this kind of information.
ÿ

Furthermore, this app allow citizens to inform local government with data, images or information which can help to improve quality of streets, roads and public space furniture. This information also must give added value (intelligent processing), e.g. receiving complaints always from the same device can be indicative of a person complaining about everything. However they typically are limited to visualization only. This leads to weak evaluations of the designs when people consider the looks only -- for example whether a new building or a part of the city would look nice. We shift the focus on functional aspects: how would the design actually work? Currently it often has to be imagined based on textual descriptions. We find that human cognitive capacity is easily too limited to really be able to review the functionality of a complex plan in the mind only. Therefore we plan to offer software tools to support it.
ÿ

Computer games show a rich variety of practical solutions of how functionality and activities can be added to 2D and 3D environments. Yet those complex simulated interactive environments are packaged in simple to use and easily comprehensible user experiences. We will adapt the best suitable approaches from games to real-world design processes and innovate new solutions for publishing designs with functionality.ÿÿAn employee can for example test his/her 10 most common work tasks and discover how the proposed movement routes and placement of tools etc. work for him in the proposed designÿ-- by actually doing those tasks in the virtual environment.

1157,FICO148,FICO,FICO,France,PredicSis,Personalized Sleep Coach - Well Being,"5 rue Louis de Broglie, 22300 Lannion, France",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Users buy more and more connected devices to track their lives with an objective to analyse their sport performances and other health-related habits. Today's solutions consist frequency of a single isolated device and a dedicated mobile/web application. The functionality of the latter is is almost exclusively limited to visualizations or to comparing the given user with an average from other users of a similar age, for example (e.g. ""you should walk a little more as an average 30 year old woman makes X steps a day"").

We find that when it comes to giving advice and coaching, especially in the area of health, the potential of intelligence that can be derived from connected devices is much higher than that. Our ambition is to create a system enabling users to receive suggestions regarding more serious health-related phenomena, like insomnia, migrenes, etc, which can be of a very personal nature.

Therefore, we propose a system that can be alimented with contextual data coming from any connected device, which performs automatic machine learning on the collected data, and which presents the results of the data analysis to the user. For this pilot project in the predictive analytics driven approach to health related coaching we chose the insomnia phenomenon as a primary use case. As a result we expect the application developed during the project to be able to empower users with messages like: ""your problems with sleep are frequently related to playing squash over half an hour in the evening, after a meeting-loaded day at work - you may take it under consideration for the today's game"".

Thus, in last decades, regulations concerning environmental noise exposure have been developed. For example, European regulation 2002/49/EC presented a methodology to estimate different sources of noise, as well as their impact, and corrective actions.
ÿ

The estimation of the daily equivalent level in order to assess the noise dose received by a person from all sources along a route would be a target for both the administration, in order to make a proper municipal planning and to evaluate their action plans, and citizens who daily care about the polluting factors around them.

Nowadays, the development of social networks encourages citizens? participation through these groups of action. These are an ?object of desire? of marketing agents, being very important the achievement of close clients to make offers adapted to their profiles.

Provide information about urban noise doses received by an individual according to the total dose and to the specific dose received from the different sources of the urban area.

Report of received doses by citizens to authorities, what will allow a better management of action plans to reduce pollution in a given urban area.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

Coop.,INternet Experience for privaTe mobile radio Users,"Via Re Tancredi, 8, Int. 8, 00162 Rome, Italy",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"The project aims to realize a new Internet experience for all the people and organizations that already use or are intended to use Digital Private Mobile Radio Networks (D-PMR) for work or hobby.

D-PMR networks represent the digital evolution of the analogical Push to Talk FM radio networks, still widely used in the world. D-PMR add advanced services to the voice service. These advanced services are being consolidated in the working habits of users. The main advanced services are: Group Calls, Individual Calls, Text Messages, Terminal Positions, Call Alert, Data for telemetry.

During the project will be developed a new Internet Service that, thanks to the deep integration with the D-PMR Network, will make possible for the internet users to be seamlessly connected with the D-PMR network using their smartphones. The innovative integration will enable a totally new kind of applications for all D-PMR users, as those involved into Civil Protection, Health Care, Emergency, Security as well as those involved in the management of public or private events, infrastructures or services, outdoor gaming.

Most of these users play a valuable activity for the daily life of each one of us. During of these activities an easy, immediate and effective use of any available communication means can make the difference between a good or bad service to the citizens or in the worst case between life and dead. The project aims to give to these users a way to better interact during mobility with the D-PMR network services, instruments to better understanding of the operational picture, the capability to maintain the radio contact with the D-PMR network in absence of D-PMR coverage or D-PMR portable terminals, a rapid and easy solution for interoperability during inter agency in field joined activities.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

1164,FICO155,FICO,FICO,Romania,Qualitance QBS SRL,Bubl,"Dr. Staicovici 2, Opera Center, 050558 Bucharest, Romania",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Bubl is a new online venture that mixes elements of social networking and location based services. Powered by an experienced management team of Web technology experts, Bubl?s key value propositions is a platform for facilitating high quality matches between people who share the same interests. Bubl will also offer a social context to various geo-locations, from a well known museum in a large city to a high-lands waterfall hidden in the mountain.
ÿ

Our idea is to develop an application that is meant to redesign how people share their experiences and how people perceive the surrounding reality. The basic function of Bubl is to display a news feed (wall) of posts (pictures, videos, text) based on the current location. These ?bubls? are posted ÿby other users, not necessarily friends. Unlike many competing social platforms, we make sure that updates are displayed only in the location where they were initially shared.
ÿ
Bubl lets users post updates on their current location. By default bubbles are visible to any nearby users within a 100 feet range. For each like the range is increased by 1 feet.
Users can share location based statuses to be seen by other people when they reach that location whether it?s on the street or indoor.
An advanced algorithm will decide what content is deliver for each user based on the location, age, gender, interests, keywords, timeframe
Users can geo-tag places of interest. Places will ve visible on the map in much wider area.
User have the ability to connect to each other and exchange real time private message.
User can manage their privacy and user profile.
ÿ

Blue symbolizes communication and promotes interaction. Our app name and concept is inspired from childhood. Nothing compares to the sweet simplicity of blowing soap bubbles for the very first time.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

G, 50002 Zaragoza, Spain",HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES,B2B,6,2,YES,IN,Rafael Espinosa de los Monteros Iglesias,"Reta Al Alzheimer S.L. is a company focused on 2 clear goals:ÿDelay of cognitive impairment and help of active ageing, focusing on Alzheimer?s in a first stage, but aiming to different dementias in the future.
ÿ

The reason for a service like this is that, with 44 million people diagnosed Alzheimer's in the world, 100 million people affected and pharmacological therapies not being reliable until many decades ahead, the focus must be on how to live with Alzheimer's today, and how to increase quality of life of both patients and their environment.
ÿ
The way of achieving these goals is through ÿAlzhUp, which is based on 4 key pillars:
1.- A scientifically validated pre-diagnosis tool, which main objective is to facilitate pre-diagnosis of Alzheimer's.

2.- A Personal Bank of Memories with the possibility of cataloguing memories through a patented algorithm, based on the Art of Memory, in a similar way our brain stores memories, making it a unique tool against other similar systems that can't use their content for helping in dementias due to its cataloguing methodology, similar to a computer, which is not valid for ÿour brain.

3.- NON pharmacologic therapies, scientifically validated (PACID therapy created by CRE Salamanca), covering 7 different cognitive areas) and completely customized to each patient thanks to the Personal Bank of Memories, allowing delay of Alzheimer's effects up to 3-5 years.
4.- Active Participation of the family based on a powerful gamification system, following and improving the white book for Alzheimer's gamification presented by University of Stamdford.
ÿ

AlzhUp is thought for families and professionals (specialized centers, occupational therapists, insurance companies) and is presented in a standard version of 60 ?/year, or a professional one for 15 ?/month. The service will be released worldwide in 2015.",Tech provider,,X,0,0,X,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,0,0,SME,0,alzhup.com

column2: An publicidad S.L.,"Multichannel, multi-content and user adjustable high performance Internet TV.","Street Ultramar, 2, business premises, 47006 Valladolid, Spain",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"1- Our project consists on the creation of an Internet TV channel with live broadcasts, together with a wide variety of contents to be chosen by the user (audiovisual library), as well as other channels, which will be exceptionally broadcast on pay-per-view (PPV) modality.

column1: 2- We want live broadcast to be controlled by the user, so that he can decide which of the broadcasting camera he would like to choose. This would make the user's experience much more personal.
3- Besides that, the user will be able to interact with multimedia contents which are linked to what he is making use of (data, other videos, biographies, etc.)

4- Access will be different for each user, since the system will store his likes based on his navigation and the time he spends on each content. This will generate a customized homepage for each user.

5- The system will detect the device where contents are being watched and the device's screen's resolution automatically. This will make the image and the device suitable for each other, as well as optimize the unnecessary downloading of data (example: It is not the same to download to a computer or smartphone connected to a WiFi net, than to a smartphone which is using it's own data download capacity)
6- Broadcast scheduling will also be real-time subtitled in the language chosen by the user.

7- Registered users will have the chance to take part in a social network, which spots the places and subjects of interest. This network will allow them to get in contact with places and people they share their likes with, taking in consideration geographical closeness among them. Geographical closeness will also be used to recommend trips and for places and people making the same journey (spots and people near the places the user has gone to)

8- The user will be able to create his own play-list based on his preferences. The user could either choose what to show on this list himself, or let the system do it automatically by taking in account the user's access to the contents.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

1169,FICO160,FICO,FICO,Finland,Sanoste Oy,Novel virtual services for elderly with memory disorders,"Mariantie 15, 02700 Kauniainen, Finland",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Memory disorders are considered the major chronic healthcare challenge of the 21st century, leading to significant societal and financial impacts. Our aim is to provide innovative and cost-effective virtual services for home-dwelling elderly with memory disorders to enable them to live longer in their own homes.
ÿ

In this project our highly professional team, with over 20 years of experience in user-driven services, design, medical science, technology and business, aims to develop virtual rehabilitation consisting of interactive physical and mental training and virtual homecare supported by a nurse who makes virtual assessments, reminders of medication and gives support in daily routines.
ÿ
Both our services and our user-interfaces are co-created together with the end-users to give an extensive attention to their needs and wishes.
ÿ
The services are integrated to a video technology platform which is already available.
ÿ
In developing our services we are using the following FIWARE enablers: Object Storage and BigData Analysis.
ÿ

With physical training the elderly with memory disorders are shown to have longer stay at home, increased functional capacity, improved feeling of security, and decreased feeling of loneliness. We believe that most of this training can be delivered also with virtual technology.
ÿ
The elderly will benefit from active training, frequent contacts, social networks, and peer support.
The homecare providers will have an increased range of existing services and improved cost-effectiveness as some of the visits can be transferred to virtual visits.
The family members will benefit from easier contacts and increased security of their loved ones.
The society will benefit from decreased costs.
ÿ
Before the final launch, a randomized controlled trial will be organized to proof the cost-effectiveness of our services.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

More specifically, the defined end-user product (called the ""Citizen product"") will take care of families and their belongings residing in the city by monitoring their movement patterns via their satellite position.
ÿ
Overall, StickySolutions consist of Stickydots (very compact, low-power, long-lasting, low-cost position trackers) and dedicated applications (mobile and web Apps) for location-based interactions.
ÿ

On top, StickySolutions offers a business model where local city partners are integrated to kickstart the local market of IoT enabled smart city applications and services, by providing local IoT ecosystems based on open-standards and open-data.ÿ StickySolutions is a ?seed? for strong IoT smart city ecosystem growth where local partners, companies, municipalities and citizens are empowered to take part in the ecosystem.

Finally, StickySolutions makes use of the Complex Event Processing, Publish/Subscribe Context Broker and POI Proxy enablers, which allow faster development of the StickySolutions backend and an enrichment of the Citizen product.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

column1: ÿ

In SensoWave we have developed an eHealth product that monitors and tracks the condition of these patients based on the information extracted from different sensors deployed in the patient?s home such as presence sensors, door/window sensors, smoke/gas leakage sensors, water leakage sensors, etc.
column2: sensors available in smartphones and even other wearables like smart bands. 1173,FICO164,FICO,FICO,Spain,"Sharing Academy, Sociedad Limitada",Sharing Academy,"c/ Almog?vers 165, 08018 Barcelona, Spain",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Sharing Academy is a peer-to-peer marketplace where university students share their knowledge and learn from their colleagues with private classes.
ÿ

Nowadays, university students only have a few options if they need extra help in a particular subject: they can attend review classes, go to an academy to get academic support or ask family and friends for help.
ÿ

After an extensive study with university students, we at Sharing Academy, concluded that the best tutor for a specific subject is the student who successfully completed that subject. Every student has that subject that he is perfect at
column2: itïs a shame that all this knowledge vanishes once he completes the course. At Sharing Academy, we want that student to share his knowledge with his colleagues, while making some money in exchange.

column1: ÿ

Therefore, anyone with teaching, tutoring, or instructing experience can become a tutor as far as they are currently enrolled in, or have graduated from the same college subject they want to teach.ÿThis benefits all the community members involved. On one hand, students that need help with a particular subject can find specific resources on that subject, which will be taught by another colleague who passed that subject within the same school. On the other hand, good students can make extra money teaching subjects they are passionate about, and become even better students during the process.

The positive effects of this connection are numerous: not only do students in need of help become better students, but it encourages studying at all levels, as good students compete to offer the best class. Classmates who never met before create powerful bonds with their peers. And most importantly, sharing knowledge is the key to success for those students that will later become professionals.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

1179,FICO170,FICO,FICO,Ireland,Sneaky Vegetables Ltd,ShowMaker,"Crane Street, NDRC, Digital Exchange Building, 8 Dublin, Ireland",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Our proposed platform is called ShowMaker and it is a creative, educational tool within a game environment. ShowMaker allows players to collaboratively create their own shows and presentations using mixed digital media. Players can invite collaborators to join a project and create a video that could be used to present a school project or for future TV producers to make their own shows. The players can create their own graphics or choose them from the ShowMaker library. ShowMaker gives the gamer generation an opportunity to share their own content among their community.
ÿ

Technology has been a difficult sell in education. IT has been successful in business because it generally aims to automate work processes. Globally, however, educators do not want to automate education in this way. As such, Ed-Tech that has proven successful in schools has tended to automate administration, rather than educational material, leaving smaller addressable markets open to content creators. ShowMaker hands the production of educational content over to children in the style of a game editor, using a model based on the modding (popular in the games industry).
ÿ

Educators may also choose ShowMaker as a classroom tool. Given the gamer generation's expectations on how they receive and disseminate information, current classroom methods do not meet these needs. ShowMaker provides a secure platform for teachers to set a project via a game environment while having the control to monitor partcipants and their activities. Progress reports are sent to the educator/parent via email at two junctures: when a new player accepts an invitation and on completion of a project.
ShowMaker will bridge the gap between the gamer generation and their educators, between games and lessons.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

1187,FICO178,FICO,FICO,France,Digitemis,Digidiag,"Centre d'Affaires La Noue, 85140 La Merlati?re, France",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Digidiag is a web platform which aim is to both educate and diagnose the maturity of employees on IT security within their company. This outreach solution is designed to meet the organizational needs of all sizes in all industries.

Several studies clearly proved that the human factor is the cause of the majority of security IT systems incidents within companies. It is therefore necessary, often mandatory depending on organisation and market, to qualitatively analyze the sensitivity of the staff on the security of the IT system, and give the employees a good training to lead them to responsible behaviors. The management also expects a graduated overview of the maturity of an organisation.

The first stage of the project will be to know the status of each employee regarding IT security. We will measure their awareness through a complete and innovative diagnosis system, based on questions that are directly linked to their work activity. This measurement will be made over three axes: sensitivity, knowledge and behavior. The level of awareness in terms of maturity is evaluated thanks to various themes such as logical access, good practices, legal aspect, e-mail, critical data, customer data, computing and liberties, internet, mobility, multi-function printers.

During the second stage of Digidiag, every employee will receive a targeted digital training. The initial diagnosis will indeed bring to light the various points that are not mastered enough by the employee. This aspect of training is completely innovative, since each employee will be trained on some specific points, which are a function of his/her maturity on IT security.

Finally, a diagnosis of acquired validation will be made to verify the aggregation of all the data learned during the training, and giving final recommendations for the company and each employee.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

However, a parking control system requires a finer-grain accuracy with respect to the one provided by GPS-based positioning, especially in urban areas. Such accuracy is obtained by means of augmented satellite-based technologies for improving GPS positioning.

1200,FICO191,FICO,FICO,Germany,Symonics GmbH,A Socia Media Platform for Musicians supporting Distributed Ensemble Performances,"Sand 13, 72076 Tbingen, Germany",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"If musicians want to play together, they need to be in close proximity
column2: otherwise they cannot keep in time. If they sit apart from each other more than eight meters, the acoustic one-way-delay is more than 23 ms. As a result, one musician hears a note from his musical colleague while the fellow musician already plays the next.

column1: ÿ

We have developed an optimised high-speed phone for musicians which we call Musicbox. It is fast enough to transmit music over the Internet at best CD quality with a delay overhead of only a few milliseconds. If musicians have a typical broadband Internet connection with a round-trip Internet ping time below 30 ms between them, they can already jam together.
ÿ

Within this project, we will use FiWare enablers to set up a web based social platform for musicians which will help them to find a nearby playfellow and to connect the Musicboxes to each other, even if they are behind firewalls and NAT routers.
ÿ

Our business model is straight forward. We aim to sell the Musicbox hardware to musicians and people who learn an instrument. In addition, we expect advertisement revenues from the Musicbox social media platform.
ÿ

Our solutions help to connect musicians across Europe who want to jam with their friends without having to go to the rehearsal room or who are just looking for a new fellow musician. It is also good for young musicians who, during their practise, want to get feedback from their teachers.

1224,FICO215,FICO,FICO,Spain,Videona Socialmedia S.L.,Videona,"C\ Maria Blanchard 2, portal 7 bajo d, 28232 Las Rozas de Madrid, Spain",Consumer leisure/gaming,B2C,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,0,"The number of smartphone users worldwide will be about 1.91 billion in 2015 a figure that will increase another 12.6% to near

profiles or friends in the Videona social network to share in real time, videos they have recorded and edited (semi- or
automatically) with their smartphones through the advanced video features of Videona that you can?t find in other apps such as
users editing the same video or even use certain parts of that to create a new one turning to be coeditors. The app is mainly
addressed to digital natives

with functionalities to add filters in real-time, flexible use of functions such as flash and front camera, and a basic media editor,
that allow music addition to improve the quality of the video and share in that exact moment without loosing the momentum with
their smartphones.  In the future any user will have the possibility to edit videos from other users or use some parts of them to
make another one. Like this, they turn to be co-editors. In Videona the property of the videos is done through CC licenses. This
makes the authors the only ones to decide where, how or when others can use their videos.

1228,FICO219,FICO,FICO,France,Vox inzebox S.A.,Veni Vidi Visit,"37 rue Guibal, Pole media de la Belle de Mai, 13003 Marseille, France",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"The international sales platform of the guided tours.
ÿ
What?

ViViVi is a marketplace for customized tours hosted by locals. It aims to connect travellers with hosts in cities worldwide. Travellers can choose from existing options or propose different ones. Local guides offer tours, manage schedules and promote themselves.
ÿ
Why?

Travellers currently have three options for exploring new places: following the herd in a lame group tour, hiring an expensive private guide, or taking the time-consuming risk of planning a tour themselves.
ÿ
We want to create a simple way for travellers to connect with hosts who can provide authentic, affordable and fun local experiences.
ÿ
Local guides do not have the marketing skills and power to promote themselves on a global level, especially when it is an after work activity to earn a bit of extra money.
ÿ
ÿ
Who?
ÿ
Travellers, local guides at the initial stage
ÿ
Tourist offices, event organisers, tour guide agencies, conference organisers in a second stage
ÿ
Where?
ÿ
3 countries (France, Spain, Italy) at first and then all countries offering world heritage and cultural tours.
ÿ
When?
ÿ
To be launched in the first quarter of 2016.
ÿ
How?
ÿ
4 main technical assets to be developed:
A web site enabling travellers to view available tours: duration, cost, reviews of local guides, schedules, communication interface
A mobile application offering the same services as the web site, plus geolocalization
A ?public? back office where local guides can propose tours, manage their costs and their schedules as well as promote themselves.
A ?company? back office enabling us to manage all the relevant activities.
ÿ
How much?
ÿ

Phocuswrightÿestimates that US travellers spend over $26 billion per year on tours and activities. With the addition of European and Asian travellers, the global figure is therefore higher. Setting these figures against people that use mobile technologies when travelling leaves enough room for a real market to be addressed.
ÿ
Our differentiation?
ÿ

We already own a database of 4,500 audioguided multilingual tours around the world (www.zevisit.com), which can be offered as an alternative to local guides. Hence, the platform will offer real content from the very first day.

The Serapix platform consists of three components, the Serapix-App, the Serapix Hub as well as the Serapix cloud service. The Serapix Hub provides the app back-end as a stand-alone service within the local network of an event location or a company?s intranet. 1231,FICO222,FICO,FICO,Poland,WBB Centrum Wojciech Gogol,PotHolesBeGone,"Brzozowa , 8, 55-200 Bystrzyca, Poland",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Project ? a platform for reporting potholes and other hazards, using a mobile application accompanied by a thematic vortal and social network for the reviewing, managing, discussing, and presenting of pothole status and severity as color-coded regions on maps (heat-map).

We are all road users, if not car drivers then at least cyclists or pedestrians, riding or walking along or across streets. It is therefore in our best interest that these roads and sidewalks are kept safe and comfortable.
The reality, however, is that the urban infrastructure ages and deteriorates fast.
By neglecting repairs or failing to carry them out properly, roads quickly turn into hole-ridden traps. A key factor to properly repairing or servicing roads is response time
column2: repairs carried out at an early stadium (as soon as the defect surfaces) can be even 5 times less expensive than those typically delayed for 30-60 days. It is also imperative to use the latest technologies which enable quick, effective and lasting road repair at relatively low cost.

column1: Our intention is to create a platform where road users may expose and report potholes on a massive scale to road administrators and the authorities responsible for their repair. At the same time, accumulating large amounts of reliable data about potholes will enable the authorities to manage the problem thanks to our workflow solution. By making this information public, we will put social pressure on the decision-makers to take considerably more effective approach to road repairs. The platform will furthermore enable the community of road users to instantly file claims against administrators for compensation and restitution due to damages or injuries caused by potholes. This step-by-step process will significantly ease the frustration of all the parties involved.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

column1: 1234,FICO225,FICO,FICO,France,Wi6Labs,City's Building Optimization,"10 rue de Jouanet,,  E-Park, ,  35700 Rennes , France",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"Cities, local authorities obtain less and less fund from french state (-12,7M? until 2017). In the meanwhile, the energy consumption and the bill increase from year to yearÿ (respectively of 5% and 8% in 2012 - 2013). In this very difficult situation, local authorities can only invest in energy saving program with good ROI.
ÿ

City's Building Optimization project aims at offering a general service of optimization of public buildings such as schools, gyms rooms, polyvalent rooms, hall centers and so on. The principle consists in starting a brief diagnostic of what is worth to be optimized among several items such as goods and persons security, predictive maintenance (e.g. detecting broken bulb), power consumption (heat, light...), environment (air pollution...).
ÿ

Then an appropriate wireless sensor network (WSN) is deployed to supervise objects identified as relevant to be monitored during the diagnostic. Not only the WSN is able to remotely monitor the relevant objects but it is also able to trigger actuators to command those objects (e.g. turn off heating or light). Public authorities in charge of the building are able to remotely monitor or actuate the objects through a cloud based solution.
The customer benefits are cost savings, security of goods and persons and more comfort offered to citizens.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

1236,FICO227,FICO,FICO,France,Wildmoka,Multiscreen Video Clipping,"1047 route des Dolines, Business Pole, 06560 Valbonne Sophia Antipolis, France",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"The Internet and television worlds are merging, which triggers massive disruptions in video consumption and TV watching in particular. Users are pushing for more connection between their devices and their usages. Among them, a vast majority of users is mobile multi-tasking while watching TV. The interaction between users during live shows on social networks is growing rapidly. In addition, these disruptions are also brought by changes in the market. The TV advertising business is in crisis, content monetization experiences a great step back, and new online players destabilize the well-established market chain. The goal of this project is to build a solution to address those challenges and to propose a new business model and monetization source. Concretely, the project aims at creating software as a service (SaaS), which offers an end-to-end multiscreen video clipping solution for image rights owners, such as TV channels or operators. This SaaS solution provides an extensive tool, with which the end user can easily share, from his first or second screen, any moment he just saw on TV on social networks, mainly on Facebook and Twitter. To be able to offer such a solution, many technological components are necessary. Wildmoka possesses a part of these components, others will be retrieved from the FI-Content and the FI Ware catalogues, and the remaining will be developed during the project. The goal is to provide a video-clipping feature compatible with the various terminals, which allows a simple and easy use case. The success of the solution depends also on the quality of the user experience.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

1238,FICO229,FICO,FICO,The Netherlands,XS2China BV,CityKickStart,"Wilgenweg 16B, 1031 HV Amsterdam, Netherlands",0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,0,"People who travel for business have in general limited time. Since work related activities take most of their time, business travellers have limited spare time to spend in a city. They also don?t put much effort in preparing their trip by selecting hot-spots and sightseeing locations.
ÿ

But when they can spend time, it is important that it is exactly what they are looking for. On what sources can they on to get the right information? Travel websites/blogs? Foursquare/Yelp? Google Maps? Tripadvisor? Or one of the many city guides that is available in the App Store? All these sources provide (a lot of) generic information and don?t focus on the specific individual needs of business travellers. All in all, finding information is not easy and takes time. ÿ
ÿ

CityKickStart is different than all other sources and services that are currently available. CityKickStart is a mobile service that will provide instant, relevant and personalised advice targeted to business travellers. It takes the travel behavior and needs of a business traveller with a specific time frame for visiting as starting point and matches this opportunity with his personal interests based on smart profiling.
ÿ

By offering curated information in combination with open source data, it will instantly provide the business traveller a limited and high quality selection of suggestions and advice how to best spend their time in a different city. By learning from the user?s behaviour, we are able to provide even better advice. CityKickStart?s advice has the quality of a personal advisor due to the curated content, and will have the personal fit with the wishes of business traveller by using smart profiling technologies and city data gathering.",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

1240,FICO231,FICO,FICO,Belgium,JAJA  BVBA,ZEBRA,"Drie Linden 14, 1831 Diegem, Belgium",HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES,B2B,4,1,YES,IN,Helio Fernandez,"Our goal is to develop an open medical communication platform for pre- to post-hospital treatment, by implementing real item audio-video interaction between medical personnel and patients with real time access to device and medical data. Our team developed a pre-hospital (ambulance) telemedicine device that can deliver real time bidirectional audio-video between a patient in a moving ambulance and a physician at any remote location. The device also realizes live and automated transfer of vital parameters integrated with a tailor made acute stroke decision support software. The goal of this telemedicine device is to speed up the diagnosis of acute stroke patients, increasing patient outcome and reducing costs, both for hospitals and society. We successfully progressed a clinical feasibility study with results published in international peer-reviewed journals. Currently we are starting a longer randomized trial on outcome and time savings related towars the solution we are now commercialising. Currently we are closing our first commercial sale of the solution to a Belgian Hospital. The goal of the fiware project is to integrate this solution in a wider audio-video-data network: Interoperable platform for Remote monitoringÿ Integrated e-Solutions (Zebra). Our solution will allow transfering of real time audio-video and medical data in a legal compliant manner. is that the organizations and business units spend money always to the connected people.
As a consequence, the lack of a permanent, continuous supply of source selective noise information makes the refreshment of
strategic noise maps ? available in all large cities in the EU ? difficult. Even if refreshment is delivered through automated
monitoring systems, the result is uncertain especially in densely populated urban spaces. Cities are dynamic, quickly changing
environment, which makes a strategic noise maps quickly outdated and useless.
ReSoNo is a concept for an automated audio event recognition system that aims to complement conventional automated noise
monitoring systems with information about individual noise sources. Source information would enable the separation of the
measured noise level into source selective components, which can be used for monitoring specific sources in urban spaces and
refreshing strategic noise maps in real-time.
