2145,FINO239,FINO,FINODEX,Greece,Ergobyte Informatics S.A.,CropDiagnosis,,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,4,13,YES,IN,George Nikolaidis,"Pest management in agriculture is a topic of high economic and environmental importance. Errors in selection and application of chemicals to treat cultivation problems lead to crop losses, soil loading and increased expenses. CropDiagnosis is a mobile application that will improve pest management decisions by making crop diagnosis more accurate, selection of indicated chemical error-free and application assisted by personalised instructions.

By evaluating the crop's details (type, location, soil, history, etc) and threat?s characteristics (type, appearance, progress, etc), as entered by the user through a smart questionnaire, the app suggests the most likely diagnosis. The user then is shown images of possible threats and given the opportunity to refine his answers. After diagnosing the problem, the system presents a filtered list of matching products (chemicals) that can mitigate it, according to the indications for use as provided by their manufacturers. With a given product selected by the user, the application proceeds with the presentation of detailed and personalised application instructions, after taking into account the crop's characteristics.

As a result, farmers and agriculturists can prevent errors that cost both time and money and maximize farm?s productivity. Moreover, they are no longer be exposed to chemicals for no reason and protect the environment.",Service provider,0,0,0,X,0,0,0,Software,0,#N/A,#N/A,2,X,0,SME,0,ergobyte.gr

2146,FINO240,FINO,FINODEX,Spain,Bipsin,MentalCheck,,HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES,B2B,3,4,YES,IN,Mercedes Mart¡nez Jauand,"MentalCheck is a web and mobile based platform to design the behaviour recording during and after mental health and behavioural treatments by using mobile devices. MentalCheck will provide to professionals a catalogue of templates for the recording of a diversity of mental health disorders and symptoms designed by experts according to the scientific evidence. MentalCheck will also offer the customers the possibility to personalized and create their specific templates, to generate reports on the patients evolution and export the data for its statistical analysis. This approach provide advantages to researchers and clinicians, since real-time assessments minimize the retrospective bias, can reveal dynamic processes, enhance the adherence to the treatment and the generalizability of results, and helps to prevent relapses. Moreover, MentalCheck consists of a multi-modal tool which can integrate psychological and physiological data, identifies situations - or the relation of symptoms in a specific context- and will provide interactive feedback in real time. Combining different technologies, FI-WARE Generic and Specific enablers will be implemented to ensure the security and data protection, and content specific APIs will increase the usability of the interface and create a network of professionals and institutions. Finally, Open Data will be used in the system to provide relevant drug information and to assess and compare the quality of mental health services. MentalCheck project follows the Lean Startup Methodology and its commercialization will be based on a freemium model.  ",Service provider,0,0,0,X,0,0,0,Software,0,#N/A,#N/A,2,X,0,SME,0,0

2151,Spee1,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Datenfreunde UG (haftungsbeschr?Ïnkt) ,DATA FLOW,Klementstr. 8 ,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,5,3,YES,OUT,Carl Ziegner ,"Open Data needs to become Real-Time -
DATAFLOW adds stream / event publishing to discontinuous open and closed data sources
* Building on the Open Data / Open Government movement
* providing Data Stream / Data Event publishing capabilities to Open Data portals
* Enabling Data Stream publishing as a revenue source for businesses
* Adding analysis / visualization services on top of the published data.

Thanks to the Open Government / Open Data movements, administrations in many jurisdictions are publishing their data for citizens and companies to use. This is laudable - however, itƒ??s not as useful as it could be. Publishing documents or datasets makes their reuse cumbersome and hard to organize. Transforming those data sources into a continuous streaming data service that can be ingested, processed, visualized  and acted upon continuously will add value to those datasets. Anonymization and billing services will enable us to take this approach to the world of closed data, where companies will want to monetize some derivation of the data they produce internally. Analysis and visualization services can be built upon those data streams for less sophisticated SME customers. 2153,Spee3,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Datenfreunde UG (haftungsbeschr?Ïnkt) ,ROBOREPORT,Keplerstr. 18 ,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,4,5,YES,OUT,Martin Virtel ,"The amount of structured and semi-structured data is continuously increasing. Open Data initiatives by public authorities and commercial APIs massively simplify the automated exchange of information. Yet in journalism most data is still analysed, interpreted and published by hand. With RoboReport we aim to turn large data sets into building blocks and ƒ?? where possible ƒ?? visualisations that convey relevant, hyper-local and hyper-topical information to their readers.

Many data points are relevant to the end user, but the information is so basic that no human can expect to be paid to turn them from a row in a database into a news article. Examples of this are traffic information on the way to work, petrol prices, environmental data (e.g. air quality), real-time public transport data, available parking spots ƒ?? many more such scenarios are likely candidates, especially in a ƒ??Smart Cityƒ? context.

Information must be pushed to or pulled by the user ƒ?? either she receives an automated notification (e.g. when some value exceeds a threshold) or she actively seeks the information. This is where we want to create opportunities to inform people via the most convenient device at a certain time and place and in any given context. A ƒ??smart homeƒ? for instance could send a notification to all inhabitants when it detects that nobody is home and some windows have been left open while a thunderstorm with strong winds has been forecast to hit the area ƒ?? or that the air quality has sunk below a certain threshold. One person could be notified by email, another via text message and a third via an audio message read out by her car ƒ?? all based on their individual usage profile.

Both players are forging alliances with building automation devices and networks, and establishing standards that will define the whole field for years to come. These players aim at developing and capturing the market - we want to ride on that wave and offer analysis and visualization of the data gathered by all these sensors. So, the Internet of Things becomes visible, analizable - and ultimately a source for decision-making by both private homeowners and professional real estate management firms and real estate owners.
No vendor-lock-in

As a first step, we will test the available hardware for Standards compliance and create own APIs or API adaptors that enable us to manage and store data from all available sources on on one platform. A pilot installation will help us get a first grip on analysis and visualization of data from heterogeneous sources.
Europe Privacy (tm)
Current solutions are provided by US companies.  We will collect and process all available data in european data centers, providing customers with safeguards against snooping.
B2B Focus

We will target small and medium real-estate management firms, in contrast to the solutions currently available which target consumer or prosumer audiences. Our focus is on real estate management companies and building owners.
Data Provider

Aggregated, anonymized data from our customers will be made available in real time or on a regular report basis as a product for further analysis, by architects, city planners, utilities or even economists or social scientists. 2155,Spee5,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Smart energy management with the IoT,smIoT,Freudenthalstr. 18 ,"Consumer energy & home automation, ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND AIR CONDITIONING SUPPLY",B2B/B2C,2,0,YES,IN,Angelo Wyszengrad ,"Domestic energy saving still is a huge opportunity for the reduction of carbon emissions: A one percent cutback in electricity consumption of German households would mean 75.000 tons less CO2 per year.  Unfortunately, most consumers do not know about the details of their energy consumption and the difference they could make by changing their day-to-day behaviour. Our goal is to change that by developing an affordable, internet-connected device and a web application which gives end users insight into and advice about their energy consumption.

Recent developments in hardware allow us to build a solution that is independent from a base station, has fewer components than existing devices and uses the ubiquitous 802.11n protocol, thus being significantly cheaper and easier to set up than what is available now.

The product consists of an internet-connected electricity meter socket (ƒ??smart meter socketƒ?) for monitoring, a web platform and API for analysis and management. In contrast to traditional meters or common smart meters, one device monitors the consumption of single electricity consumer rather than the whole household.

For the scope of this project we focus on the development, production and distribution of pilot production run of 400 devices plus the corresponding web application.  ",Tech provider,,0,0,X,X,X,,Hardware,Consumer application,#N/A,#N/A,1,X,#N/A,Other,50000,swocket.de

2157,Spee7,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,firstCarity,1stCA,Tresckowstr. 62 ,"Consumer health/wellness, HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES",B2B/B2C,5,0,YES,IN,Karin Steinhage ,"firstCarity - Fast and easy daily help for seniro citizens

Demographic change is posing Europe important challenges. Ageing populations mean that there are more and more people in need of care and assistance, while the number of persons willing or able to deliver such care within the family is stagnating and dropping. Nursing homes and official care services are already unable to meet this growing need, given that most elderly people in need of care prefer to remain in their own home. It is for this reason (and also because care homes are expensive) that the number of people with relatives in need of care is increasing, often resulting in a clash between professional, family-related and care commitments. The market offers day-to-day assistance (as a complement rather than a replacement), designed to afford elderly people assistance in their day-to-day lives and/or provide relief for their relatives. However, if the need for such day-to-day assistance is unexpected or urgent, it is hard to find, as the market focuses mainly on the engaging of carers for long-term placements. A person in need of help currently needs to spend a long time searching through various competing websites in order to find a care assistant.
firstCarity uses digital FIWARE technology to provide a smart, scalable, future-proof solution to this problem:

- firstCarity is an internet platform combined with mobile applications that senior citizens or their family- members can use to obtain fast and easy access to day-to-day assistance from local sources.
- firstCarity does not provide mere care staff, but rather dedicated, professional and private assistants trained to work in a home environment.
- as a one-stop meta-platform, firstCarity offers fast and easy access to all help offers in a region, which are available within the shortest time frame at one glance.
- firstCarity will be designed from the outset as a multilingual, supra-regional and scalable initiative.
",Service provider,,0,0,X,0,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,www.firstcarity.de,Other,50000,firstcarity.de

2159,Spee9,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Datamantics,4Sight4Cities,Himmelsmoor 25B ,PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND DEFENCE
column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY,0,3-5,0,NO,0,Robin Prosch ,"What are desirable future scenarios in an smart urban area ? What would be a disastrous future scenario to avoid ? How will these scenarios evolve through time when more and more complex data becomes accessible? How can a city be constantly made aware of developments in science or society or technology breakthroughs so that competitive advantages can be taken adjusting city development planning, securing and increase prosperity ?

column1: Being a Smart City entails more than optimizing the flow of data within a city, it also requires a city to foresee & shape development itself in the most intelligent manner possible.

4Sight4Cities will enable metropolitan mayors, city planners and other stakeholders to become aware of the future through scanning new occurrences of data/information that potentially will impact the development of a city. These occurrences, or FUTURE-SIGNALS, can be surfaced and evaluated to identify potential city opportunities and warnings. Collaborative features aim at the integration of subject matter experts and citizens.

Our Datamantics algorithms will assist with the handling and growing complexity of relevant information from structured quantitative sources and semantic unstructured sources, separating ""noise"" from ""signal. They help to crunch, log, analyze, extrapolate and connect data, which than can be used to simulate and match diversified chain-of-events-scenarios.

These pictures of the future embrace uncertainty and help to navigate through the known and unknown dangers and advantages of a wider range of paths, to shape common objectives, guiding principals and values for the SMART CITY of tomorrow!

(This proposal in based on research work published in an european journal by one of the co-founders, combined with latest available data analysis advancements in machine learning and artificial intelligence. It will be created using user centric design principles right from the start and will leverage significant portions of the FiWare GE's.) column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES",B2B/B2C,4,1,YES,OUT,Michael Zoelzer ,"Abutter ƒ?? synonym for neighbour ƒ?? ensures that customers never miss a parcel delivery to their private address anymore. The system combines online shoppers, who want their delivery as fast as possible but are out for work and not at home, and their neighbours who are at home (e.g. for parental leave, as senior citizen or in home office). The nearby available neighbour is found by utilization of satellite-based local allocation. The election can be done prior to shipment, i.e. during checkout at an online store, or even in real-time while delivery from the depot to home. Besides abutter, the online shoppers (get their delivery right away), the neighbours (get rewarded for receiving the parcels), the parcel services (are able to deliver on first try) and online merchants (rely on timely delivery) will benefit. Even drones are supported because the neighbours are able to open the door to collect the delivery from them. 2162,Spee12,Spee,SpeedUp,Italy,Teamdev srl ,Agricolous,Via Tiberina 70   ,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,16,7,YES,IN,Andrea  Cruciani ,"Our world is getting largerƒ?? and hungrierƒ?? with every tick of the clock. Each second, the worldƒ??s population grows by nearly 3 more people, that is 240,000 people a day. By 2025, the global population will reach 8 billion people and 9.6 billion by 2050. This means there will be an extra billion mouths to feed within the next 12 years. And within one generation, there will be more people additionally on the planet than there were at the beginning of the 20th century. Feeding the growing world population poses an unprecedented challenge to human ingenuity. Even in the best of circumstances, sustainably satisfying this hugely increased demand for crops and livestock will be an enormous task. By 2050, food production must increase by 70% to keep pace.

European Agriculture needs to become more productive and at the same time to meet environmental goals. Reconciling food production and environmental goals can be achieved through the adoption of appropriate technologies. Frequently farm entrepreneurs do not have the right information at the right time in order to manage efficiently both their farm production and the phytosanitary (pesticide and fertilizers) treatments needed for the health plants. Moreover very often the information related to sow /harvest /treatments are not interconnected with the pesticide and fertilizers storage and are used only for administrative scopes. Agricolous project aim at address these problems by providing a novel precision agriculture solutions integrated into FI-WAARE technology enabling farmer to both produce ƒ??more with lessƒ? improving and reduce agricultureƒ??s environmental footprint.

2165,Spee15,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Bat Sharing,Bat Sharing,Kattegatstr. 12 ,Consumer transport & logistics,B2C,3,1,YES,IN,Emiliano Saurin ,"Bat Sharing is a free iOS and Android app (also Wearable) released last February 2014 by Emiliano Saurin and Serena Schimd.

Self developed and self funded, Bat Sharing strives to simplify the usability of the wide number of car sharing services arriving in Italywhile also promoting the use of this great service.The app is currently applicable in 3 cities in Italy(Milan, Rome and Florence), but soon other european cities will be supported.

Why Bat Sharing? Each car sharing service either has a personal mobile app or no mobile app at all. The experience is then fragmented and the user is forced to switch from one app to another. We provide an unique experience. Bat Sharing brings together all of the services to one place and has additional features not available on the provider apps.

The app is easily downloadable from the App store. There is no registration: all you need is to subscribe to the car-sharing services. Once you enter the Bat Sharing app, it will automatically show your position and the closest cars. You can plug in your departure and Bat Sharing will present you with various options based on your current location, allowing you to compare them by duration and price, all in real-time.
No more waste of time checking the dozen different apps!

Supported services: car2go, enjoy by Eni, Twist, Uber, GuidaMi, BikeMi, e-vai, Eq Sharing, Open Wifi, Roma Sharing, Firenze Sharing.  ",Service provider,X,0,0,X,0,0,,Software,Consumer application,#N/A,#N/A,1,X,www.batsharing.com,Other,50000,batsharing.com

column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY",B2B/B2C,5,1,YES,IN,Johannes Weber ,"A preceding research project of the Hamburg University of Technology (TUHH) had the goal to develop an environmental measurement device that can be used for on-site analysis of contaminated soil. The outcome in 2013 was a lightweight, handheld and battery operated analytical device for detecting volatile organic compounds (VOC) in gases. The device makes use of a chromatography multi-capillary and a photoionization detector (sensor).

column1: The device is an innovation awarded several times
column2: for example by winning the 2014 INNOTECH business plan competition. In November 2014 the startup bentekk GmbH was incorporated by the two TUHH and NIT alumni Matthias Schmittmann and Johannes Weber to further develop the prototype to market readiness. The young entrepreneurs are supported by the TUHH StartupDock, the EXIST scholarship and the IFB Hamburg program InnoRampUp. In the SpeedUp Europe project, bentekk joins forces with the web developer Felix Wittmann, the iOS developer Arne J??nemann and the peak detection algorithm expert Paul Weber.

column1: Based on a deep understanding of the market of portable environmental measurement devices, the team plans to create an additional service for bentekk: The cloud-based web platform bencloud will display, enhance and connect measured data in a seemly way. First for bentekkƒ??s device. In a second step, we plan to open the platform for other measurement devices. A more visionary perspective sees the possibility to connect many devices over the web platform in an intelligent manner. The sensor data can be used to create profiles about contamination of sites or even whole cities. Bencloud will be sold to measurement device users in a freemium business model and individual connectors will be developed for device manufacturers. 2167,Spee17,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Betontaxi,Betontaxi,Neuer Wall 50 ,"MANUFACTURING, TRANSPORTATION AND STORAGE",B2B,3-5,0,YES,OUT,Marco Reemer ,"Our project aims to improve the efficiency and effectivity of the concrete delivery process and hereby realize cost savings for the involved companies and to reduce superfluous traffic. This will not only reduce the traffic jams in crowded cities but also reduce the environmental pollution by exhaust gases.

Concrete factories typically subcontract most of their logistics processes to transport providers that own truck mixers and concrete pumps. The coordination is very challenging since concrete delivery is very time critical and is influenced by many factors such as the weather and delays on construction. Currently dispatchers at the concrete factories spend stressful hours on their phones each day just calling for the right driver and still often the optimum allocation between factory and truck is not found due to lack of information.

We will create a market platform that allows concrete factories and transportation companies to request and allocate vehicles in a much easier way and hereby exploit the huge potential for cost savings and increase in turnover of both parties. Dispatchers will be able to enter their vehicle requests into the platform, distribute them automatically to a set of relevant transportation companies and receive a confirmation from the winning contractor. The contractor in turn can use the platform to allocate jobs to his vehicles and hereby gain transparency about their load capacity. He will also immediately identify his inactive vehicles. Furthermore the vehicles of the transportation companies will be equipped by GPS systems transmitting their position to the platform. This will significantly simplify the required short term planning of concrete deliveries. ",Tech provider,X,0,X,0,X,0,,Software,Logistics,Applications,Supply Chain Management (SCM) Applications,1,0,#N/A,0,0,zupp.ly

2168,Spee18,Spee,SpeedUp,Portugal,"Byline Solutions, Lda ",BetterCity,"Urbaniza?õ??o Quinta da Teodora, Lote 28 ",0,0,6-10,1,NO,0,Paulo Paiva ,"This project aims to establish a link between citizens and local public services improving the quality of life, citizenship and boosting savings of resources.
By creating one digital ecosystem, supported by fiware technologies, we will connect several players at real-time to achieve a common goal. Improving public assets management and a smart governance.
We want to connect:

- The citizens, with mobile apps, can report issues like damaged roads, broken trash cans, missing traffic signs, water pipe leak or other physical assets. Doing that they make part of the process e-participation and can earn discounts on public services, like public transportation
- Public Technicians, with specialized mobile apps, so they can validate and classify the information gathered by the citizens
- Decision Makers, with desktop applications, to assist and accelerate the decision making process, so they can optimize interventions in every asset.
- Sensors, applied in public vehicles, like bus, that collect information in real time about the quality of street pavements.
- We allow third party apps, that can connect  to collected data to optimize their processes.

With the data collected and with connecting to external data sources, like weather conditions, traffic counts, public safety, etc. We can build prediction data models to analise the evolution of each asset and the interventions needed in a period of time. 2169,Spee19,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,betterspace,betterspace,"Paul-Nagel Str. 8,  ",0,0,3-5,1,NO,0,Siwanand Misara ,"Betterspace develops the energy management solutions for non-residential buildings, such as offices and hotels. In this applications, the energy efficiency is even more critical compared to that of residential applications. There is a clear conflict of interests between building owners/employers and users/employees. For instance, the users usually show less interest in using resources efficiently since they are not the ones paying for it.

It is possible to save up to 30% of the energy consumption through connecting things/appliances inside the rooms as well as intelligent controlling the room to adapt to the individual needs of the users. In order to save the maintenance costs of the facility, moreover, it is also linking various rooms to a facility control hub to control/ diagnose remotely
In comparison to other competitors, we are working with
ƒ??	low-cost solution based on open hardware and software,
ƒ??	open for different vendors one after another based on interoperability approach
ƒ??	smart-grid and smart cities control algorithms.
The payback time is less than 3 years.

The target market is firstly the private operated hotels and offices, which exhibit about 18.000 buildings with a market volume of 140 million EUR in Germany. Growth in this sector is influenced positively by the national and international legislative and its ambitious goals.

In order to have high market penetration, a low cost system with basic functions will be provided, even with a lower margin. It can be estimated as a basic infrastructure. Afterwards, the additional modules can be further booked with different applications, e.g. maintenance app, luxury apps, etc. It can be compared with mobile phone, which users can book different apps.

The co-founders are Mr. Siwanand Misara and Mr. Gerhard Weiss with responsibility for business development and research/development, respectively. They both have worked together at Fraunhofer Institute for more than 4 years.
2170,Spee20,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,biig,bi-ig,"B??ckelweg 3,  ",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,3-5,1,YES,IN,Andr?? Johannsen ,"Business Intelligence ƒ?? immersive gamified

Each modern enterprise is dealing with an escalating quantity of data, which are presented in form of numbers and calculated with complex formulas. For a better and faster understanding of these data we developed more advanced and complex methods for calculating and imaginary parameters to describe themselves. During this process a major loss and alienation of the original facts are accepted as inevitable collateral damage.
Our concepts targets at understanding data with a minimal information loss and maximal overview for the context of each key figure. We target at enriching the interaction and collaboration on data.

The idea behind BIIG is to provide a tool for data exploration and visualization within a business intelligence environment as an immersive three dimensional world. We will introduce the use of gamification techniques on data exploration and collaboration within data visualizations to bring more contextual meaning in your business data warehouse. We want to revolutionize the way of information processing for daily business key figures with a concept of creating 3D elements out of data, which does not stop at making bar charts 3D ƒ?? we go far further and make use of analogies for special visualization modules where we set data in context of business objects.

We will use FIWARE core technologies to build our system landscape and test our approaches in a minimum time. Also the FIWARE technologies help us providing multiuser ability and include data processing systems. We use the Avatar enabler to provide our customers with one of our first gamification approaches: the data exploration assistant.

Our system will provide info-screen abilities to use special visualization module like team progress in a project or overall business key figures within our customers working environment. We will provide a free version for NGOs and will support other visualization libraries with code.

2172,Spee22,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,binee - to be founded ,Binee,Zum Muehlweg 85 ,"Consumer citizen engagement, TRANSPORTATION AND STORAGE",B2B/B2C,3-5,1,YES,IN,Martin Jaehnert ,"Binee, a hardware and app. We incentivize users to separate their trash by making it fun! We gamify waste separation through a mobile app, turning it in an interesting and fun experience. Beyond all the game stuff, users are also able to track their trash and know where its recycled form is going to be used as well as compete with their friends.

Every single year, about US$ 150.000.000 (150 million) waste worth is thrown into landfills. However, waste is only valuable if separated, and most of it is not. For a more concrete idea, in Brazil, only 1% of all waste produced is recycled. Thus, we went to the streets, and discovered why it is not being effective. After several analysis from the major countries in the world, we discovered several reasons that make waste separation unsuccessful, and which most impressed us is that it is definitely not fun. So, why not make all of this fun and exciting? Through Binee, people will have a fully experience about the trash lifecycle as well as have fun with the gamification form of waste separation.

We split the value created among three major parts: the recycling companies, users, and us. Each Binee breaks even in three months after its installation. The more Binee trash cans we install, the more value we create. For example, if we install 50 thousand Binee stations, we will hit one billion dollars in revenue, which comes from valuable separated waste.
So, what about stop wasting and start having fun?
Binee: no waste, more fun.
",Tech provider,X,0,0,X,0,X,,Hardware,Customer service,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,0,www.binee.co,Other,50000,binee.co

The project will mainly focus on municipalities, farms, forest owners, and investors.

Biomass as a source of heat (energy) has shown to be the most efficient and profitable solution for its use, actually, allowing to reach high performances, when used in advance equipment, optimised and prepared for biomass combustion. The project will be focused on a development of apps assessing renewable energy potential. It will include:
1.	The proposed system will analyse the available sources of Linked open data (LOD) possible local potential energy sources and subsequent possible limitations
2.	The function and production of forests and agricultural production (category forests, reservations, farming, landscaping, poor habitat, biodiversity conservation, NATURA 2000) for business plans.

The platform will provide service scenarios for five types of investments assumed to be good simplification of all complexity of costumers needs. 2175,Spee25,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,business network 4.0,BN40,Notenstecherweg 3 ,0,0,3-5,2,NO,0,Andreas Nimz ,"During the last years, many regional and national networks have been established. Most of these networks were launched with public funding and the support of local politicians. It can be concluded that once the funding expires most networks do not have the financial capabilities to survive. Sadly, many only live and provide very limited services for their members. As the operator of one network with more than 100 IT companies in the metropolitan region of Hannover, we have been thinking about other options to facilitate the long term success for these networks.

With this concept we are aiming to provide an IT platform based on FIWARE which provides three core elements: A market place function, a calendar of events and a campus for education and training. Preassembled bundles of FIWARE provide a solid good foundation for our planned services and activities.

Many networks are stuck by discussions around the various interests of its members and limit the options for expansion in the region where they have been established. With the help of a marketplace containing the products and services from all members, transparency is delivered for the network members and potential clients. This will increase the marketing power and value-add of the network directly to the region. The bundled marketing from a central platform will support many small companies. The offered services on the operator side of the platform provide a specific value which can be used by active networking. As a result science and industry and SMEs have the opportunity for e.g. training on site.

We will start with the implementation of the IT platform for our own network as a pilot installation and want to enhance the IT platform with additional services. Furthermore we aim to offer the platform for other networks after the successful pilot phase. In this case, the network itself may not be the customer, but it may be, that an economic development department of a city or region buys or rents the platform.

Bonsum is a marketplace and loyalty program for sustainable shopping, rewarding customer for spending their money on sustainable products and services. We are currently working with Humboldt-University of Berlin to transform loyalty points into a good digital currency.

column1: Besides sustainability the founders are focussed on rigid user data protection and are already trying to diminish usage of US-IT services as far as possible (e.g. usage of Piwik, Mailjet, hosted in Berlin). Loyalty programs are under constant public scrutiny e.g. the Big Brother Award ""For organizations that have been acting particularly and consistently to threaten or violate people's privacy, or disclosed peopleƒ??s personal data to third partiesƒ? received by Payback in Germany.

With Bonsum, we want to create a prototype in the epicentre of data profiling, offering the benefits of relevant deals and offers to customers, combined with a transparent, rigid European data protection policy using the FI-WARE framework, positioning our European approach in regards to data protection not as a weakness, but as a USP and seal for safe data usage to attract users. 2177,Spee27,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,ecoCloud,Breeze,Billwerder Neuer Deich 17 ,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,3,0,YES,IN,Robert Heinecke ,"Breeze aims to provide everyone with reliable data about the most essential thing in our world: the air they are breathing. We aim to help people to live a healthier life by creating a consciousness for one of the highest influences on our health: air pollution.

To achieve this, we will introduce Breeze, an integrated microcontroller platform with the ability to comprehensively measure local air quality based on the Air Quality Index, and the Breeze Cloud, a FIWARE-enabled platform collecting the gathered data, enriching it with other available data sources and making it accessible both locally and on a global scale.

We are targeting four customer segments with our solution: 1) end users, who can place Breeze in and around their homes to get insights into the air they are breathing every day, 2) urban farmers, who can monitor the air pollution their products are exposed to during growth to minimize health risks during their consumption, 3) businesses, who will be able to monitor and certify the air quality in their offices with a business service to demonstrate corporate social responsibility and 4) farmers, who will be able to sign up for a robust and reliable solution to measure air pollution on their agricultural areas. We will certify crops from unpolluted areas to ensure customer safety and provide additional value the agricultural products and for the clients.

We are a team of three students, complementing each other perfectly: We all have a background in IT, but our strengths lie in different areas: Robert, the project leader, has expertise in strategic planning and business administration. Jan, the developer, has long experience in software and hardware development. And Sascha, the all-rounder, combines these worlds, supporting all functions as needed while focusing on backend development. ",Tech provider,,X,0,0,X,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,www.projectbreeze.eu,Other,50000,projectbreeze.eu

2178,Spee28,Spee,SpeedUp,Latvia,BALTIC OPEN SOLUTIONS CENTER SIA ,BuyFromFarm,Kr.Barona Street 32-7 ,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING, Consumer shopping",0,3-5,7,NO,0,Karel Charvat ,"Proposal Summary: The aim of the BuyFromFarm project is to develop and experiment advanced FI-Ware based apps to enable farmers and agro-food SMEs to access the eBusiness space created by the Single Electronic Market of Europe. The proposed service aims to face and solve needs of farmers and agro-food SMEs such as the visibility in the market, the interoperability with customers and the introduction of state-of-art business and technology topics into their production. The proposed apps will be provided to a large number of agro-food SMEs through the web, in order to enhance their market competitiveness. In addition, the proposed project aims to facilitate the update of Web2.0 technologies in order for them to deploy services to their SME members that can support them in their everyday businesses. Examples include map-based location services for the farmers in some region.
The main results of the BuyFromFarm project will be two apps:
ƒ??	Apps for farmers and local agri food SMEs allowing to offer their products on the web and advertisement, but also manager ordering, invoicing and CRM.

ƒ??	Apps for customer, with primary focus on search for certain products in certain location based on location based services, but also make orders, provide navigation to the farm and also supporting social tagging and bookmarking.

On the server side, there will be application supporting spatial queries (OpenStreetMap will be used as base map), CRM, but also ontology or vocabulary allowing to translate orders among different languages. There will be also used advanced visualisation methods like virtual reality or 3D visualisation to attract potential customers. 2179,Spee29,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Datenfreunde UG (haftungsbeschr?Ïnkt) ,CARNANNY,Winzeldorferweg 12 ,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,1,5,YES,OUT,Arvea Marieni ,"We aim to introduce a new category to the mobility market: Unused Vehicle Services. Motor Vehicles on average are unused and unmoved for 90% of the day. This systematic inefficiency calls for a peer-to-peer allocation platform that matches needs of vehicle owners and service providers: CARNANNY. It is a smart peer-to-peer service platform for vehicles aimed at making driversƒ?? life easier in densely populated metropolitan areas stareved of parking and driving space.
The sharing economy marketplace provides several matching opportunities:
1. Rent-As-Taxi institutional and private vehicle owners can make their cars available for rent by taxi drivers when they are not needed over a longer period of time.

2. Peer-To-Peer-Parking Citizens can rent out their own private driveways and garage as parking spaces, Drivers who score a notoriously hard to get parking place can auction it out using the MotorNanny App

3. Car Babysitting Maintenance SMEs can bid for billable services that can be performed while the vehicles are unused  (changing a tyre, car wash, oil exchange, moving the vehicle when unattended over a longer time etc.).
This project proposal foresees the development and roll out of a pilot (Beta product) in Hamburg in two phases:
Phase I. Set up and test of the FIWARE based multi-function infrastructure

Phase II. Business Case verification by comparing the proposed revenue generation operating models. ",Service provider,X,0,X,0,0,0,,Software,Business-to-Business Middleware,Application Development & Deployment,Integration and Orchestration Middleware,1,X,0,Other,50000,zensuskarte.de

2180,Spee30,Spee,SpeedUp,Italy,Carrello Express,CEX,"Via Kramer,31 ",0,0,3-5,0,NO,0,Rossella Incardona ,"CarrelloExpress is an e-commerce market place where customers compare prices and shop for their grocey from both local stores and supermarkets. The innovation is in the home delivery service, performed in crowdsourcing by other platform users who pick up the order (geo -tagged and posted on the platform) and use their bikes or their vehicles, or simply their foot, to deliver the goods at home to the customers. Another innovative feature is the possibility to shop for grocery online from multiple stores and have access to neighborhood quality shops.

CarrelloExpress is aimed at making the shopping experience simpler and more confortable, whilst reducing the Co2 produced by traditional home delivery services, allowing young people and temporarily unemployed people to make some money by simply shopping for their neighbors, giving local shops an online window and a flexible delivery service without bearing the relative costs.

CarrelloExpress relies on collaborative economy models to build smarter, cleaner and more comfortable cities, and it is based on the FIWARE generic & specific enablers and on the enthusiasm of online customers, users (our ƒ??shop-runnersƒ?), and vendors. 2181,Spee31,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Hinrichsen und Chen GbR ,CH,Oktaviostra??e 34B ,"ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND AIR CONDITIONING SUPPLY",B2B,4,2,YES,IN,Benjamin Chen ,"In the modern information society our hunger for more data-processing explodes exponentially. To feed this requirement, more and more data centres are built. The main resource these centres need is electric power. Servers or computers need electric power in order to work. Over 99% of the electric power used by a server will be converted to heat. It has to be absorbed by or discharged into the environment. This process requires artificial cooling circles like air-radiators or fluid-cooling-systems. These cooling-systems also need electric power to work. A study showed that approximately 1/3 of the electric power resource for a modern and energy-efficient data centre is used for cooling systems for servers.

The project cloudheizung aims to re-use the produced heat. Instead of ƒ??destroyingƒ? the heat with cooling systems, we use innovative heat exchanging system to convert it into heating energy which can be used for office or civilian buildings. Our concept is to establish multiple mini data centre locations based on the need for heating energy.  ",Tech provider,X,X,0,0,0,0,,Hardware,not software,#N/A,#N/A,1,X,0,Other,50000,cloudheizung.de

2182,Spee32,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Kooperationsstelle Hamburg IFE GmbH ,ChemSub,Humboldtstr. 67a ,MANUFACTURING,B2B,6-10,5,YES,OUT,Lothar  Lissner ,"The objective of ChemSub is to bring legally and technically safe and economically viable solutions to those enterprises that use chemicals but do not possess the specialist knowledge to understand the hazards and risks posed by these chemicals. The existing knowledge databases (www.subsport.eu
column2: www.cleantool.org) have to be upgraded in order to create a user-friendly interactive tool that, based on input by the enterprises, helps identifying the best solution for an alternative and less hazardous chemical in the specific context of the particular business. The decision process flow includes the following elements:

column1: ƒ??	Unambiguous identification of a chemical (STEP 1) for non-chemists and import of information from other enterprise
chemical management systems or electronic Safety Data Sheets (eSDS).
ƒ??	A check and feedback system with key information based on input on the chemicals used. This basically includes infor-
mation on a current or future ban or restriction of this chemical due to current or future legislation or restriction lists
(STEP 2).
ƒ??   Web-based check-up of options for action: application for exemption, use of available substitutes, check of the technical
requirements and legal certainty of alternatives and the cost implications of the alternative solution (STEP 3 - 6).
ƒ??	A concluding assessment listing all advantages and disadvantages (STEP 7).

A tool displaying all these features does not exist until now in Europe. It¶ïs added value consists in enabling the users to adopt their production and working processes to the current and future legal requirements, reduce expensive redundant protection measures, better protect their workers, better protect the environment and, in many cases, reduce the costs. ",Tech provider,,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,Data Integration and Access Software,Application Development & Deployment,Structured Data Management Software,1,0,0,0,0,0

2183,Spee33,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Crowd Journalism,CJ,Johann-Mohr-Weg 22b ,Consumer leisure/gaming,B2C,3,0,YES,IN,Pino Almeida ,"### Video clip based solution for citizen journalism in the domain ""Smart Cities"" ###

The digitalisation of moving image productions and their distribution has produced a whole range of new media services in recent years that - with Youtube at the fore - have led to a veritable boom in video content. Above all, a new generation of filmmakers is using the possibilities of modern technology to their own benefit: many vloggers and young production companies, as well as cultural initiatives, local NGOs and companies produce large quantities of high-quality video material about events in their cities or relating to news from specific content areas on a daily basis. Material that could be very interesting for professional users such as media online portals, TV stations or publishers. However, the exchange between new and established video producers remains difficult, as the possibilities for targeted searching for regional or specialised content on conventional video platforms is severely limited. Moreover, the very open nature of the content often results in large uncertainties in relation to copyright and licensing rights. A professional, systematic exchange between suppliers and consumers, therefore, is not possible. We want to enable this exchange with our project. It will act as a digital exchange for local and specialist video productions, on which producers can actively market their content. Users are offered a clearer, more professional and legally secure service that will help to raise awareness of new, young and regional suppliers.

Please take a look at our UGC at http://files.bitprojects.de/the_cj_team.mp4 ",Service provider,X,X,X,0,0,0,,Software,File Synchronization and Sharing Software,Applications,Collaborative Applications,1,X,0,Group of Entrepreneurs,50000,bitprojects.de

2184,Spee34,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Global Green ,ClimateShow,Husumer Str. 17 ,0,0,6-10,0,NO,0,Katrin Heratsch ,"revolution. A lot of citizens still lack specific attempts for specific participation possibilities. Together with the most famous German climatologist, Prof. Mojib Latif of the excellent cluster ocean of the future in Kiel we will put the climate show, a completely new event concept, on the market. Particularly in citizens of smart Cities a general understanding for sustainable action should be awoken to save resources and CO2 and therefore to fight against climate change. In the centre of the project is the climate change presentations of the famous climatologist media-wide known Prof. Mojib Latif. In supplement to his regular and known lecture the show should be supplemented with new attractive elements which allow the public to dip deeper into an extended reality.

The public is confronted with climate change, however, they can change the show at the same time and thus participate interactive. Important is that the guests do not leave the show frustrated, but encouraged with new ideas and tips how they can fight against the climate change. For example, the public can search with the ƒ??Augmented Realityƒ? tool certain objects on the screen. Whole parts of the presentation should be hidden on the show stage and only become visible, when the public moves their mobile devices. In addition, we will form an interactive website for the show. All information can be recalled there for the show: an interactive map will show the locations of the next show and its contents. In the course of bringing Europe closer together the shows will be first streamed in Germanyon the website with English and Spanish capitations, to make the show available to bigger masses. In the next steps, the show will be also implemented in other European cities. ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

2185,Spee35,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,no ,Climateweek,Heilholtkamp 40 ,0,0,6-10,0,NO,0,Susanne Pla?? ,"The CO2 value is too high in most cities as in Hamburg, and according to the regulations of the European Union this level must be reduced in order to address climate change and its consequences. Based on the success of the Hamburg Climate Week, a project is to be initiated with the goal of the inhabitants of the city in mind and to generate a comprehensive information on this topic. It seeks to provide information to anyone that can make a positive contribution to reduce the CO2 emission. The aim of the initiative in the first place is for the citizens to reflect on the measurement and consequences of CO2 production and to encourage positive changes with the hope to demonstrate how these changes can lead to sustainable behavior. We will make use of the existing data from the Hamburg Environmental Measuring Network http://luft.hamburg.de/. The data will be presented so that the general public will be able to get a clear idea of the present situation. The website will also provide important information and tips and tricks on how each individual can reduce CO2. On this platform it is expected to produce hands-on activities for anyone willing to participate, e.g., scientists, activists, companies, government ministries, and institutes. This will promote a discussion and will raise awareness within the Climate Week Network Events. This project will be an essential component of the already existing and successful Hamburg Climate Week which takes place each fall and has been staged for the past seven years. The Hamburg Climate Week is a combination of exhibit space, educational programs and lectures
column2: during this week, residents of the with their sustainable activities, for example, in the areas of mobility, consumption and housing. This is a crucial approach for a ƒ??Smart Cityƒ? and we are hoping that it will endure in the years to come, and Hamburg is in this case used as a project model.  ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 2186,Spee36,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Kiimia UG ,CLST,Philipsstr.10 ,0,0,3-5,1,NO,0,Sahar Khayambashi ,"Focusing on Smart Commerce within Smart Cities we will reduce the complexity of online shopping and provide users a wish list and personalized product recommendations. Furthermore, our platform enables users to connect with friends or brands and supports social relationships.

CHILIST is a cloud based social commerce platform which will be available for both web and mobile. Our mission with CHILIST is a comprehensive solution in order to bring the usability of online shopping to a new level. We enable users to save products they like from any shop at one central platform, which is accessible from everywhere and can easily be shared with friends. Moreover, CHILIST gives friends an idea what to buy for occasions such as birthday, weddings or Christmas. Each member becomes automatically a curator of his own unique world of shopping as well as an inspiring trendsetter for other users. Furthermore, an algorithm will analyze similarities of userƒ??s preferences and recommend saved items to the similar group of users.

Three major segments will profit from our idea. The user being less stressed and having an organizational tool for free. Shops and brands having a relevant platform as marketing channel to strengthen awareness and acquire new customers. Moreover, the conscious purchase of the user leads to less returns and higher efficiency of the shops. On the other hand, the low return rates will have a positive impact of logistic traffic and the environment, thus also on the health of the society.
Doing so, the FI-WARE technology and its open source enablers support our purpose allowing us to focus more on other technically and strategic tasks and challenges.

2187,Spee37,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,F??rderverein Meer e.V. ,CompetitionResearchAtSea,Neulander Weg 24 ,0,0,6-10,23,NO,0,Elke Spinneker ,"For a smart city that is connected with the sea such as Hamburg it is important to deal with subjects related to climate, environment and the ocean. Hamburg is closely connected to the sea and in particular climate change effects represent a serious threat for coastal towns. Therefore, the youth competition that started in Germanyaims to create a closer connection between the living space sea and the people living in the city as well as to tie a closer bound between the way of living and acting with the marine environment. The goal of the project is to create a European-wide approach to connect modern lifestyle with marine subjects. Teams of students have the opportunity to submit their own research ideas in the area of marine, environmental or climate protection.  Thus an understanding is created about how important our oceans are, their impact on our climate as well as on measures that need to be taken to retain this sensitive living space. The submitted research ideas will be evaluated from a well-known board of curators such as representatives of the German museum for oceanography, the Max-Planck- Institute of meteorology and the Museum for nature science museum in Berlin. Together with experienced scientists the winner team goes on a one-week long research expedition, to turn their idea into reality. By using the software FiWare the communication about the contest will be improved and a more intense integration into society realized. In a database research ideas as well as results will be collected. On an interactive map the research expeditions can be post-experienced by linking Videos and Pictures to the places to illustrate the intension of the young team. Through a streaming tool videos from the expeditions will be played on the website with subtitles in English or Spanish, so that also internet users of other European countries get access to contents and the expeditions. In addition log-books of the last years will be processed and presented. ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

Our mission is to help citizens meet their learning needs by offering them a platform that allows them to invite their favourite educational speakers to their locality and to crowdfund educational events. Croffee shapes healthy behaviours by encouraging citizens to co-design and co-create events tailored to their needs. By providing low thresholds for joining and attending learning groups and events, social integration is being fostered.

Croffee is a website that allows fans of great speakers, trainers and educators to crowdsource their idol to come to their hometown. Our business model is designed to provide advantages for speakers, freelance educators and their fans on a ƒ??no cure no payƒ? basis. The website provides education providers (experts, speakers and consultants) with a free business development and market research tool by allowing them to scope demand in different locations on a ""no cure, no payƒ? basis. These crowdsourcing and crowdfunding principles apply to physical as well as virtual events. column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITYÿÿÿ",0,50-99,11,NO,0,Ioannis Mavroudis ,"Through the new frame of Common Agricultural Policy (CAP), important issues about the requirements of cross compliance have been arisen. To this context, the main idea of developing this project came from the latest European Commission Regulation about Cross Compliance in the Article 93 of Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013 and Annex II, as well. According to this Regulation there will be important changes in the rules
column3: therefore, informing Greek farmers (as well as European ones) on these, becomes a crucial issue on agricultural sector. In addition to that, the legislative framework concerning cross compliance is not fully comprehended by the majority of them. The outcome of this lack of available information is the incomplete implementation of cross complianceƒ??s rules. Even though, most of the European farmers are in a way familiar with the obligatory nature of cross compliance, Greek farmers have not understood, yet, the importance of it, not only for receiving the financial support but also for protecting the environment. In order to overcome the above mentioned problems, through the proposed application (CCAPP) we aim at designing a useful tool addressing mainly to farmers or agriculturalists that through the insertion of their farmsƒ?? data, guiding them for the actions that should be taken in order to fully comply with the cross compliance rules. column1: 2190,Spee40,Spee,SpeedUp,The Netherlands,QwikSense B.V. ,DAPE,Hooghiemstraplein 75 ,0,0,3-5,1,NO,0,Paul Stomph ,"QwikSense is a complete, scalable indoor environment monitoring solution for work environments, which includes a meshed network of specialized sensors as well as data acquisition and analytics, to achieve the optimization of energy consumption and better healthier workplaces for employees. Poor work environments have a huge impact on absenteeism and the productivity of the employees, which costs organizations a considerable amount of money every year. Research has shown that a) indoor air pollution is 5x worse than the air outdoors and b) corporations may lose up to 3.600ƒ?ª per employee due to low productivity. Moreover, large working spaces, such as corporate office buildings or hospitals, consume 30% more energy than was originally calculated. QwikSense is the solution that will allow every work environment to be optimized both in terms of working conditions for the employees, as well as in terms of energy efficiency, always with a low cost for the end user. It is the first system to offer high quality data for a great variety of parameters crucial for a work environment to be monitored at any point in space. QwikSense makes all this possible using the latest technology in sensors, a prototype already developed for production. ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

2191,Spee41,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Data Look,DataLook,Mindener Str. 4 ,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,5,1,YES,IN,Tobias Pfaff ,"Open data have great potential to enhance life in Smart Cities. While more and more people learn about the idea that open data can be used to streamline government services and to solve social problems, it is difficult to find successful use cases and realized projects. DataLook changes that. At its core DataLook provides the web site datalook.io which allows people to share and discuss data-driven projects for social good. We create a platform that enables people to get inspired by innovative and useful projects from around the world. The vision is that our users eventually replicate these projects in their own community and bring the idea of Smart Cities to life.

Going beyond open data DataLook also showcases projects that have used closed data to solve hard problems for the greater good. Some of these projects have even contributed to saving lives and it makes therefore sense to include them and to inspire the open data community. DataLook approaches people with different backgrounds, while all are stakeholders of Smart Cities. On the one hand programmers and data scientists who realize data-driven projects from a technical point of view. But also representatives from the government and NGO sector who have deep domain expertise and who can work with the technical people to identify problems that can be solved with data. Journalists and researchers also find inspiration for their work on DataLook.

In this proposal we describe how FIWARE can help us to reach important milestones for the project. Specifically, we build an interactive map showing the location of projects together with metadata. CKAN integration allows users to store and find data sets related to the projects. Eventually, we will organize a hackathon that is live broadcasted using FIWARE technology. This allows us to broadcast hands-on examples how data can be used for social good to the FIWARE community and beyond. Possibilities to monetize our services are also described in the proposal. ",Service provider,X,X,X,0,X,0,,Software,File Synchronization and Sharing Software,Applications,Collaborative Applications,1,X,0,Other,50000,datalook.io

2192,Spee42,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,reportingimpulse GmbH ,DataViz & MSC,Katharinenplatz 1 ,0,0,2,1,NO,0,Kai-Uwe Stahl ,"A picture is worth a thousand words. This motto has long been the basis for data visualisation projects in several companies. For our SpeedUP! Europe project we will use these methods and modern forms of visualization gained through our book, our conducted studies and our practical experience for societal and political issues.

We want to enable our society to get a more efficient and intelligent use of major societal challenges by making them visually understandable to everyone and enable changes in these areas. Potential areas for our visualisation are health, demographic change and well-being of society, but also issues of environmental protection and transport projects to save resources.

The development of an online platform to communicate the contents with modern visual dashboards to make visual analysis of specific societal challenges and the organization of informal evening events are the basis to share the project to broad public.
At the end the establishment of a nonprofit association about visualization is planned to ensure that the project idea also lives on over the project period.

3D printing is rapidly evolving as a means to
- manufacture highly specialized objects from various materials, on demand.
- manufacture locally, providing personal contact with the expert or even print at home (smart cities).
- allow for small-scale, resource efficient production with ecologically compatible  materials (clean tech).

To fully play out these innovations, the digital design tool should use modern web technologies, such as WebGL, have a fast and easy-to-use responsive design, full compatibility with all device types (Desktop, Laptop, Netbook, Pad, Mobile Phone) and must be independent of any additional plugins. Native browser support is important.
FIWARE technologies such as Object Storage, Key Management and 2DUI provide the perfect framework for data handling along all stages of design and production.

Our aim is the development of a full production line, from the first user input, visualization, processing of custom shapes, storing on distributed (cloud) services, to online-purchases, easy payment, automatic order processing, 3D printing, mold optimization if required, material casting and finally shipping of the 3D printed product to the customers. Optimizing the production process, material research, reducing production costs and different 3D printing methods for different product requirements is the long-term task. ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A
2197,Spee47,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,DocPointer,DocPointer,Gr??newaldstra??e 10 ,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,3-5,1,YES,IN,Nikolaus Kreuzhermes ,"DocPointer

Situation: Huge structural elements on-site need continuous reporting. Every detail, like a welding seam or a bore hole, has to be released from an authorised person. Without release no structural element can be licenced to operate. The reporting has to clearly identify each part  and has to fulfil high legal requirements. The inspection of huge structural elements on-site generates an unmanageable amount of reports (e.g. e-mails, photos, markings, documents, revision instructions, approvals). The organisation, handling and researching of reports is time-consuming, expensive and error-prone.

Approach: The DocPointer allocates reports generated on-site automatically in a secure database and provides a legally sound documentation history for auditing. The docPointer reduces the time of production, particularly the final acceptance of construction work. The management and retrieval of information (non conformed reports NCR) becomes efficient and exact.

Objectives: The ƒ??pointer"" identifies all relevant documentation of an object by using GPS coordinates, photo material, engineering drawing or a 3D-model. Additional personal data (Name, Date, Time, Authorization, Permission) is recorded. The generation of the pointer is based on Fi-Ware.

Example: The application spectrum of the DocPointer is manifold (e.g. bridge construction, ship building, high-rise building). In this project the DocPointer should use the example of offshore windfarm grounding. The erecting of Windpower stations fundaments (Tripods) requires very high legal efforts (comparable to marine technique). One fundament needs 600 welding seams for example. 80 windmills in a plant are leading to 48.000 (!) welding seams which have to be identified individually. Reducing the production time of one wind turbine results cost saving of ~ 200.000 ƒ?ª/day! This is why the DocPointer is a very useful tool to keep the construction plant smart and safe.
",Tech provider,,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,"Content Analytics, Discovery, and Cognitive Software",Applications,Content Applications,1,0,0,SME,50000,docpointer.eu

2201,Spee51,Spee,SpeedUp,The Netherlands,EasyDoc.,ED,Zuiderzeeweg 92H ,0,0,3-5,1,NO,0,Manuel Mayer ,"EasyDoc saves time and eases communication between individuals and family doctors by providing an Internet platform that connects with a medical home device and enables instant online consultation with a doctor of your choice.

The idea was developed by the team during our Masters in Business Administration at the University of Amsterdam (UvA). We came up with a solution for minimizing unnecessarily doctor visits. By providing a platform for online doctor consultation we eliminate the time and energy consuming transit of the patient from home to the doctors office. At the same time, by integrating a hardware home device that measures the basic health parameters (like temperature and blood pressure), we shorten the time of the consultation: the doctor receives information about these parameters via the platform, and does not need to make the measurements him or herself. These online consultations will be designed as a preliminary step in the treatment mainly in order to assess, whether it is necessary for the patient to physically come to the doctorƒ??s office.
In order to make our product work we will use the following FI-WARE technologies: Orion Context Broker, Orion PEP proxy, Cygnus, Cosmos, Wirecloud, Security Monitoring, and Kurento.

Our team consist of members from the Netherlands, Slovenia, and Austria and met during our Master in Entrepreneurship & Innovation where we decided to take our idea to the next level. We have work experience in different industries such as hospitality, event management, and healthcare. Our academic background ranges from marketing, communications, and international development, to entrepreneurial economics and hospitality management. We have experienced a great complementarity among us while working together and believe that we are able to execute the idea behind EasyDoc successfully.

2204,Spee54,Spee,SpeedUp,Poland,Ecoisme sp. z o.o. ,Energy Management System for Households (EMSH),12 Przemyslowa str. ,0,0,3-5,2,NO,0,Ivan Pasichnyk ,"Ecoisme is a B2B2C service which solves problems of both end customers and energy retailers. For end customers the service allows to reduce bills for electricity up to 30%. For energy retailers Ecoisme helps to reduce power peaks and offer energy retailersƒ?? customers a value added service.

The service provides easy, low-cost and effective solution for monitoring and saving energy at customersƒ?? homes. All they need to do is to attach Ecoisme sensor to their main power line and connect it to Ecoisme cloud. The sensor measures total energy consumption and sends data to Ecoisme cloud-based system. Then the system singles out every device, plugged-it to the electrical grid to show how efficient they are. Based on this information, Ecoisme will recommend customers easy-to-follow advices to save energy. Moreover, for customers with smart meters the company will offer limited functionality of the service even without installing any additional hardware.

To identify home appliances, Ecoisme uses a comprehensive technology, which combines power and spectral analysis. Therefore with the help of a single low-cost hardware device at customersƒ?? homes, Ecoisme allows them to identify all home appliances and all electrical devices even with power consumption that varies.

Energy saving is not only benefit of Ecoisme. Since it can identify every single device in the home, Ecoisme will know if customers forgot to switch off an iron or other home appliances and advise them to do so.

The project is in a closed beta-testing stage now. We raised seed investments from Deutsche Telekom and incorporated in Poland. We have a hardware prototype of our sensor ready and we develop the analytics system to start the beta-testing with real apartments in February. Then we are planning to start a first pilot project in cooperation with Deutsche Telekom. ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY",B2B/B2C,3-5,4,YES,IN,Stefan Bech ,"WATCHER is a smartwatch app designed to make European cities safer. It will utilize biometric sensors in modern smartwatches (e.g., Android Wear and the upcoming Apple Watch), combined with geo-location data and public crime statistics, to create a personal attack alarm that watches over the wearer when she is out and about in high-risk areas. The app runs in the background and automatically detects the physiological response to a sudden stress event, the so-called fight-or-flight response, and provides an easy way to alert emergency contacts and local law enforcement with a single push of a button that appears on the watch display.

column1: Panic button apps have been tried before on smartphones, but they don't work very well in practice, because, frankly, the last thing you think of in a panic situation is to pull out your phone and start digging around for an app you installed long ago. For the concept to work, it needs to detect potential emergencies automatically and let the user call for help without pulling out her phone. This is the use case that WATCHER is focused on solving. ",Tech provider,X,0,X,0,X,X,,Hardware,Consumer application,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,Other,50000,wantr.com

2214,Spee64,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,FICityTrivia,FICityTrivia,Bismarckstr. 77 ,0,0,3-5,1,NO,0,Lars Kalusky ,"People love to leave information at and about special places. Just think of cave paintings, hearts carved in trees or graffiti on walls. With FICityTrivia we want to offer a web platform where anyone can enter any kind of information about a specific place on a virtual sign board. Our idea is to connect information in the virtual world with real locations and most importantly to enable anyone to do so.

FICityTrivia encourages users to share their knowledge about the cityƒ??s ""hot spots"". It provides the wisdom of the crowd for anyone to see: How was a place utilized in the past? This knowledge might inspire people living today. Were there crimes committed here? Did accidents happen here? These facts can be used to make a city safer today!
You can share trivial or entertaining facts with like-minded people. Maybe a scene of your favorite movie was set here or the hero of your favourite book met the love of his life at this very spot.
The present can also be of interest for the general public: Telling people to be aware of potholes or informing them about irregularities on the subway train they are about to board.

In addition to the web platform that lets you share and find trivial information, we encourage users to also use FICityTrivia on their smartphone. Using your location your smartphone will inform you about the surroundings and provide you with the facts that match your interests. FICityTrivia will give you a reason to take your eyes off your smartphone and look up to experience the world.
2215,Spee65,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,OPOX GmbH ,FIDemocracy,Schauenburgerstrasse 116 ,"Consumer citizen engagement, PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND DEFENCE
column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY",B2B/B2C,1,1,YES,IN,Alexander Schulz ,"The startup project ƒ??local electionƒ? is an innovative Video Candidate Comparison and will provide an internet platform to compare candidates of mayoral elections via two-minute videos all over Europe:

column1: Every year more than 6.000 mayoral elections in medium-sized European cities are held. Very often the local citizens donƒ??t know all candidates of the mayoral election in their cities and they do not want to invest a lot of time to get to know them.
The Video Candidate Comparison will help citizens to find their candidate to vote in 6 to 10 minutes - online.
Usually one, two or three candidates apply for the mayor position in one city.

On one internet-slide four election candidates are comparable by two-minute videos. Users can see the number of video hits and how long the other users let the video run. Under the video you can see in writing the most important political issues of the candidate. Candidates pay a fee to install the video on this platform. Beside that the project generates earnings with internet marketing.

The team of Alexander Schulz (business manager), Thorsten Crispin (IT programmer) and Thomas Sievers (IT developer and graphic designer) contribute more than 30 years of work experience. The open European FIWARE software will be used to install an open European political platform for candidate comparison.
ƒ??Local electionƒ? will provide a more transparent election campaign and helps the candidates to present themselves to a wider public. Democracies in smarter cities will be strengthened.
",Service provider,X,X,X,0,0,0,,Software,Consumer application,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,Other,50000,opox.eu

2216,Spee66,Spee,SpeedUp,Denmark,Ceptu IVS ,FieldSense,"Department of Computer Science Aarhus University (attn: John Smedegaard, Turing 126) IT-Parken, Aabogade 34 ",0,0,3-5,1,NO,0,John Smedegaard ,"In our project we will help our farmers decrease the amount pesticides farmers use. This will be achieved by providing the farmers with information about what parts of his field are healthy, as well as which areas require pesticides to match the intended growth. Furthermore, FieldSense will allow farmers to spend their time monitoring their fields more efficiently. This will reduce the farmers overall cost to achieve the same yield, while giving the customer more time to focus on the important tasks required to keep the customers farm running.

The innovative feature of this software is that it requires no manual work to retrieve data, using drones to collect the same data is time consuming and expensive, FieldSense uses readily available satellite data, in a innovative easy-to-use platform, that allows any farmer to easily see and understand data about his fields and crops.

The objective of FieldSense is to reduce farmerƒ??s pesticides usage. Studies in the field have shown, that pesticide usage can be cut down by 40% when using monitoring systems. This reduction will be achieved through developing a new intuitive web platform that will allow farmers to see what parts of their fields require pesticides in order maximize the growth of their crops. Developing models for crop growth data that will be based on satellite data and combining this with other sources of data about the farmerƒ??s fields will achieve the saving. Through close contact with farmers during the testing of the prototype we will get real life data confirming our reduction goals and by the launch we will be able to provide the farmers with clear metrics of what they can expect to save. Once the product has been launched we will be able to further develop the potential saving from using the FieldSense while ensuring that the product easily integrates with the farmers existing workflows. ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

2217,Spee67,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Family Farming,FIFARM,Marmstorfer Weg 110 ,Consumer health/wellness,B2C,5,0,YES,IN,Jennifer Schneider ,"Have you ever tried to grow your own vegetables? You could not bother or already failed? We give people the opportunity to grow their own food, even if they have limited time, space or experience, as it is often the case in urban areas. Although urbanization has caused many people to live without direct contact to agriculture, many citizens (e.g., LOHAS) set high value in healthy food, and they are aware of the importance of sustainable and organic cultivation. The Family Farming application approaches this task by a combination of a smart raised-bed gardening box, called the Agrarium, with a wireless web and mobile application that guides the user to a successful harvest. Thanks to the FIWARE Generic and Specific Enabler (GE/SE) software libraries, we are able to efficiently and easily implement complex Internet of Things (IoT) intercommunication. The successful real world farming experience depends critically on FIWARE which provides a sophisticated framework for various tasks, including data exchange and analysis, user interface design, social networking and access control. Sensors within the Agrarium provide data about temperature, humidity, luminosity and nutritional value which the customers can use and which will be evaluated and illustrated by selected FIWARE software solutions. The web and mobile applications provide the user with appropriate guidance and instructions based on context data evaluated by the FIWARE network. Since FIWARE Enablers went open source, we are able to contribute to the developing community. We will help to drive FIWARE forward into the future while benefitting from a network of experienced programmers, hence reducing production cost and time. Our project guarantees a successful farming experience to people who wish to produce their own food and the FIWARE Enablers help to re-establish an awareness not only for the importance of sustainable food but also for the complex challenge of urban agriculture. Join us and become a FIFarmer! ",Tech provider,,0,X,0,X,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,Other,50000,farmyo.com
