column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY,B2B,3-5,#N/A,YES,IN,Arjuna Mittwede ,"We want to build a Fiware-based communication and consultation platform for local government agencies in the European Union, to provide face to face video conferences for citizens within the web browser. It will be easy and safe to use, with no need to install plugins or software from either the citizen or the public official in the agency, thanks to the Fiware Kurento Video Server. We increase accessibility for government services for all citizens (especially disabled individuals and older adults), by integrating local government agencies and public officials into a map using the Fiware POI Data Provider. Citizens can search and connect to the right person for the right question, either from home or from mobile devices. This will reduce the time to find the appropriate public official for specific questions and will decrease the amount of traffic within cities.

column1: Deaf people for example will be able to connect to any public official and request a sign language translator to join the video conference. This facilitates inclusion and empowers deaf and otherwise disabled people, whoƒ??re still confronted with barriers when using public services in their daily life. We can enable government agencies, and other organizations as well, to easily comply with current laws that require maximum accessibility and inclusion of disabled individuals. Older adults, who often exhibit great limitations to their mobility, can connect and talk to public officials from the safety of their own home. The platform can be used in other public and private sectors as well. For instance, political parties can become more visible and accessible to the general population by integrating into the open street map and allow to connect via video conference calls on just one platform. Other options of use could be in education, travel agencies, business consulting and finances.
",Service provider,X,0,X,0,X,0,,Software,Conferencing Applications,Applications,Collaborative Applications,1,0,0,Other,50000,0

Kft. ,ForestMon,M??rton ??t 12 ,0,0,3-5,9,NO,0,Bence Megyesi ,"Our proposal (a kind of remote surveillance system) might be a useful supporting tool in widely different branches of the agribusiness. This tool shall be able to sense and identify special selectable, pre-defined voices, forward alarm to centres and/or initiate instant actions as defined by the user. Examples of applications identified till now:

#Bee keepers wandering in rural areas proactively can identify swarming of their bees by the changed noise before beehive (2-3 days in advance). It is important in order not to loose the new bee family.

#In certain wine growing area the vintage is endangered by starlings flying in clouds in autumn (and producing a rather typical noise). To prevent them eating up the corps different actions are taken, these frightening can be produced continuously, but the birds get accustomed to that. A better approach is to initiate the action (e.g. a loud voice) when they are actually detected.
#In certain parts of the world illegal lumbering (timbering) is not rare while in others poaching, (or the early alarming of forest fires) are of major importance.
This list of application fields will be extended in the future.

At the sensing points we use voice recognition technology. The data collection and evaluation is based on the background offered by FIWARE as it seems to be the most effective way for a reasonably fast customisation.

2220,Spee70,Spee,SpeedUp,Sweden,VicVision,Further development of G??rdskoll www.gardskoll.com,Eriksdals G??rd ,0,0,1,3,NO,0,Victor Johansson ,"My name is Victor Johansson, I am 20 years old and coming from Sweden. I live with my family on a large farm, we have 350 milk cows milking in milkrobots. I have always been interested in technology and specially how we can use it in our day of work. When I was 17 years old I founded my startup VicVision. Today we are working mainly with mobile apps in agriculture. Today I have a mobile app called ""G??rdskoll"" (farmcontrol in Swedish), I have around 100 farms (customers) and we are growing day by day. We saw a need on our farm to have better control of our fuel consumtion. We have around 15 tractors and fuel it's a big cost for us. Before my app we manually with pen and paper keep track of our fuel consumption but it all ended up with stacks of papers and nobody wanted to transform the papers into the computer. We saw a need there and I've solved it with my app. Nowadays we just open my app ""G??rdskoll"", while waiting for the pump to fuel up we just enter some info about which tractor, which driver, what task we were doing and so on. Everything is stored in the cloud and we can access our data anytime anywhere. The app automatic calculates our cost and we can see exactly what every task costs in terms of fuel cost. With all that data we can make better decisions to improve our machinery. We can save both time and resources with my app. This is a great idea and on the European market I'am nearly unique with this. In a world when climate changes is on the top of the news and when we need to save our future this is a great step! My idea is to implement some FIWARE technology in my existing app. It could be things like IoT-sensors. I have today many ideas of how I can improve my solution with FIWARE technology. For example I would like to see some temperatures in my milk tank and FIWARE will get the data, map it up with diagrams and charts so I can be alerted when something might happened. I hope that you see what I see with this, read more about me on www.gardskoll.com ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

2221,Spee71,Spee,SpeedUp,Finland,Fuzu Oy ,Fuzu,H?Ïmeentie 157 ,0,0,3-5,1,NO,0,Jussi Hinkkanen ,"Fuzu uses cutting edge European technologies and pedagogical know how to discover hidden talent, create new career opportunities, and unleash human potential in underserved emerging markets.

Fuzu is an innovative career development service targeted at mobile users. Fuzu takes a completely new angle to employment and recruitment and introduces a service that enables job seekers to get a job without applying for one. For employers, Fuzu gives an access to readily validated and tested pool of talent. Fuzu improves individualsƒ?? chances of getting a job and radically lowers the cost of recruitment while improving the quality of recruits.

The goal of the project is to mature Fuzu software architecture for rapid scaling across emerging markets. That requires first MVP piloting in Kenya (3 months), alteration of the platform according to MVP feedback (3 months), and implementing enablers (e.g. local payment gateways) for further localisation in key markets like Nigeria and South Africa (3 months).

Fuzu team has an extensive experience in developing and commercializing mobile services in Africa, the Middle East, India and other emerging regions. The team has multi-disciplinary skillset and broad connections across the region, and is uniquely positioned to capture the blue ocean opportunity in these rapidly growing markets.

Use of Fiware technologies (Semantic Application Support and Revenue Settlement and Sharing System) will radically accelerate development of time-consuming platform elements and thus provides savings in R&D time and costs for Fuzu. Short time-to-market is an important competitive advantage and strengthens the platform in areas which are naturally not thematic strengths of the team. 2224,Spee74,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,ERGON Datenprojekte GmbH ,GeoInfo4Kids,Glockengie??erwall 2 ,Consumer leisure/gaming,B2C,12,14,YES,OUT,Ralf Stemmer ,"GeoInfo4Kids is a map-based information system that collects different kinds of information about places and sights of interest for children. It provides information for parents, grandparents, teachers or children. Places of Interest (POI) are, e.g., playgrounds, public swimming pools and recreation areas. There are existing portals and guidebooks focussing on some of those already. But there are much more interesting spots which are not evaluated yet whether they could be of interest for a day trip, e.g., museums, caf??s, events, etc.

GeoInfo4Kids displays the wide range of information on a map view to see what can be reached easily or is located in a certain area. It assists you in combining multiple targets that are close to each. While completing the list of errands it helps you to find a good spot for the children nearby and allows them to have a break at a nice place. GeoInfo4Kids will collect data from different sources and provide a set of side details like weather, public transport, user ratings etc. It prevents you from the need of checking a set of web pages and gives you all information on a single page instead. The system enables the users to add events and places. Furthermore, the users can write comments, add photos, videos, or more detailed descriptions. This will help to keep the system alive!

GeoInfo4Kids can be accessed via web page or alternatively as an app on a mobile device. Localisation can be used by the app users and the software will show you how to find the Point of Interest. The user group can be easily classified which makes the software attractive for advertisement partners.
GeoInfo4Kids will help users to plan their day trips and find interesting places nearby.

column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES",B2B/B2C,5,2,YES,IN,Daniel Robert Michael Sonnet ,"Without beating around the bush, all existing loyalty card systems do not intend to make consumers loyal to certain shops. Usually, the bigger programs are multi partner programs, meaning consumers collect points at different stores and get something useless (bags, water kettle etc.) in return. The truth is that all of these card companies are simply keen on personal data. It is very attractive to combine consumer data with their behaviour and preferences and sell this enriched personal data afterwards to shops for marketing reasons.

column1: Approximately 24 month ago a team of five people thought, the time has come to realise the ƒ??most honest customer cardƒ? in the world. The card/app should be useable anonymously (no data misuse possible) and customers using the card should be given a real reward at the shop where they collected points. Furthermore should it be possible to support local charity organisation by donating points. Why not entitling someone in need to pick up some fresh vegetables at a local supermarket by simply donating some points? Last but not least, a fair customer card should of course send newsletters and coupons, but please just send people stuff they really need and like. In total, we think treating people fairly will result in a good return rate of the card, which is than good for shops. So far, we are proud to having realised a first prototype and also sold some license of our system. Approx. 70% of the distributed cards (6.000) are used on a daily basis. We call that a good start for a loyalty system.

However, it does not mean that our system cannot be extended. Although the entire system is designed for stationary shops, we solely use internet and web technologies. This is a perfect match to integrate FIWARE components to make our vision of the most honest loyalty card in the world even more realistic. This loyalty card with a strong charity component brings people closer. We therefore consider us a project within ƒ??Smart Citiesƒ?.  ",Service provider,X,X,0,X,X,0,,Software,Customer Service,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,X,0,"SME, Other",50000,gerabo.de

2227,Spee77,Spee,SpeedUp,Denmark,WizArts Inc. ,GN,"Kr?÷yer Kielbergs vej 3, 5th floor ",0,0,3-5,8,NO,0,Henrik  Bratb?÷l ,"The design relies on simplicity and functionality, combining the experience of reading the time with the new function of monitoring your buildingƒ??s energy consumption.

In an attempt to nudge the user towards saving energy, progress towards preset energy saving goals is presented to the user every time he or she looks at the clock. Also, GPS is used to coordinate access to the energy consumption data.

The design is meant for larger organizations or facilities. This is because a large number of consumers inevitably lead to large energy consumption, thus, the design will have a larger impact here. Furthermore, this setup makes it manageable to reach a vast amount of people since they all travel around the same facilities.

The thesis is that a visualization of the energy consumption will lead a reduction of it. In this case it is mentionable that the thesis has been tested in previous projects of WizArts. To read more about this look at our Techem case. Thus, it is not a question about the viability of visualization in regards to a more energy-conscious behavior
column2: it is a question about how the visualization will be manifested. In this regard WizArts is working on various methods, both virtual and physical.

column1: To induce a more energy-conscious behavior WizArts will implement gamification in the final solution. This is done in order to make dull tasks as walking the stairs, shutting of the power, and etc. fun to do.

Furthermore, WizArts aims to encourage a general positive change in behavior of the users. WizArts solution does not limit itself to reduction of energy-consumption. We see the bigger picture. People are more likely to change their behavior if other people are doing the same. This is why we will implement social elements in our final solution. To live cleaner and healthier is something we do together for each other.

column2: REPAIR OF MOTOR VEHICLES AND MOTORCYCLES",B2B/B2C,5,1,YES,IN,Niko Gabrielides ,"In a world were striving for personal success becomes increasingly important, here at GAIA Nutrition we wanted to create something that would have a great Impact without all the efforts usually necessary.

Realizing how much time, money and quality of life we were missing out for that purpose we really wondered: Why is it so hard to eat healthy? We learned that it is not like people do not have the will or persistence to eat well
column2: rather everyone wants to look and live well. The problem is that only a few really know how to do it, do not have the time to do it or both. This gave birth to GAIA Nutritionƒ??s idea to make real success in Fitness achievable without literally being on a treadmill for hours and not getting anywhere.

column1: So, what do we do? In brief: We maximize results by increasing productivity. Our customers will get more done in the same time with better, long lasting effects. To achieve this, we created a 360¶ø, full nutrition management service that comes with targeted, science approved nutrition protocols, woven for our customerƒ??s individual goals. Additionally, because we know, that a protocol alone is not enough, we will form an online service that reminds them of their personal goals, keeps track of their progress and challenges them step by step, to reach the next level. Furthermore we will take care of all the grocery shopping, delivering all the ingredients for their tailored diet right to their door ƒ?? without any extra fees! To make this all possible our goal is to cooperate with established grocery stores like REWE so our customer can take advantage of their superior quality and logistics capabili ties.

All in all we strip away the efforts of a healthy diet, like researching, creating meal plans and grocery lists, even goingshopping, leaving our customers with all the more time for sports and the other good things in life! 2229,Spee79,Spee,SpeedUp,The Netherlands,FourceLabs B.V. ,GO,concordiastraat 68 ,0,0,3-5,7,NO,0,Karel Millenaar ,"The Green Owl application is aimed at decreasing hours spend in commuter traffic. This is done by showing users their mobility profile, the notion that they can decrease their CO2-output and giving them the tools to actually decrease their CO2-output.
The application has two sides to it: one side aimed at the employee who can get to work with the application. And one side aimed at the employer who can offer the app to its employees.

For employees it offers a possibility to get to know their mobility profile and to learn how they can decrease their CO2-output. Next to that the app makes employees work together towards a common goal, which increases work floor engagement.

For employers it is a chance to decrease mobility budgets and CO2-emissions. This makes it so that employers can use these efforts in their communication and show the outside world that they are working on becoming a ƒ??green companyƒ??.

For employers it is also a tool to create behavioural change in their company. Although all effects in the application are short term, because of the duration of participation and the use of gaming design principles a long lasting behavioural change is a noticeable effect.
Green Owl full automatically registers the mobility of a user and shows this in the application.

When a user subsequently travels a kilometre, which they normally would travel by car, by public transportation or by bike they score a point. These points are cumulative throughout the entire participating company. When the participating company scores enough points within a set time-frame (six months), the employer will donate a significant portion of the money that was saved to a cause chosen by the employees. This cause could be anything, ranging from new shirts for the local football club to drinks at the office.

2230,Spee80,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Simple Data Sharing for Wearables,Hi! App,Am Fallturm 1 ,"Consumer leisure/gaming, Consumer health/wellness",B2C,5,0,YES,IN,Esteban  Bayro Kaiser ,"Imagine you could influence positively your community, city or even your favourite companies with the data that you generate on a daily bases. If communities could do so, they could steer the way cities are planned and organized. Or simply imagine after doing sport, you could easily share your physical activity data with your health insurance and medics. You could receive a tailored service according to your needs.

Personal data sharing is a current trend and it will continue to grow, most of this data is multimedia and it is mostly for entertaining purposes. What if one could do more with ones data? This would have a great impact.

Wearable computers are gaining popularity and are projected to be a 30,2 billion(US$) global market in the next 5 years. Wearables such as Smart Watches, Smart Wristbands and Google Glasses have already interesting applications, but there is a big room for innovation for the end user. We believe that wearables will become mainstream and we want to build a software solution for it. Wearables and Smartphones generate multimedia and sensor data.  We want to build an new generation application that enables users to share this data not just with friends, but also with their communities and open data portals. Our focus will be on user data privacy and security. With our application users will be the only ones who decide which data to share and with whom.

For developing our Android based application we will use the FIWARE. This platform is useful for this project because it provides an open and free framework with specific tools for the backend of our application. More specifically we will use the cloud service, the Orion context broker for user context, Object storage for storage of multimedia and Kurento for multimedia streaming.

column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY",B2B/B2C,5,0,YES,IN,Peter Frantzen ,"Rivers are getting polluted increasingly by plastic with extensive consequences for the health of the people. Therefore, the project idea is the establishment of a big public data bank. Researchers and scientists can put down on their results of the research in regard to the pollution of the rivers, the consequences on our climate and important actions to avoid such impurities. Also the Hamburg research and media ship ALDEBARAN will travel on different rivers to execute educational and research work in co-operation with the college for applied sciences Hamburg (HAW) and the environment tests bank (federal environment office). By the construction of a big international research network we are able, to collect all type of data and to make it available for everybody.

column1: An interactive website will serve as an information and exchange platform. On a map all pictures and videos which were taken in certain locations affected by impurity will be presented. The visualization of these data will improve the understanding of society that it is necessary to protect the rivers against pollution and that this is possible only together. With headquarter in Hamburg, this project will be made accessible primarily to citizens to demonstrate the importance of our waters (e.g., rivers and lakes). This is a crucial attempt for a smart city how to exist throughout the next years. In the course of bringing Europe closer together, the project is set up from the start to involve not only national researchers, but build up an international dialogue. ",Service provider,X,0,X,0,X,0,,Software,Spatial Information Management Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,X,0,"SME, Group of Entrepreneurs, Startup, Other",50000,bundesverband-meeresmuell.de

2235,Spee85,Spee,SpeedUp,Spain,ImmiGREATe,IACG,Calle Vicente Raga 3 Esc.2 P 2B ,0,0,3-5,0,NO,0,Carolina Zuniga Alvarez ,"Within the framework of the ImmiGREATe initiative, which aims to improve intercultural integration between immigrants and local citizens, we will develop an Arabic city guide for refugees in Germany.
The project aims the creation of a system to improve the quality of life of Arabic speaking refugees helping them to overcome the language barrier.

In a pilot project to be carried out in the city of L??neburg, with the support of the Leuphana University and the local administration we will develop a web and mobile application containing relevant information for the refugees translated into Arabic. We will follow an agile approach for the development and will involve the refugees directly on the iterative definition and testing development phases.

Moreover Arabic speaking refugees will support us with the collection of voice and handwritten samples in Arabic in order to improve the performance of an audio and visual recognition system that will permit to include in the future, a functionality for voice and hand written requests for the mobile application. One of the key factors of such a machine learning system is the quantity and quality of data used. Since the available data for Arabic is currently very limited and costly to acquire, we will combine this technical constraint with the currently urgent need of the refugees in Germanyto have an occupation and a means to be integrated in the German society

Refugees will participate actively on the definition and development of the system. In this way their current condition of not having a work permit is taken as the advantage of having the time to actively participate in the project. Working together in an intercultural team with the participation of German students will provide them additionally, the opportunity to learn about the way of working and thinking in the German society.

column1: 2238,Spee88,Spee,SpeedUp,Serbia,Micro Circuit Development,InsEct,39 Balzakova Street ,0,0,3-5,14,NO,0,Aleksandar Milinski ,"Agriculture and natural resources are continuously affected not only by market trends like the strong vulnerability of international commodity markets but also by environmental risks such as the weather, the local climatic and soil capabilities or the living beings themselves (insects, pests) residing and feeding in the soil or on the plants. The balance of these factors determine agricultural production and the livelihood of millions of people.

The agricultural production cycle is long-drawn, intervention possibilities are limited and must be initiated with the outmost care as they can ignite complex biological reactions and adverse effects. If the land is disturbed beyond a certain point the negative effects can be non-reversible or can only be corrected to a limited extent.
Insect traps are used for monitoring and reducing pest population. In most cases traps are based on pheromones or on sticky substances placed on a coloured surface
column2: the ƒ?§bateƒ?? is chosen according to the type of the pest: fly, roach, moths, etc. In order to act in the shortest possible time and to reduce monitoring costs, an integrated solution with camera, GPRS controller, solar panel and backup power supply will be developed and put in place with the aim of significantly improving the usage of insect traps. The pictures taken by the camera will be transmitted by the GPRS controller to a computer which has a specific software installed for insect monitoring. The algorithm will be based on registering the changes in the number of insects in the trap. The changes/results will be sent to a computer for monitoring which will enable the user to act in accordance to the pre-defined action plan. The algorithm is pest type independent and can be used for indoor and outdoor applications. FIWARE and cloud-use will make the application Future Internet compatible. ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 2239,Spee89,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Peppermind Projects,IoTEK,Telemannstr. 56 ,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),0,3-5,1,NO,0,Marius Schmeding ,"The Internet of Things Enterprise Kit (IoTEK) aims to provide a full-stack solution for the Internet of Things (IoT) including hardware to connect virtually anything.
It has two parts: a middleware and a universal hardware module.

The IoTEK embodies a universal communication protocol and a robust cloud infrastructure. With a web-based management console at its heart and a generic industry-grade hardware interface for sensors and actuators it enables companies to implement the IoT for their specific needs out of the box.
Our focus is on industry applications, where we see a new level of automation, efficiency, security, general productivity potential resulting in lower costs of production and lower energy footprint.
We enable IT providers and developers to concentrate on their clientsƒ?? needs
Todayƒ??s fragmented solutions make the development of IoT applications a time- and resource-consuming task.
With IoTEK, developers will be able to concentrate on their application needs, not on the peripherals such as physical or digital constraints of data dispatching, warehousing or security.
The fusion of sophisticated hardware and a top-notch software infrastructure is essential

We are already in discussion with one of the leading industrial telemetry manufacturers to bring their 15 years of experience in machine-to-machine (M2M) hardware development to the new era of a connected industry.
This IoT infrastructure is based on FIWARE modules (access control with Cygnus module, Publish/Subscribe with Orion Context Broker, visualisation / control with Wirecloud)
",Tech provider,,X,0,0,0,X,,Hardware,Integration Middleware,Application Development & Deployment,Integration and Orchestration Middleware,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column2: and neighboring countries who wish to outsource or optimize their services. This way they can expand and broaden their horizons.

column1: Consequentially, this will not only increase the job or business opportunities, especially in IT, in Germanybut also avoid brain drain. Germany, as many other countries, are missing talented web entrepreneurs and coders with skills. Further, the students, invited to study in the local universities, are lacking of business opportunities and internships. 2246,Spee96,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Silpion IT-Solutions GmbH ,MALR,Brandshofer Deich 48 ,0,0,100-249,1,NO,0,Thomas Stohl ,"Living conditions and the quality of life are changing. As cities are constantly on the move, they must become more sustainable, more efficient, and more resource-conserving due to increasing urbanization.

Information and communications technologies (ICT) are shaping urban development. An entire urban area can be equipped with sensors that make all their captured data available in the cloud. The result is a constant interaction between the city dwellers and the technology that surrounds them.

Our concept is to enable the inhabitants of a city to participate in its maintenance. With the help of an intelligent framework solution (mobile app), it is possible to easily and quickly document all types of problems or damage in public spaces, and forward that information to the appropriate authorities. The app automatically determines the exact location (geodata) and any additional data added by the person reporting the incident. Photos, videos, audio recordings, or text can be included in the documentation and used to help the appropriate agencies quickly identify a potentially unsafe situation. They can then send construction companies directly to the site to repair the damage. The citizens themselves are part of the technical infrastructure of their city.

City administration has generally not reached the current state of this technology. By enabling intensive collaboration between city authorities and citizens, this project will provide a simpler and user-friendly system for reporting damage in a city. ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

2247,Spee97,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,no ,Marinelitter,Georg-heck-Weg 6 ,0,0,6-10,14,NO,0,Sabine Wedemeyer ,"Numerous recent scientific insights show that both deep-sea and coastal waters and inland waters such as rivers and lakes are contaminated with waste and especially with plastic waste. Especially plastic particles are considered as potentially problematic in the environment in connection with bonded thereto pollutants and their potential accumulation in different organisms. The problem provides growing concern in the society. Therefor we will bring to live the Association Against Marine Waste. This Association will provide a national platform where scientists, but also the whole society researchers are able to upload their research results, pictures and films related to marine waste to a database to make it accessible for everyone. We want to build up a community to show their point of views and to animate people to joint actions (clean-up activities, networking events). The Association will coordinate all efforts to prevent marine waste nationally and internationally, since the waste in the sea knows no boundaries. With the help of FIWARE on a map all other similar associations and their activities, documented as pictures, videos or texts, shall be shown. Besides, the website will be also used to held web conferences, where everyone can participate and get the latest information and discussion on marine waste. With our platform all people living in Germanyor Europe should get an understanding of how important it is to protect and preserve our water and which consequences the pollution has for their own health. Based in Hamburg, this project helps especially urban inhabitants of Smart Cities to understand the importance of clear water infrastructure (e.g. oceans, rivers and lakes). A decidedly Smart City approach shows ways for urban living in the years to come. In the process of an europeanisation such associations shall be implemented in other countries around Europe in order to enter into a dialogue. ",0,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

2255,Spee105,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Global Green ,Nature_in_city_EU,H??gelstrasse 21 ,0,0,6-10,1,NO,0,Marina Schweikert ,"The change of the biodiversity is the most dramatic consequence of not lastingly action, especially in a smart city. It is definitely in the time to get a better awareness, a better education and feel more responsible for joint-actions towards the protection of the seas. People are closer connected with the sea and dependent than all think. Especially for a coastal town as a smart city, it should be of tremendous interest to take care of the ocean and its resources. That's way we want to execute research expeditions to generate contents about the biological variety. These contents will be first of all data about the variety, but also impressive pictures and videos of this beautiful living space. After several expeditions there will be comparison data and perhaps pictures and videos which should show to the people the effect of not lastingly act. With the support from the German French television broadcast station ƒ??ARTEƒ? there will be a multipart documentation of the expeditions and also connected to the ARTE multimedia platform ƒ??ARTE futureƒ?. In the course of that, these professional documentations should be integrated advertising-effective on a website and also in television. With the support of FIWARE we will make the topic also more attractive, interactive and clear for the whole society, so we will implement on a website a search engine system that makes it easy for the user to show all maps, pictures, videos, data and Wikipedia entries related to a specific search term. This interactive intention should move the people in the smart cities to the rethinking and clear up. The aim is after a test phase by the German media and research vessel ALDEBARAN to activate and to network research ships in all European coastal towns, which operate then exhaustive in Europe. We will also build up a community of international researchers, scientists and other people to also providing us with data, videos and pictures about biodiversity. 2256,Spee106,Spee,SpeedUp,Belgium,Natan Group BVBA ,NCF,Kievitplein 20 Building C Floor 12 ,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,4,2,YES,OUT,Aleksandr Natanelov ,"With Fruitania we aim to develop an interactive market and knowledge platform for fruit growers from a specific region. The current political crisis with Russia clearly illustrated the vulnerability of the fruit growers and their dependence on limited number of export countries. Due to the political sanctions, a significant number of fruit growers encountered strong difficulties in maintaining their business model and risk to go bankrupt unless they find new clients/markets.

Fruitania should enable fruit growers to enter new markets and find new clients. The digital platform will contain information (e.g. type of fruits, size of the company, history, export markets, target markets, ƒ??) about all the fruit growers from the targeted area (i.e. province of Limburg), contain regulatory information regarding export provisions to the various markets, specific market information regarding selected target markets, information on potential business partners (i.e. clients), automatic matching tool based on pre-defined criteria, etc.

Fruitania will offer also specific services to fruit growers and their potential parties. This service provision will make use of the existing networks established by Europe (e.g. European Enterprise Network) combined with its own service line.
Furthermore, Fruitania will take specific business development initiatives on a yearly basis targeting specific markets, products, etc.

In addition, to business driven initiatives Fruitania will also act as a catalysator for local fruit growers for innovation by bringing different stakeholders together (i.e. research centres, universities, public institution, etc).
Fruitania, growing together!
",Service provider,,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,Data Integration and Access Software,Application Development & Deployment,Structured Data Management Software,1,X,0,0,0,0

2257,Spee107,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,near2share,Near2share,Grossneumarkt 38 ,0,0,3-5,2,NO,0,Gunter Steltenkamp ,"People need communication and want to communicate (interact) with others.  But sometimes it is difficult to get in contact. For example when people are new in the neighbourhood or sometimes even after many years in the same neighbourhood, there¶ïs not enough confidence to interact with your surrounding. When is the perfect moment and what is the perfect place and the perfect topic to start talking...Near2share is the perfect solution because people just make a public offers in the bulletin board (e.g I do have a ticket for the  opera tomorrow, who wants to come?)   when someone answer, you think (my neighbour likes the opera and now we have something to talk about) it is the first approach for a united community. It is our goal to bring people together by facilitated sharing of knowledge, resources and activities in local surroundings.

We want to achieve this by creating a mobile app using services of FI-Ware. By geo-referencing the app shall connect nearby people e.g. neighbours or people that happen to be in the same area. Users can write messages on a virtual local bulletin board. This bulletin board can be seen by other users nearby (within defined local radius) in real-time. The users can read, write or comment on existing messages. For ease of search messages can be classified in different categories e.g. activities (sport, social, cultural), help and share, notices, giveaways etc. Activities or offers can be scheduled and are shown as calendar of local activities.

In smart cities of tomorrow social isolation and anonymous neighbourhoods will be overcome. Instead people easily are part of the social micro cosmos. With the virtual local bulletin board neighbourhoods grow together. Meeting for common activities and helping each other gets easier and sharing things will help to use resources more efficiently. 2258,Spee108,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,NubeFon Cloud Hosted PBX project,NFCHPBX,Meyerstr.149 ,0,0,3-5,0,NO,0,Juan Diego  Valenzuela Romero ,"Having an small business is all about being working 24/7, all about being connected to your potential customers.

We will help small businesses get better connected with its customers by an affordable yet simple virtual PBX (Private Branch Exchange) solution that will utilize the PSTN. We want to make small businesses look bigger, keeping the appropriated level of decorum and efficiency in its phone communications. Improving the communication between business and customer, optimizing the resources, is part of the smart city model filled up with smart citizens and smart businesses

NubeFon will be a cloud hosted phone system focused on small businesses. It will have a plug-and-play setup with all the features needed for small companies of any kind, in the early or mature stage. It will unifies all the existing phones and service providers previously contracted by the people involved on the business. This solution will be highly reliable due to the use of the PSTN and furthermore will not required extra equipment or infrastructure.

For developing our B2B we will make use of FIWARE platform. The FIWARE platform is useful for this project because it provides us with an open and free architecture with specific set of tool that we can uses for the backend this application. More specifically we will use Cloud infrastructure, Orion context broker, Keyrock, Wirecloud, SpagoBI, Security monitoring and Kurento.

2259,Spee109,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Resatur GmbH ,NIF,Silbersacktwiete 1 ,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,4,1,YES,OUT,Markus Schacht ,"Our target is on developing a notification and information function (NIF) which measures the movement of e. g. packages or the change of object conditions to inform its owners and to give them the possibility to steer the system in a way they want: The user can determine, who will be informed in what way. The NIF can be used as stand alone device for different household appliances (e. g. package boxes) in the Smart Home and Smart Cities context.

The NIF will be used for three different kind of use cases: First of all for products like our already existing package box (B2C), second as an after-market equipment for owners of letter- and package boxes (B2C) and other suppliers of letter- and package boxes (B2B), and third for service providers, using the IT-based platform of the NIF-system, to enhance it with their additional software services of smart home solutions.

The offered FIWARE-technologies are necessary to realize the software parts of the NIF-product and make sure that the hard- and software parts are ready to be connected with other services from different service providers. The NIF-software and cloud-based services will be open through FIWARE-GEs for our B2B-costumers to be connected with their additional software services. Additional to that, our database and software service will be ready through the open FIWARE-technology to be developed even further, when smart home solutions change in the future. column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY,B2B,6-10,0,YES,IN,Kai  Pohlmann ,"In 2011, the national ""Development Plan Ocean: Strategy for Integrated German Maritime Policy "" was set up by the German government. It was developed together with our team member Frank Schweikert. To support the plan, the German Ocean Foundation is under way to be launched. We will connect all relevant stake holders  and organizations woh deal with ocean topics in Germanyand Europe. We will help them to win assistance and support for their projects with the help of our time donation app that enables the inhabitants of smart cities to donate time for actions and projects. Our app will match their profiles and the distance to the point where support is needed for beach cleanings, campaigns, dives, flashmobs, repair actions etc.. Activists can accept such invitations and see on a map where they should go and what they are expected to do.

column1: The German Ocean Foundation will also take the role of a communication hub and as a representative communicating with governments. During the last 10 years, we have established a database of 12.000 activists, scientists and politicians. This will be helpful to establish contacts within the community. Together with them we will generate time donation plus ƒ??best in classƒ? images, videos, knowledge, social media content and campaigns..

The new startup is a result of a very successful series of conferences called ƒ??EU-U.S. Conference Series: ""Sustainable Oceans ""  which took place until last year in Lisbon. It brought together the European community of marine experts.

We will closely work together with many existing European initiatives like Future Ocean  or the Euromarine Network  as well as the EU fishery initiative Inseparable who we previously organized the launch event for. Without strengthening the maritime sector the EU would risk to lose 10% of jobs  in this sector. From our base we will develop our network to Nice, Amsterdam, Stockholm, Helsinki, Kopenhagen, Tallin. 2261,Spee111,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Open Energy Exchange,OEEX,Schimmelmannstrasse 16 ,Consumer energy & home automation,B2C,3,0,YES,IN,Tobias Linnenberg ," We envision an open-source low-budget hardware and software solution, using a smart-plug integrated into a virtual social network to enable people to run their home appliances when there is green energy production close to their homes. As we target a broad audience not accustomed to automation technology, the utilization shall be as simple as possible. Therefore we build upon well known techniques from social media platforms to establish the connection between the device, the user and the renewable energy plant supplying the power needed.

In contrast to social media based energy saving contests, which engage the user socially but do not interact with the power flow directly, the smart plug hardware contains sensors and a relay. Thus, fully automatic physical demand response can be accomplished, without the requirement of user interactions during runtime.
For doing so, the website of the Open Energy Exchange (OEEX) shows details of nearby generators and their operators in a facebook-style profile on a map, from which users select the preferred target.

As a bottom-up demand response innovation, we suggest to transfer the intuitive concept of ƒ??followingƒ?? from social networks to smart grids: a power generator publishes its energy generation measurements and consumers can choose a target to follow with their flexible loads, e.g. an electric vehicle can follow the ownerƒ??s or neighbourƒ??s solar panel or wind generator. The flexible loads then aim to balance some of the fluctuation in generation, thus increasing the tolerable penetration limits of fluctuating energy sources.

In contrast to Renewable Energy Certificates, which provide market segmentation and price discrimination but are prone to ƒ??greenwashingƒ??, the ƒ??followingƒ?? concept aligns the real power flows in the network, while giving the customer the chance to build up a personal relation to his preferred energy source and thus the energy consumed. ",Tech provider,,0,X,0,X,X,,Hardware,Data Integration and Access Software,Application Development & Deployment,Structured Data Management Software,1,X,0,Other,50000,oeex.org

2262,Spee112,Spee,SpeedUp,Portugal,AgroLusitania,OpenPD,"Alto de S??o Francisco, 19 ","AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",0,1,0,NO,0,M??nica Pedro ,"Pest and disease identification in plants is a common problem faced mostly by farmers with critical direct impact on production of food and consequently negative impact on the environment and eventually on human well-being trough the use of pesticides. The first step is to have a proper diagnostic preferably at an early stage. Pest and disease diagnostics are sought by farmers either by talking with each others, by calling a specialist or by sending plant samples to certified laboratories for analysis. Respectively, these ways seem to be ineffective, not be readily available (or not available at all) or take longer than needed.

OpenPD, an on-the-field and on-the-fly system for fast identification of plant pests and diseases, aims to provide a way to shorten the response time for a correct diagnostic of plant and crop pests and diseases by speeding up the process of identification. Supported by a database and a mobile app, users submit a digital photo of the affected plant part along with other relevant data and receive an answer leading to the diagnosis, coming from other users (general or specialists) or automatically by image interpretation and/or by a learning algorithm taking previous (positive) users answers. OpenPD will be reactive (usersƒ?? questions and answers) but also proactive (sending warnings and alerts to users) and will be structured as an open community model. Answers should be evaluated and users rewarded and ranked using a ranking pyramid model (evaluation by the users but also by the system). OpenPD will make use of at least 6 generic enablers from the FIWARE Catalogue and be integrated in FISpace. OpenPDƒ??s business model customer acquisition component will by supported by its Freemium model, strategic partnerships with public and private organizations, media partnerships and digital media plan. The monetization component will have its support on sponsorship, paid subscription fees and report generation from data mining the database as it grows.
",Service provider,,0,0,X,0,0,,Software,Enterprise Social Networks,Applications,Collaborative Applications,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

2265,Spee115,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Bundesverband Meeresm??ll e.V. ,Plarimar,Mottenburger Twiete 14 ,0,0,6-10,0,NO,0,Sandra Sch??ttner ,"Rivers, lakes and oceans are increasingly polluted with plastic litter and its residuals, with potentially detrimental consequences for human health. The vision for this project is to establish an international online database and network, in which scientists, public authorities, environmental organizations and other institutions involved in the monitoring and mitigation of plastic litter share their findings ƒ?? complemented with additional information relevant for public engagement. Set up in a clear, informative but also attractive manner, this website will serve as both research and outreach platform where all kinds of scientific and associated non-scientific data are collected, integrated and made publically accessible to experts and laymen alike. Core element of the website will be a special, interactive map through which different data, pictures, videos and lots of other relevant information about plastic litter and the affected aquatic systems can be accessed, visualized and directly used (e.g. via social media channels). By providing scientific data and additional information in a visually attractive and interactive way, this project seeks to improve societyƒ??s understanding of the plastic pollution problem in German and European aquatic systems ƒ?? and help spark ideas for possible solutions. Based in Hamburg, we will take public outreach one step further by sensitizing particularly urban citizens for the health and importance of their local river, lakes and coastline. This is a crucial aspect for a SmartCity like Hamburg which has the potential to further develop and endure during the coming years. Also the research and media ship ALDEBARAN will be involved in different plastic monitoring studies, in cooperation with the Hamburg University of Applied Sciences and the German Environmental Specimen Bank. Nevertheless, in the course of Europeanization, this project is mainly rooted the idea of fostering both the national and international dialogue. By doing so, the biggest challenge for companies is to build and identify executable ideas and especially ideas their customers want and buy in the end, as nowadays companies waste money and competitorsƒ?? advantage by having a product flop ratio of 70-90%. So far, no easy way exists to identify and integrate external resources, such as experts, customers or perspectives. PHANTOMINDS offers the solution - an online crowdsourcing community where the companyƒ??s clients together with talents and experts from the respective field of activity create the next innovations, i.e. digital products, services and business model innovations. PHANTOMINDS offers companies using their community or software/platform the possibility to develop ideas and innovation by using the perspective, expertise and knowledge from their community and/or within the company/client. To integrate experts including lead user and early adopter in the respective field of a company, we develop a ƒ??self learning algorithmƒ? to identify via data points (e.g. specific forums) these experts for the companies and their challenges. PHANTOMINDS provides the necessary surrounding to make the process fun, fair for the community and customer focused for the company by using an own developed method and incentive scheme. We believe in the power of our community, the customer centric approach and the success of co-creation. Therefore, we are an economic alternative for organizations to traditional consulting companies, agencies and offer a dialog with the client's customers and an access to a community with a great expertise and a high creative potential. 2267,Spee117,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,"COMPANY FOR PROVISION OF SERVICES, RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT NISSATECH INNOVATION CENTRE DOO, NI?ÿ ",Protector,Nordoststrasse 26 ,"Consumer health/wellness, HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES",B2B/B2C,5,6,YES,OUT,Ljiljana Stojanovic ,"Due to different social phenomenon and especially the ageing of Europe, there is an in increasing need for different types of caregiving services, esp. in a modern urban environment (Smart City), starting from rather simple tasks of observing some daily activities (e.g. controlling breathing of caretaker during walking), till detecting some critical behaviour of caretakers (e.g. falling down). Many of such services are based on various types of monitoring activities, like monitoring the vital parameters (e.g. measuring blood pressure regularly), monitoring the physical activity of caretakers (e.g. not to lay in the bed too long), monitoring the environmental condition (e.g. not to walk too long on a hot day), whereas most of them can be performed remotely. We argue that smart cities, as places where an enormous majority of caretakers live, have to provide a solid infrastructure for the realization of such caregiving services, especially through the provision of different types of information which are relevant for caretakers and their health status (e.g. microclimate condition, level of air-pollution, noise-level, etc.).

In this proposal we propose a mobile solution which will reuse the smart city information infrastructure for the provisioning of monitoring-based caregiving services based on a novel technology for hybrid complex event processing, partially implemented using FIWARE technology, which enables continuous personalized and proactive monitoring of caretakers, including alarming caregivers and families before some critical situation might happen.

The main goal is to increase the quality of life and safety of caretakers, but also their families who will be very interested in paying for such remote monitoring. The system will be provided as Solution as a Service, including a mobile app, server-side and web-portal parts, with the main revenue streams coming from subscription fees and advertisement. ",Tech provider,X,0,0,X,0,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,Other,50000,nissatech.com

2268,Spee118,Spee,SpeedUp,Spain,Pycno,Pycno,"Paseo Valdigna 18,  Puzol ","AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,3-5,1,YES,IN,Nahuel Lavino ,"At Pycno we are on a mission to develop tools that help farmers produce more and use less resources. Current methods of food production are unsustainable - humanity will need 100% more food to feed the 9bn population in 2050. We already suffer from shortage of land and water. Current practices have to be improved! Our first product is a wireless sensor network. The sensors are placed around the farm and stuck into the soil. They measure soil moisture, temperature, electrical conductivity, ambient temperature, relative humidity and solar radiation. Our software platform collects sensor data and generates farm specific actionable analytics and recommendations. 2269,Spee119,Spee,SpeedUp,Denmark,RateAbout ,RateAbout,nikolajgade 22 ,0,0,3-5,2,NO,0,Steffen Kirkegaard ,"RateAbout, your trusted advisor. The more you rate the better guidance you get. 2270,Spee120,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Gesellschaft zur F??rderung der Eigenvermarktung mbH ,REMA,"Gau??stra??e 136, Innenhof rechts ",0,0,11-49,2,NO,0,Lars Boettger ,"This project deals with the selling and renting of all kinds of properties and brings the considered parties together: brokers, vendors, tenants and purchasers. They all find a portal with transparent information of the markets in the different branches such as industrial, office rent, commercial, logistics, etc. It will be possible to see the agents related to a building. One building exists only once in the base. All other information is linked to it. Also requiring parties are listed but they have the possibility to give themselves an anonymous state. So any agent can suggest properties. This relation is only visible between those two, also if they start negotiating. In case of a notary appointment the property is marked as ""reserved"". The negotiating parties may conclude to not set the properties to ""reserved"".

The tool makes it easy for different brokers and their agents to do business together and agree on a percentage to share the commission. This portal shall make the relation between the parties and the properties transparent so the buyers or tenants are served directly and have all information required at once. Also they do not risk to pay twice. A map displays the location (if agreed to make publish or only for designated parties) and all relevant information about population, price development, crime statistics, employment, income, nationalities, etc. POIs and the distance also the time to reach them is displayed in the map. The map also allows to choose a section to filter for properties with certain criteria. Also the buildings may be presented in 3D, 360¶ø and including floor plans and furnished virtually if chosen. All properties will be available in the database, no one will be introduced by the agents, only new projects of changes may be applied ad we introduce after checking. The data can be added by the agents responsible for a property and the information will be marked by whom it was introduced or changed, as the agents may change. Price: 800ƒ?ª setup fee, 18,50 for the portal per agent. Another 18,50 for the marketing and administration including budget for advertising. Their own brand will be held high! 2271,Spee121,Spee,SpeedUp,Italy,RESET Italy,RESET,"via Nosadella, 31 ",Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,4,0,YES,OUT,Carlo Giannelli ,"The project aims at producing a significant energy saving in public and private outdoor illumination. Nowadays, in the night-time cities are constantly illuminated by street lighting
column2: from dusk till dawn, public and private lights enlighten streets, public gardens, parking, industries, etc. despite people actually spend time there. This results in a huge waste of energy due to the fact that during the night most of the time outdoor public and private places have very low frequency of human activities. This is especially true in suburban areas located at the edge of cities and in the country side where most of the social activities happens during the day.

column1: The goal of the project is to support a novel smart real-time lighting product, enlightening locations only if actually required. To this purpose, our product will recognize basic human activities, e.g., people walking, bike riding, and car driving, to dynamically change street lighting on/off status and intensity to fulfil the light needs. For instance, people crossing a street may require intense localized lighting to allow approaching cars to spot people in advance while bike riders could benefit from intense lighting where they currently are and soft lighting along the street in the direction of bikes.

The project will adopt low cost arrays of infrared camera to monitor target areas and detect any motion: whenever an infrared camera perceives a movement, it notifies the cloud-based system in charge of applying pattern recognition algorithms to detected the type of movement. Whenever there is no movements (or detected movement is not interesting, e.g., foliage movements due to the wind) overall street illumination is reduced by either decreasing light intensity or switching off (part of) light spots. We believe that our novel product will be highly beneficial in a wide set of environments, allowing to achieve huge energy saving in both public and private illumination areas. ",Tech provider,,X,0,0,0,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,0,0,Other,50000,stoorm5.com

2272,Spee122,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Folge 3 GmbH ,Reshin,Neuer Pferdemarkt 1 ,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,6-10,6,YES,IN,Christoph Fr??hlich ,"Reshin (http://www.reshin.org) is an online dashboard service to visualize arbitrary big data in a browser. The major objective of Reshin is to offer easy data analysis and monitoring tools to enterprise customers.
Reshin will be available either as a Software-as-a-Service subscription or as a binary license with annual fees.
Reshin's interactive dashboards allows users to explore and to monitor heterogenous data sets and input streams.
Dashboards can be kept private or can be made available to distinct users. They can even be made public under a permanent url.

Data can be uploaded manually as individual data sets or data can be continuously fetched from input streams like log files, shop statistics, sensor data from Internet-of-Things devices and so on. Datasources can be managed online in the browser. Adding and editing datasources can be done with a few mouse clicks.
An alerting sub systems notifies users when user defined thresholds are exceeded.
Data is kept safe and secure. Reshin is a european project and european ideas of data protection and privacy are an intrinsic element of its development.

Reshin is based on Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana, aka the ƒ??ELKƒ?-Stack, which is a popular open source search and dashboard solution. Currently ELK targets mainly developers and misses user management, data administration and data protection capabilities. Reshin will address these issues and thus enable enterprise customers to make broader use of ELK.

Reshin.org will enable stakeholders in Smart Cities to enhance performance and engage more effectively with their citizens. We believe that Reshin will help citizens, companies and civil servants to build knowledge from facts, to take well-informed decisions and to respond in general more effectively to changing circumstances. ",Tech provider,X,X,0,0,X,X,,Software,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,"SME, Group of Entrepreneurs, Startup",50000,folge3.de

2273,Spee123,Spee,SpeedUp,The Netherlands,FaustusTech,ReTreat,Van Hogendorpstraat 72E ,"Consumer health/wellness, HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES",B2B/B2C,3,1,YES,OUT,Simas  Jarasunas ,"The ReTreat bracelet is a wearable device that constantly measures, analyzes and displays userƒ??s emotions. The data generated by this all-day emotional tracking device provides users with a highly personalized treatment and feedback. Emotional records are also integrated with other types of data, such as current activities, location and agenda. First of all, the ReTreat bracelet connects its users to professional health care services. Depressed people often do not understand or clearly state their emotions. The bracelet also helps professional therapists to connect the dots between patientsƒ?? emotions and effective treatment. The big amounts of data collected enable the device to identify patient-specific emotional patterns, emotional triggers, and responsiveness to different types of treatment. The bracelet connects its user to private circles of friends and family based upon their location (GPS), availability and the particular relationship to the user (friend, family member, etc.). By understanding the location (and situation) in which its users are in, the bracelet provides the most effective treatment and feedback. Furthermore, integrating emotional data and using machine learning allows the bracelet to improve the suggestions over time and provide specialized advice the next time the user finds him or her in a similar situation. To sum up, Retreat bracelet enables its users to take control of their emotions and make happiness both tangible and sustainable. ",Tech provider,,0,0,0,0,X,,Hardware,Data Integration and Access Software,Application Development & Deployment,Structured Data Management Software,1,0,0,Other,50000,0

2274,Spee124,Spee,SpeedUp,Sweden,Safhet,Safhet,"Drottning Kristinas v?Ïg 73, Stockholm, Sweden(1307) ",0,0,3-5,0,NO,0,Magdy Abdallah ,"The purpose of the Safhet platform is to impact the renewable energy industry through a novel method of collaboration. While others applying to this call for proposals may have ideas about novel ways to participate in clean technology industries, Safhet instead aims to facilitate and accelerate the progress of others. We believe sufficient resources and talent are currently being applied to solve problems in the field of renewable energy. It is a top research priority in many countries. The opportunity we see, though, is that the potential of the internet has not yet been fully utilised in endeavours to drive progress. In essence, scientific journals, conferences and research groups serve to spread knowledge and thereby facilitate progress for the industry as a whole. Safhet will perform a similar function, but with far less words. By bringing more of peopleƒ??s most valuable thoughts online, Safhet will be a platform for collective progress that is more accessible, more efficient and more effective in facilitating technological advancements. 2275,Spee125,Spee,SpeedUp,Sweden,Spontano AB ,SBDRE,Gullmarsv?Ïgen 45 ,"ACCOMMODATION AND FOOD SERVICE ACTIVITIES, ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION, Consumer leisure/gaming",B2B/B2C,3-5,1,YES,IN,Ludvig Linse ,"Spontano is a smart city concept that aims to enable spontaneity in the live entertainment industry by providing personalised recommendations to users of what to do in the coming 48 hours, and allowing bookings with two taps on mobile devices. Graduated from the STING accelerator in Stockholm, the startup Spontano has been live on iOS and Android since fall 2014 and are now taking their product to the next level.

During a pre-study done summer -14, we learned that lack of relevance is a key blocker of spontaneous bookings in Spontanoƒ??s current service. Currently the service provides a curated list of events and activities happening in Stockholm. The challenge is to tailor the experience to each individual userƒ??s preferences, behaviour, location and demographics to show of only the most relevant events and activities available.

Through FI-WARE technology, Spontano is enabled to process large sets of data and construct a scalable, automated recommendations engine that will allow us to provide state-of-the-art relevance to each user. Already collecting heaps of data, the FI-WARE Cosmos platform enable us to build, test and deploy efficient big data methodologies without spending resources on own infrastructure.

2277,Spee127,Spee,SpeedUp,Spain,ESCUELA DE CIENCIAS INFORM?TICAS S.L. ,SCT,C/ Bernardo Mart?ğn P??rez ,0,0,3-5,18,NO,0,V?ğctor P??rez Tapia ,"SmartCulturalTourism is an interactive travel guide service that allows users to build their own unique tourism experience through different devices. ƒ??Plan, Enjoy, Rememberƒ?

The smart planner is STCƒ??s main feature. It offers the users the possibility to plan several itineraries taking into account different variables such as the length of stay, the amount of places users want to visit and public transport itineraries among other things.

Thanks to SmartCulturalTourism tourists will have quick access to their travel plans with just a click in their mobile devices. The itineraries generated by the smart planner will be downloaded as complete packs giving the possibility to consult them offline. The Active Tourguide Mode will be switched on when the user activates one of the routes.

Then STC app will guide the tourist through simple text and voice messages, notifications, videos or even with an Augmented Reality service. The downloaded itineraries and routes include the POIS selected by the user and also useful information about the places or services close to them. They will be shown as additional notifications (for instance, a place of interest near to the route scheduled will pop up a notification in order to inform the user). This notifications will not only respond to geographic context but also time information. This notifications will be triggered by geographic context and time information (for example, if it is lunch time SCT will pop up a notification to inform the user about nearest restaurants).
All this extra information is generated by SCT through an user experience algorithm that offers personalized suggestions for each user in a an unique and personalized visit experience.

Active TourGuide mode acts as a visit capturer as well. It captures the activity of the photo/video camera and recording applications besides POIS and itineraries usersƒ?? ratings. This will allow the users to create their own personalized memory book once they are back at home.

2279,Spee129,Spee,SpeedUp,Italy,Second Opportunity,Second Opportunity,Via Vallemiccina 35 ,0,0,3-5,1,NO,0,Simone Vellucci ,"The ƒ??recipeƒ? of Second Opportunity (2¶ø) is composed of different ƒ??ingredientsƒ? which are all prepared ƒ?? but, often, not accurately mixed ƒ?? in the big ƒ??potƒ? symbolising contemporary society: hectic, inefficient, shallow, but also dynamic, technological and sensitive to environmental and social issues, of which the public opinion is gradually becoming more conscious. The project idea rests upon 7 elements which allowed its conception, research and development:
1 .Data on food waste in all the links of the chain: from field to fork.
2. The decrease of Italian familiesƒ?? purchasing power due to economic recession.
3. Consumption reduction.
4. Consumerƒ??s growing interest in food traceability along the entire supply chain.
5. Public opinionƒ??s great attention in environmental and social issues.
6. The solutions offered by Internet of Things, its evolution and ever growing diffusion.
7. The constant and widespread diffusion of smartphones and, more generally, mobile devices.

These premises suggested the adoption of a tool that takes advantage of technology and public awareness of social and environmental issues, thereby meeting the needs of the consumer, who wants to save money, the retailer, who wants to reduce costs, and the environment, which demands eco-sustainable solutions.
2280,Spee130,Spee,SpeedUp,The Netherlands,Blom Computer Consult v.o.f. ,SeeBat WebForest,Vlinderstraat 15 ,"WATER SUPPLY
column2: SEWERAGE, WASTE MANAGEMENT AND REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES",B2B,3-5,27,YES,IN,Ed Blom ,"Fit a sensor (IoT) in a waste-container that reports the filling (by volume) of this container every day to a central server.  Depending on the filling of all containers, the planning department can calculate the shortest route to efficiently empty the containers.

column1: Because the filling is known on forehand, the planning knows how many containers can fit into one truck. This is especially useful if the waste-containers are spread all around the countrie(s).
This sensor-device (SeeBat) is an Internet of Things device that uses GPS to report its position and a tilt-sensor to record when it is emptied.
The communication is done by GPRS/GSM.

A history of filling and emptying is maintained in the central server. This central server is called the WebForest. This is an analogy of the SeeBat sensors being the trees in the forest. The collecting of the waste containers can be seen as harvesting the trees (SeeBats)
The WebForest website is the central place where all the information is displayed, stored and calculated.
",Tech provider,X,0,0,0,0,X,,Hardware,Logistics,Applications,Supply Chain Management (SCM) Applications,1,0,0,Other,50000,computercursus.com

column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY,B2B,5,0,YES,OUT,Haydar Biyik ,"SENS-O-COPTER is a long endurance UAV (Unmanned aerial vehicle, Multicopter) designed to acquire and deliver multiple sensory data in situations and areas where manned inspection is too costly, dangerous or even not possible. The gathered Data will be stored in the cloud. The UAV and the sensor-unit are based on open-source Hard- and Software to keep the development time low and to benefit from proven designs. The system will be tailored to our special needs: rain and snow resistant, long endurance, flight time up to 90 min, long range, up to 50km (one way), easy handling and high level of automation and safety.

column1: The gathered data (temperature, air pressure, height, GPS position, air quality, hydrogen sulphide, magnetic field, UV-, visible-, NIR- and IR-camera, radioactive level) will be sent over WLAN/LTE modem/Laptop-Base-Station into the cloud to store the data. The user can use a web interface (PC/Mobile Device) to display the processed data on a map. The data will be processed and combined with the GPS and time and displayed on a map.

Possible applications: Environmental monitoring, air quality, emissions, contaminated areas, radioactive levels, gas leakages, civil protection, weather data, vulcan research, natural disaster, mobile network signal strength, quality control, documentation purposes. 2283,Spee133,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Sentibar,sentibar,Lippische Str. 29 ,PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND DEFENCE
column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY,B2B,5,0,YES,OUT,Ulrich Schoof ,"Smart Cities are powered by information streams. The jobs of many people rely on accurate and timely information about opinions ƒ?? among them product developers and business developers, journalists, researchers and politicians. Yet, there is no one place that provides the latest information about public opinion easily, valid and fast. The mission of sentibar is to close that gap. sentibar uses smart algorithms to collect information about opinions and attitudes from surveys and opinion polls. The Minimum Viable Product (MVP) is a news aggregator that provides external links to survey results. Listening closely to user feedback we will gradually add features towards creating a proper data hub. The data hub offers users access to survey results and to complete data sets. Interactive visualization and reporting are further features that improve the user experience. The vision is that we enhance data quality, provide data access and therefore improve the opportunities for action of citizens.

column1: But sentibar does not stop there. We are passionate about surveys and we want to reveal hidden information. Users provide us with their interests so that we can deliver tailored information products. We see who is interested in the same topics and we can use this information to connect people with the same interests, building powerful knowledge clusters for Smart Cities around opinion data. Eventually, an international survey data base enriched by user interaction data is a unique treasure trove of information. It allows us to identify patterns, build better and new products. And we can share this knowledge with research institutions who are in turn interesting partners for us.

This proposal lays the foundations for our larger endeavour. Some generic enablers are used for the MVP, while CKAN allows us to leapfrog and quickly reach the stage of a data hub. We will also explore how SpagoBI can be used in connection with CKAN to provide additional features such as generating reports. ",Service provider,X,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,Data Integration and Access Software,Application Development & Deployment,Structured Data Management Software,1,0,0,Other,0,sentibar.com

2285,Spee135,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,Shipulate,Shipulate,Isestr. 63 ,"BUSINESS SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION AND STORAGE",B2B,5,0,YES,OUT,Dennis Clavier ,"Our project aims to make the communication between raw material traders (shippers) and ship-owners (i.e. transport providers) easier, consequently increasing efficiency and effectiveness of maritime transportation.
By finding more suitable cargoes, the ships can increase their capacity utilization by reducing their idle time.

Presently much of communication is done by email in nearly standardized formats (often called circulars), giving details of a cargo-, the origin- and destination-, the time of shipment- and some other common terms. The short and relatively standardized format derives from times when the telex was the major technology used.
Business between cargo (Charterers) and ship (Ship Owners) is mostly done via intermediaries (Brokers) who will not simply share all their market information with the rest of the world.

We want to create a platform that allows users (Charterers, Ship Owners and Brokers) to allocate ships and cargo in a much easier way. At the same time users remain in full control about who they share their information with.

Employees at all three company types (Brokers, Charterers, Ship Owners) spend hours each day just scanning through these ƒ??circularsƒ?? and still often the optimum allocation between cargo and ship is not found due to lack of information. Ideally our platform can reduce work-load-, carbon emission produced by merchant ships and costs for raw materials for the end user.
",Service provider,,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Logistics,Applications,Supply Chain Management (SCM) Applications,1,0,0,0,0,0

column2: COMPULSORY SOCIAL SECURITY,B2B,4,0,YES,OUT,Sabine Tabrizi ,"When we are looking at today's society, we observe growing gaps between social classes. In Germany, journalists speak about 1.6 million kids (aged under 15) living in poverty. Other European countries show similar numbers. The EU study in 2006 had shown a total of 19 million kids in Europe living under the poverty line. It seems essential for us ƒ?? especially in a highly developed nation and/or union ƒ?? to take over social responsibility for these circumstances in order to improve these figures.

column1: Thus, we thought about the possibility to establish an IT-based charity system allowing an intelligent contribution of used goods in good condition (donations in form of clothes, toys, furniture - not older than three years): ƒ??Recycle with Loveƒ? became our motto in order support kids and families in need.
Therefore, we developed the idea of a ƒ??modern, multifunctional charity platformƒ?
a) meeting the needs of a modern social-driven thinking (ƒ??social/charitable networkingƒ?),
b) allowing to connect social strata,
c) streamlining social engagement on a nationwide basis in the beginning and pan-European in the future
d) developing - as a positive side-effect ƒ?? new ways of a employability and decentralised warehousing (warehouse networking concept).

Our project addresses different target groups to guarantee a nationwide coverage, i.e. our system includes databases for socially deprived families (private households), institutions working on the private-public sector (prisons, women's houses etc.) and last but not least those families contributing into the system. 2289,Spee139,Spee,SpeedUp,Germany,SmartCityKids,SK4HH,Eichenstra??e 52  ,0,0,3-5,0,NO,0,Hanno Tietgens ,"SmartCityKids: Enter Now.

Smart Cities need Smart Kids. But in Germanyand other European countries, the public school system does not encourage and enable each kid to explore and develop all of their 21st century skills. When it gets to digital media literacy, basic coding skills and an understanding of computer sciences, most German schools lag behind
column2: only weeks ago, the international ICILS 2013 study has made this very clear.

column1: There is no lack of ideas. There is no lack of initiative. There is, obviously, a lack of willingness and knowledge on the side of those who decide on budgets, curricula, and the education of educators. And there's a lack of impact on the side of those ready to make a change.
1.	Digital Media Literacy must become a part of the official curricula of public schools.
2.	Learning (and teaching) should be vastly improved, adding the richness of interactive digital media.

Using FIWARE and starting in Hamburg, we will create SmartCityKids, an innovative technical platform to connect people, projects, products and places. This includes an inspiring knowledge-base with mobile outreach, accessible both in the physical and in the digital world. As a result, we will help to grow and support a strong community of kids, teachers and other stakeholders, ready to transform the classroom into a better place:
More fun. More engagement. More individual challenge and support. More productivity and learning success. More time for teachers to interact with their kids. In short: More 21st century skills.
