2633,FABu38,FABu,FABulous,Denmark,Meshify ApS,Meshify,"Valdemar Holmers Gade 40, 1.","BUSINESS SERVICES, Consumer DIY/design, MANUFACTURING",B2B/B2C,3,1,YES,IN,Erik Andreassen,"Meshify is a cloud-based design service, which converts a user uploaded solid CAD file into a 3D printable mesh-like lattice structure. The user either downloads 3D-printer ready sliced files, or orders the manufactured part directly at partnering print service providers.

Initially, the web interface allows the user to customize the lattice structure by adjusting parameters such as knot density, typical rod length, rod thickness, regularity etc. Later, the web interface will be coupled to advanced state-of-the-art optimization algorithms, which will assist the user in designing optimized lattices for specific requirements.

To shorten the time to market, the service will use FIWARE. Meshify requires a web-based 3D user-interface (UI), cloud-based management of resources, and a webshop interface. These can all be translated into FIWARE enablers. In SML1, the UI will be implemented based on a FIWARE generic enabler from the category ?Advanced web-based UI?. In SML2, the scalability of the solution is assured by using the enablers in the category ?Cloud infrastructure?. In SML3, a webshop is attached using the enabler Store-WStore.

The impact of Meshify will be profound. The standard version targets two segments. On one side, designers and artists who wish to create designs with complex geometry and surface conformal lattices, which cannot be handled by today?s CAD software. On the other side, consumers searching cost reduction opportunities. Both groups will benefit from significant reductions in manufacturing cost and time, as less material needs to be printed. The pricing of the service will be based on pay-per-use, thus removing up-front investments.

The advanced version of Meshify maximizes the utilization of printed material. This version is aimed at industrial manufacturers of advanced products ranging from lightweight aerospace components to advanced mechanical filters. Performance is improved, even more material is saved, and the cost is further decreased.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Output Management Tools,System Infrastructure Software,System Management Software,1,X,0,SME,18000,meshify.dk

2634,FABu39,FABu,FABulous,Italy,MathFem S.r.l.,MF3DP,"Via dei Canonici Renani, 6 40033 Casalecchio di Reno (Bologna) - Italia","BUSINESS SERVICES, Consumer DIY/design, MANUFACTURING",B2B/B2C,4,6,YES,IN,Christian Carestia,"MathFem3DP is a cloud-based web app which allows both industrial (manufacturing companies, R&D centres, design studios) and private (makers, hobbyists, online shop owners) users to perform Computer-Aided Engineering (CAE) analysis on CAD models before 3D printing (3DP), with the help of an easy-to-setup meshless solver and a user-friendly interface which guides the user step-by-step during the analysis process.
The main objectives of the project are:
?to propose an innovative use of 3D printing technologies in the industry
?to democratize the CAE and 3DP industries, making every user able to perform a CAE analysis and print the part in an accurate way
?to validate material properties and generate a large 3DP material database.

The application backend features a proprietary meshless algorithm (already developed) which allows the user to import any type of CAD model and analyse it without any mesh: anyone who wants to produce a 3D printed item will reduce risks of premature failures.
Our web-app provides an easy to use interface which guides the user during the process
column2: he will also be informed about component's weight, real-time pricing and manufacturing warnings.

column1: Being cloud and web-based, there are no compatibility problems for different OS neither the need for dedicated infrastructures which are usually required for CAE simulations.

The service will make use the following enablers: 3DUI-WebTundra and 3D-UI-XML3D (visualization), realXtend implementation (collaboration), Key Rock GE and Access Control-THA (security),Object Storage GE and FI-Lab Cloud.
The benefits for the FIWARE ecosystem are: release of an open-source plugin (neutral CAD file import) for realXtend Tundra server, contribution to testing of enablers
column2: promotion of the FIWARE ecosystem.

column1: Industries will reduce costs due to an innovative use of 3DP. Private users will increase awareness towards 3DP capabilities. A large number of 3DP users will help to reduce services and materials' costs.",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,0,0,,Software,Mechanical Computer-Aided Engineering,Applications,Engineering Applications,1,X,0,Startup,18000,mathfem.it

2636,FABu41,FABu,FABulous,Spain,BIB,OrtoLab,"Landako Elkartegi, Of. 101 - Avenida Landako, 4 - 48200 Durango (Spain)","HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES, MANUFACTURING",B2B,6,7,YES,OUT,Francisco Javier Finez Rat¢n,"Orthopaedics, podiatrists, physiotherapists and related health services are nearly artisans producing prosthesis, orthesis (P&O) or insoles: plaster the body area or tape measuring, cast a mould, extract the positive and manual fabrication or milling of the part. This old fashion way of working is time consuming, cost-inefficient and causes many inconveniences to patients.

Ortholab aim is to produce advanced scan and manufacturing solutions to the P&O and insole sectors by connecting ICT advanced services to the FIware assets, specifically to visual, rendering and 3D printing facilities.

Thus, Ortholab innovation lies on the technological revolution that will allow redefining the obsolete way of doing things by introducing digital technologies and services that will significantly reduce time, cost and hassle for patients while giving a face-lift to a sector that nowadays is still semi-handcrafted.

With Ortholab solution orthopaedists or physiotherapists will be able to take digital information (photos or videos) of the patient body part that need P&O or insole (upper or lower stumps, feet, body slings, etc.). Building on already existing FIware generic enablers (GE) such as 2D/3D Capture, it will be possible to produce customized 3D models of the body part that will save many of the intermediate processes traditionally incurred (casting of moulds, extraction of positive part) and finally by using the 3D printing technology, it will be possible to produce the semi-concluded parts that will be shipped back to the professionals that will make the finishing touches needed to personalize the product to the patients? requirements.

The impact of Ortholab in the P&O and insole sectors will be high since health professionals will not need to make huge investments on gadgets (manual scanners to obtain cloud points of the body part) or milling machines to shape the product. Instead, all these cost and time consuming processes will be done based on FIware GEs and 3D printing.

2637,FABu42,FABu,FABulous,Spain,Eslite Learning,P2Print,Loramendi, 11, Mondragon (Gipuzkoa)","Consumer education/culture, MANUFACTURING",B2B/B2C,7,5,YES,OUT,Janire Villa Andr‚s,"European society is suffering a serious social problem around unemployment, specially affecting young people, who are being unable to access jobs for lacking the industry specific skills and experience that companies request. In this same context, European manufacturing SMEs are facing serious difficulties to access funding and qualified professionals, which has turned into a diminishment of their R&D capacities and a consequent deterioration of the competitiveness in the international scene.

Similarly, disruptive technologies such as 3D printing, have lately suffered a process of democratization thanks to a tangible cost reduction, but still miss a process of normalization through education and training to make them accessible to the mainstream industry and professional network.

Eslite Learning aims to fill this opportunity gap through the P2Print platform: a virtual meeting point around product design innovation, where different stakeholders of the 3D printing field could meet, share and collaborate between each other. This 3DP ecosystem would offer an affordable mechanism and funding facilities for R&D processes to the manufacturing SMEs, and increase employability and entrepreneurship opportunities for young professionals by offering them training itineraries based on industry required competences. P2Print will create a social network based on the collaborative culture and peer-to-peer learning that will evolve and adapt to the user needs thanks to the FIWARE open-source technologies.

column2: 2) Community that consists of profiles, firstly of manufacturers/sellers of 3D materials, secondly of buyers, thirdly opinion leaders/ bloggers who provides rating for materials. Different statistics will be available for registered users
column3: 3) Crowd sourced materials R&D where initial ideas for new 3D materials will meet with the Community and potential sponsors to develop new 3D materials.

column1: It is the right time to jump into the 3D printing materials market. It is estimated that the 3D printing materials market could hit 1 billion USD mark in the next five years (http://goo.gl/Bs7h3l). In addition there were roughly 33 000 3D printers shipped in the third quarter of 2014 alone (http://goo.gl/pnPg4h). 73% of these printers will are hobby class (under 10k USD) and those will quite a bit of standard plastic material. The largest producer of 3D printers Stratasys, launched its lowest scale 3D printer on Amazon (http://goo.gl/hqaaZK), which subsequently means that the large companies which have been locking their material supply chains, will be opening some of them up soon. We hope to disrupt the market with currently non-existent high level of 3D printing material sales platform. It will employ the following enablers from FI-Ware: Marketplace - SAP RI, Revenue Settlement and Sharing System and Identity Management ? KeyRock enablers.

2639,FABu44,FABu,FABulous,Poland,Entrepreneur,Printify - online 3d printing,Piramowicza 9, 90-254, Lodz",Consumer DIY/design,B2C,4,4,YES,IN,Tomasz Cichowicz,"Printify is a global, open marketplace and e-commerce platform for 3D printing services. It connects people who would like to 3D print with 3D printing services providers. We bring the 3D printing industry to the e-commerce world by supplying a platform that caters for customers and 3D printing service providers. Printify targets global market thanks to multilanguage, multicurrency support and compatibility with internal and cross-border taxation policies.

For customers Printify is a first central place for their 3D printing needs. It is where all suppliers are, quotes are received immediately and orders can be placed without hassle. It is as easy as online shopping ? just upload the design, set the order criteria and Prinitfy will automatically search for compatible suppliers.

For 3D printing service providers Prinitify is an e-commerce platform and additional sales channel. It helps them acquire new customers and, what is more important, automates the whole quoting and ordering process. 3D printing service providers will use Printify to automate and streamline business processes related to 3D printing and increase the scale of their business.

Printify is free for customers who only need to pay for the printing service itself. Suppliers of the service have the choice to use one of two plans: Open ? in which they register their services in the open marketplace
column2: and Professional which enables them to use the platform as a SaaS. We wish to further develop our project by improving already existing features and introducing new functionalities. In relation to FIWARE technology our project will focus mostly on Advanced Web-based User Interfaces that will ensure the platform offers more flexibility and improves user experience. Taking into account these factors plugins including advanced display of 3D models and managing spatial data are required: the POI Data Provider GE and 3DScan, Collaborative 3D Web Viewer or Cloud Rendering.

column1: Website: printify3d.net, printify.pl",Service provider,0,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Marketing,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,X,0,0,0,0

2640,FABu45,FABu,FABulous,Israel,Entrepreneur,Pzartech,POB 23474\nTel Aviv 61590,MANUFACTURING,B2B,2,1,YES,IN,Jeremie Brabet-Adonajlo,"70% of the manufacturer considers that obsolete spare parts will be provided through 3D printing within the next 3 to
5 years and 57% consider that it?ll be the case of the after-market spare parts. This would not only simplify
manufacturers? logistic but it would also raise their customers? satisfaction. Pzartech aims to tackle this opportunity.
To do so, Pzartech offers a service combining a 3D designs marketplace and a printing platform into a one-stop-shop.
Our initiative innovates in several directions.
Firstly, technologically wise, we're developing algorithms that check that the design is suitable and optimized for 3D
printing. We strive to optimize the 3D files to reduce the printing failure rate and provide our customer with the
highest item quality.
Then, marketing wise, we?re building a user friendly platform. We focus on a clear vertical: plastic spare parts. We?re
building partnership with existing POS networks to integrate 3D printers their shops. The goal is to offer a local high
quality service for the mass market.
One of the core features of our platform is protection of the Intellectual Property (IP) of the 3D files.
Industrial partners are interested to monetize their designs and receive a pay-per-print revenue each time someone 3D
prints their designs, but they are concerned with their IP being leaked. Therefore, we implement IP protection
solutions for each layer of our service.
We implement a ?degraded? viewer for the customer-facing interface that shows to the user a ?preview? of the file to
be printed at only a few selected ?critical? angles.
As administrators and reviewers of the uploaded content, we need a 100% fidelity rendering of the 3D file preview,
that would let us rotate it, move it, zoom it to see each and every little detail.
It is critical for us for quality insurance processes, and to monitor that our users are not infringing the Terms of Use
of our website.

Therefore, 3D-UI-XML3D GE is a particularly relevant to us.",Service provider,0,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Marketing,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,X,0,Startup,18000,pzartech.com

2641,FABu46,FABu,FABulous,Austria,Fluidforms,ReDo-3D,"Don-Bosco-Weg 10c, 8053 Graz","Consumer DIY/design, MANUFACTURING",B2B/B2C,5,10,YES,IN,Hannes Walter,"The overall goal of the ReDo-3D project is the development of a B2B(2C) Platform and the related applications and services for (Re-)Manufacturing of customizable Real Objects based on 3D scanning data by addressing the following specific objectives:
? development of a service concept for (re-)manufacturing of real objects and prototypical implementation of a service demonstrator together with relevant industry partners,
? evaluation of the 3DP service/app demonstrator in a field trial and elaboration of suitable business models
? Integration of FIWARE technologies for smart re-use of existing Future Internet infrastructure and enabling advanced 3D printing scenarios in the manufacturing domain.
According to the evaluation framework the project results will be evaluated based on trials with respective industry partners within two use cases (which have been pre-defined at proposal stage).
? Use case 1: Manufacturing of personalized eyewear/hearing aids
? Use case 2: Remanufacturing of production components/?real 3D objects? (e.g. fixing forms)

The main innovation capacity of the project is twofold: On the one hand side it uses an innovative meta designer module based on GML - generative design of procedural shapes. On the other hand the project creates a platform reusable for a broad diversity of B2B services, as illustrated by the two use cases ? from ?medical?/AAL product customization to remanufacturing of spare parts in industry,

The ReDo-3D project intends a maximum ?re-usage? of FI-WARE GE, FITMAN SE and FITMAN platforms within the development of the ReDo-3D platform and the use case related services according to the specific application partners` requirements and the results of the general feasibility analysis.

The ReDo-3D project focuses on the enlargement of business opportunities in the B2B and 2B2C sector for Fluidforms with the clear goal to develop marketable services/apps for 3D scanning and printing in the manufacturing domain.

,Tech provider,0,0,0,X,0,0,,Software,Mechanical Computer-Aided Manufacturing,Applications,Engineering Applications,1,X,0,SME,18000,fluid-forms.com
2642,FABu47,FABu,FABulous,Germany,INDMATEC,SAMGO,Kanalweg 154,Consumer DIY/design,B2C,9,1,YES,OUT,Jochen Zimmer,The main goal of this project is the development of a service based web platform, where customers can easily create 3D models from existing objects and directly send an order for 3D printing. SAMGO could be described as an online copy shop where users can scan and print 3D copies of almost every object.

To generate a 3D model of the object, different sensor systems will be supported for acquiring the necessary data. The SAMGO web platform is aiming for easy to use sensors like digital cameras, smart phones and gaming console sensors, which potential clients may already have at home. Uploaded data are automatically processed and converted into 3D models while the web platform offers several tools for optimizing these models for 3D printing. SAMGO also provides a 3D printing service, which enables customers to directly order a 3D printed version of their created model.

Realizing SAMGO, several FIWARE Generic Enablers (GE) and Specific Enablers (SE) will be utilized. In particular the 3DScan SE, provided by FITMAN, will be used for 3D visualisation of point clouds and meshes. Furthermore, the SAMGO platform will benefit from 3D file storage management tools which are included in the 3DScan SE. SAMGO will also provide user authentication using the Identity Management ? KeyRock (GE). Processing the large amounts of data, the SAMGO back-end will profit from the BigData Analysis ? Cosmos (GE). In order to handle the connection of different sensor types, the Backend Device Management ? IDAS (GE) will be favourable. The FIWARE Store ? WStore (GE) is suitable to implement the SAMGO web shop.

The major innovations of the SAMGO web platform are found in covering the entire process from data acquisition to 3D printing in a unified web portal. In particular, providing a common interface for different low-cost sensor devices and the development of innovative algorithms for data processing and model optimization are expected to lead to a significant impact on the consumer market.",Service provider,0,0,0,0,X,X,,Software,Consumer application,#N/A,#N/A,1,X,0,SME,18000,indmatec.com

2643,FABu48,FABu,FABulous,Spain,SmallSignals,shusfuss,"Iris 23 bajo, 02005 Albacete",Consumer DIY/design,B2C,3,2,YES,OUT,Nera Gonzalez,"From children to adults the need for fancy costumes will be always in great demand. Also DIY communities grow and grow everywhere. However not everybody has the skills, even more at the beginning. Another burden for amateurs is the high costs of the hobby tools.
In this project we focused on DIY costume pattern design, allowing users take part on the parts of the project where they feel comfortable and, of course, get their costume.

Shusfuss is a community as well as an app to create clothes, masks and accessories using fabrics and 3D Printing. Through the app, users will be able to create new designs, share them and combine with pre-existing designs. Our main differentiation is the use of parametrical patterns that fit perfect to the user?s body measurements and customize the accessories. Once the pattern is finished, users can print himself or order it in Shusfuss webpage. Shusfuss will provide 3D and 2D patterns in digital format as well as 3D printed accessories, 2D printed patterns, cut fabric pieces and assembled costumes.

The architecture of this project is based on FiWare. 2D and 3D models will be stored on the Cloud Storage. User interface will be created using widgets on Wirecloud. Store will be based on WStore. Offers will be composed by resources published on Cloud Storage. Manufacturing will be managed by an application based on FITMAN SE. ",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,0,0,,Software,Consumer application,#N/A,#N/A,1,X,0,SME,18000,shusfuss.com

2644,FABu49,FABu,FABulous,Germany,Solify,Solify,"Gussmannstr. 30, 01217 Dresden",MANUFACTURING,B2B,4,1,YES,OUT,Benjamin R„tz,"The SOLIFY Project will utilize FIWARE technology to create the first comprehensive web service for 3D-printed spare parts. Built on a Cloud-based framework of 3D/CAD technology, an innovative user interface will allow users to search and customize 3D-printable CAD designs. Co-operation with professional partners in the manufacturing industry in spare part delivery, customer support and product development will provide consumers with the spare part they need, at any time and any place. Strictly lean and engineered towards sustainability, the SOLIFY Project will revolutionize the traditional aftermarket supply chain for spare parts towards a more efficient, economical and eco-friendly business. In its entirety, the SOLIFY Project comprises:
- an online database of 3D designs,
- a cloud-based software layer with 3D modification and rendering capabilities,
- a 3D-UI that allows users to display and modify the 3D designs in the database via the software layer,
- a 2D-UI which integrates the 3D-UI into an innovative online community to crowd-source new 3D designs of spare parts, and

- an online shop system to manage dispersion of 3D printing files or, alternatively, print-and-deliver orders.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Collaborative Product Data Management,Applications,Engineering Applications,1,X,0,SME,18000,solify.de

2645,FABu50,FABu,FABulous,The Netherlands,th3rd,TH3RD,Johan Huizingalaan 763a,"ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT AND RECREATION",B2B,4,1,YES,OUT,Rudo Bisschop,"Th3rd is founded in 2014 in order to explore the opportunities of 3d-scanning and quickly turned in one of the first 3d-scan studios in the Netherlands and the biggest in the world (136 DSLR cameras). Th3rd is using photogrammetry technology to scan people and animals for a multitude of print and digital purposes. By acquiring a 360 degrees of data instantaneously the studio achieves high accuracies, depth of color, true pixel-to-point registration and allow for the scanning of animated postures.

In this project the objective is to develop an integrated software solution to create realistic 3d humans for Illustrations, Animations, Games, measurement (clothing/body measurement/medical) and of course the main purpose print. The processing time for artist will be greatly reduced, quality increased and the number of final applications for the scan increased. The end result is a 3D point cloud processing software solution with use of meshing algorithms. The models will be ready to print on the latest industrial printers. Once we reduce the processing time for each scan, we could integrate a platform for scanned models, where artists from each application that uses 3D models can offer their skills. Such a platform, built with and combined with FIWARE could boost the use of 3d scans, prints and all other applications within Europe and boost productivity within a fast growing sector.

2646,FABu51,FABu,FABulous,Italy,THINGARAGE,THINGARAGE,VIA GIOVANNI GIOLITTI, 34","Consumer DIY/design, MANUFACTURING",0,5,#N/A,NO,0,Antonello Balestrieri,"Thingarage is a web portal that offers to companies services for creative and technology innovation (through crowdsourcing and thanks to 3D printing), and for users (product and industria designers) give the opportunity to work with International brands and companies, revolutionizing the R&D processes for the the manufacturing industry.

Thingarage was founded in December 2013 by Antonello Balestrieri (architect and product designer), Valentina Lauro (business developer) and Carlo Tomei (software engineer) , with the aim of becoming the market leader in 3D design on-demand and find new ways to revolutionize R&D (research and development) processes of the companies.
Companies that need to innovate their products, they can get them by Thingarage services, simply communicating which product they need, in how much time and how much is their budget
column2: on Thingarage website there are thousands of international designers specialized in 3D design, which will present to the client company numerous proposals for innovative design that will be evaluated by the company itself. Once chosen the favorite design, company pays the designer with the budget set previously and gets the 3D models and the technical drawings. The 3D models can be used for the production with numerically controlled machines (CNC) used in the companies manufacturing process, or used by 3D printers (desktop and industrial types) that are able to create prototypes aimed for testing and mechanical processes.

column1: Thingarage, in partnership with 3D Systems Europe and othereuropean 3D printing provider, can print the prototypes with the latest 3D printing technologies and send them to the companies.",Service provider,0,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Marketing,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

2647,FABu52,FABu,FABulous,Spain,Thopsh,Thopsh,"Jon Arrospide, 28 - 11? B. 48014 Bilbao","Consumer DIY/design, MANUFACTURING",B2B/B2C,4,1,YES,OUT,Javier Jes£s Bustamante Benito,"The Open Shoes is the first project ever for the creation of open source and modular shoes for the well-being of the wearer. Shoes have traditionally been considered a fashion complement when, in fact, they should have been considered a health complement. Many people have come to us to find relief for their afflictions, which were often the consequence of using inappropriate shoes.

Many people who do not use healthy shoes do so because of aesthetic concerns. They prefer to endure pain in their feet, their back or their joints rather than using shoes that do not agree with their aesthetic preferences.

When making shoes, the traditional way of considering a shoe as a whole unit leads to waste of materials. The Open Shoes concept implies making the shoes modular, dividing each shoe in three parts: The midsole (the most important part), the insole (which gives a better feeling to the soles of the feet) and the outer shell. One set with a full range of midsoles and insoles is enough to create all of our shoes. In that way we reduce significantly the use of material and resources.

The most important thing is for the midsole to be as customizable as possible, so that it can spread the pressure along the soles of the feet, absorb impacts, and adjust to each user according to their physical characteristics (mostly their height, the width of their feet and their weight). To do that a public repository will be created by means of repository-sap-ri. At the same time, designs will be made available to the general community in object-storage-ge-fi-ware-implementation, and users will be able to improve it by means of interface-designer. In this way, every user, by means of 3D printing, will be able to create their own midsoles and complement them with the necessary outer shells and insoles.

The goal is to improve musculoskeletal health, which lies at the root of many personal problems and high costs to businesses and the administration.",Service provider,0,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Content Management,Applications,Content Applications,1,X,0,SME,18000,theopenshoes.org

2648,FABu53,FABu,FABulous,Denmark,Entrepreneur,U3DP,"Blyt?kkervej 6, Sal 1, L3","Consumer leisure/gaming, BUSINESS SERVICES",B2B/B2C,5,1,YES,OUT,Hannes Becker,"Virtual reality will change the way how society will consume videos in the future. The U3D camera ball builds the bridge between virtual reality (VR) devices and the real world. Building a camera like this, means that a complete new media format will emerge that is able to contain and process more data. We believe, this format will become a new media standard and co-exist with formats like mp4. U3DP shall be the link between our camera and 3D printing and show people how easy it easy to apply 3D printing technology to create something useful.

U3DP is a crowdsourcing web-shop for 3D printing designs to improve the original camera and will be an extensive service to incorporate 3D printing technology to the existing offer. The best way to explain this concept is to see it as a combination of the GoPro camera (http://gopro.com/), VRJaunt (http://www.jauntvr.com/) and the 3D printing web-shop Sculpteo.com (http://www.sculpteo.com/). Potential to innovate either camera or platform can be found in both incremental and radical terms.

In the future, we want to test market opportunities to expand the utility of U3D to measure the distance of objects within the environment around the camera. That could become interesting for urban planners, architects or interior designers. With consideration to improve water and pressure resistance, it could even be useful for deep sea explorations. Generating input of the depth of space in combination with the possibilities of U3DP, could allow users to access the precise measurements of respective environmental settings in 3D and enable them to print them out.

Because U3DP is in its purest sense a web-shop, we need cloud storage, access and file management, and payment features. We found several front-end and back-end solutions among the FIWARE technologies that help us integrating core essential functions into the platform. The integration of FIWARE helps us to build a functional platform and cut costs.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,0,0,,Hardware,Marketing,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,X,0,Startup,18000,0

2649,FABu54,FABu,FABulous,Italy,Fablessy srl,Wop3D,"via della sapienza, 58 - 81030 Villa di Briano (CE)",Consumer DIY/design,B2C,4,0,YES,OUT,Saverio Diana,"Wop3D is a digital web store, whose purpose is to collect 3D printing models, either our creations or third party and
to sell them for a single use. Print will be carried on from the cloud, by streaming.
The strength of Wop3D lies in the innovative purchasing system: users can't buy any model, nor printable, nor
generic license, but just acquire the right to print once the required object. This system will free the designers from
costs in protecting their works, still having some sort of protection of intellectual property, hence assuring an
income chance. On the other hand, people interested in buying have a benefit from low, scalable prices that varies
depending on the chosen object and on the required quantity.
Wop3D will extensively use some of the Fiware technologies both in the Web Site (enablers for developing the
marketplace) and in the printing service (enablers connecting a network device to the cloud).
Such application could ease the spreading of 3D printing, since low prices intrigue buyers and incentive to try out
the service. In addition, printing a flawed model does not generate frustration. The limited time in which you get
the objects, associated with a wide range and competitive prices will affect the printer market, thereby enlarging
more and more the buying audience.
This system offers to the designer, for the first time, a concrete source of income associated to the modeling of
consumer objects. We trust that this possibility will attract a high number of designers, creating free competition
between them on the Internet Portal, raising the quality level of the proposed models. A successful portal will be
seen as a showcase, an opportunity not to be missed for beginners, for established professionals and even for the
ones who target a niche area of the market.",Service provider,0,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Marketing,Applications,Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Applications,1,X,0,SME,18000,fablessy.com

2650,FABu55,FABu,FABulous,Spain,Entrepreneur,3Diet,0,Consumer health/wellness,B2C,1,0,YES,IN,lea  Ingold Pradel,"3Diet is a project that consist of 3D printing different sets of containers for measuring food intakes during a diet. Based on rough and not exact proportions ( no exact weights, no calories counts possible), we try to preserve a healthy relation with food. Containers will allow customers to measure the amount of food they have to eat without worrying about weight or calories, making them going on diet easier. Those intakes will be determined by a study of the main diets, with a nutritionist help, and will be personalized for each customers, according to the kind of diet they follow and there calories/day intakes. As a result will have a set of measuring food containers specifically designed of customers needs. Combining the difference kind of containers you will be able to elaborate your diet meal in a very easy way.The work of the nutritionist will also help us to establish some safety parameters to ensure our platform will not be used in an unhealthy way. Containers will not only be customized for dietetic issues but also to match the taste of customers, turning a useful tool into a desirable and enjoyable gadget. To help this project, FIWARE technology will be used. 3D printing is the technology allowing us to make this proposal a real and cost efficient business. FIWARE makes easier the access to our products to a great range of customers, permitting it to be online on a safe, functional and modern platform.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,0,0,,Hardware,Mechanical Computer-Aided Design,Applications,Engineering Applications,2,X,0,0,0,0

2653,FABu58,FABu,FABulous,Spain,SIMAC Mundo Digital, SL",3DPMedical,0,HUMAN HEALTH AND SOCIAL WORK ACTIVITIES,B2B,0,0,YES,OUT,Miguel µngel Casanova Gonz lez,"We propose an innovative 3D printing platform as a service, confidential, secure and efficient, using 3D printing cloud-based services where all the stakeholders related to medical, dental, biological and healthcare industries form a new ecosystem. That PaaS will permit medical and healthcare specialists obtain 3D printed assets of their patients or medical devices prototypes.

They will be able to upload the big-data of CT, MRI or Ultrasound scans of their patients and control the parameters of the future 3D printed assets. The platform will store encrypted and secured big-data and meta-data of patient?s scans to guarantees his confidentiality but processed by the specialist, they can collaborate to show and edit models before process it with additive manufacturing. The platform will facilitate transactions between 3D printing manufacturers and specialist users that want to make 3D prints, choosing service providers by location, materials, 3d printer tech, price, end-quality, etc. to get their 3D models printed nearby or as soon as possible.
Using FIWARE and FITMAN technologies, we plan to build the reference 3D printing platform for healthcare sector.

Since every hospital and private clinic can?t get advanced metal, resin, laser-cusing? or innovative tissues 3D printers, this platform will assure, simplify and automatize the workflow of ?Personal Medicine?, from the captured disease patient scans to the 3D printed bone, knee, crown or dental bridge or even personalized glasses or esthetical pieces, guarantying confidentiality and professional work using our digital factory platform.

Bluemind Software S.R.L.,3DP-OPECR,0,MANUFACTURING, TRANSPORTATION AND STORAGE",B2B,2,11,YES,IN,Bogdan Alexandru Deaky ,"This project addresses the ?Manufacturing & Logistics Tools and Services? challenge, by helping 3D printer hubs (small and big) in better organizing their production activities, estimating and forecasting materials consumption and in improving the communication with their clients.
This will be ensured by creating a subscription-based service hosted in the cloud, 3DP-OPECR, which involves 3D Printing Hubs (main target of the business model), their customers and 3rd parties.

The service will allow Factories to expose their capabilities, to receive Orders, to interact with Customers, to have automated work scheduling for each 3D printer, to estimate and forecast Material consumption, to visualize Order history and to be easily connected to other relevant services by means of web-services/APIs.

The service will allow Customers to see Factory capabilities, place orders directly or over a third-party (web-service/API), communicate with the Factory and check personal order status and order history.
Using the collected data, big data analysis and BI tools will be used to compute 3D printing market trends and other relevant indicators.

We mix the best features that exist to create a unique application which is easy to use and dedicated for 3D printing. The added web-services / APIs, the big data analysis element and the use of FIWARE technologies in this field are innovative.

The service is based on FIWARE tehnology and involves many enablers (e.g. Context Broker GE, BigData GE, Data Visualization - SpagoBI GE and others) in order to increase the development speed. Our platform and marketing materials will promote the growth of the FIWARE ecosystem.

The project aligns itself with the goals of the present call and brings economical and relational value to the business and to the whole 3D printing field. The improved organization, the automations and the connectivity to other relevant services save time which can be used for innovation by the industry.

2655,FABu60,FABu,FABulous,The Netherlands,Avionics Control Systems B.V,3Drones,0,Consumer DIY/design,B2C,5,3,YES,IN,David Eugenio Pajares de Santiago,3Drones is a revolutionary platform aimed for the creation of drones. There is nothing similar to this, and thanks to 3D printing technology and the use of FIWARE, it will provide a perfect space where users can share their designs for free with the rest of the community.

Users will register in the platform for free and will be able to view and download all the designs shared by the community, which will be accompanied by the software developed for the Hermes Autopilot by AvioniCS Systems Control during our stage in the Business Incubator Centre of the European Space Agency. Both of these services will be free of charge for the users.

The Hermes control system will allow users to modify the values of the PID controllers (proportional-integral-derivative) so that they can adapt the control system to achieve perfect maneuverability, depending on the chosen design for of their drones.

On the platform users will be able to buy all the necessary parts (engines, propellers, batteries, etc.) and the hardware developed by AvioniCS Control Systems, where they will be able to will load the autopilot, and build their own drone adapted to their needs, whether they are professionals or amateurs.

Weïve launched with the support of public bodies of the Basque Government (SPRI/Ekintzaile, IK4/Lortek ) and the University of the Basque Country ( UPV) a project for the installation of a cell manufacturing metal parts for the medical and aerospace market using SLM 3D printing technology. Aiming to make it happen and to respond to the growing market within which is this technology at the beginning of 2016. Within this project SLM 3D technology, was born the need to develop software capable of facilitating the approach of this technology to the end user.

This project showed us clearly that currently in the 3D printing for metal parts (SLM) market, manufacturers of products for different industries where this technology has many advantages, are facing several major problems and few solutions. Problems: system, products and staff are very different from those commonly used. No previous experience within the company and little beyond.
This creates two major drawbacks to the user of 3D printing technology: excessive costs and deadlines.

Our project 3DMEPASMO, want to be an cooperative and innovative software based in FIWARE Generic Enables that checks and optimizes geometrical structures generated by CAD before transmitted to the 3D printing machine , particularly focused on metallic parts (SLM ) for the aerospace and medical market. There will result in a refined and optimized version of the input data, which allow optimum manufacturing 3D metallic parts. This software open a multitude of new advantages for design engineers of metal parts. This results in better cost and deadlines for the 3D metal parts manufacturers.

Main advantages: Optimize mesh quality, Design & modify (textures, patterns, perforations, lightweight structures...), Repair and defeature, Combine.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Mechanical Computer-Aided Engineering,Applications,Engineering Applications,2,0,0,0,0,0

2681,FABu86,FABu,FABulous,Greece,CONSULTING & SOFTWARE PRODUCTS,UNIPROC,0,BUSINESS SERVICES, Consumer DIY/design, MANUFACTURING",B2B/B2C,6,16,YES,IN,George  Papanikolopoulos ,"UNIPROC project aims to deliver a breakthrough in the field of customized Additive Manufacturing (AM) through utilization of cloud technologies. The project targets to develop tools, based on FIWARE add-ons, adequately user friendly and highly efficient, capable to meet the requirements set by industry and consumers worldwide, addressing software for optimization of the AM processes, based on a unified approach. The project aims to deliver significant impact in terms of lowering the cost of software, provide secure storage of data in cloud, speed up utilization of manufacturing optimization software taking into account cost, time and flexibility, streamline communications between stakeholders of AM technology and accelerate product development by expediting collaboration and providing optimization capabilities. These will be achieved through cloud-based implementations for holistic production optimization. Supply chain management, Enterprise Resource Planning and selection of the best combination of machine/process parameters will be implemented to achieve customized manufacturing of complex geometries, utilizing AM techniques. Cloud technologies will be utilized in terms of data communication (software-software, hardware-hardware and software-hardware) as well as through determining the best manufacturing scenario, based on a selection of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), aiming to select a feasible and optimized ensemble of manufacturing entities in order to achieve sustainability, productivity and customization to a large extent.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,0,0,,Hardware,Collaborative Product Data Management,Applications,Engineering Applications,2,X,0,0,0,0

3007,INCE1,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,Cuaqea S.L.,cuaQea,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"cuaQea is a voice microblogging application where users can record and share voice messages with their family, their friends and the rest of the world, wherever they are. Users can customize their cuaQs by adding cool free filters, like distortion and background effects
column2: share their posts with their Facebook friends and Twitter followers and create their own community
column3: follow people of their interest and stay ahead of trends. Users also have the option or ƒ??re-cuaquingƒ? other users cuaQs or mark them as ƒ??favouritesƒ? (likes). In addition, through the ƒ??buscuaQƒ? feature they will be able to look for interesting cuaQs by tags and for other users by name or location. Finally, users can also subscribe to channels of their interest in order to listen to key personalities, journalists willing to spread their opinions or public speakers and coaches who share tips and ideas. Our product combines the 2 most growing trends worldwide: microblogging and social networking, into the same product and provides an added value to users through a product which can be used on the move and in those daily situations (while driving, practising sports, learning pronunciation) when talking is the only alternative to typing. cuaQea is a voice Twitter or an audio Instagram, you create audio messages, add effects and share with people. Potential users enter cuaQeas market the moment they cannot, or would rather not, use their hands to type messages, or wish to quickly capture and share a moment where sound is important. The majority of social networking platforms focus on cold text and pictures only, while our purpose is to let users convey their true feelings and emotions through the most powerful communication vehicle we have: voice. Today, potential users are not truly addressing this issue. They are: - Texting while walking - Texting while driving - Disconnecting entirely when working out (gym, running) - Taking time out to record moments with a camera - Recording heavy video files with their mobile phone - Recording audio notes on chatting devices which get buried among all other media being shared",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 3008,INCE2,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,IDP INGENIERIA Y ARQUITECTURA IBERIA SL,FI-CleanTech,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Most widely used control systems are not yet compatible with 100% native web technology making it difficult to integrate it with cloud platforms based on FIWARE. This implies that many times integration with todays control systems and web environments are costly and not feasible and the power of FIWARE technology cannot be used. Our objective is the creation of a standard low-cost solution for renewables with a 3 in 1 function able to be connected to the European FIWARE standard, providing local web control application for the Clean Tech areas with open standard industrial communication protocols like OPC-UA, providing remote monitoring and control for the Clean Tech areas and integrating data with FIWARE. Our proposed standard software solution for the Clean Tech areas will allow easy and seamless integration with FIWARE for users without specific knowledge of FIWARE environments making it easy the FIWARE adoption in the Clean Tech domain.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3009,INCE3,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,Meteo for Energy S.L.,3D Meteorological service,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Weather forecast is a general interest for all the people around the world. Forecasted weather data is required for businesses and individuals for different purposes: construction, transport, hobbies, etc. The visualization of weather information has to be as simple and intuitive as possible. Real-time and 3D technologies give the users a very realistic view of the situation of what is happening, and the information shown is easy to understand. Freemium business models consist on giving free services and premium services. It is a business model in which we give a core product (basic weather forecasts) for free to a large group of users making money with CPM ads (Cost per mille visualizations) and sell premium products with extra features and options to a smaller fraction of this user base. The premium service can be divided in different aspects such as, API access to data, greater frequency of upgrade, information of more meteorological variables, dual and multi-licenses,...",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3011,INCE5,INCE,INCENSe,Portugal,Watt-IS Lda.,Watt Intelligent Solutions,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Watt-IS aims to promote energy efficiency in the household sector by providing end consumers and electricity providers a new layer of information about disaggregated energy consumption. We have developed a software solution that is able to analyze the aggregated electricity consumption data of a household provided by smart meters and identify when and which main appliances (fridge, washers, stand-by, etc.) were used. With this information, Watt-IS generates tailored made energy efficiency measures targeted at each household to help end clients to utilize electricity more efficiently, thus saving in their energy bill. Additionally the information gathered can be useful to energy utility companies to better understand their clients and achieving proper client segmentation that allows them to create targeted energy services aimed towards specific market niches. A similar approach in terms of technology and business model is currently being assessed targeting SMEs. Watt-IS intends to partner with energy companies, providing on their behalf tailored made energy efficiency information to their existing client base, charging a yearly fee to the utilities.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3012,INCE6,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,Applied REsearch to Technologies S.r.l.,CHARGE ADVISOR - Integrated electric vehicles navigation and charging control services,0,MANUFACTURING,B2B,10,-,YES,IN,  ,"The project is aimed at establishing a business model for an electric vehicles navigation and charging control system. The system has been already tested and validated at laboratory and small scale field level in the context of SMARTV2G and MOBINCITY FP7 projects, jointly managing navigation and charging as interdependent tasks. The navigation subsystem allows to plan the optimal trip taking into account vehicle autonomy and integrating intermediate fast charging service. The charging control subsystem allows to dinamically control the charging power guaranteeing the satisfaction of drivers preferences in terms of desired state of charge and dwelling time, grid players constraints in terms of aggregated power tracking and release of active demand products, also taking into account the availability of renewable energy sources and the technical limitations on charging current established by the IEC 61851 international standard. The controller exposes a set of services needed to extend traditional electromobility platforms from authentication, monitoring and billing functionalities to control ones
column2: optimization algorithms at the basis of navigation and control services require significant parallel computational capabilities when managing large road maps and a large number of charging sessions, which can be provided by virtual machines through cloud computing. As a matter of fact the IaaS Data Center Resource Management Generic Enabler is expected to provide a significant boost towards the implementation of a solution sufficiently mature to be put on the market
column3: this enabler allows to dinamically and optimally allocate and manage virtual machines on a cloud tailored for the provisioning of the computational effort required to support multiple trip planning services and operation of multiple charging areas along the distribution grid. In the best knowledge of the proposer, though a number of vehicles routing and charging strategies have been presented in the scientific literature, an integrated navigation and charging control system taking into account all the above mentioned aspects has not been put on the market yet.",Tech provider,,X,0,0,0,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,www.ares2t.com,Startup,150000,ares2t.com

3014,INCE8,INCE,INCENSe,Greece,Plegma Labs S.A.,"PLEGMA, an open Building Energy Management System",0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"We are witnessing the beginning of the IoT (r)evolution. We use smartphones, numerous gadgets and sensors in our everyday life, providing us with unimaginable information, insights and benefits. We have smart homes, smart wearables, smart cars, smart almost everything
column2: yet buildings remain ƒ??dumbƒ? especially in reference to energy efficiency. Enterprises today more than ever require detailed monitoring and control of their buildings energy usage in their attempt to optimize energy efficiency and meet specified efficiency standards. However, traditional approaches (by large OEMs) most often do not make economic sense, especially for small enterprises, as overall cost often surpasses even medium-to-long term potential energy savings, while also do not provide future proof solutions and lock in clients to their own product range. Consequently in the EU and US, market penetration of BEMS in commercial buildings is only 0.2%! We consider this an important business opportunity which can be addressed with our cost-efficient fully open approach, transforming the way traditional BEMS technology is installed and used, but also changing the business model of the BEMS industry from CAPEX-intense/licence based to subscription services OPEX model. Our integration platform is based on the Eclipse SmartHome project, developed in Java/OSGi technology and is designed to be absolutely vendor-neutral as well as hardware/protocol agnostic. We believe our participation in INCENSe combined with the use of FI-WARE technologies will provide an ideal ecosystem for our platform to grow and evolve in.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 3015,INCE9,INCE,INCENSe,Serbia,High Tech Engineering Center,Cardea,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Cardea is innovative telemedicine system capable of recording, transferring and analyzing ECG signals from patients to medical specialists.Implementation of Cardea telemedicine system will affect following problems concerning cardiology: 1.increasing number of cardiac patients 2.extreme shortage of cardiologists in EU 3.cardiologists need at least 15-20 minutes per patient to set the right diagnose in the hospital environment 4.cardiologists have trouble to reach patients who are stationed in non-urban locations 5.expensiveness of devices and software for cardiac diagnosis.Cardea significantly helping cardiologists in:1.improving diagnosis accuracy 2.decreasing the time requirements for accurate diagnosis up to setting the diagnose in less than a minute 3.monitoring for cardiac patients thus allowing for multiplication of patients served at the same time and expert 4.saving more lives at the same time 5.saving both time and money for service provider and patients 5.24/7 patient",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3016,INCE10,INCE,INCENSe,Croatia,EkoESCO d.o.o.,Aabo PaaS,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Aabo PaaS (Platform as a Service) is an enabling technology for intelligent sensor and control device network. It provides flexible, scalable, cost-effective, and user-friendly networking layer that allows fast deployment of remote networks of sensing and control equipment (e.g. temperature sensors, utility meters, control switches, or manufacturing robots), and multi-platform monitoring and control GUIs. Aabo PaaS can be used by individuals, SMEs, and large enterprises alike: from a hobbyist that installing a simple temperature sensor in her home, a startup launching a new networked product or service, to a utility company deploying an array of smart meters. Aabo will make money by charging access to the platform via API and licensing software for enterprise-scale implementations, and selling hardware. By using open source hardware and software components and cultivating a vibrant community of contributors, Aabo will become the networking layer of choice of the emerging Internet of Things (IoT).",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3018,INCE12,INCE,INCENSe,Germany,-,Bat Sharing,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,  ,"Bat Sharing is a free iOS and Android app (also Wearable) released last February 2014 by Emiliano Saurin and Serena Schimd. Self developed and self funded, Bat Sharing strives to simplify the usability of the wide number of car sharing services arriving in Italywhile also promoting the use of this great service.The app is currently applicable in 3 cities in Italy(Milan, Rome and Florence), but soon other european cities will be supported. Why Bat Sharing? Each car sharing service either has a personal mobile app or no mobile app at all. The experience is then fragmented and the user is forced to switch from one app to another. We provide an unique experience. Bat Sharing brings together all of the services to one place and has additional features not available on the provider apps. The app is easily downloadable from the App store. There is no registration: all you need is to subscribe to the car-sharing services. Once you enter the Bat Sharing app, it will automatically show your position and the closest cars. You can plug in your departure and Bat Sharing will present you with various options based on your current location, allowing you to compare them by duration and price, all in real-time. No more waste of time checking the dozen different apps! We will run marketing campaign to share our vision of building an intermodal mobility platform that helps people get around cities easier and helps improve the cities mobility. We want to try to make people really understand the qualities of the sharing system and the big changes it can bring to the economy, the environment, the transport, the society and the energy system. Many cities in the world and car-sharing companies have already started to integrate green vehicles in their fleets to help the global improvement, but a good product behind the service is necessary. That is what we are. We will try to get people to change their habits and their mindsets, knowing that it is not an easy task. We aim to make partnerships with the small car-sharing providers which can help us gaining more visibility and users, and we can help them in the same way.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3019,INCE13,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,Bluelife Battery,Bluelife Battery,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Bluelife Battery was born as the first company specialised in battery regeneration. After working with its own resources and conducting an intense research and development in a completely new and still unexplored field, it eventually developed and patented its own methodology to regenerate batteries. PATENT: P201331851 What does battery regeneration imply? When a battery starts to misfire, it means that some of its modules start to misfire, and this failure can reach the other modules. Bluelife Battery has developed a series of analysis techniques that allow us to conduct specific actions, as well as its own methodology, to regenerate the battery and carry out its fine tuning so that it can be still used, putting it back in the active circuit and considerably reducing its environmental impact. We have succeeded in regenerating more than 350 batteries, which have proven that our method works, and the best evidence of this are the satisfied customers themselves, as well as the regenerated batteries, which propel the hybrid vehicles of our customers. The accumulated experience and, above all, the development of a deep knowledge of battery functioning, problems, breakdowns and reliability allowed us to come up with the idea of designing our own batteries. We had detected a necessity on the market and we were able to meet it. Thanks to our experience, we were able to develop our own system of batteries, characterised by their greater capacity, lower failure rate and longer durability, what we consider a step forward in the appropriate technological direction. We are talking about modules with a durability which is six-fold higher than the one of Toyotas current models: ~200,000km. vs 750,000km. We have already received the first prototypes and we are developing two important processes in parallel, in order to consolidate the product
column2: on the one hand, the launch and installation of the first unit in a vehicle to test the stress in the street and, on the other hand, we are going to start a certification process with INTA (the National Institute of Aerospace Technology) in order to guarantee, scientifically and neutrally, the durability of the modules. Both processes are aimed at launching the product and consolidating it on the market. Moreover, Bluelife Battery, a company committed to the environment and sustainability, is also investing resources to provide thrown-out batteries with a second useful life. We want to use them in renewable energy projects, as a storage system. Many of these batteries do not have enough power to propel an electric vehicle, but they do keep their capacity to store energy for other electric processes, especially if we regenerate them and make modular blocks with them (since these are static systems, size is not important and it is possible to use blocks made up of several battery sets), in order to multiply the storage capacity, closing the circle of sustainability and reducing the environmental impact and waste.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3023,INCE17,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,-,IOOOTA,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,  ,"We have analyzed the household appliance sector and smart-home and we have divided the problems encountered today, hand holding and user side. The solution? Support of a standard protocol supported by a consortium consolidated within already more than 100 different major companies in the industry and integrating some other protocols, our solution is a software embedded into a hub for the home and a web platform in cloud, economic and scalable. Hand holding, allows you to monitor in real-time usage data, the data to date, complete and accurate, with a saving in economic analysis and market research. 3043,INCE37,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,"NNERGIX ENERGY MANAGEMENT, S.L.",Nnergix SMARTmonitor,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The past of electric grids was few generation points and some demand areas. All those infraestrucures were possible to be managed in a centralized way. Nowadays, grids must be considered for multiple generation demand points geolocated around a region. Moreover, most of these generation sources are renewable technologies that are producing in an intermitent way. Also should be considered the fact that in order to reduce consumption and $, macrogrids should be considered and organized as a sum of microgrids that should be efficiently managed individually. Nnergix is developing a technological platform to individually manage microgrids based on predictive algorithms generating high value information through data analytics. SMARTmonitor platform is designed to generate information based on monitored data and forecasting models for both industrial microgrids and smart cities with the main goal to take advantage of the presence of renewable energy sources, self-consumption facilities, electric vehicles and demand rescheduling with a unique tool with multiple features.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3046,INCE40,INCE,INCENSe,Estonia,Jalousier OU,Comfee,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Heat transfer through windows in all buildings accounts for ~4 Quads of annual energy use (10% of total buildings energy use), and adds substantially to the peak cooling load of buildings. Manually opening and closing ordinary blinds often causes problems because it is time consuming, requires constant monitoring, and is prone to hardware malfunction. Shades are manually operated by s in an inefficient manner. Alternatively, automated blinds exist but are expensive and require professional installation and maintenance. Most of them require wiring and power outlets, which have to be considered in the original building design. Motorized blinds are not available for renters and have been am attribute of luxury homes and offices for decades. Trends: ƒ?? Energy efficiency retrofits ƒ?? Gap for windows in smart home ecosystem Comfee is the first learning device that makes window blinds smart and energy bills small. ƒ?? column2: ƒ?? Saves money on electricity, heating and cooling
column3: ƒ?? Works as a standalone as well as integrates with smart home hubs. It is fitted with indoor temperature sensor, indoor and outdoor lighting sensors. Control algorithm evaluates heating, cooling or neutral mode, and determines optimal shade position. Here are many different reasons to control the amount of sunlight that is admitted into a building. 1. Energy efficiency through simple retrofits ƒ?? Reducing heating and cooling costs
column4: For example, when completely closed and lowered on a sunny window, highly reflective blinds can reduce heat gain by around 45%. ƒ?? Saving on artificial lighting for at least 2-3 hours a day
column5: A 2012 paper by researchers from Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory looked at savings from 32 installations, and concluded that the average savings from daylighting was 28%, with a maximum reported energy savings of 60%. 2. Comfort and more convenient life ƒ?? Saving time on manual adjusting of blinds
column6: ƒ?? Visual comfort, glare control and reducing contrast ratios
column7: ƒ?? Healthy environment by maximizing the amount of daylight to increase productivity in working spaces, boost test scores in classrooms, accelerate recovery in hospital patient rooms
column8: ƒ?? Automation of hard-to-reach windows and skylights
column9: 3. Privacy and security ƒ?? Blinds instantly close when the light is on in the evening
column10: ƒ?? Place looks occupied even when you are away

column1: 3047,INCE41,INCE,INCENSe,Germany,EMTech - Excel Micro Technologies GmbH,Multi-Agent Based Optimization for Power Substations,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The ƒ??smart-gridƒ? concept focuses on the improvement of reliability, efficiency and economics of electrical network operations, by applying automation and ICT technologies to power grids. EMTech GmbH intends to enable decentralized, automated optimization solutions for power systems, based on a multi-agent system using Internet-of-Things (IoT) concepts. Our case idea focuses on a Machine-to-Machine (M2M) communication framework among hardware units installed in power substations, which shall exchange information and automatically seek and employ optimal substation operation w.r.t. Voltage and Reactive Power (Volt/Var optimization). In this way, substation equipment strains are reduced, energy losses minimized and distribution reliability enhanced, resulting in an improved behavior of the power system, both operationally and economically. Profits shall result from license fees, paid for each interconnected hardware unit, as well as for each user with access to the back-end database.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3048,INCE42,INCE,INCENSe,Croatia,Vulpes d.o.o.,Vebbu - heating and energy preservation smart wireless control system,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Vebbu is user-friendly wireless heating and energy preservation smart control system. Vebbu gets rid of wiring. Only power supply for some of devices are wired. Vebbu reduces need for high skilled (expensive) assistance. It decreases energy consumption by 20-30%. The core of the system consists of gateway, on/off relays, temperature sensors, tags and thermostatic radiator valves. It can extend to boilers, heaters, fan coils, etc. The gateway is the protocol adapter for handling communication between wireless devices and user interface. The relay box is attached to the existing heating system controlling heating source. Any number of temperature sensors can be placed anywhere, as there is no wiring. Customized binds between numerous devices are possible. Vebbu would be controlled by smartphone/web ƒ??appsƒ?. The patent request has been submitted.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

Sp.k.,"ECOSYSTEM ƒ?? innovative system promoting, expanding and updating knowledge of low-energy solutions in the construction industry",0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The main project goal is to create ECOSYSTEM ƒ?? online system (web portal and web application) promoting, expanding and updating knowledge of low-energy solutions in the construction industry. The web portal integrates knowledge regarding various low-energy and sustainable solutions, enabling owners to compare and estimate the prices of the various constituent solutions, i.e. appropriate windows, suitable and efficient heating system (e.g. heat pumps), to decide on the buildings orientation relative to cardinal directions, and sustainable materials to be used, as well as to decide on the overall solution, i.e. passive or active house. The system promotes energy-efficient and sustainable solutions such as passive solar technologies, wind energy, biogas energy, heat pumps, heat recovery, heating with ice, geothermal energy, green roofs, recycling, downcycling and upcycling. The system seeks to promote, expand and update knowledge of low-energy solutions, which will translate into increased sustainability awareness in the construction industry and among contractors in the business. The system automatically renders the house design compliant with Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council 2010/31/EU of 19 May 2010. The directive imposes a requirement to develop nearly zero-energy buildings as of 2020.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3054,INCE48,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,Rethink Srls,SunnyRev - The Solar Rooftops Revolution,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"SunnyRev will be the first global Reverse Auction Marketplace for Solar Rooftops. It will eliminate the transaction inefficiencies in the traditional trade process of Solar Power Purchase Agreements (SPPA) and Solar Leases (SL), enabling a win-win condition both for Solar Services Providers and for Rooftop Owners. With SunnyRev, Rooftop Owners will be able to minimize the solar rate and maximize their savings by putting Producers in competition for their rooftops with a reverse auction mechanism. Bidding performed in real-time via the Internet will result in a dynamic, competitive process. This will help achieve rapid downward price pressure (energy price or lease remittance, depending of the case) that is not normally attainable using traditional static paper-based bidding processes. At the same time, Producers will reduce costs and timing for acquiring new clients. SunnyRev will charge the Solar Services Providers using the following revenues model: - Subscription fees for using the Portal (2000 ƒ?ª/year) - Transaction fees (depending on the power of the Solar Rooftop) - Ad or slotting fees - Fees for premium content - Fees for selling data or analytics (business intelligence data) For the Rooftop Owners, the use of the platform will be free.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3056,INCE50,INCE,INCENSe,Ireland,Spark Renewables,Smart Energy Cluster Optimisation (SECO),0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"SECO is an Energy Optimisation software platform that facilitates the balancing of loads and distributed generation in a micro grid setting and clusters these hubs towards energy neutralisation. The technology is targeted at industrial clients who have relatively high energy usage and have a degree of flexibility as to when they consume it - such as thermal loads or they may be able to build up work in progress. SECO will model the loads of production plants using self-learning algorithms and will predict the amount of energy required to meet the production schedule. The price of electricity changes on the wholesale market every half hour and the system receives feeds in advance as to the predicted electrical price variations and will optimise the production schedule to suit the best tariffs. SECO also caters for on-site energy such as wind turbines and using forecasting technology, predicts the output of a suitably sized turbine for that location and optimises its on-site usage against the sites load. The self-learning algorithms will therefore constantly model your load and optimize the flexible load against the market and on-site generation and battery storage.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3057,INCE51,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,MBI srl,NRG-predictor,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The aim of the project is to implement a system for forecasting electricity production from solar or wind power (mainly based on weather forecasts). EU electricity producers who use renewal energy sources are the main target for this subscription service. This is because these electricity producers need to provide details in advance of the amount they will contribute to the power grid. However, the service could be used also by public institutions which promote renewable energy sources, such as GSE in Italywhich has to forecast electricity production from several groups of small-scale plants (for households or which produce < 10MVA), or energy providers who have to monitor and balance their distribution network.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3058,INCE52,INCE,INCENSe,Denmark,Sharingear IVS,Sharingear,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"It is an extreme pain to play live concerts when transportation is an expense for musicians. column1: 3060,INCE54,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,Geo.In.Tech. s.r.l.,GEST,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The company Geo.In.Tech. deals with geo-energy, solutions and technologies regarding low enthalpy geothermal energy, a renewable resource in rapid diffusion used for air conditioning and production of hot water through a system borehole heat exchanger / grout / ground heat pump (GHP) for all types of buildings. The idea is to create innovative vertical borehole heat exchanger (BHE) designed to replace the traditionally used geothermal heat pump systems. The business plan provides collaboration between the Geo.In.Tech. and an industrial partner that will work closely for the creation, testing, patenting and the industrialization of the geothermal probe. The development of the prototype will provide a heat exchange with the ground between the 20-30% greater than the tubes present on the market, allowing a reduction of about 20-25% of the costs of installation of a geothermal plant with the practicality of laying in work. The innovation proposed by the draft Geo.In.Tech. is expected to make a significant development in the field of low entalphy geothermal energy in Italyand abroad",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3062,INCE56,INCE,INCENSe,Ireland,EcoWatch Ltd,SmartGridWatch - A SmartGrid Sensor Network for Active Distribution System Management,0,"ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND AIR CONDITIONING SUPPLY",B2B,#N/A,-,YES,OUT,John OFlaherty,"Renewables and Distributed Generation (DG) require disruptive changes to how electricity distribution networks are planned/operated. Optimal energy delivery needs smart management of bi-directional energy flows that must be actively managed in real-time, using distributed smart sensor networks. A ƒ?ª0.4B market. ROI for Utilities is cost effective phasor monitoring for grid synchronisation to maximise utilisation of their assets, optimise energy delivery, minimise grid outages/time to restoration, improve safety and reduce network stress. SmartGridWatch will provide Utilities with a new innovative supply-side Active Distribution Management system using FIWARE GEs as an IoT to enable smartgrids integrate DG and operate efficiently. The proposer is a high potential start-up SME with new innovative patented flexible magnetic current sensors, to address Utilities needs and this huge market.",Tech provider,,0,0,0,X,X,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,0,0,0,0,#N/A

3063,INCE57,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,Think+ Sustainable Services Srl,InteraRete,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"InteraRete (IR) provides an innovative ICT solution for the shared mobility market with the potential to radically reshape the operations and the perception of the Ride Sharing service. IR service works like a social, shared transportation network of citizens for citizens, made up by ride offers and requests on private vehicles. The innovative data model implements a real network of geo-referenced routes (IR Lines) and junctions (IR Stops), which represent the mobility resources available and is able to take full advantage of the relevant global growth of ridesharing customers, since it can dramatically increase the current still low rate of matches between offer and demand. As a result: increased flexibility in finding/planning the most convenient trip and more equity and accuracy in the reimbursement of the shared travel expenses (you pay for what actually used). Revenues will come from transactional fees on rides booking and from service subscription flat fees as well as from the sale of adv. spaces associated to IR Stops.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

Ruiz,"Our proposal is a disruptive approach in Energy audits software for buildings. We use limited data points to assess remotely energy efficiency for buildings. Leveraging that information through smart analytics, and a big energy data benchmark to pinpoint which retrofits and upgrades will yield the greatest savings. The solution will include a Virtual Energy Assessment and an Automated Audit Service. It uses data analysis to improve energy efficiency thanks to the rising penetration of smart meters in Europe. 3067,INCE61,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,Midori srl,NED,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Midori srl is a cleantech startup company based in Torino, IT that offers ICT solutions and tools to estimate and monitor electricity consumption and create awareness to adopt optimization strategies in terms of energy efficiency, reduce costs and healthier climate. So NED is a class of product capable of disaggregating total electricity consumption of buildings into individual appliances using a single sensing point and providing energy consumption feedback to both customers and energy suppliers so as to increase consumption efficiency, reduce CO2 emission and increase DSM system. Deliverable applications for NED includes: 1) load forecasting and monitoring by utilities, energy efficiency planning and operation organizations, 2) provide advanced and itemized energy billing, device aging and anomaly detection, and actionable recommendations(automated load shifting) to customers. Potential sectors and target markets include residential, commercial, and electricity suppliers at large.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 3069,INCE63,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,-,SPIDER (Smart Grid Simulation Framework for PLC Networks),0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,  ,"M2M communications are becoming an important issue for energy companies that try to get the best of the Smart Grid paradigm. Two problems need to be solved: modeling communications networks is a challenging task, and it is not aligned with their main lines of work. We propose an adaptation of a simulation tool to be used by professional users, by using a validated simulation framework able to emulate the behaviour of communication networks based on PLC, one of the main technologies targeted for Smart Grids. Using this simulation framework, communication networks can be analysed and forecasted. Added-value services existing in the Smart Grids would benefit from the network performance output obtained by this framework since the communication capabilities are a key requirement. Our product is designed for a pay-per-use basis with licensed subscription, which can be easily implemented given the cloud environment provided by FIWARE. Main clients are DSOs, meter manufacturers and R D centers.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A
