3161,INCE155,INCE,INCENSe,Switzerland,Nozomi Networks SA,Nozomi Industrial Global Critical State Guardian,0,"ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND AIR CONDITIONING SUPPLY, MANUFACTURING",B2B,2,1,YES,IN,Andrea Carcano,"The company Nozomi Networks was founded in 2013 after years of research in the field of Cyber Security. The company was founded by two Ph.D., Andrea Carcano (holding a Ph.D. in Cybersecurity and InfoSec expert) and Moreno Carullo (holding a Ph.D. in Artificial Intelligence and Software Engineering expert). Nozomi main focus is the development of products for protecting, monitoring and troubleshooting Industrial networks with a particular focus on energy systems and smart grid. In the latest years, Industrial Critical Installations started to use massively network interconnections, and what it is worst they came in contact with the public network, i.e. with Internet. The net effect of such new trend, is the introduction of a new interleaved and heterogeneous architecture combining typical information system (e.g. data bases, web-servers, web-applications and web-activities), with real-time elements implementing the control functions of industrial plants. If, from a certain point of view, the advantages of such complex architectures are several (remote management functions, distributed con-trol and management systems, on the fly monitoring etc. ), on the other hand they intro-duce a new layer of exposure to malicious threats. These specialized hardware and software equipment used in these critical installations (eg. Smart grids, power plants, pipeline etc.) often communicate with specialized protocols engineered with availability, speed and reliability in mind. InfoSec issues are, however, often not covered thus leaving such critical protocols (Modbus, IEC-61850-5-101/104, MMS, GOOSE, SampledValues, etc) and architectures (IEC 61850) with open flaws for a wide range of cyberattacks. In addition, day-by-day operation can be seriously impacted by hardware or software malfunction that in such distributed scenarios can be really hard to detect and recover quickly. Both these two scenarios need an integrated, advanced external monitoring system able to detect and record system failures, with integrated tools supporting operators in recovering the system and preventing future incidents. We have envisioned a platform, the Nozomi Industrial Global Critical State Guardian (IGCSG), currently composed by two different products: Nozomi SCADAguardian (SG) and Nozomi Industrial Event Monitor (IEM). The first has already been developed by Nozomi and the latter will be developed thanks to INCENSE/FIWARE resources. These two products permit to visualize current a past behavior of the monitored Industrial networks, allowing operators to find and resolve security and operational issues of the involved components. A recognized plus of our product is a state-of-the art, advanced, responsive HTML5 interface with graphic controls aimed at synthesizing network-related and process-related data, at various levels of details. Nozomi Networks is strucutered as a technological Vendor, with revenues coming from product sales, product support and professioanl services. In the Product services price section of the business plan further details are available. Future developments of the company will add additional revenue streams, for instance other components of the platform or integrated Industrial Cybersecurity services.",Tech provider,,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,Network Security,System Infrastructure Software,Security Software,1,0,0,Startup,0,nozominetworks.com

3162,INCE156,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,-,Smart Facility Manager,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,  ,"Nowadays global attention is strongly focused on the efficient use of energy resources and reduction of CO2 emissions. Under these premises, our business idea is based on a developed prototype, an intelligent Building Management System (iBMS), able to optimize the policies of BMS for complex buildings. Our integrated solution is scalable for district linking, and can obtain energy savings of over 30% in a cost effective, adaptive and transparent way. Possible revenues could be obtained from sale, installation, and maintenance of the solution and from percentage of guaranteed savings.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3163,INCE157,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,"Sofcomputing Castilla y Le??n, S.L.",Forest Energy,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Forest Energy is shown as a dynamic and operative simulator that will allow to estimate the amount of biomass of a woodland, the quality of the biomass that is available to be used as a energetic resource and the amount of CO2 kept by the biomass estimated. All this data can be graphed, providing also georeferential information, by the use of the SIG Data Provider ƒ?? Geoserver/3D Generic Enabler. This tool will help to determine the technical and economical feasibility of these projects. In conclusion, user can capture, store, manipulate, analyze and display all the georeferential information with the aim of solving complex problems related with the planning and management of the biomass of the woodlands that want to be analyzed.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3164,INCE158,INCE,INCENSe,UK,OpenTRV Limited,OpenTRV,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Save money by only heating the rooms that you use. OpenTRV is an open, low cost and effective way to reduce the energy bills for space heating in homes and small commercial buildings. The services and software built around the commodity low cost hardware are the key business opportunities for the company - the business model is akin to Red Hat. For example, with OpenTRV software, a hotel booking system can automatically turn down the heating in unoccupied rooms in a hotel without any staff interaction. OpenTRV will lease the system and share in the savings with the hotel. This project is to write the software, the revenue generating part of the business model. The business model is to sell the software, maintenance and services around the low cost, commodity hardware. Building Energy Management Systems (BEMS) are products sold into large commercial buildings that monitor and control the heating systems. BEMS are not traditionally installed into smaller commercial buildings or homes and are rarely retrofitted due to the cost of installation and making good after disruption. OpenTRV allows a BEMS to be retrofitted, and this project is to design the BEMS and underlying intelligence to be usable by non specialists (in the home or small commercial building environment), save people money and save a very significant amount of the EUs carbon emissions (total addressable saving is 8% of the EUs carbon emissions).",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3167,INCE161,INCE,INCENSe,The Netherlands,Savve B.V.,Savve Simply Saving Energy,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"//Type of business // Savve is an online marketplace that gives advice to consumers looking to improve the energy efficiency and comfort of their home and connects them with installers. //Company summary // Savve is a software solution consisting of a website and app. Savve uses an in-house developed algorithm to accurately estimate the savings potential of existing buildings in a matter of seconds. Consumers enter just their zip code and house number to receive a free tailor-made advice suggesting what energy saving solutions to install. Examples of products Savve sells to consumers are: wall- floor insulation, CV boilers, solar panels (PV). Savve also supports the installer with software developed for mobile devices (e.g. smartphones) that will increase efficiency and lower sales marketing costs. Savve coordinates the entire process from advice to installation while taking as many business processes online as possible. //Already creating real market value through validated learning// We are already helping customers and generating revenues and hence creating real market value. We have validated the problem and the right solution through Lean Startup methodologies. Now that we are getting traction we need capital to develop Savves disruptive online platform to its full potential using innovative internet technologies. This should push software technology forward while both the installer and consumer will benefit and homes become more sustainable. //Mission:// We want to be the number one company for energy saving solutions and make homes more sustainable by making choices for consumers simple and installation for craftsmen easy. //Added value// The savings-check (ƒ??Bespaarcheckƒ?) of the online marketplace provides consumers with insight in their savings potential. Information is presented in a way that enables consumers to easily compare and select the right energy savings solution(s). It shows how much can be saved and what the return on their investment will be. Savve creates transparency in an industry where price and brand comparison are difficult and time consuming and the differences in installer pricing and quality are not transparent. Savve will also develop intuitive, user-friendly software for installers running on mobile devices. This will reduce acquisition- marketing costs for the small installation companies because it enables Savve to take over their sales and marketing resulting in larger sales volumes. Future versions of the software will also reduce administration time by simplifying the current difficult-to-use software that most of the time runs on desktops designed for larger companies. Savve will make this low-operational excellence market more efficient to take a big step towards a more sustainable future. Savve can improve efficiency with an estimated 7-25% for roughly 25000 installers of ƒ??greenƒ? solutions in the Netherlands. //Management team and staff// The start-up management team combines an engineering background in relevant areas, experience in business development and sound financial expertise. //Business system// Savve is a 2-sided marketplace in the home energy efficiency market. Consumers get advice and insight for free but pay for the transaction of turnkey products. Savve then pays the installers for materials and work. Installers pay a commission for leads to consumers that have shown interest in a solution. Savve first focuses on R D and software development to achieve a successful proof-of-concept in collaboration with installers in a chosen region (e.g. in the Netherlands). Once the proof-of-concept is demonstrated, Savve will focus more on sales, marketing and operational efficiency and launch nationally. Savve will generate three streams of revenue: ƒ?? Leads (selling details of registered consumers) ƒ?? Orders (sales of turnkey products to consumers) ƒ?? SaaS subscriptions (monthly revenue from sales of software) Competitive edge Savve distinguishes from Dutch competition by coordinating the entire process from advice to installation. Savves competitive edge is three-fold: 1. Integral analysis of entire energy system vs. partial analysis of e.g. solar PV ƒ§? Leading to an all-round advice with larger efficiency gains 2. Rating system for both buyers (consumers) and sellers (installers) ƒ§? Sets high quality standards 3. Developing user-friendly, intuitive software for installers for mobile devices ƒ§? Improving operational efficiency and increasing switching costs //Disruptive business model// Savve has the potential not just to grow into a large company but also to develop into an industry changer and radically change the installation sector. The disruptive force of its business model has the power to turn a low operational excellence installation market into a major marketplace. In conclusion, the profitability of Savve will be substantial due to the low-cost structure and scalability that will generate high shareholders value. It can become the number one company for energy saving solutions at home, based on the superior qualities of our online marketplace, generating attractive savings for consumers and increased efficiency for installers while maintaining high-quality standards.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3168,INCE162,INCE,INCENSe,Slovakia,"energy analytics, s.r.o.",Price forecasting tool for the European short-term electricity market,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Continuing liberalisation of the electricity markets in Europe brings increasing competition and decreasing profit margins. Market participants are struggling to increase their efficiency which is possible only with a good access to information. Particularly the reliable and affordable forecasts of future wholesale market prices create signals for companies to optimize their producing and trading activities. At the same time EU energy strategy calls for cleaner electricity markets through further increases in renewable generation share and improving markets efficiency with the projects of smart grids and market coupling. Demand response is presently one of the most crucial issues in the EU electricity markets operation as with lower stability of electricity markets in the future it is important to persuade the customers to shift their consumption to the times when abundance of supply is available. However, to achieve this it is inevitable to create an environment where the correct market signals are available for all the market subjects. EU authorities have done a significant amount of work aiming to increase transparency of electricity markets in the recent years. The amount of fundamental data available today can be well used to provide affordable and precise price signals for the electricity market participants. The aim of the proposed project is to develop the price predicting tool - a software solution - for the interconnected European short-term electricity market. The developed product will be based on a software collecting relevant data, and generating price predictions
column2: with calculations based on the state-of-the-art algorithm in the cloud environment. This would provide hourly spot price predictions for the whole ENTSO-E region with 2-7 days ahead in a reliable, precise, user friendly and comparatively cheap manner.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3170,INCE164,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,S4ENV Srl,FI-METER ƒ?? Future Internet Event-Driven Smart Electricity Metering,0,"Consumer energy & home automation, ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND AIR CONDITIONING SUPPLY",B2B/B2C,#N/A,-,YES,OUT,  ,"The business project idea of S4ENV is to offer innovative services, based on event-driven smart meters, to industrial endƒ??users on the energy market, and particularly to prosumers. In the known state-of-the-art, traditional time-driven smart meters produce infrequent averaged measurements of energy every 15-30 minutes. This precision is sufficient for billing, but legacy meters show energy usage only in an approximate manner. In 2013, the Research Institute ISMB (www.ismb.it) got the patent protecting the event-driven modality of electrical energy metering. In 2014, TeamWare (www.teamware.it) produced the first lot of event-driven meters implementing the patented metering modality after ISMB permission. The new meters implement analytical modality of energy measurements and communicate data in real-time. This is a completely new technology, which up to now is unknown to competitors. In the assumption that TeamWare ƒ?? the SME which has full control of S4ENV - will start fabricating the new hardware devices in 2015, S4ENV plans to make available a new web- and mobile-app-based technology platform and to provide value-added services to the customers going to adopt the event-driven meters. The goal is 1) to improve energy-efficiency and automate energy-saving operations at the premises of the users in almost transparent manner, 2) to enable prosumers to optimize production, consumption, storage and sale of energy in cooperation among themselves.",Tech provider,,X,0,X,0,0,,Hardware,Event-Driven Middleware,Application Development & Deployment,Integration and Orchestration Middleware,1,0,0,0,0,#N/A

3174,INCE168,INCE,INCENSe,Estonia,Cityntel O??,New generation Smart Street Light Control,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Cityntel has brought into the market revolutionary new generation Plug Play Smart Street Light Control solution. 3175,INCE169,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,CARRIOTS S.L.,FICHARGE,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The objective of this project (FI-CHARGE) is the development of an Open Interface protocol and a Smart phone implementation, to enable communication between Electric Vehicle (EV) Charging Points and Smart Phones (Android, IoT and html5) . This open protocol will be offered for free as a open Generic Enabler to the FIWARE community. The project will then develop a smart phone application, using the proposed specification, allowing reservation of charging time and an easy interface to carry out payment, either using a dedicated account, via Paypal or other e-payment options. The application will include an advanced geographical interface and the possibility of route selection to the nearest charging point. Even if the initial phase will focus on the smart phone app, in future phases the protocol will allow automatic communication with the EV, becoming an step forward to automatic driving. The proposed protocol will be based on Open Charge Alliance Standards",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3178,INCE172,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,-,Apparatus for deferred use of electricity produced from renewable sources,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,  ,"The apparatus provides for converting electrical energy into thermal energy via an induction loop placed in contact with a container made of ferromagnetic material containing a mixture of NaNO3 and KNO3 or other salts or materials suitable for this purpose. The container with the salts together with all the other hot parts of the apparatus is isolated from the external environment by means of the vacuum, and therefore, will be able to retain the thermal energy stored with little losses. The thermal energy stored will be used during periods in which the renewable sources are not able to provide it directly, using common heating and hot water plants and / or converted into electricity by an alternator powered by a Stirling engine. The heat is extracted from the mass of molten salts with a coil of pipes that pass through the mixture inside which passes, as vector flow driven by a pump or blower, air, nitrogen, water vapor, or other gases. The Stirling engine is not powered, as occurs normally, with the products of fuel combustion and the residual heat content of the stream which sold part of the thermal energy to the head warm of engine is not released into the environment, but returns to the canister of the salts. The use of hollow spaces under vacuum that insulate all the hot parts of the apparatus allows to obtain in the form of electricity and/or heat almost the entire energy initially entered in the apparatus.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3186,INCE180,INCE,INCENSe,UK,NquiringMinds Ltd,uControl,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"uControl is a low cost simple to use modular sensor system for installing in domestic and commercial properties. The software can be upgraded over the air. Likewise the modular sensor suite can upgraded. The current suite in trial contains heating, humidity, electricity use, gas use, CO2 levels PR sensors and actuator controls for boilers and radiators. The hardware and much of the software is build on open source principles. This is to bring down the physical cost of production and encourage ecosystem compatibility. The uControl business is based on the cloud based analytic and control software that attaches to the sensor units. These analyticss developed in collaboration with the Energy Resarch Group at Southampton do the following. 1) Optimise energy use, through intelligent conrol 2) Analyse building performance 3) Make recommendations on buidling intervention to reduce energy cost The product will be sold to Local Authorities (cities) and building contractors",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3187,INCE181,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,0,Verichim,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Chemical constituents of the solution obey the laws of balance that it is customary to express the form of equations involving generally two to four different species. The participation of a species to more than one balance potentially puts it in connection with any other species by determining the global state of the system (solution) that as a whole reacts to external perturbations (as if it were governed by a single, extended, equilibrium equation). It is obtained in this way a domino effect until the last card in which is influenced by the movement of the former. So far we have been accustomed to the use of expressions like the data are related but we should probably take a different point of view, one in which the data are in the correlations. It means that the data are already in relationships and with a little effort calculation and a modest number of available data can be derived everyone. To quote Whitehead no more substances, but relations have priority
column2: not the subject, but the dependency ratio is the foundational instance. VERICHIM is a virtual analyzer which, by using a limited set of concentrations (measured) of chemical species in aqueous solution, is able to extend the knowledge of the system (in equilibrium) in all other species that are related to the first by a relationship of some kind (complex formation, slightly soluble salts, redox equilibria, empirical relationships, etc.). It is a survey instrument powerful and rapid that also allows to check the internal consistency of a set of analytical data.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3189,INCE183,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,AEORUM ESPA??A S.L.,HelioXcan: Advanced Information System for Intelligent Maintenance of Solar Power Plants,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"HelioXcan is an internet based business model focused in the Solar Power Plants Mainteinance Sector. Potential HelioXcan customers are organizations in charge of Solar Power Plants maintenance tasks. During the inspection of the plant, all the data will be acquired automatically with an intuitive drone based tool. It will be possible to perform an automated analysis of the Power Plant infrastructure and configure several inspection reports. 3190,INCE184,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,ditta claudio giordano,Smart box and sharing energy,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The project involves the creation of a network of local and distribution of electric energy that, by using the normal power distribution network put on sharing the energies through a smart box in power line communication.In practice every source of energy from renewable sources feed into the network and puts in sharing the energy produced less the part that instant of observation is required for their own consumption, ie energy produced by the plant and which is in excess of instant of observation t0. The software that should handle the request could be designed on the basis of an optimization algorithm such as dynamic programming algorithms that are a function of distance from the / and source / the seller / the energy demand (least-cost path) and above is a function of power losses in the distribution network of electricity, this is to ensure that efficiency the electricity transmission system (grid).",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3191,INCE185,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,THE SWAMP IOT FACTORY SL,BOTCAR,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Road transport contributes about one-fifth of the EUs total emissions of carbon dioxide (CO2). Transport is the only major sector in the EU where greenhouse gas emissions are still rising (23% between 1990 and 2010). According to the US Department of Energy, only about 15% of the energy from the fuel in the tank of the car is actually used to move the car. 60% of the energy gets lost due to inef?ªciencies related with energy transfromation, engine and drive train. Another 25% gets lost due to bad habits related with driving. BotCar consists of an easy to install system integrated by a device, a mobile app and a web service, which allows and automatic recording of real-time data from the sensors of the vehicle, including GPS location. Data from the sensors is gathered through a device connected to the On-Board-Diagnostic (OBD) port of the car. The features provided, allow the driver to learn by doing through a mobile app and via web. Users can monitor speeds, excessive idling, harsh braking, harsh acceleration, efficiency in choosing routes, or mechanical health of the vehicle. Users can also setting up automation features like anti-thief alerts, geo-fence alerts, or refuelling optimization. These information helps drivers identify waste, correct the problem and reduce fuel costs and emissions as well as improving safety control. BotCar includes social features to facilitate benchmarking, awareness and collaborative learning.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3194,INCE188,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,SPI TECNO SRL,HiTech Photovoltaic street lamps with LED Luminaires,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The idea that Ill describe later on the fixed with a patent registered in the Chamber of Commerce of Milan under the number WO 20111/114284 A1. The patent consists in the realization of a photovoltaic pole of public lighting comprising a street lamp with LED technology, from a photovoltaic panel bifocal (photovoltaic cells in both sides), mini inverted and especially to reuse the existing power lines. Each pole photovoltaics will also have a remote control system connected to the platform FIWARE. The remote connection through the network FIWARE give multiple benefits of programmability illuminance of the night, measure the energy consumption of the streetlight at night and then calculate the breakeven point energy. Furthermore the system, equipped with environmental sensors can increase road safety by changing the color temperature of the light, especially in case of fog, rain and snow. The energy produced during the day can be stored on local batteries, batteries of centralized or injected into the grid. Each photovoltaic panel will be equipped with mini inverter and battery charger The plant is equipped with a remote control system connected to the platform FIWARE. The decision to accumulate or injected into the grid, or take the two possibilities together, depends on the various regulations of the various countries adopting the system., For example, in case adopt to accumulate energy, the extra energy produced can be injected into the grid. Main features: - able to work stand alone or grid connected with the possibility to enter the extra energy produced into the electrical grid
column2: - smart city functionality and remote controls systems using FIWARE Technology
column3: - increase road safety
column4: - very long battery life
column5: - very attractive design - ultimate Italian PV bifacial panels technology

3195,INCE189,INCE,INCENSe,Poland,K I Ireneusz Kulka,Utility Services Managment Platform,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,The introduced solution will offer convenient way of ordering, managing and payment for utility services in the philosophy of Pay as you go and PrePaid solution. We can say that it allow to make interaction between very formal and traditional utility business and modern, paperless, @ customer live stile as easy and comfortable as it is possible. On the other side it allows to compare, verify and optimize utility services usage (specially electricity and heating) by customers in their day by day activity. Whats more it create independence between the formal client of utility service company, the user and the payer of services , who may be the same or different entities, without the need of formal regulations when changing one of the entities. It create an additional value and is consistent with global trend of rising people mobility and make ƒ??life easerƒ? It allows to utility services providers using this system for communication with customers to change the role from single services provider into ƒ??living services advisory centerƒ? even if ƒ??other servicesƒ? are provided by third party. column1: 3196,INCE190,INCE,INCENSe,Slovenia,"ComSensus, komunikacije in senzorika, d.o.o.",GridBroker,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The emergence of smart -grid, -home and -city concepts is causing notable market disruption and development of innovative technologies and business models. The aim of this project is to develop a cloud service framework for the PaaS provision of demand-response management based on autonomous control of customer loads. The service will be licensed to energy management companies and will support the control of smart appliances, plug loads and existing setups retrofitted with our custom developed energy management module. In a similar way as smart room thermostats allow personalised control of HVAC systems to achieve energy savings and increase comfort, our solution will enable an optimised control of water heaters that account for approximately 15% of total domestic energy consumption. The benefits of controlling the loads that support time shifting, energy storage or power control are twofold, in users energy cost savings and in utilities ability to reduce and manage peak demands. The service will be licensed on a per user and functionality basis and will also have multiplicative effect on the sales of our retrofit modules.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3203,INCE197,INCE,INCENSe,Cyprus,Aditess Ltd,Service Oriented Seasonal forecasting of Renewable Energy Sources,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The objective of the ƒ??Service Oriented Seasonal forecasting of Renewable Energy Sourcesƒ? proposal is to build an innovative concept for generating predictions of climate parameters for horizons up to 6-9 months in the future with high confidence, which can be later offered as a service to interested parties (energy industry, urban planners, energy planning offices etc). The 6-9 months forecasting work performed within ADITESS is a highly innovative climate prediction model build on an HPC and with high resolution 20 km on a European continental scale. The output of the model is then transformed into wind and PV energy products, at very long temporal scale, far exceeding anything available on the market up to now.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3205,INCE199,INCE,INCENSe,Spain,ISOTROL SA,ENGIE,0,"ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND AIR CONDITIONING SUPPLY",B2B,#N/A,-,YES,OUT,Carlos Cobos Calvo,"ENGIE provides a distributed renewable generation management platform for utilities, energy traders, energy service providers and renewable energy asset managers based on FI-WARE and the Internet of Things. Based on ISOTROLs leading renewable energy and energy efficiency monitoring and control solutions for large photovoltaics and wind farms, ENGIE provides the management platform for the next level of distributed renewable generation: a greater number of smaller installations, such as rooftop photovoltaic panels and micro wind turbines, cheaper to install and operate. Using ENGIE, customers can manage, monitor and control from a centralized system a portfolio of renewable generation assets. ENGIE focuses on both technical and economical perspectives, providing access to collected (e.g. production parameters) and calculated data (e.g. generated revenue) as well as alarms related to events on the installations or deviations from expected performance indicators that can be set on them.",Tech provider,,0,0,0,0,X,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,0,0,SME,0,isotrol.com

3213,INCE207,INCE,INCENSe,Denmark,S.C. Nordic IVS,EnergyExpertS - Energy Expert Systsem,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"SC Nordic is a spin-off from another Venture based project ƒ?? GridManager. The initial idea was formulated during a brainstorm competition in IBM is 2012, where it was formulated and entered as a business concept for IBMs beacon award. It won their global contest, and was award the price as (link to youtube below). The entire concept was a reflection on knowledge developed since 2007, and triggered by a reflection that energy monitoring systems, despite how advanced, does not sell. Energy consumption has become increasingly important to individuals and industries over the last decade, but all Industrial focused Energy monitoring suffers, and hasnt delivered on the initial goal and ambitions. The core of the problem lies in customer perceived value. Delivering details on how bad and costly a given activity is to run, doesnt give value if actions to rectify the problem is enforced. The international recognized standard for doing something ƒ?? ISO50.001, is based on the core assumption that expert knowledge and resources are allocated, whereby appropriate actions, measures and investment are facilitated. All of the above dictates access to trained and experienced experts, which increase costs and creates a high dependency on labor. Conclusion: Bottlenecks on human resources drives cost up, individual skillsets becomes vital, and customer uncertainty increases. SC Nordics novel approach to this is to implement an layer of expert knowledge software onto of existing meters and data acquisition software. This can be accomplished by recognizing that the same 8-10 type of appliances drives a minimum of 75% of consumption across the industry. The goal is to implementation expert knowledge of individual appliances into server based software, so it can be provided as packaged solutions (apps and widgets) for given installations. Example: An industrial compressor will be fitted with a consumption meter, flow and pressure sensors. The expert software will constantly monitor consumption of air, power and calculate the efficiency of this individual compressor. Matched against similar setups and based on consumption profiles and company opening hours, the operate is given a simple 1-100 figure to relate to. If it falls out of accepted performance the software is triggered and provides details report, suggestions and calculations on potential savings. A service organization can even be trigged automatically, and assist the client. This concept has been presented to a number of potential clients, and the conclusion has been that 60-80% of consumption can managed by: 1. Grundfos from 10-12 modules (compressed air, cooling, heating, lighting, idle load, smartgrid, load) 2. IBMs hosting centers can be managed from 4-5 modules (cooling, load, smartgrid, insulation) 3. Public schools and building needs 6-8 modules (idle load, cooling, heating and insulation) 4. Active Solar could manage their solar panel production using 3-4 modules (compressed airƒ?? 5. Shopping center - Izlazyl in Madrid, need cooling, air-condition, lighting, and idle load. The goal is to implement Expert modules as an add-on to existing monitoring systems for: 1. Compressed air and distribution 2. Heat-pumps, for cooling, freezing and heating 3. Monitoring of lighting 4. Management of heating in buildings, district or local 5. Base-load monitoring, or out-of-hours consumption monitoring 6. SmartGrid based on dynamic tariffs and day-ahead markets 7. Basic project management We have uploaded a word report on how this approach have provided a solution for a public scholl in Kiev Ukraine (municipality of Brovary) SC Nordic focuses on the following market segments, and have already developed References: 1. Larger industrial consumers Grundfos DK, Kievguma (Ukraine), Active Solar (Ukraine), KOMO Cheese (Ukraine), Galychnia (Ukraine) 2. Municipalities that needs improvements done to public buildings like schools and kindergartens (Brovary, Lviv, Gornok, Kiev City Administration 3. Large production plants that suffers from poor quality on the power delivered to them by the Power Grid. Kievenergo (Ukraine) Activ Solar (Ukraine) 4. Technical partnerships Smilics (Spainand Scandinavia), IBM (Scandinavia), Caverion (Northen Europe), Grundfos (Denmark) 5. Financial partnerships. Nefco (Nefco.org), IFU (Foreign office in Denmark) The main driver for the last 6 months has been to verify the concept and the potential in purpose build calculations and reports, based on data from Internet of Things.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3214,INCE208,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,SER TEC S.r.l.,TortellinoHPC,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"TORTELLINOHPC, High Performance Computing Cluster is a prototype built with an energy-efficient system that allows users to consume less energy and calculate faster. The project fits in the search for innovative and eco-compatible (GreenTech) solutions for cooling systems of calculation and data centers. The main difference with respect to other solutions available on the market is the immersion cooling system, which collects and removes heat from the CPU, GPU and APU, FPGA, RAM and power supplies, and diverts it to other applications. In particular, TORTELLINOHPC employs as cooling fluid a dielectric vegetable biofluid developed by SER TEC S.r.l.. Processors are fully immersed in this fluid which has a much better thermo-conductivity and convection than those commonly used in other systems as coolant. Good thermal-conductivity and convection permits operation in passive cooling conditions, without expensive and bulky devices for fluid circulation and heat exchange. Our closed loopƒ??system is able to maintain the temperature within the due range¶ÿ for the correct operation of hardware. These factors allow a drastically reduced energy consumption for cooling, and hence, energy consumption as a whole. In terms of usability, therefore, it is a practical and safe solution that guarantees very high performance. Furthermore, SER TEC biofluid is not harmful to humans in case of contact and / or ingestion. The TORTELLINOHPC cooling system operates soundlessly and this is a further advantage in comparison to conventional systems. The watchword of the presented business proposal are efficiency and eco-friendly.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3217,INCE211,INCE,INCENSe,Germany,-,e.Ray The Current Converter,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,  ,"The serial production of modular hydrokinetic power plants is our goal. By converting the kinetic energy of rivers, a clean and stable energy source can be used for expediting the electrification in developing countries and as an extension of the energy system in industrialized countries. The converter unit can be directly attached to the shore. By connecting several converter units, it is possible to increase the power output and the size of the platform. The platform over the water surface can be used by people practicing a nature based lifestyle, where they can leave their boat, use it as recreational area, do fish-farming or use it as a habitat for flora and fauna. We plan to use the FI-WARE sensor / actuator package and a cloud based SQL data base to store and process sensor and production data. A web app will provide our customers with reports about their electricity consumption and production. Also we would like to collect and provide ecological data of the rivers where our power plants are installed, e.g. to provide better flood forecast. Because we handle sensitive data from our customers, we like to integrate also FI-WARE security.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3219,INCE213,INCE,INCENSe,Germany,-,Betterspace,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,  ,"Betterspace develops energy efficiency (EE) solutions for non-residential buildings (e.g. offices and hotels). Its EE is even more critical compared to those of residential and industrial applications. There is a clear conflict of interests between hotel and guest, landlord and tenant as well as employers and employees. Above problems can be solved through connecting things (sensors and actors) inside the rooms as well as providing intelligent control (apps) at room levels (e.g. energy saving, individual room comfort). To save maintenance costs, various rooms can be linked to a facility control for the remote diagnostic system. Having a high penetration, a low cost system with basic functions could be provided, assumed as a basic infrastructure. Then the additional apps can be further booked (e.g. maintenance, luxury). It can be compared with mobile phone, which users can book different apps. With open source concepts, the payback time of our EE-solution is less than 3 years.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3224,INCE218,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,Lock Charge Srl,Lock Charge system (LC system),0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The patent pending LC system is unlocking the potential of small voltage electric vehicles. column1: 3226,INCE220,INCE,INCENSe,Belgium,-,Noven Energy Hub,0,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,#N/A,-,YES,OUT,  ,"The Noven Energy Hub orchestrates on a real-time basis the energy (heat and power) supply and demand balance in buildings. 1) CONNECT: the Hub interfaces with all the energy nodes in a building: consumption meters, generators, storage, grid connection etc. 2) MONITOR: the Hub provides at any time a real-time overview of the energy balance as well as the status of the different components. It sends alerts in event of breakdowns and provide data to create or validate energy bills. 3) MANAGE: based on the instantaneous energy balance, the Hub manages the available flexibility in the building (generation capacity, demand side management or storage) to minimize the cost of the energy and to smoothen the integration in the grid Customers of the Hub will be charged a license fee: a recurring fee based on their actual needs and use of the Hub. About Noven: Noven is a novel energy supplier for buildings: it designs, installs and operates integrated energy solutions. (www.noven.be)",Tech provider,,0,0,0,0,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,0,0,SME,0,noven.be

3228,INCE222,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,TEA Ambiente s.r.l,GUENDA,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"Geothermal district system at low and medium enthalpies for power and heating/cooling generation are expected to grow rapidly in the next few years, increasing of 250% of installed power within 2030. To properly exploit and manage these resources at urban scale, specific software are needed, especially to plan resources development across urban districts. The scope of GUENDA proposal is to provide energy utilities, engineering companies and public administrator with an advanced and integrated design and management tool for electrical power generation and heating/cooling distribution system on urban district based on geothermal low and medium enthalpies, providing on the same platform both design capabilities of the systems, prediction of performance along the time, data collection and distribution for remote elaboration through cloud implementation of application, all managed by a 3D GIS interface for application interaction and data representation for desktop and mobile terminals",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3229,INCE223,INCE,INCENSe,Greece,Satellite Mobile Applications P.C.,"Simple, Intelligent Sensitive M2M (SIS-M2M) system for water and electricity saving: Its more than just an automation",0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,#N/A,"The reason of inspiration was the concern over the water and electricity overconsumption. The environmental impacts of irrigation relate to the changes in quantity and quality of soil and water as a result of irrigation and the effects on natural and social conditions in river basins and downstream of an irrigation scheme. Day by day the electricity consumption is rapidly increased over the world. The need of a break into solution for efficient water and electrical power management is of massive importance. The aforementioned in brief were the 2 keys of the idea conception. The main two targeted domains of applicability are the Agricultural and the Home Intelligence domain. The innovation that can really characterize and differ from common smart homes and automated irrigation systems is that everything occured under sensitive processing, steps, loops and parameters. Moreover we succesfully integrated into our solution satellite data (data fusion - SAR, optical etc.) which is actually another asset of our solution. The ƒ??sensitivityƒ? is a totally new designation for a M2M network and it refers to the information that we want to propagate. Sensitive M2M communication has to deal with the information, which can be characterized by its volume, security, speed, autonomy, priority etc. This information is the main object of two or more machines/systems that communicate. Utilizing the aforementioned information we can save water electrical power and several sources of energy. The proposed idea can be applied for both Farming and Home Intelligence domains (Agricultural and Domestic applications). The system can be described by Hardware and Software (will be analyzed in other sections) module, where every component is independent system independent of local environment and constitutes a complete smart grid. This SIS-M2M system consists of one Intelligent Box, which is actually the processinf-operational-decision centre that can automatically communicate under a sensitive way with a large group of sensors, systems and machines. The sensitive way that mentioned above is the reason why M2M communication can become special and can be described as a Co-interactive Communication (CiC) under specific group of programming scripts. The whole networked-system will be developed under common systems and protocols such as: Bluetooth, Wi-Fi module, GSM GPS module, Serial communication, I2C protocol, A/D conversion etc. The SIS-M2M application will be able to sense the needs of every system with an intelligent way recording the water and electricity consumption within predefined thresholds (thresholds and needs set by Consumers). For instance an installed soil moisture probe in a corn farm will be able to automatically communicate with the irrigation system and rural drilling machine in order to start the irrigation when the soil is ƒ??thirstyƒ?. The next step is that the soil moisture probe will inform the Intelligent Box that the moisture level is ƒ??OKƒ? in order to stop the irrigation. This can save large amounts of water and make farming intelligent under IoT and M2M frameworks. Additionally we will exploit our know-how of soil moisture retrieval from satellite optical and SAR imagery to upgrade our system. The Intelligent Box will be able to receive data from the installed sensors and satellite data. With an automated way (our algorithm) soil moisture will be also estimated from sat images, whicah can act as a confirmation or the major parameter in larger farms. Thousands of Gallons can be saved with this preocedure. The SIS-M2M system can easily adopted from the Home Intelligence domain. It constitutes an transferrable technology with high intercompatibility independent systems. Smart Homes with special automation were something incredible 10 years ago. With our sensitive proposal we can create special features and apply out intelligent system in homes or existent smart applications for Home automation (thermostat can easily integrated-utilized in SIS-M2M system). The reason why we offer innovative solution is that the user will be able to control everything from his smartdevice or his PC with a simple application. He will be able to interfere to the system according to his needs by predefining the thresholds of the system (both for agricultural and domestic domain). The application can be simply installed in smart devices (smartphones, smartwatches, etc) by offering remote control of sources management with real time need records.",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

column1: 3234,INCE228,INCE,INCENSe,Macedonia,-,e-PARKING,0,0,0,#N/A,-,NO,0,  ,"The user (driver) by their smart phone connects to the network of a SMART CITY and asks for the closest available parking place. The network confirms the demand and guides the user to the nearest vacant place. HUD device is being used. (www.navdy.com) The type and dimensions of the used vehicle is previously programmed in parking process apps of the smart phone. The garage computer receives the information what vehicle (size, weight) is expected. The SMART CITY also informs the garage computer about the exact time when the vehicle will reach the entrance terminal based on the real evaluated movement through traffic. There are places in the garage marked, equipped and defined for leaving and taking the vehicle t e r m i n a l s. The vehicles are left on the first available terminal in the garage. The driver leaves the car. From that moment on, the garage computer is responsible for the vehicle. During the operation GALE guides the TRPE-s under the vehicle. TRPE-s are raising and then carrying the car to the place of previously determined exact parking spot. The whole process is reversed during the return of the vehicle to the user. While not working, the robots are moved to predefined place and connected to the grid for recharging. During the whole process the engine of the parked car is not working. Unlike other systems for automating parking, where parking places are dimensioned for the largest vehicles, in this case there is possibility for completely economization of the available space. The maximum modular structure of the system offers high level of redundancy and readiness . All mechanical modules of the System GALE, TRPE, elevators and vehicle entrance and exit terminals are relatively simple, and integrated from standardized parts. The system is relatively easy to manufacture and maintenances with long service life. All other elements in the system are software. Any software is very flexible and easy to develop, improve, upgrade and replace within FI-PPP. The whole system of parking area, has only smooth leveled concrete floor without other complicated elements and structures. The parking is networked within SMART CITY cloud in FIWARE environment. Open source architecture offers opportunity for major optimization of the processes, save time, space, energy, provides user friendly service, less pollution during operation and it is versatile in every aspect. The manipulation robot is consisted of four operating elements TRPE that transport, lift and position the vehicle. The fifth element is the intelligent robot GALE- which manages and monitors the manipulation process on the site. The four TRPE elements are in constant WIFI and sensor connection between each other and also with the fifth element GALE which manages the whole movement process. All elements are synchronized and move through the parking in several predefined mutual formations depending of the situation. If there is necessity for changing the floor level, then the elevator is used. GALE has the ability for the vehicle dimension recognizing and immediately compares the vehicle with the stored data from the garage computer car database, information from the smart phone of the owner, as well as recognition of the vehicle at the point of reception. From to the database info for the car type, dimensions and characteristics of the vehicles, GALE and TRPE robots determine the approach trajectory, the approach patch and how to raise the vehicle for which predefined routines are written , according to the configuration of the garage. GALE and TRPE robots control and maintain the relative position between each other and the surrounding space with use of sensors. GALE is in constant communication with the garage computer and orients in space by local GPS network at each floor level, triangulating on the required number of transponders or through a wired network in the floor. All communications and payments for the service will be performed electronically. The parking space is under complete surveillance and all security elements are constantly monitored. .",#N/A,,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,0,#N/A,0,#N/A

3244,INCE238,INCE,INCENSe,Greece,Modio Computing SP,TransformIntel,0,"ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND AIR CONDITIONING SUPPLY",B2B,3,2,YES,IN,Ioannis Georgiadis,"Industrial power transformers constitute a critical element of power-based infrastructure. Failure of power transformers can lead to power outages, communication outages and interruptions to transportation. Yet monitoring transformers remains largely a lengthy manual task while only very short-term failure estimation services are commercially available. Transformintel is a real-time intelligent monitoring, and predictive failure analysis solution for industrial power transformers. Transformintel combines chemical analysis and electrical properties of power transformers in order to reliably identify ongoing and potential hardware failures. Transformintel employs predictive analytics algorithms and a large set of historic measurements to develop models for current hardware health state and potential future hardware failure. Transformintel is an integrated hardware/software solution offered as a service with an elastic subscription-based pricing model.",Tech Provider,X,X,0,0,X,0,,Hardware,Other Engineering,Applications,Engineering Applications,2,0,0,SME,0,modio.io

column1: 3254,INCE248,INCE,INCENSe,Italy,Atooma SRL,Atooma,0,Horizontal (solutions suitable for every verticals),B2B,7,3,YES,IN,Fabrizio Cialdea,"Today more than 99 percent of ?things? still lays unconnected, and this means there is a tremendous growth potential that will make networked connections more and more valuable, bringing together data from people (human to machine) and smart objects (machine to machine), and providing richer experiences thanks to context-aware ecosystems of devices connected to the cloud. Nowadays, besides restricted market niches, there are no established players providing a standardisation as enablers for cross-device interactions in the IoT landscape, but an undefined number of device manufacturers and platform providers. We have built Atooma as the key enabler to new generations of smart devices designed to connect any  kind of smart device and sensors, and to let them talk to each other as an automation hub. 3267,Smar1,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Denmark,minAGRO,AC,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Peter Arendt,"Relevance Grain prices are extremely volatile and farmers are experiencing a huge price related risk. Timing of sales of grains and purchase of animal feed has therefore become crusiual for the long term survival of the farmer of today. Most farmers are, however, not aware of the huge price related risk that they are experiensing at any time. Those few farmers who are aware og the risk, do not have the tools nor the relevant competencies to control it. Instead they focus on what they are good at ? being a farmer. Their focus is on optimizing yields and feed formula and NOT on optimizing prices. As a result they invest a large amount of money in various machinery and agricultural consultancy. However the economical benefit is relatively small, the size of the investment taken into account. On the other hand, it is possible to create a large scale economical benefit by trading grains at the right time with an up-to-date risk management strategy. The AgroCockpit app supply the farmer with a professionel and up-to-date trading strategy, that makes sure, he takes advatage of favorable price trends in the grain market. Description of App - version 1.0 The AgroCockpit app makes it easy for farmers to manage their price related risk despite difficult market conditions, through automacialy robot generated and up-to-date risk management strategies. The app is developed for growers and sellers of grains as well as for buyers of grains and animal feed ? hence arable farming as well as livestock production. Targeting market The targeting market is farmers worldwide selling or buying grains. Initially, the targeting market is European farmers. The AgroCockpit app is, however, equally applicable for rice producers in China, coffee producers in South America, farmers in developing countries, as it is for soy producers and cattle breeders in the United States. All farmers world wide are subject to the extreme price fluctuations and therefore need to proactively manage the price related risk.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3268,Smar2,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Poland,SIRC Sp. z o.o.,AerialMonitor,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Radoslaw Piesiewicz,"It is the aim of SIRC to join forces with MP Projekt and develop an integrated solution for remote and automated sensing of soil moisture content utilizing radar sensor and radar signals processing from SIRC and flying platform from MP Projekt in addition to its expertise of the farming/agricultural market and well developed distribution channels. The system is intended to sense soil moisture and will support the farmer in taking optimal decisions to streamline his precision agriculture (PA) processes. Currently, soil moisture is either measured locally by on-the-site measurement equipment, which is costly, time consuming and provides only local information, or by means of satellites, which is also costly, difficult to deploy on demand and delivers data with coarse resolution only. A breakthrough in the remote measurement of soil moisture could be achieved by mounting radar sensors on drones, i.e. remotely piloted aerial systems (RPAS). Data collected from such a system could be collected in real-time, processed and utilized for the management of PA processes. Such an integrated system of soil moisture content sensing, mapping and feedback channels for PA processes would provide tremendous benefits for farmers and agricultural enterprises. The specicfic objective of this project is to design and develop a dedicated prototype software solution, consisting of a centrally managed command center, mobile apps deployed on portable devices to visualize results and take decisions for PA and an app deployed on a drone to read the radar data and send it to a command center for further processing. The developed software solution will be validated in-field.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

It is accessible via an easy to understand REST API or JavaScript API and web mashups. Ag-Knowledge allows any web portal, mobile app or enterprise application to offer cost efficient field monitoring to their customers. It provides continuous updates on crop phenology and field activites throughout the season for each field subscribed to the service. Through notifications and alarming services the user will be actively informed about irregularities on his field. In its nature the field monitoring service is comparable to weather web-services that can be found on many web pages. Ag-Knowledge addresses the following basic information needs: ? Getting actively informed about any detected status change on the field such as a phenology status change, a crop damage or farming operations such as tillage, planting and harvest ? Providing documentation of farmer activities on the field throughout the season ? Providing simplified information for non experts This information can be used for the following purposes: ? Farmers will get informed about the status of their remote properties ? Consultants and agents will have better information for their advices to farmers ? Insurances get information about current and previous field status as well as potential claims ? Agri-finance industry can improve their risks management ? Supply chain players can address their farmers more specifically ? Food industry can monitor contracted fields and better predict supply ? Governments can improve their controls for subsidies payments Geocledian will be supported among others stakeholders by two partners: ? CloudEO AG for backend services and business development ? Ceptu IVS carrying out end-user trials with their mobile application FieldSense for monitoring crop health.",Tech provider,0,0,0,X,X,0,,Software,Data Integration and Access Software,Application Development & Deployment,Structured Data Management Software,1,X,#N/A,SME,40000,0

3270,Smar4,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,0,AgManor,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Pat Mc Neill,"AgManor has identified a problem that affects farmers every time they have to buy/sell livestock. A day at the ?cattle mart? costs them time and money both of which tend to be in short supply given the vagaries of farming. Remember that a journey could be pointless and also one is limited to the market as represented by the chosen livestock mart. AgManor is developing a platform which permits farmers to view and bid online at participating marts from the comfort of their own home (or tractor!). They will also be able to avail of a ?virtual ring? for the purpose of buying and selling livestock between themselves while being assured that the paperwork and payments will be processed by their nearest mart. The platform will be accessed via their smartphones or tablets . AgManor will also provide customers with the ability to review the day?s activity through watching recorded mart sales and also placing adverts online to appeal to their target audience in a way that has never been done before. Technology is progressing at such a rapid pace that new and smart solutions are emerging all the time and especially in the field of commerce. Online trading concepts are well established across many industries including agri-business, therefore, the opportunity exists to apply an efficient and cost-effective technical solution to the trading of bovine animals and others.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3271,Smar5,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,MATRIX - Information Technologies,AGRENIO,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,3,4,YES,IN,Hara Koutalou,"Software in the field of Precision Agriculture (PA) - irrigation The main aim of the project is to create easy-to-use software that will advise farmers how much and when to irrigate their crops using data from weather stations and other humidity measurement instruments installed in their fields or near them. The situation now In Greece, the use of water in agriculture with irrigation covering 85% of the total water consumption. In South Europe, farmers are irrigating their fields with empirical methods. It is known that they use much more water than necessary ? about 30% more. This method has the result of a large wastefulness of water and laundering of useful soil components. The software The software belongs to the class of Precision Agriculture (PA) and irrigation in particular rational. The software will be development as a web application for all of its characteristics and as a mobile application only to give information to the farmers. The software will be very easy-to-use from farmers. The software will take data from weather stations and other humidity measurement instruments installed in the field, calculate the amount of water needed using the appropriate calculation formula every day and advise farmers if their crop needs irrigation and how much water they need. Each time the software connects with instruments and reads new data, will calculate the amount of water needed for each particular crop the farmer has assigned to each particular weather station or other measurement devices. Every farmer will have an account in the software and a record for every field and every crop they want to watch for irrigation with the software. The farmer can connect to application whenever he wants ? web or mobile edition ? and informed if his crops needs irrigation and the amount of water needed. Advantages of using the software Using this software, a farmer will: ? reduce production costs ? save water ? improve product quality ? protect the environment",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,Advanced and Predictive Analytics Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,X,http://www.matrix-it.gr/,Startup,40000,matrix-it.gr

3272,Smar6,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Poland,Double P Software Piotr Pytlik,Agri Services,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Piotr Pytlik,"Our proposal is to bring a smart SaaS farm management solution into the EU marketplace, adapted to its agricultural needs and processes, integrated with the Fi-Ware platform. This system, successfully deployed in Canada 10 years ago, has been helping Canadian farmers and their advisors ever since. They have been showing consistent improvement in productivity, lowering the production cost while increasing the yield. This is due to the optimization of all processes and thanks to handy access to relevant data within a single, integrated solution. We would like to adapt this system to the specifics of a much more fragmented European agricultural infrastructure. In the end, our solution will be made available as a social network consisting of farmers, producers, suppliers, advisors and other stakeholders in the food industry, allowing a smart exchange and the sharing of customized information. Placed in the cloud, it will offer mobile and web-based support to farmers throughout the process of agricultural production as well as in crisis situations related to equipment failure, weather anomalies and other random incidents. Our solution will enable quick access to all relevant information required by the farmer in a given situation, sharing of spare resources, group buying, selling, training and outsourcing services offered within a local geographical region. In many cases it will shorten the supply chain and allow all producers to better compete in the world market. Given the large number of small entities, this is a key factor in terms of efficiency. Intelligent data mining algorithms will forward relevant information directly to specific groups of agricultural producers. These communication channels will allow the delivery of quality information needed to optimize and improve efficiency of the production process regardless of the farm size and specialization. Our platform and its essential functionality will be made available to farmers free of charge.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3273,Smar7,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Italy,TeamDev,Agricolous,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,5,7,YES,IN,Alex Paiella,"Our world is getting larger? and hungrier? with every tick of the clock. Each second, the world?s population grows by nearly 3 more people, that is 240,000 people a day. By 2025, the global population will reach 8 billion people and 9.6 billion by 2050. This means there will be an extra billion mouths to feed within the next 12 years. And within one generation, there will be more people additionally on the planet than there were at the beginning of the 20th century. Feeding the growing world population poses an unprecedented challenge to human ingenuity. Even in the best of circumstances, sustainably satisfying this hugely increased demand for crops and livestock will be an enormous task. By 2050, food production must increase by 70% to keep pace. European Agriculture needs to become more productive and at the same time to meet environmental goals. Reconciling food production and environmental goals can be achieved through the adoption of appropriate technologies. Frequently farm entrepreneurs do not have the right information at the right time in order to manage efficiently both their farm production and the phytosanitary (pesticide and fertilizers) treatments needed for the health plants. Moreover very often the information related to sow /harvest /treatments are not interconnected with the pesticide and fertilizers storage and are used only for administrative scopes. Agricolous project aim at address these problems by providing a novel solution integrated into FI-WAARE/ FI-SPACE technology enabling farmer to both produce ?more with less? improving and reduce agriculture?s environmental footprint.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,#N/A,SME,40000,0

3274,Smar8,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,SYNELIXIS SOLUTIONS,AgriFI,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,6,9,YES,IN,Panos Trakadas,"AgriFI is a novel, FIWARE-based service, offered through the FIspace platform, that will provide the opportunity to farmers across Europe to: 1) get accurate and real-time predictions of possible diseases related to their crops and consequently activate rules and conditions that will trigger specific actions related to diseases, 2) get up-to-date information about diseases and nutrition recipes related to their crops and 3) capitalize on the FIspace platform to create a pan-European farmers? community, sharing the same problems and discussing possible solutions. AgriFI will be realized through the instantiation, adaptation, configuration and utilization of 11 FI-PPP enablers, including the 7 FIspace modules, 2 GEs and 2 SEs. During the project lifetime, AgriFI service will be extensively validated in two key European agricultural countries (Germany and Finland), based on SynField product and already installed external management systems, against a clear set of KPIs. Testing and validation of AgriFI will be conducted in the Hessische Staatsdomane Frankenhausen farm (320ha) provided by University of Kassel and the Vakola research farm (150ha) provided by MTT. AgriFI service will include disease prediction rules for a variety of crops cultivated across Europe, including cereals (wheat, barley), vineyards, potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, cauliflowers and cherry trees. The experience of Synelixis in FIWARE components (gained through the participation in four FI-PPP projects) and agricultural products (SynField) combined with the expertise in developing disease prediction rules of one of the most famous Universities in Europe (University of Kassel) and one of the largest research institutes in Europe (MTT) creates a strong consortium capable of developing, testing and validating a competitive disease management solution for the European agricultural market. AgriFI will promote its results through a well-defined and specially designed strategy with clear purpose, audience, methods and different messages to be transferred per stakeholders? group, based on their special interests. In this perspective, AgriFI will provide additional functionality to the extensible FIspace SaaS platform, enabling the seamless, efficient and effective business collaboration across stakeholders.",Service provider,0,X,0,0,X,0,,Software,Advanced and Predictive Analytics Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,X,http://www.synelixis.com/,SME,39635,synelixis.com

3275,Smar9,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Slovenia,"BO - MO, d.o.o.",AgriFORsee,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,4,21,YES,IN,Luka Honzak,"High-resolution meteorological data is of key relevance for agriculture since weather plays an important role in agriculture. It has a substantial influence on crop growth and yield development, incidence of pests and diseases and irrigation requirements. Weather forecast can significantly support the decisions made on optimization of agro-management practices, such as fertilizer applications and cultural field operations. The Balkan area/South-eastern Europe has an intensive agricultural production and plays an important role as well in European agricultural space. Agricultural sector is big water user in many countries in the area and proper irrigation scheduling (applying of water when needed in the optimal amount) is necessary. Optimization of irrigation water use is based on the fact that sensitivity of crop growth and development may vary between different stages of crop growth. We propose two applications with associated smartphone application (or at least web page adjusted to smartphone): Weather forecast for agriculture application and Irrigation advice application. As we already explained good weather forecasts are extremely important in agriculture, thus we propose application for high resolution weather forecast with the lead time of 3-4 days, which will provide crucial agro-meteorological variables used in agriculture on hourly basis and especially focus on the rain. The spatial extent covers broader Balkan region. Moreover, data from this application could be used also used as an input for other application (e.g. irrigation). Irrigation advice application is a simple application for advising on irrigation timing and amount of water applied for major crops, based on farmers? tensiometer/lizimeter measurement and rain forecast from Weather forecast for agriculture application. 3277,Smar11,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Clictic S.L.,AGRI-sens,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,5,6,YES,IN,Miguel Caneda,"ICT use in the horticultural sector is an interesting work field for the present and future opportunities, in particular by developing precise agricultural technologies monitoring air and soil temperature and humidity to support and help farmers to better manage production for ensuring high quality products, competitiveness, productivity and profitability while reducing the environmental footprints. 3278,Smar12,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,Martin Hoffmann,agriSmaCCS,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Martin Hoffmann,"The permanent control and monitoring of animals and premises is a time and cost intensive task. A farmer has to visit and inspect his stables or grazing land regularly. Especially during the calving period, a vet (and a dairy farmer) have to leave bed many times per night. A camera installation inside the stable can reduce these nightly visits and lead to better calving results and better treatment for sick animals. The image data alone does not suffice to treat a calving or sick animal. It is necessary to gather more information (where did the animal graze). This information need to be looked up separately in a herd management system or online databases. Gathering data from different sources is a time consuming task. We propose to develop a video surveillance systems that stores data in the cloud. Thereby farmers can access the video streams from remote locations. The system will allow for remote monitoring via a smartphone application and provide a web interface integrated into FISpace. Farmers therefore need to install cameras on their premises. Since we are not interested in selling cameras, we will support a wide range of common off-the-shelf cameras, that can be used with the software we are going to develop. Many Farmers already use CCTV based analog systems in order to remotely monitor the state of their animals. A drawback of these systems is the image quality and the lack of remote access to the video data. I.e., the video data can be watched on a monitor in the farmers kitchen or office ? but not while working outside on the fields. Apart from farmers, the cameras can be accessed by vets. Thereby, cost for the treatment of sick/calving animals can be reduced. With FIspace, the image data can be connected to data from herd management systems. Thereby, the data is connected to nutrition and health information of each animal. We plan to cooperate with Irish Farm Computers Ltd, and address both Ireland and Germany with our respective software products.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3280,Smar14,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,AGROESTUDIO TECHNOLOGY,AGROAPP,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jonathan Becedas,"The agro-food sector presents one of the largest manufacturing industries in Europe. 3281,Smar15,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Agroptima,Agroptima,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,10,1,YES,IN,Emilia Vila Valls,"Farmers need a software farm management tool to keep record of their activities on the fields, make better decisions based on real data and manage from one place their fields, machines, products, etc. The reality is that a lot of farmers want to use such a tool, but the problem is that current software tools have a series of deficiencies: they are not mobile, they are hard to use or they are not based on real data, etc. In addition, the machine generated data from their tractors and other devices gets lost. Therefore, most farmers end up making poor decisions, which are not based on data. Agroptima is a simple and modern mobile APP and a cloud software tool for farmers, designed with farmers. It will have a simple interface and farmers can work from the fields without internet connection. Agroptima allows the farmer to keep record of his activities, crops and to analyze costs, based on real data he gathers with his smartphone. In addition, the cloud will have an API to connect to the machines so machine generated data can be used for further decision making. The benefits for the farmer: - Manage his farm efficiently from anywhere - Save time by keeping records from the field, so when he arrives home most administrative work is done - Have real data to make better decisions - Concentrate all his information in one single place - Be more competitive, by identifying which crops, fields, machines or workers have better productivity. Improve decisions on his inputs, crop planning, investment in machinery, hiring, etc. The 2 differences between us and other companies who might have a similar idea is that first, we focus on mobile, because agriculture is mobile and second, we focus on use of machine generated data to improve the decision-making of the farmer. Our vision is to modernize farm management. We think that farmers are the most important player in this challenge, and our tool is designed with them in mind. We now need SmartAgriFood funding to accelerate our development. Help us make our vision come true! The Agroptima team",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,X,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,#N/A,SME,40000,0
