3285,Smar19,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Portugal,Instituto Pedro Nunes,AGSS,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jo?o Almeida,"Currently, many projects we face in south Europe country farmers have some kind of automation and sensoring. Nevertheless, there are typically dated setups, in which there is no intelligence nor communication, and little user interaction. They are, in fact, systems based on timers, which allow little external and remote control and don?t take into account external weather conditions. Most complaints from the owners of these systems are the inability to remotely control the production, and therefore they are limited to local control. This limitation leads to higher costs of transportations (as the fields are typically far from habitation centers). Being timer-based systems, most of them have a low number of sensors. This lack of information does not allow the system to take into account weather factors, nutrient presence of the remaining irrigation water, and the presence of plant diseases, which are normally manually observed by the human operator. Therefore, with the proposed Advanced Growing System (AGS) system, we want to take a further step on the agricultural production process, implementing a system with a number of sensors for different areas: production, phytosanitary, nutrient, etc, and a central intelligent system, which, by means of proven algorithms, takes into account the sensor information to optimize in real time quantity and production time. The system will also have a user friendly cloud-based interface, from which the user will have all the production under control, even taking manual actions, if necessary.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3286,Smar20,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Ireland,RFI Ltd.,AIGBLP,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Raymond O'Neill,"This application is made from the Company RFI Ltd. who are a agri. and environmental consulting company based in the south wast Of Ireland. Raymond O'Neill is CEO and holds a master degree in Agriculture for University College Dublin. The project will develop, test and market mobile apps for the intensive grass based livestock sector. Dairy farmers who utilise a large proportion of grazed grass in their cows diet are the core target market. This app will allow farmers to understand the amount of grass on their farm and make decisions based on the information. This data will be shared through the FI space platform with other farmers and consultants. This will allow farmers to allocate the correct amount of grass to their herd per grazing event. The app will be monitised in two ways:- 1. A small initial charge for downloading the app. onto smartphone or other mobile device. (?1 /?2 suggested) 2. Advertising revenue. As information on the quantity of grass available to farmers is known, when compiled and analysed it makes a larger over-all regional and national picture. Oversupply farmers are natural customers for input suppliers (plastic, silage additive, forage traders) while under supply farmers may require feed, fertiliser, better grass cultivars or additional forage. Two apps will be created - both of which are already at design document stage (see attachment):- The first app will summarise the amount of available grass on the farm through a simple 'wedge' graph. The farmer inputs the data (grass cover per paddock) which is then computed and displayed in a quantity of grass per paddock. When data input is finished this completed data is assembled and displayed in graphical form and stored for reference. The referencing the graph the farmer can make decisions as the actual grass supply is displayed against 'idea'l grass supply. If over-supplied the farmer can make silage witht hte excess etc or if under-supplied then the farmer can feed supplementary feed etc. The second app. is used by farmers to allocate grass to the herd per grazing event (12 hourly/ daily etc). By inputting the grass cover and the number of cows to be fed the app will display the farmers the areas required. Using the GPS function of the phone the phone then signals the farmer then the correct beginning point to erect the temperory fence is reached.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3287,Smar21,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Poland,Informatyka Bankowa POLSOFT,AM RENTAL,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Kajetan Wlazlo,"In Poland, small and medium-sized farms make up over half of all farms. Also in other European countries a lot of farmers operate on a small scale. Often they cannot afford to buy expensive equipment such as harvesters or another advanced equipment and agricultural machinery. Presently, in Polish villages it is customary to use the services of more affluent farmers who have the necessary equipment. Often, such people despite their willingness, are not able to help everyone during harvest time at short notice. Some wealthy farmers, when they realize that they have a monopoly on this type of services in their area, tend to increase prices. Unfortunately, not all farmers are able to meet the costs. Limitation to choosing only from among people from in the closest area and lack of awareness of offers from farmers from neighbouring villages, is the current state of things in Polish villages. A common problem can also be matching the machinery size to the size of the field. For example a large harvester cannot work in small fields. Conversely, small harvesters become unprofitable on larger fields. However, the lack of choice of other machines, and the lack of knowledge of farmers about offers from other people results in having no other choice than using only their closest neighbours? offers. Our application is intended for small and medium-sized farmers who do not have large or advanced agricultural machines. Such machines are expensive and can be afforded only by the large-scale farmers. However, as all farmer need to cultivate their land, smaller farms have to use more services in order to maintain their production. So far those services are provided among people who know each other. One large farmer often has a monopoly on this type of services in his area and either demands high prices or is not able to help all farmers from the nearest area. This issue can be solved by our portal. It allows to create offers for agricultural services, which increases competitiveness and also gives opportunity for large-scale farmers to plan the work. On the other hand our solution offers smaller farmers the possibility to choose the best offers of agricultural services. Also the smaller farmers may publish notices they have a demand for specific services and equipment, and then choose the best offer. This solution allows to reduce the costs for small farms, which is very important for their small budgets. Moreover, thanks to the development of such a system, all farmers can improve their management plans for their farms.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3288,Smar22,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,0,ASFAST,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Actua2 Actuaciones Tacticas y Tecnologicas S.L.,"Our project consists to design a predictive model based on Datamining and Big Data principles that help agricultural companies to plan their future campaign and to be more competitive on the markets in which they operate and on the new where they decide to operate.This can be achieved by measurement systems that collect data as well as external and internal indicators.Those variables and indicators shall be collect from several fonts and they will be able to show us future scenarios that influence in the company investments, on the market where they intend to commercialize, in the prices policy, in the profit margins, etc. This solution provides the information necessary to allow a staff sizing in line with production needs in terms of the numbers of operators by line and position through an analytical and predictive process. Similarly it allows you to define operative development patterns that should guide the operatorïs performance to achieve the defined results.A number of test batteries will be used in order to define the development patterns for a specific position which it will include dichotomous indicators defined as critical outputs of each node of the process.the definition of production objectives shall be determined by a joint analysis of inputs provided by the companyïs historical data.Using this variables through the GE (Generic Enabler) ?Cosmos? it will be possible the analysis of these data and the creation of an operative solution to the productive performing and dimensioning problem in the stores. The use of presence sensors placed above the lines and in register (through weight and line speed sensors) as well as transformed outputs in each position (processed kg) will allow the identification of misaligned production rate through the use of the module Orion-Context Broker. This may lead to corrective actions for potential threats to the realization of the objectives. The target market on we are focusing our project is the distribution chain in the fruit and vegetable sector. The team (that are going to develop this project) shall include: 1 Project manager, 2 analysts, 1 programmer analyst, 2 programmers, 1 systems technician and 1 infraestructure provider partner. With regard to these competitors, our project has an important differential value that it is described below: We know horticultural sector because we have implemented several solutions in this environment, such as commercial balance scorecard, description, valuation and evaluation of productive equipments performing, productivity and economic results improving. Our predictive models are very sectorized regarding competition because there are no so specialized solutions. In addition, it covers the transformation area, productive needs and logistic and sales capacities as well as human capital. The way of commercialization will consist of offering a service in the cloud and a personalized scorecard to companies of this sector for the decision making. To do this, we take into account not only previous campaign production results but also future scenarios depending on trend of macroeconomic, social, politic, market and sectoral indicators. To attract companies weïll undertake diffusion campaigns of target service. This service is characterized by ?pay per use? once it has been parameterized and personalized. Therefore, the intention is that companies contract consulting services for the interpretation of the data, the implementation of action plans and the improvement of the competitiveness. In addition, it will be provided more services in the cloud such as access information of the sector, observatory, positioning in several parameters?that will be contracted separately. The aim is a company can contract this service by internet as well as beginning enjoying it within fifteen once the company includes the requirement information to personalize its casuistry. The business model proposed here is a company (Actua2)-dependent business line that allows a parameterization and personalization service of the tool in remote control taking into account that the solution is installed in a datacenter. 3291,Smar25,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Ireland,Beefmarket,Beefmarket,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Joe Dillon,"The Problem The Beef Industry ?There is always a beef crisis somewhere in the EU but sometimes it flares up more than usual. At the moment this industry is in crisis once again. Firstly, in Ireland all farmers can?t be dairy farmers because of circumstances, so the Beef / Suckler farmer is sometimes the only option and sometimes the preferred option or a way of life. For Example Ireland: Beef is a natural resource to Ireland and very significant part of Irish exports. Ireland has arguably the most stringent and best regulated Beef industry in the world with full back to birth traceability, highest quality, and highest level of animal welfare. Under the current system, the Irish Beef industry will continue fire-fighting, going from one crisis to the next. There is too many variables, costs continue to rise year and year while revenues are unknown and market driven. Beef Farmers have no control of finance, cash-flows, banking to name a few and their ability to stay in business has become a yearly gamble. Beef factories too have to contend with an unpredictable supply and quality, which forces commodity type pricing. These are some reasons for this ongoing beef crisis. We must refine this industry. The Solution The BEEFMARKET is an interactive website with a large database facility and mobile app compatible with android and apple devices, which benefit both the farmer and factory. The BEEFMARKET is an advance booking system for farmers to book their beef cattle to their chosen factory based on a ?minimum price? contract. The BEEFMARKET is a real time forecasting system for all factories within the system. The BEEFMARKET website will display ?minimum price? offers from all factories (within the system) based on killing dates up to a minimum of 3 months. Once the farmer is satisfied with a price/offer, he can lock into a ?minimum price? contract with the chosen factory. The BEEFMARKET is compatible with the CMMS (department animal database), therefore the farmer can highlight and upload his herd details on the BEEFMARKET website using his own secure login. Factories will have access to one of the largest feedlots in the world (BEEFMARKET).",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3292,Smar26,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,Beenotes,Beenotes,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,6,1,YES,IN,Notis Papasouliotis,"Horticulture and arable farming activities rely heavily on pollination. Western honey bees (Apis mellifera) are undoubtedly the single-most valuable animal pollinators to agriculture because they can be easily maintained and transported to pollinator-dependent crops. It is well documented that 76% of the production of food for human consumption is dependent on the beekeeping sector and 84% of vegetable species cultivated in Europe depend on pollination. Even though sharp regional declines in honey bee populations have occurred in the past, the magnitude and velocity of recent declines are shocking. The collapse in the global honeybee population is a major threat to crops and it is a product of multiple and often interacting factors. Beekeeping in EU27 is practiced mainly traditionally with little progress to report over the last 30-40 years in terms of innovation in techniques, methodologies or business practices and so it maintains an extensive rather than intensive nature. One of the primary constraints towards automation and intensification of the processes involved beekeeping has been the physical impossibility of beekeepers adequately recording beehive inspection and production data. Our proposed solution is a mobile phone application and web service, which will enable beekeepers worldwide to: i. Record, monitor and analyze production related data of beehives via a Voice User Interface (VUI)-guided, structured and optimized beehive inspection routine ii. Improve productivity by suggesting practices via a built-in decision support software based on unique, field-tested methodology offering : a) Advanced yet simple in practice productivity enhancement methods b) Holistic approach towards minimization of bees morbidity parameters(parasites, viruses, management issues, starvation, queen related issues) targeting the optimization of colony internal defense mechanisms. c) Production monitoring optimization and finally d) offer pollination services to farmers.",Tech provider,0,0,0,X,X,0,,Software,"Content Analytics, Discovery, and Cognitive Software",Applications,Content Applications,1,X,#N/A,SME,19400,0

3293,Smar27,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,France,Agri-Intranet SA,Bright Soil,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Stephane Duran,"Our prospective is to target a more efficient and sustainable use of certain inputs on arable crops. The objective is to modulate theses inputs according to the soil?s heterogeneity. Several soil properties determine to a large extent the crop performance in a field. If the aggregated heterogeneity of soil is combined with historic crop biomass heterogeneity, then we have a frame and diagnose to represent the spatial variation in crop performance in a field, with under- and outperforming zones. We will have a 3 step approach. Step 1 is the input of historic data on soil, biomass and yield heterogeneity. Step 2 delivers the diagnose map on which underperforming, average and outperforming parts of the field are shown. This information is used to propose management zones. In Step 3, management zones are linked to rates of important inputs, such as seeding density, some fertilizer and soil herbicides rates, as well as different tilling practices. If mature, we will use and contribute to many FIware generic enablers App along with the FISpace platform. The Soil Performance Diagnose App (SPD) will enable maps sharing with experts and will also evaluate the economic benefits when the farmer modulates its inputs.SPD will require little farmer?s data input and will be very affordable. Agri Intranet will lead and in be in charge of the software development of the SPD App. Earlier related work from Wageningen UR ?PPO/PRI on soil mapping and variable rate technology as well as Cesbio work on satellite imagery and Sentinel2 satellites, fully operational, in 2016 ( through EU COPERNICUS program) will comfort the project. End user trials will be done on farms in France and The Netherlands. Involved farm equipment companies indicated they will promote across farmers if the SPD App performed as expected. We limit the end user trial to testing in three crops. We will target sunflower crop in France and potato crop in Netherlands, as well as wheat in both counties.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 3296,Smar30,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Denmark,Conpleks Innovation ApS,CLARA,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,3,#N/A,YES,IN,Tom Simonsen,"We propose to develop a solution, called CLARA, for intelligent ?fleet management? of agricultural robots, with apropriate interfaces to the robots in operation and interfaces to centralized, cloud-based data logging facilities, helping to achieve this. The main product in the solution is a Clever Agricultural Robot App for tablet and/or smartphone use for management of agricultural robots. Some of the app functions and features are: ? Present the relevant robot operational data in a user-friendly way, supporting use-cases where the operator have access to one or several robots, with instant access to both live data as well as historical logged data ? Enable the sharing of live and historical data with other applications through the FIWARE Object Storage GE ? Utilize e.g. route planning and/or GIS data made by other applications for use on the connected managed robots ? Overall robot fleet management and supervision with integrated alarms and alerts ? Possibility to retrieve, gather and store, and compare operational information from agricultural robots in the field ? Real-time upload of data during live operation or as off-line batch uploads after completed operations ? to be stored in FIWARE Object Storage GE ? Enable information sharing with other applications through FIWARE The market for the solution and the app product is initially targeted at robots for semi-autonomous and later on autonomous, grassland automation and automated weed control. Also turf management related to maintenance of turf grass for sports or leisure use is in focus. The project described in this application will be developed by Conpleks Innovation ApS in Struer Denmark, with initially two selected end-user field trial partners. Conpleks is very active in research and development of agricultural robots. Currently this area contributes with approx. 80% of the company turnover.",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,X,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,40000,0

3297,Smar31,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,Digigrow Electronics,Connect your cultivation to the cloud,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,3,1,YES,IN,Dimitris Charitatos,"Remote monitoring and control systems used in agriculture, in the context of ""precision agriculture"", can be seen as an aid to the farmer for saving transportation costs to the field, taking action in case something changes in the field such as a sudden drop in temperature, forecasting plants diseases and optimizing irrigation procedures and energy consumption. In Digigrow we have developed a device to be installed in or near cultivations to monitor environmental variables such as temperature, air humidity, wind speed, luminosity etc. The device is easy to install and to use and connects to the internet either via a Wifi or 3G network. The user can then access the data through a web-service, view it in real-time and historically, and control other electronic or electrical devices connected to the device such as a water pumps, water valves and various types of switches. As part of the SmartAgriFood &ICT-AGRI call for funding, we propose to integrate FIWare generic enablers to our existing web-service and expose the resulting functionality as Widgets and Operators in FISpace. More specifically we are planning to utilize Orion Context Broker and Cosmos BigData Analysis. Following the software development which will be our main focus during Stage 1 (Prototyping), since the development of the device has been finalized as of the submission of the application, we are planning to perform end-user trials during Stage 2 with our proposed partners for this project in three (3) European countries: U.K. - Greenwatt Technology (greenwatt.co.uk) Sweden - LRF (lrf.se/In-English) Greece - Stevia-Hellas (stevianet.gr)",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,X,X,,Hardware,Performance Management Software,System Infrastructure Software,System Management Software,1,X,0,SME,40000,0

3298,Smar32,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Italy,PANON.IT,CROPS,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,Srdjan Sladojevic,"The problem of efficient plant-disease protection is closely related to the problems of sustainable agriculture and climate change. Research results indicate that climate change can alter stages and rates of development of the pathogen, modify host resistance, and result in changes in the physiology of host-pathogen interactions. The situation is further complicated by the fact that, today, diseases are transferred globally easier than ever before. New diseases can occur in places in which they were not present before and where the local expertise to combat them does not exist and ill-informed application of pesticides causes the development of long-term resistance of the pathogens, severely reducing our ability to fight back. Timely and accurate diagnosis of plant diseases is one of the pillars of precision agriculture and is crucial for preventing unnecessary waste of financial and other resources, achieving healthier production, addressing the problem of the development of long term resistance of the pathogen and mitigating the negative effects of climate change. An application for smart mobile devices that could detect diseases in fruits, vegetables and other crops based on the photo of a leaf, and suggest correct treatment, would serve as an aid to farmers for fast disease detection and speed up the decision-making process related to plant protection. At the same time it can be used to collect information about the location of the disease, creating a robust, grassroots technology system to aid in the fight for sustainable agriculture.",Tech provider,0,0,0,X,0,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,0,0,SME,40000,0

3299,Smar33,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Hungary,V mosinno Ltd.,CrowdHarvest,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,µd m Szab¢,"Generally, agricultural businesses, especially smaller ones, require liquid capital continuously for daily operation. A farmer has to invest throughout the year to reach the harvest and get some liquidity. Receiving a traditional credit or funding for an existing plantation is difficult and slow. Even if a bank or credit institution is willing to provide a loan it always involves mortgage for the concerned area. The solution is our system, called CrowdHarvest, which operation is based on crowdfunding, and gives the cheapest and easiest finance to the farmers.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3301,Smar35,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Protecnis,Digital grapevine,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Francisco Bermejo,"Digital grapevine, an application for having an individual control of each grapevine to improve various productive processes in the vineyard, including pruning, monitoring of the treatments and ripening. Experimental wine is getting more and more celebrated every day. This kind of wines requires a rigid control of the grapevine, almost getting to know grape by grape. When we talk about little holdings, this control is more viable, but in big farmings, monitor every grape is hardly impossible. However, with the digital grapevine application, this task becomes easier to fulfill, because without paying attention to the number of grapevines, it could be feasible to have a complete knowledge about every grape quickly. This application also allows the user to have background information of every grapevine with the objective of predicting plagues and compare different year?s production. Finally, this would lead to a better quality of the final product, the wine. This is all possible thanks to our current technology, as our mobile devices are able to capture information and pictures of the vineyard every moment. Also, the improvement in processing information has been increased with recent technologies, for example, cloud computing.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3305,Smar39,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,EURIZON,ECOLUP,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,6,2,YES,IN,Irene Paredes,"ECOLUP provides a solution to a global challenge: the underutilisation of by-products, co-products and waste streams in agriculture, farming and agri-food industry, particularly in the organic production. With ECOLUP we provide a specifically designed communication channel to connect the organic producers that want to sell their outputs (by-products, co-products or waste, which are organic as well), to the organic producers that want to obtain organic inputs, for applying them in their production. ECOLUP is planned to be a multiplatform based application being accessible from mobile, tablet devices and computers. Our users have either smartphones or tablets with them during their field work, but, according to our previous research, they will prefer to complete their profile in a standard computer. It will retreive some data from FIWARE, and it will be very active in feeding data to FIWARE, which is particularly useful for the organic farming sector due to the scarcity of representative data for this particular sector whose trends and behaviour are normally different from the conventional agri-food sector. We are fostering the creation of new opportunities for the valorisation of agricultural waste, by-and co-products resulting in a better use of resources that nowadays are underexploited, resulting in environmental and economic benefits for the organic community, diminishing also the investment in waste management. ECOLUP is presented as an intuitive and professional solution aimed at the organic farminc EU sector designed by specialists.",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,0,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,40000,eurizon.es

3306,Smar40,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Slovenia,Elmitel Engineering,Elmitel Sensing,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,4,2,YES,IN,Matic æerc,"Elmitel Sensing is an ecosystem of software products that will allow farmers to deploy and use agricultural wireless sensor networks and decision support systems for their crops without IT expert support for solution set-up. Elmitel Sensing will allow usage of data from its wireless sensor networks inside applications, developed on FIspace. A complete sensor network based decision support solution in the area of vineyard management, addressing vineyard managers and vineyard advisories, will be developed inside the Elmitel Sensing at the beginning, by using the FIspace platform. The main commercial drawback of wireless sensor networks today is that applications that rely on them, need to be set up by IT experts, because of the set up complexity. This implies higher cost (and in some regions also unavailability) of the solutions, based on the wireless sensor network technology, as well as lower flexibility of the solution in terms of network topology changes and network expansion. Elmitel Sensing addresses this drawback and turns wireless sensor network set-up into a process that can be accomplished by non-IT personnel (like farmers), because this recently became possible and feasible with the availability of modular hardware and IoT cellular plans. The consequence is a wireless sensor network that costs less and is more flexible and easier to upgrade, while all of the data processing for particular crop is done in the cloud. Supported sensor network hardware is already available in the EU and globally.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,0,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,40000,elmitel.com

3309,Smar43,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,Timothy Kelly,Farm Risk Management,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Timothy Kelly,"This project will provide a flexible cloud based application for managing risk in the agri sector accessible via a web interface on computers and mobile devices as required. Initially this application would be targeted at farm level. When proven this application could be adapted for use in the wider agri-sector Building on our experience in the aviation safety management system (SMS) area, our objective is to adapt the Aviation Framework and our software application for use in the agri sector. We propose implementation in a modular manner commencing with a prototype software module focused on safety risk management but also having the capability to manage other risks. Application functions/ module, includes: Reporting, Investigation, Hazard log, Risk Management, Objectives management, Management of Roles and Responsibilities, Management of Change, Implementation Management, Performance Monitoring, Data Integration, Data Analysis, Safety & Culture Surveys, Quality Audit, Dashboards, Document Management (Policy, Safety Statement, Safety Case, Procedures, etc.), Contractor/ Supplier Risk Manager, Review Manager, Issue Manager, Competency Management, Training and Learning Management Also at a agri-system/ sector level: WiKIi / Knowledge Sharing Site, including Social Media

column1: 3312,Smar46,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,CAIMANICS Tech Studio,Farm-o-matic,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Pablo Bacho,"Setting up an ecosystem of sensors, actuators, gateways and other devices for farm management & control made from highly-available low-cost hardware. These devices will expose their data to FIWare platform using GEs such as IDAS or Orion Context Manager, allowing third-party apps to access them for interoperability with integral systems. Benefits: + Variety of customizable hardware sensing tons of parameters, as well as actuating upon events. + Integration with either existing or new farm management apps through FIspace. We have an openhardware platform for the Internet of Things, CaiSquares, which is highly flexible and allows for different sensors, actuators, and communication interfaces to be combined, making it suitable for any custom application. These end devices communicate with a single-board computer gateway such as Raspberry Pi, BeagleBone, or a commercial router running OpenWRT, that sends the information to a server in the cloud running the open-source monitoring software Zabbix. Currently, we're working on a smart farming solution based on our technology, with two lines of development: smart irrigation and smart fish farming. We're collaborating with a regional institution and a multinational who provide guidance on the development and will facilitate testing sites for the prototypes. Our goal is to create an open-source ecosystem of hardware to be deployed in farms for many functions. Being part of its core concept the interoperability and integrability with other systems, FIWare offers an outstanding technology for them. The objectives of this project are: + Build a prototype of a sensor network. + Software running on the gateway that uses FIWare enablers to expose gathered data. + Build a test app that accesses the data.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3313,Smar47,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,Venamics,FeedingManager,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Willem Jan Lamers,"Automation is a known and important tendency in the agricultural sector. The feeding of the animals is ¢ne of the most important and at the same time labor intensive tasks of the entrepreneur. We are constructing a robot feed mixing wagon. This worldwide unique product exists of a vehicle that can, fully independent, take care of the feeding in every cowshed. The problem is that there exists no system for the farmers, which combines the automated feeding as well as the management of the feeding process. Because of this the feeding process is not executed efficiently, the well-being of the animals is not optimized and the work is very labor intensive, while it is the most important aspect of the farming business. The systems with the limited possibilities, that are available on the market, also distinguish themselves by a high level of inflexibility and demand large adaptations in cowsheds. Automated feeding has the big advantage that the feeding and animal management can be executed much better. By the use of sensors in the feed mixing wagon the farmer can determine exactly how much food is to be fed to each animal. We want to develop an application, with the help of the SmartAgriFood call, so that the use of the feed mixing wagon becomes as simple and effective for the agricultural entrepreneur as possible. Also it must be possible for the farmer to make profiles of all his animals in order to be able to keep up per animal what the status of the animal is. Is it healthy? Does it need special nourishment? Is all the nourishment in stock? What has been the taking in of the food and does this has to be adjusted? The aim is to develop a management system for the end user which functions completely in the cloud. An API for Windows as well as Android and the iOS platform is made available to make a link to the current systems such as for example FeedstockManager of CRV4ALL.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3316,Smar50,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Denmark,Ceptu IVS,FieldSense,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,5,1,YES,IN,John Smedegaard,"FieldSense is a smartphone and tablet application that allows farmers to easily monitor the health of their crops. During the agricultural season, cereal crops, like any other crops, face a number of dangers such as pest attacks, competition with parasitic plants as well as health issues due to lack of nutrients. These lead to large drops in yield and lost revenue. FieldSense will offer farmers weekly updates on the health status of their crops. Farmers can use this information to make informed decisions about how to tackle crop health issues. FieldSense will use Landsat and Sentinel 2 satellite data at its core. FieldSense will use partly processed data supplied by satellite data distributors, which will be further processed into easy to understand color maps describing crop health status.",Tech provider,0,0,0,X,X,0,,Software,Spatial Information Management Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,X,0,SME,40000,0

3318,Smar52,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Cyprus,OOB Software LTD,FI-ORAMA,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,4,1,YES,IN,Panagiotis Stamatelopoylos,"FI-ORAMA (Future Internet - Orchards Automated Management) will use a range of FI-WARE enablers to develop a Farm Management information System (FMIS) for applying precision agriculture management at orchards and vineyards. It will be applied for collect all data generated in the field at site-specific level and this information will be collected and stored in a manner to be used for further purposes, such as certification or traceability. FI-ORAMA allows orchard growers and vine growers to collect and analyze data in multiple levels of aggregation. Data will be collected automatically from sensors in the field (i.e. soil moisture sensors) or obtained externally (i.e. local weather station) where possible but due to having individual trees and hand-picking of fruit, the system will automate the process of data to be manually entered into a portable device in the field. The system provides a mobile app that facilitates data collection and displays simple reports, the data is stored in the cloud. Storage and processing is powered by FIWARE generic enablers described below. Detailed reporting and advanced data manipulation will be possible via web interface. The system functionalities are listed below: * Real time reports * Automatic data collection from sensors and external providers * Manual data collection assisted by the mobile application * Decision Support System with a limited set of predefined patterns and the ability for user-defined custom patterns and alerts. * Activity calendar that records all operations * Precision farming capabilities for generation of yield, quality and soil maps * Spatial data storage like field boundaries, tree positions, tree variables (manual and automatic entries) and area variables such as soil humidity etc. * Dual user roles, farmer and agricultural advisors * Ability to connect farmer and agricultural advisors for real-time advice, via email",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,X,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,40000,oobsoftwarecy.com

3319,Smar53,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Hungary,Juravet Kft.,FIP,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,5,6,YES,IN,Ildik¢ S tori,"To support the growing demand for livestock products agriculture production should be intensified. However, intensification is confronted with grassland degradation (overgrazing) and with the reduction of grass, meat and milk production due to drought and heat waves. Furthermore, intensification is threatened as there is less herdsman and many of them are lacking traditional pasture management knowledge or having hard time to intensify their extensive farms. On the other hand there are many potential new sources of scientific data and new information-technology-communication tools (ITC) which are unutilized so far in the livestock systems. There are sensors available to track the movement of animals (GPS, telemetry), follow their health condition (temperature, bio acoustic) or to geo-localize them through GIS based maps. Furthermore, collecting local and regional weather data became easier and cheaper than ever before. Remote sensed multispectral images (satellite, drone images) or field based photos (animal camera) could be available to investigate grassland productivity. Herd management data (livestock unit number LSU, feed requirements, health stage etc.) are usually stored in book entries in which modification are difficult to make. Farmers have a huge responsibility above their animals and their product. To ensure milk or meat quality and to sustain grassland productivity farmers needs to consider many aspects at the same time (such as grassland productivity, herd size, animal health, weather and soil condition etc) even if they are lacking of knowledge in certain areas. Knowing the exact position of the animals (over-under grazed sites, breeding and calving sites) and shepherding them is crucial, yet it is time-consuming and labor-intensive work. Our application (FIP, Future Internet Pasture) is an integrated solution for precise pasture management.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,X,X,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,40000,fip-project.eu

3320,Smar54,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Portugal,"Introsys, SA",FRESH,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,Magno Guedes,"FRESH project addresses the specific problem of how to help small to medium and familiar crop growers making use of smart technology and future internet tools to optimize their production, expand their market and face the growth of the competition. The project proposes a 3-layered system based on remote sensing, back-end processing and user front-end with the purpose of shorten distances and facilitate B2B collaboration between farmers, experts, service providers and consumers. A initial test case will focus on hydroponic tomato production with a potential to expand to other types of greenhouse cultures and, ultimately, to any type of agricultural crops.",Tech provider,0,0,X,0,0,X,,Software,Production Planning,Applications,Supply Chain Management (SCM) Applications,1,0,0,SME,40000,introsys.eu

3321,Smar55,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,Green Projects SA,Fresh Produce Trade App,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Nikos Tsotsolas,"Our idea has to do with the development of an online application which aims to facilitate online business-to-business collaboration (B2B) between farmers and traders concerning the exports of vast quantities of fresh produce. The operation of the application could support agricultural cooperatives, producer groups and specialized brokers to facilitate the entire range of transactions including offer making, request for offer, order, sales contract, electronic invoicing, export accompanying documentation, logistics shipment tracking, payment procedures. By focusing on the specific products of each producer, the application will create the appropriate environment for a unique placement opportunity of quality products in a European and even global market. The producers may take advantage of a market with no borders in order to achieve better prices partially due to the reduction of the intervention of middlemen, while on the other hand the traders may explore new markets with products of great added value. Furthermore, the rigorous procedures that will be supported by the application will lead to the development of a whole network of trust in which the producer will receive the proper price for good quality products and the traders will receive the agreed products in time with the minimum administrative burden. This network of trust will be also will be further strengthen by the involvement of third trusted parties which will monitor and certify the quality of the selling products. Besides the operational aspect of supporting the everyday transaction in the agricultural trade, the new platform will support the strategic design of producers by dealing with the production and analysis of statistical data concerning prices in relation to product characteristics, to time, to weather conditions, to competition aspects, ?? geopolitical situation etc.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3323,Smar57,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,NEUROPUBLIC SA,GAPP,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,JOHN MAVROUDIS,"The new CAP reform taking into account the wealth and diversity of agriculture in the EU Member States, targets to answer to the emerging environmental and climate-related challenges facing our society. To this context, from 2015 onwards, the CAP introduces a new policy instrument in Pillar 1, the Green Direct Payment. This accounts for 30% of the national direct payment envelope and rewards farmers for respecting three obligatory agricultural practices, namely maintenance of permanent grassland, Ecological Focus Areas (EFAs) and crop diversification. The Greening Application (GAPP) proposal deals with the green direct payment in a way that it deploys an ICT product that facilitates the European agricultural producers to comply with the greening demands of the new CAP. Specifically, the GAPP ICT product includes two applications, i.e., the EFA Calculator and the Crop Diversifier. The first application checks whether an agricultural producer possesses the required amount of EFAs that excuses the green direct payment. In case of non-conformance, it suggests actions that have to be taken in order the producer to be eligible for this kind of subsidy. To the same context, the second application checks whether the producer obeys the crop diversification rule and which are the required actions that have to be taken in case of non-conformance. The basic prototype of the GAP ICT product is going to address about 200 producers having diverse features (in terms of entitlements, arable cultivations, sizes of holdings, etc). The end-user testbed goals to include around 2000 producers around Europe (although the majority will be Greek, the established liaison with COPA-COGECA will be exploited in order to test GAP ICT product in a pan-European way). Closing, regarding the product market penetration, it is expected that at least regarding the Greek famers, 20000 of them will purchase the GAPP ICT product.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,0,0,SME,39640,neuropublic.gr

3324,Smar58,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Portugal,InspiringSci,GardenWiz,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Pedro Dinis Gaspar,"The proposed smart agriculture solution relies on a simple user-friendly and scalable application for assisting urban gardening that provides, among others, the following features: (1) plants taxonomy information: allows to identify, describe, classify, and name vegetables and fruits, plants, flowers, and shrubs
column2: (2) planting and harvesting dates advice: provides advices about the best planting and harvesting dates as well as the seed quantities (depending on the area set for each plant)
column3: (3) nutrient needs: provides information of the nutrient needs (quantity and time) based on the plant, area, and previous cultivation
column4: (4) meteorological information: provides weather forecast for the specific geographical location
column5: (5) irrigation: provides information of the quantity of irrigating times for each type of plant, and this data is dynamically updated using the weather forecast
column6: (6) usual diseases and pests: provides information of usual diseases and pests that affect the plants sow, including tips to avoid or eliminate them
column7: (7) allelopathy information: provides information about how the selected plants will grow together, i.e., species distribution, abundance of a specific plant among the community, and resources competition
column8: (8) garden designer: allows planning the garden, raised beds, rows or containers
column9: (9) crop rotation planner: plans the crop rotation in order to improve soil structure and fertility (proper nutrients depending on the previous plants) as well as to mitigate diseases and pests
column10: (10) gardening tasks reminder: reminds through short message service (SMS) and email the list of gardening tasks to perform in the following days (planting, irrigating, fertilizing, cutting, harvesting, among others)
column11: and (11) the app incorporates social elements such as Facebook and Twitter sharing.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3326,Smar60,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,Tomas ¦eimys,Grain Sensors,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Tomas ¦eimys,"Because of the spoilage of stored grain and pest activity, there is an average of 10% grain loss worldwide. In less developed countries (eg. African countries, India), this figure is 15%. In European and North American countries for the same reason, the average annual loss is 5-8% of yield. These few percents in global means millions of tons of grain, which will never reach its end-user and the large loss of income of grain growers. System for early phase of grain spoilage detection will use the method based on monitoring of physical and chemical properties in the environment in a period of time. These three characteristics of the environment and their dynamics in time will be monitored constantly: CO2 concentration, temperature and relative humidity. These three environmental indicators were selected knowing the fact that even in the initial stages of grain spoilage, high enough carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions can be detected. The solution is based on CO2, temperature and relative humidity sensors and result analysis system. This solution will help identify emerging issues significantly faster than traditional methods.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3327,Smar61,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,UK,GroCircle Ltd,GroCircle,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING, Consumer leisure/gaming",B2B/B2C,2,1,YES,IN,Kari Dempsey,"At GroCircle we provide solutions for commercial Hydroponic horticulture farmers and urban farmers. 3328,Smar62,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,MOBEO,Growtrack,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Martijn Roos,"Scaling, mechanization, automation and market changes made greenhouses more difficult to manage. If multiple persons are responsible for managing the nursery, collaboration and sharing information seems to be essential. In addition, product-innovations within the horticultural sector are necessary in order to survive and stay one step ahead of the competition. Successful product-innovations are in most cases the results of experiments taken at the nursery and/or research centers. A successful product-innovation provides a positive contribution to the increase in the R.O.I. in the entire chain. In practice it turns out that the registration process of the experiments is difficult. In the most situations the results of the measurements are hand written down on a piece of paper, and afterwards put into a spreadsheet program. This is a time-consuming process and increases the risk of errors. Also, sharing information with stakeholders is not easy. All of this affects the quality of the analysis and advice. Therefor we have the idea to develop the growtrack-app. This is an experiment data collection app for smartphones and tablets. It offers a solution for fast and error-free recording of (human) measurements and observations of experiments in the horticulture sector. With the growtrack-app experiments can be setup in the cloud. Print the tags and collect the data with phone or tablet to organize, visualize and analyze this data (reports). Growers, crop managers, suppliers and consultants are connected through the internet and can view the data and collaborate. This will increases the quality and reduce costs.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3329,Smar63,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,Connecterra,HappyCow,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,5,1,YES,IN,Yasir Khokhar,"Project Happy Cow will develop hardware and software for a cloud based Estrus detection system for Dairy farms with special focus on organic dairy farms. Our approach is based from the perspective of the internet of things leveraging the FI-Ware platform. Increase in the cost of production, abolishment of the quota system will put pressure on dairy farmers to find new ways to optimize their farm production [1]. Estrus detection is one of the fundamental optimization points in operations and can save farmers significant amounts of money, up to ?250/year per cow. While current detection systems provide adequate accuracy, they are mostly based on algorithms designed for indoor/shed base farms. Furthermore, the business model is based on monolithic implementations based on devices that require fixed capital investments. These systems are usually out of reach of small to medium sized farms. Also, the technology is fixed and cannot be adapted to changing farmer needs and scale. In the future it is anticipated that farms will need to optimize their facilities for greenhouse emissions, animal welfare and production per cow require systems which not only measure but also provide a scientific basis for prediction and control. Sensor based solutions will be required to scale and adapt to these needs. For farmers, an optimal solution would be to invest in systems that can adapt and morph as the needs change. In order to detect estrus and animal behavior, our solution uses sensors mounted on cows and connected to our cloud services platform providing a unique approach to estrus detection leveraging deep learning, life-time data storage and FI-Ware integration to enable new services based on sensor networks. Our approach is transmutable to different scenarios within the farm environment and currently does not have any direct competition.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,X,X,,Hardware,Advanced and Predictive Analytics Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,X,0,SME,40000,0

3330,Smar64,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,Cyril Byrne,Harvesting Results in the Cloud,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Cyril Byrne,"FarmNet is a multi-faceted solution designed to retrieve and manage data for farmers and their staff to aid and improve their day to day jobs. It maximises the collection and manipulation of this data using existing interfaces such as mobile devices thereby removing the need and the cost of specialised equipment. Knowledge is power, and the key to effectively controlling costs and increasing profitability for farmers lies in retrieving the maximum number of data indicators available and manipulating these into a format which can be easily understood and addressed. FarmNet gives farmers and agricultural contractors access via the FISpace platform to this data, using tools provided by machinery suppliers and mobile devices in the field. Real-time display and manipulation of this data gives the farm manager the ability to make key decisions or changes to maximise the return from a Job. Some of the features which FarmNet captures includes: - Collection of Job data - manual input of data such as cost of labour, fuel usage, distance travelled, units produced with real time interfaces to machinery, Geo-Coding and GIS Mapping services - Mapping and visualisation of the working environment delivered directly to mobile devices - Real-time messaging and data exchange between the farmer and staff in the field. - Efficient analysis of data providing a real picture of the actual costs of each job undertaken and the profitability of viability of those activities - Cloud based data repository of the farmer?s resources, staff, machinery etc. with effective analysis and reporting on all current and historic data - Virtualisation and Visualisation to recreate a job, e.g. replaying the actual route that a machine took in a field during a job combined with the heat maps of usage and yields. FarmNet combines key data with traditional job management tools and mobile solutions to bring the farmers job from an office to a virtual farm allowing them to maximise the power of the new internet.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3331,Smar65,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Forma Masiva,HEAMO,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Juan J Carmona Garc¡a,"Fi-ware technology improves the quality of life of farmers and aims to be the tool to transform the countryside into a place where it's possible to have a profitable business. The work as a breeder has not been profitable for the last decade since it requires full time dedication, including spending many hours searching for the livestock in open areas wether the meteorological conditions are favorable or not. Fi-ware keeps track not only of the latitude and longitude of a single animal of the group, that's a product that already exists. Fi-ware goes much further, being able to follow the possition of all the animals in the pack. There is much more information to show on the map, like the quality of the grazing land, geography data, epidemic areas, health log of the animals and much more. The user will be able to draw customized maps and be able to check them online from virtualy anywhere. It is possible to set up routes or areas to avoid, place alarms for the livestock in order to know if the animals are approaching or moving towards geographic points set by the user. Be aware of epidemic risk zones or areas where predator attacks are common. Our project does not just show a pin in a google map like all the other GPS in the market already do. The organic food industry has been able to create a new bussines model in just a few years. Now customers are much more concerned about the way their food is produced, and they know how much this affects the quality of the final product. Also, ranching areas are able to provide for four times the livestock they already hold, but the business needs the correct tools to do so, being able to be profitable again, and ensuring new generations of shpherds and breeders.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3332,Smar66,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,Agrostis,ifarma-ffa,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,4,3,YES,IN,Vangelis Vassiliadis,"Farmers lack the tools to make informed decisions related to financial management of their business, taking into account cost and profit margins and profitability analysis. While there is a number of Farm Management ERP solutions on the market today these are mainly complete ERP systems, aimed for the big Farm Enterprises are not suitable nor affordable for use by the individual or family farm typical in most European countries. For most farms, farming activities are not properly logged at least not in a systematic way so that cost analysis can be performed to find out critical cost factors that could be avoided in order to minimize costs and maximize productivity. Individual farmers need IT tools that will enable them to log and calculate costs, plan ahead and make informed decisions on what crops to plant, what farming activities to execute and what inputs to use, based not only crop and farming requirements but also based on financial considerations. Such tools should be able to provide a 'good enough' approximation of the cost and profitability analysis using acceptable 'default values' - typical costs per input and activity, in order to compensate for the lack of accurate data logs typical in a small size farm. Agrostis, develops and markets ifarma, an integrated Farm Management App for both individual farmers and farmer groups. ifarma is provided as Saas both as a native mobile app and as a web-cloud based application. ifarma features a powerful financial analysis module that includes farm profitability analysis and cost analysis at three levels: field, crop and farm. The aim of the proposed project is to make ifarma's financial analysis module available as an App on the FISpace platform utilizing FIWare technologies. The Farm's Financial Analysis (FFA) FISpace App, will provide an interoperable service in the FISPace platform receiving field, crop and cultivation task data and using existing ifarma module as a backend service will a) Display a profitability and cost analysis dashboard as a widget on the FISpace and b) provide the resulting analyses as output via the FISpace platform for use by other Apps and services.",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,X,0,,Software,Financial Performance and Strategy Management Applications,Applications,Enterprise Resource Management (ERM) Applications,1,X,0,SME,39.9,0

3333,Smar67,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Denmark,NB-Data,IGoFI,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Nikolaj B?ggild,"A new production planning system called ?GreenPlan Collect Evaluate Suggest? (GPCES) for pot plant nurseries is under development. Once developed, GPCES will support gardeners in making well-balanced decisions regarding pot plant nursing. Hence, GPCES has a huge potential in helping gardeners making the right decisions regarding their pot plant production all over Europe. However, in order for GPCES to provide well-balanced support for gardeners in making such decisions, it is crucial for GPCES to have a solid base of valid information, both technical and biological, regarding the current state of the plants as well as the surrounding climate both inside and outside of the greenhouse. An existing system called InfoGrow collects, persists and processes greenhouse production data from climate computers installed in greenhouses. Through graphical visualization and statistical information, InfoGrow monitors the production, hence, helping gardeners to get an overview of the production. Though, InfoGrow holds sufficient information it does not provide the planning functionality. Hence, GPCES as being a planning tool and InfoGrow as being an information provider, the two systems would complement each other very well. Therefore, we propose an improved version of InfoGrow as the provider of vital information to GPCES. However, in contrast to InfoGrow, which in today?s version only comply with climate computers produced by the Danish vendor Senmatic, the planning program is neutral to whatever climate computer from whichever vendor is installed at the greenhouse. Therefore, we wish to generalize the data model of InfoGrow to match both the Senmatic climate computers and the climate computers produced by the German vendor RAM. On top of it all, we wish to introduce GPCES, InfoGrow, Senmatic and RAM to the Future Internet by making both the data collection and the providing of information available for external systems via the enablers provided by the FIspace platform.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3334,Smar68,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,0,iGrowUp,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Alessandro Cirocchi,"The objective of our Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) service ?iGrowUp? is to help farmers to become more resilient to weather and climate variability and change by making ?climate risks visible? and therefore more manageable. Agriculture is critically sensitive to weather and climate conditions, such as rain, temperature, and sunlight. Extreme climate conditions can result in big losses for farmers, while impacting a lot people all over the planet through a global market. Our CSA service iGrowUp aims to better manage climate-related risks through the development of an innovative flexible insurance scheme. We propose to develop a CSA service of index-based insurance based on a verifiable measurement of a set of Critical Climate Parameters (CCPs) that impact crop development. We believe that, by capitalizing on the FIware platform capability in combination with new sensors technologies - including Satellites and Remotely Piloted Aerial Systems (RPAS) - and big data analytics and visualization (e.g. cloud-based computing, mapbox, R statistics), we can effectively make ?climate risks more visible? thereby enabling the development of flexible insurance schemes accessible to more farmers. The iGrowUp service's core is a web based IoT application, server-side capable of collecting and integrating large amounts of heterogeneous data. These data will be collected, in part through API / WebServices available on the network and Crowdsourced information. Other data will be taken from specific sensors installed in the area to be monitored, or applied on RPAS. For sensors specific solution, FIWare Platform could be a key element, providing a powerful middleware, the ?Context Broker GE?. We plan to build our communication layer on the ""Publish / Subscribe Context Broker - Orion Context Broker"", in order to take advantage of its facilities in getting information coming from a lot of different sensors placed in wide areas.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3335,Smar69,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Czech Republic,Lesprojekt - slu§by s.r.o.,IMaToP,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,Zbynek KRIVANEK,"Tomato plays an important role in European agriculture, both from a social and economic view. In the last years, tomato crop is facing hard challenges due to problems in productivity, competitiveness and profitability. Furthermore, climate changes are jeopardizing EU agricultural products. ICT tools could play an important role in this sector. High quality is a must in horticultural products in addition water shortage increases. Thus precise agriculture technologies monitoring air and soil temperature and humidity provide a useful decision support and help farmers to better manage production, reducing energy and water consumption and assuring a product of high quality. The main problem farmers are facing with is the lack of efficient management practices in tomato production, consisting mainly in optimal irrigation and precise harvest time. Temperature, soil and air humidity are the most important parameters to be monitored during tomatoes? growth. Tomatoes irrigation is one of the most important farming practices, a good monitoring of water irrigation strongly influencing the yield and the quality of the final product, reducing rotting. In this context, future agriculture knowledge management systems could give a support not only to agriculture and environmental protection but also to all other related activities, allowing collaboration among groups in agro-food sector, consumers, public authorities and stakeholders. To that end IMaToP project aims at helping growers make appropriate and timely decisions, developing a decision web-based system using wireless sensors and tag to monitor and control air and soil condition in real time, mobile data collection and alarms. Through IMaToP App farmers will be able to take correcting actions to avoid waste from deteriorated or immature product increasing own profitability from tomato growing business. The system will be based on FIWARE and FIspace platforms.",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,0,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,0,0,SME,40000,0

3336,Smar70,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,Elements Interactive B.V.,IMEM,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Wouter ten Brink,"Elements Interactive wants to develop a solution with partner Kverneland that simplifies the work for the customer so they can easily plan their field operations and tasks in a graphical way in the basic setup and can create ISO-XML tasks for his equipment. Vice versa the results of the ISO-XML tasks will be reported back through the system. Elements plans to utilize the FIspace framework for communication of events and activities with the devices in the field, as well as opening the possibilities to extend services with external Apps in the FIspace framework, such as weather services, consultancy services etc. Besides that, Elements and Kverneland want to develop an App for Tablet and/or Smartphones that creates a graphical interface to the EasyMap system, in such a way that a farmer or contractor can use the Apps on the go during work to edit, review, modify and update tasks to be done. Tasks will automatically be synchronized with the Terminal controlling the Tractor and Implement combination in the field. The synchronization process and communication between devices in the field and the EasyMap system have to utilize the FIspace framework.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3337,Smar71,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,SensorTagSolutions,IMPRESS,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,Willem Stenfert Kroese,"In the IMPRESS project partners will realize two (synergistic) products: 1) the FI-sense platform, an open sensor platform that can be used by any sensor producer to receive and transmit data of wireless sensors in greenhouses to FIspace. The platform uses frequencies and protocols that are suitable for greenhouse conditions. 2) The AquaTagRemote soil moisture sensor. The low cost wireless soil moisture sensor will make it possible to control the irrigation based on the real soil moisture conditions. Up till now this was not possible because soil moisture sensors are too expensive and too unpractical. The AquaTagRemote will use the FI-Sense platform to deliver its data to FIspace. Partner ItoM will develop the hardware, partner info.nl will take care of the software and implementation of FI-ware apps, STS will develop the AquaTagRemote sensor together with ItoM, and takes care of the overall project management. Wageningen-UR Greenhouse Horticulture is involved (but not a partner) for the development of advice modules for translating the AquaTag remote moisture sensor data (in combination with data of other sensors) into irrigation guidelines and other greenhouse management tasks. Advantage of the FI-sense system is that it will allow farmers to combine many sensor data in smart DSS (decision support systems) in one place (FIspace) at relatively low costs. The revenues for the partners are the sales of the hardware, and an annual subscription per sensor paid by the farmers. The system will initially be marketed in the Netherlands, Spain, Turkey and Mexico, and later worldwide. The modules will be sold through distributors who will also explain the system to the end-users. Additional finance will be raised through crowdfunding (www.fundaplant.nl) and by investments of the partners. After the IMPRESS project is finished it will be possible to raise additional finance from investors.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,X,X,,Hardware,Data Integration and Access Software,Application Development & Deployment,Structured Data Management Software,1,0,0,Startup,40000,sensortagsolutions.com

3338,Smar72,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Ireland,Logpro Limited,IPOK,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,3,3,YES,IN,David Gray,"IPOK is a monitoring solution for the poultry rearing livestock industry. Production units are monitored 24/7 using wireless sensors connected to the internet. The basic kit uses temperature sensors but humidity, ammonia and carbon dioxide will also be available. Problems in the rearing environment are detected automatically by comparing the sensor data with results from previous successful crops. In this way, personnel and equipment errors are detected and alerts are sent out. This allows for timely corrective actions to be applied. With better environments, the animals remain healthy and profits are improved or maintained. The use of corrective antibiotics is reduced and animal welfare is enhanced.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,0,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,40000,0

3339,Smar73,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Italy,Sysman Progetti & Servizi,IrriSmart,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING, BUSINESS SERVICES",B2B,4,20,YES,IN,Erminio Efisio Riezzo,"IrriSmart is a cloud service that implements FAO-56 guidelines for computing crop water requirements from meteorological data and crop coefficients, a key foundation component in decision support systems for irrigation and fertirrigation practices. FAO-56 guidelines provide a standardized guidance to project managers, consultants, irrigation engineers, hydrologists, agronomists and meteorologists for computing crop water requirements for both irrigated and rainfed agriculture and water consumption by agricultural and natural vegetation, allowing a model-based approach in critical business processes. IrriSmart takes full advantage of FIspace platform capabilities, allowing the integration and the processing of weather data from inhomogeneous sources (e.g. IoT-enabled sensor system and 3rd party services), and providing multi-parameter results to the end-users via customizable widgets as well as to 3rd party software components in collaborative workflows: IrriSmart computes FAO-56 parameters, shows them in a convenient way for end-users, and shares them with 3rd party mashed-up apps allowing further analytics and complex autonomous architectures in irrigation and fertirigation practices.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,X,X,,Hardware,Advanced and Predictive Analytics Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,X,0,SME,40000,sys-man.it

3340,Smar74,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Galilea Soluciones,iSlurry,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,µlvaro Reina,"The storage of some types of manure such as swine slurry presents a challenge to producers because of the potential for environmental pollution. Therefore, swine slurries should be marketed as soon as they are produced to prevent these environmental problems. Swine slurries contains essential plant nutrients, thus using it in agriculture is the most natural way of decomposing it and also saves a great deal of chemical fertilizers for farmers. This looks like a very simple problem that get complicated when a farmer needs to take into account that the effectiveness of swine slurries as a source of plant nutrients, vary depending on several factors such as type of soil, crop, climatic regions, and different characteristics of each particular slurry. Therefore, the main goal of this project is to offer farmers a system that will help them to get the best and nearest swine slurry, enabling them to decide the amount of manure to spread based on estimated crop needs and on the levels of these elements in the soil while in the other hand, the producers will take advantage of the system by marketing their animal slurries.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3341,Smar75,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Slovenia,"OPTILAB d.o.o., informacijske tehnologije in poslovne storitve",Local Food Exchange,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Katarina Ropret,"Farms and agricultural producers in Slovenia and other countries with similar geographical and social position are extremely disperse and often have difficulties selling their products to the market because they don?t know how to form prices, their time and fuel consumption is too high, sometimes they grow what is not needed in the market. On the other hand, larger buyers of these products (e.g. schools) need large quantities. They do not have time to micro-manage transactions with individual farmers and rather buy products from large suppliers that offer low quality non-local food in large quantities. They all need a simple application where they could order their food supplies at least as easily as from large suppliers. There are some good practises emerging of organisations acting as an intermediary between supply and demand. Such is for example local shop 18sedem3 which receives increased demand for quality, fresh and healthy local food. They urgently need IT support because connecting producers, customers and logistic has become too time-consuming and hard to manage. Providing such support, will be the main target of the project Local Food Exchange Platform, where Optilab d.o.o. will participate in the development of the application, Gaber Terseglav s.p. as the technical lead in the project and 18sedem3 will be responsible for product roadmap and prioritisation. Our FIWARE based IT solution will support different user types: (1) producers that will offer their agricultural products on the market, (2) customers that would express their demand for these products, (3) management support that would take care of the system: enter new producers, consumers and logistic companies, take care of the promotion deals, price list, end user support, etc (4) logistic support that would take care of the delivery of the products. We will also test our application in international market. Our solution is in-line with focus application of supporting transparency, traceability, safety and quality in the fruits, meat and vegetable chains and networks, upgraded with focus to short food chains and support of local farmers to enhance preservation of our ecosystem.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3342,Smar76,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Sensowave Professional Solutions (MISC International SL),Location and monitor livestock outdoors,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,4,1,YES,IN,Carlos Callejero,"Our smart agriculture solution addresses two segments within the food distribution chain of livestock: farmers and consumers. Farmers will gain tools to manage their livestock by location and monitoring of individual animals. Consumers can learn statistics such as: life time and place of life, and reports such as veterinary reports on the meat product they are purchasing. Our SME has developed low cost devices to locate and monitor livestock outdoors. The rancher, through an app, will be able to trace and track individual animals to observe their habits and improve its care. This is a new and powerful smart tool for livestock management, eliminating the locating time for an animal, and sending notifications if any anomalies are detected, for example as a result of a health problem. To accomplish it, physical parameters, such as temperature, will be monitored. The solution will reduce operating costs and will improve the farm results. Furthermore, it can also be adapted to add value to the final product. For instance, the rancher can show how much time has the animal spent outdoors, historical of disease periods per animal, distance and movement estimation. Benefits: ? Identify and locate each animal within the ranch outdoors. ? Detect anomalies like body temperature, absence of activity, abnormal behaviour, or movement out of the confinement enabled areas, etc. ? Long life batteries (between 6-12 months) providing low battery level warming. ? Allow to the farmer to manage in real time his livestock, through a mobile application. Short term objectives: ? Validate the system pilot: devices, interface, features, range, etc. in a real scenario. ? Improve the performance and features of the system through the farmer feedback. ? To develop a marketing strategy to reach the final users in Spain and Europe",Tech provider,0,0,0,X,X,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,Startup,40000,stepla.es

3343,Smar77,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Poland,Informatyka Bankowa POLSOFT,LT Platform,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Kajetan Wlazlo,"Farmers often have to deal with over-production problem of the farm products. This problem concerns particularly small farms are not engaged in the large-scale production, but their production output happens to exceed their own needs. An obvious way to deal with over-production is to sell excess products, but the price offered by large purchasers can be significantly lower than the production cost incurred by a small farm. Often, the amount of goods to sell is too low to be accepted by a prospective purchaser. An excessive amount of food is wasted or used as a fodder for farm animals. The solution for this problem is an increasing social requirement for wholesale and ecological food. Restaurants and health food stores are willing to pay more for agricultural products which are produced in harmony with nature. Currently, the prices of eco food are at a very high level, not only due to high production costs but also by high rates of intermediaries, relatively high and ever rising demand and relatively low supply. Therefore, this type of food offered in restaurants is becoming a luxury item. There appears to be no need to explain how important it is to have a healthy diet or that even the average citizen should be able to afford healthy food, especially in our times when we are faced with so many diseases caused by poor diet.
