The proposed solution is based on a platform which will provide cooperation opportunities between small and medium-sized farms and restaurants or shops. Our solution is a local trading platform for agricultural products which enables the information exchange between the parties regarding the supply offered by farmers on one hand and restaurants? or shops? demand on the other. The local trading platform will enable the sale of the excess agricultural products by farmers. And through the trading platform eco shops and restaurants can buy products directly from farmers. Our solution can also work the other way, namely, restaurants and shops may put in their demand for products in specific quantities and await offers from farmers. Then the store or restaurant will be able to select the most attractive offer. The solution is fully based on the B2B and B2C models and allows farmers and businesses to engage in an independent trade of goods without the involvement of third parties.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3344,Smar78,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,Raluca Saceanu,m-AppiBeacon,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Raluca Saceanu,"The proposed app will be integrated with new technology called iBeacon. iBeacon will allow the implementation of tag proximity to allow farmers to gather information about the health condition, nutrition, sex, vaccinations, and alerts of the cattle or sheep. One key feature of the app would be the possibility to implement additional parametres, such as notifications of suitable milking times according to antibiotic intake. Using proximity technologies would also allow the farmers to be notified (using push notifications) of specific cattle/sheep parametres (health, condition etc.) iBeacon also allows tracking the temperature and location of the cattle which would allow further analysis and more specific information. It is a unique and innovative alternative to the existing EID tags and readers, software which are very expensive and offer limited functionality. Our solution allows farmers to take multiple streams of data and have them correlated in a centralised portal that will be easily accessible on mobile devices.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3345,Smar79,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,Raluca Saceanu,m-DataApp,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Raluca Saceanu,"The proposed mobile application would allow pricing analysts in the dairy sector to have access to legacy data on agricultural production, marketing and technology to better coordinate and plan future activities regarding production, placement and pricing. The app will have significant qualitative impact focusing on price optimisation and supply chain management. Dairy commodity producers would be able to set a pricing strategy and optimise sales and product mix based on an all access to legacy data in a single platform.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3346,Smar80,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Denmark,Agrit ApS,Medic Autoreg,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Ole Baehr,"Agrit ApS is developing an intelligent syringe, named Medic Autorec, that records a defined set of data on treatments of pigs in livestock pig-farms. Recorded data tells on what treatment has been introduced to livestock: i.e. type of treatment, reason, by whom, when, and if individuals are tagged by RFID earmarks - it is on individual level (an RFID reader is incorporated in the syringe). The data will at least comply with requirements stated by Danish authorities. When the syringe is introduced to the farmers, and they start using it, the number of data available will reach the big data definition. The single customer will have access to own data, Agrit will have access to the total amount of data. Agrit ApS will build a datacollector/databroker hosted in FIspace, using a number of FIenablers (i.e. Access Control, Wirecloud, IDAS). Data can then be combined with other relevant data, i.e.climate-data and feeding & watering data from other datasources external to Agritïs system. Overall issue is to exactly record the usage of treatments/drugs during the lifetime of livestock until it shipped for further processing. It is anticipated that collected data can be used for both commercial and research purposes. It will be the first database of drugs introduced to livestock pigs. Tests of the system will be performed on livestock farms in a number of places in Poland and in Denmark",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3347,Smar81,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,DRAXIS Environmental S.A.,myLOCALfarm,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Panagiota Syropoulou,"Nowadays, wholesale buyers of horticultural products, such as restaurants and hotels, are more and more interested in purchasing locally produced food, but they do not have real-time information on the availability of such products. On the other hand, local farmers have limited access to the market, and they often lack capacity to meet buyer requirements for product volume, consistency, variety, or extended availability. myLOCALfarm will be a platform available both as a web portal and a mobile application, enabling wholesale buyers and local horticulture farmers to find each other easily, and helping farmers to create business relationships through the creation of informal farmer groups. Buyers will make customized searches of products of their interest via the myLOCALfarm search tool, and access real-time product information. Criteria such as product?s type, quantity, quality, and price will be available. They will also have the ability to post their specific demand. Local farmers will be able to post their product for sale on the platform, create informal groups, and invite others to participate. myLOCALfarm will enable buyers to place a bid to a farmer or a group, while local farmers either as individuals or as groups will be able to see buyers? demands and post financial offers. One of the available communication means will be the myLOCALfarm wall, which will facilitate users to post an invitation message to any other user?s wall. After any collaboration, users will be asked to rate each other. The rating of each user will be public seen in her/his profile. Via myLOCALfarm buyers can find fresher products, while they can choose to buy several products from a specific area so that their transportation costs are minimized. From local farmers? viewpoint, they will be able to sell jointly, form baskets of different products, find buyers easily, and access a wider market. The myLOCALfarm solution will be pilot tested in Greece and Cyprus.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3348,Smar82,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Ireland,Agrinet,MyPhoneHerd,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Barry Lynch,"MyPhoneHerd Irish Farm Computers Ltd (trading as Agrinet) 4 Church Street Kells Co Meath Ireland www.agrinet.ie 00353-46-9249964 Summary Irish Farm Computers Ltd, trading as Agrinet, has been in business since 1994. We provide farm management software to approximately 3000 farmers with a focus on herd, grass and cash management. Our clients are primarily in Republic of Ireland but our web based grassland management software has a very good uptake with grass focused dairy farmers in the UK and a smaller number in Holland, Sweden, US, Tasmania and New Zealand. This web based grass system has taught us the benefits associated with web based software systems, both from our client?s perspective and from our perspective in terms of growing our business. We have a long history in our business in sharing data with other systems. One of our primary roles is to connect the farm electronically with the outside world. We need to get data in and transfer data out. This has been ongoing for 20 years. This has involved following standards in data transfer, helping create new data standards, and it also entails working with other companies and state agencies that are involved in the value chain that creates good outcomes for our common client, the farmer. The project we would like to implement via the Fispace platform is to expand on existing work to implement a complete herd management system on a Smartphone. We will use existing back end bovine databases from other companies and agencies because these are already in place and they are eager to harvest more data from farms. We are very aware of how busy farmers are and how hard they find it to record data and consume data. We have been providing software on Pocket PCs since 2006 and we are very familiar with what is possible on a Smartphone. We know that all data recording can be done on phones and all data that a farmer might need to manage their herd can also be done on the phone. The 2 big advantages of the phone are the availability outside and the small screen which forces the interface to be very simple. There are really 3 types of herd data a farmer will want to consume: A. All data for 1 cow (easy on a phone) B. List report for a number of cows (easy on a phone) C. Analysis report for the full herd (harder on a phone) In reality farmers want to consume report types A and B for 95% of the time. Using these reports is where the farmer makes positive day to day decisions. The backend database systems that we will be linking to, for data transfer, can already do the harder herd analysis (C) reports. We therefore have a very clear idea of what we want to do, and why. Because of new web service links that are being built at the moment by the backend systems (ICBF in Ireland and VetImpress in UK), this type of project is now possible for the 1st time. The Fispace project interests us for a number of reasons 1. It allows us to use ?out of the box? enablers that will get us moving quicker. 2. It will help us mash up with other systems and allow us to bring more services to our clients in a common platform. 3. It creates a safe environment to co-operate. We have lots of experience in Ireland where the state agency data systems that we share data with, eventually start providing their own software services direct to farmers. This leads to less co-operation rather than more co-operating. 4. The funding is obviously an attraction but funding will be no good if the platform is not solid and easy to work with. 5. It will help the process of us selling more software abroad. It is a networking opportunity. We look forward to seeing how we progress our business using the Fispace platform. Regards Barry Lynch Technical Director Irish Farm Computers Ltd (Trading as Agrinet)",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3349,Smar83,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Solbyte Servicios Inform ticos,"Oil Cloud, Technology Solution for Agriculture",0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jos‚ Ferrer,"The natural resources of the field are limited in our region, Spain
column2: we currently have a serious drought, so the proper distribution of irrigation on farms is extremely important in order to maximize field production and reduce to the maximum the production costs. Today on farms, for example in the Spanish olive fields, irrigation is always performed with a fixed time, regardless of the number of hours of sunshine, temperature field throughout the day, soil moisture, etc., so that olives or other species is sometimes over irrigate and in other times is excessively dry because the specified parameters are not controlled and they water always in the same way. Also, within the same field, we can have areas drier than others, and this is ignored too, so it is clear that on the one hand we are wasting water and the other they are leaving plants drier than they should and therefore producing less than it should or shortening its life. With proper irrigation management is the fundamental point that we are addressing our application. In addition, specific Spanish farmers dedicated to olive, bases their economic and care management of the olives on experience and memory, and they havenït tools to calculate the profit margin of their business or alert them to what works have already been made and what is pending, etc. so the support to farmers in their daily operation management is also an important point to which our application is addressing. Our solution proposes have three sensors connected to a microcontroller or single-board computer (Arduino or Raspberry, for example) that will connect to the Internet using Wi-Fi
column3: This solution will be encapsulated so as to be installed by the farmer himself or contract the installation to a third party. Pending the farm size, the farmer put more or less devices that will monitor the farm that will be divided in several zones in function of the farmer necessities, our recommendation is has two devices in each ground hectare. These sensors will upload their information to Fiware platform, so the data will be stored using the Fiware?s APIs data and Internet of Things. The platform will make calculations, using the tools of big -data of Fiware, for the recommended irrigation and allow to the farm suits the irrigation to the actual circumstances of the ground and optimize it, in order to guarantee that each plant is watered conveniently. They can view the historical data of the terrain over the time, seasons, etc., offering these data and their analysis using the Fiware big-data APIs, an estimate the costs of water, the performance exploitation improvement based on current and historical conditions of the soil, etc. Given that the platform will have an ERP applied to farms, the farmers may study the costs and benefits of exploitation, have a history of treatments applied, manage alerts to warn him about future actions in the farm, check the labor costs, check the benefits of the exploitation, have an estimation of future revenues and costs of the exploitation, etc.
column4: so the farmer may take corrective actions in order to try improve their farm production.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 3350,Smar84,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Germany,Information System for Integrated Plant Production (ISIP),Online DSS Cereals,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Manfred R”hrig,"Leaf diseases in cereals cause severe damage upon the plants and cause considerable yield losses if untreated and to a large extent fungicides are often today applied in a prophylactic manner as a safety measure. Although this is done according to the crop?s developmental stage little attention is turned to the disease?s epidemiology and dispersal which prevents farmers to optimise plant treatment and reduce environmental side effects. In order to sustain gross margins and to reduce environmental side effects, fungicide inputs in cereals will be optimised to the necessary level in a forecast / prediction / warning system integrating calculation of infection pressure and real time weather data and a field monitoring system. This system will thus provide the best knowledge for farmers and consultants to decide if a treatment in the field is necessary and when. In organic crop production systems few options are available for pest and disease control. In recent years, in particular yellow rust attacks in wheat and triticale have caused severe yield losses. In some varieties total crop failure has resulted in high economic loss as well rapid propagation of weeds, often requiring years of repeated and costly mechanical weed control measures. Therefore, an early warning decision support system for diseases may enable the organic farmer at an early stage to establish a new crop, when severe yield loss is predicted. The present project addresses these crucial points by developing a series of FIspace Specific Enablers (SE) integrated into a Decision Support System that delivers the results of a prognosis model (SE DIP Cereal) alongside with the possibility to enter field observations (SE Monitoring). The model is based on a SE that provides local weather data via an open interface (SE Weather) which will also be made available to third-party FIspace apps. On the other hand, the SE DIP Cereal can be used by any weather data SE that implements the open exchange format. Thus the present project will be beneficial for both the customer as well as model and data providers.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3351,Smar85,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Portugal,Espiral Pixel Lda,Open Community on Plant Pest and Disease,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,4,2,YES,IN,M¢nica Pedro,"Pest and disease identification in plants is a common problem faced mostly by farmers with critical direct impact on production of food and consequently negative impact on the environment and eventually on human well-being trough the use of pesticides. The first step is to have a proper diagnostic preferably at an early stage. Pest and disease diagnostics are sought by farmers either by talking with each others, by calling a specialist or by sending plant samples to certified laboratories for analysis. Respectively, these ways seem to be ineffective, not be readily available (or not available at all) or take longer than needed. OpenPD, an on-the-field and on-the-fly system for fast identification of plant pests and diseases, aims to provide a way to shorten the response time for a correct diagnostic of plant and crop pests and diseases by speeding up the process of identification. Supported by a database and a mobile app, users submit a digital photo of the affected plant part along with other relevant data and receive an answer leading to the diagnosis, coming from other users (general or specialists) or automatically by image interpretation and/or by a learning algorithm taking previous (positive) users answers. OpenPD will be reactive (users? questions and answers) but also proactive (sending warnings and alerts to users) and will be structured as an open community model. Answers should be evaluated and users rewarded and ranked using a ranking pyramid model (evaluation by the users but also by the system). OpenPD will make use of at least 6 generic enablers from the FIWARE Catalogue and be integrated in FISpace. OpenPD?s business model customer acquisition component will by supported by its Freemium model, strategic partnerships with public and private organizations, media partnerships and digital media plan. The monetization component will have its support on sponsorship, paid subscription fees and report generation from data mining the database as it grows.",Service provider,0,0,X,X,X,0,,Software,Advanced and Predictive Analytics Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,X,0,SME,40000,0

3352,Smar86,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,Agro-Know,Organic-AgriWare,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,5,2,YES,IN,PMO Department,"Organic agriculture stakeholders, whether in Denmark or Greece and elsewhere, are faced with the same practical problems and obstacles when it comes to organic agriculture. Therefore, farmers and advisors need context-related information to support their long-term and short-term planning. They need to be able to acquire this knowledge without access restrictions to scientific publications. The problem is that all this information is currently dispersed at different online and off-line locations/media, making access to the already acquired knowledge difficult. Collecting the necessary context-related information is therefore currently a challenging task. To this end, we propose implementation of Organic-AgriWare that will combine organic agricultural research knowledge with other available practical information, maximizing the practical benefits for organic agriculture stakeholders. This will be a mobile platform that will provide a mashup with unique and context-aware access to the Organic Eprints resources and information from both relevant FIspace apps and other useful resources for the users, determined after a relevant use-case study. Organic-AgriWare?s implementation is based on a strategic partnership spanning two European countries, Denmark and Greece, between Agro-Know, ICROFS, and DAAS. The end application could be used by anyone interested in organic agriculture. However, the targeted customer segments are agricultural advisors and organic farmers. It will operate under a freemium revenue model, it will capitalize on already existing and future collaborations with other FIspace application providers, and it is expected to have a high early adoption rate. Our lean manufacturing and agile development approach mandates the addition of a fourth milestone.",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,X,0,,Software,Content Management,Applications,Content Applications,1,X,0,0,0,0

3353,Smar87,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Poland,Informatyka Bankowa POLSOFT,P&P Analyser,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Kajetan Wlazlo,"Farmers often have a problem with crop planning since it is difficult to predict what will be profitable in short and long terms. Besides, during harvesting, it is difficult to predict an appropriate time to sell the crops. The demand for different products varies not only among European countries, but even within a particular country. Therefore, planning is an essential problem for future profitability of agricultural activities. Naturally, cultivation may be affected by a number of factors: meteorological, geographical and geological and these factors affect the current prices. The problem, however, are the future prices. Unfortunately, the average farmer is not able to make calculations as to what produce will be paid more in the coming years and how the prices will be shaped. The problem also occurs for produce purchasing companies. They do not know what products are needed and how much they will be able to buy. Therefore, they need opportunities to issue bids. Our application is directed to farmers with small and medium-sized farms who have a problem with estimating future prices of agricultural products and determining which crops at the moment are profitable. Our application is designed to estimate prices of agricultural products and to analyse of the profitability of production of raw materials. Complex statistical activities as well as mathematical and econometric analysis in our application will allow to carry out such assessment. Selecting the type of crop and the date of commencement of sales during the harvest is difficult. It is therefore important to plan the prices of products and to analyse the market and its needs. In our application, the farmers will be able to plan their crop in the long and short term. This will allow them to assess the viability of their farms, which may greatly facilitate the management and planning of other investments. Our application is also directed at large farms and purchasing businesses of agricultural products. Purchasing companies can send their offers of what and how much they want to present to farmers. In addition, large farms and purchasing businesses will be able to buy an additional module. This module will allow for the integration of financial and accounting systems, such as SAP. These options make our application address a larger group of users and solve many of the problems of the agricultural sector.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3354,Smar88,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,NEUROPUBLIC SA,PEGAPP,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,JOHN MAVROUDIS,"According to the new Common Agricultural Policy (CAP), in addition to the Basic Payment Scheme, each holding will receive a payment per hectare for respecting certain agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment. Member States will use 30% of their national envelope in order to pay for this greening approach. Article 45(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013 provides for the protection of the share of permanent grassland compared to the total agricultural area. Individual reconversions and a prohibition of further conversions should be required in case of a decrease beyond 5%. In order to achieve this goal, Member States should monitor the evolution of the share of permanent grassland. The task of monitoring the evolution of the share of permanent grassland is not so easy and trivial especially for the south European Member States where the morphology and the special features of the permanent grassland are too different compared to the northern countryside. To this context, agricultural producers possessing livestock need to utilize and to declare during its own community aids applications (Pillar 1 applications) such an amount of permanent grassland (i.e., pasture) that excuses the greening payment. PEGAPP deals with the green direct payment in a way that it deploys an ICT product that facilitates the European agricultural producers owning livestock to comply with the greening demands of the new CAP regarding the maintenance of the permanent grassland. Specifically, the PEGAPP ICT product enables the composition of viable pasture management plans. The main project idea refers to the deployment of an application that addresses mainly to agriculturalists (without excluding agricultural producers) in order to help beneficiaries who declare pastures (in the context of their community aids applications) to maintain these pastures without serious variations for the next three years (greening measure compliance).",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,0,0,SME,39640,neuropublic.gr

3355,Smar89,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Expert Ymaging SL,PigGro,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Carla Alvarez,"The main indicator of a pig's price is its weight. Nowadays, the animal weighing process is an intensive activity that implies a huge workload, use of infrastructure (scales, fences, handling facilities) and certain risks. Logistically it is no possible to weight out each pig with a scale. Is for that reason that the development of a new system aimed to facilitate this task would be very much appreciated in the animal production sector, in particular in the porcine sector. A system like this would improve those pig weighing controls that currently are not viable and even profitable. Farmer has no power over weight calculation and is forced to pay a small fine for those animals that does not fit in the right weight, reducing his benefits. According to Data of National Federation of Agrarian Cooperatives in Catalonia a farmer loses between 2 and 2.5? for each animal. According to the EC the EU is the second biggest producer and exporter of pig meat, with 152 million pigs and a yearly production of about 23 million T carcass weight. Ymaging pretends to implement a solution that will allow to farmers for the image capture and weight calculation of the pig in a fast, robust, objective, automatic and autonomous way. With The aim of the project is the development of a device for image capture and calculation of live pig's weight in a few seconds, in an autonomous and automatic way. With this information the farmer will have essential information for the management of the animal growth in an ubiquitous and continuous way thanks to Cloud technologies. With PigGro the farmer will be able to maximize the production through management of feed and water consumption (to control the pig's weight), to identify sick pigs and to identify the right time for the pig's slaughtering according to weight rates. Machine Learning Algorithms will suggest to the farmer some actions and will show him similar production according to the season, number of animals and the evolution of animal's weight.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3356,Smar90,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,Tomas ¦eimys,PracticeExchange,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Tomas ¦eimys,"The use of information technology in agricultural sector of European Union countries is relatively high. And many farmers use ICT solutions for work planning and performance analysis. However, currently there is no reliable information exchange system between these platforms systems. The most common IT solutions are focused on economic accounting (financial accounting, work planning, production accounting) and contains a lot of information related to farm operations and their consequences. Farms could exchange anonymous information with other farms to help make more effective decisions based on the experience of others and influencing factors at that time. Partial exchange of such information takes place in closed groups connecting different farms, for example: associations, co-operatives. However, these days we have adequate IT tools for large data collection, processing and exchange of information. We strive to combine IT solutions used in EU counties into a single information system which could process anonymous farm information, resulting in aggregated and structured data that could help farmers make more effective decisions. The ultimate goal of the project isa standardized system that enables a farmer to connect any farm management solution used.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3357,Smar91,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Latvia,Baltic Open Solutions Center,PROWINE,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Premysl Vohnout,"Precision Viticulture (PV) is the combined use of sensors and the analysis of the data produced by the sensors to improve differential management of different zones of vineyards. Sensors currently provide a leading role in all strategies for controlling productivity and quality of grapes and hence in managing the harvest time and quality of wine produced. Currently, the number of sensors is vast, and their number is rapidly increasing in order to meet new challenges in the field of Precision Viticulture. The proposed solution has to deal with existing and new sensors in a uniform easy way, abstracting details in favour of a feasible management for service provision. Our project proposes to create a FISPACE and FI-WARE architecture using some outputs from the FOODIE project, which is easily extendable through the addition of services available in the cloud. In order to do so, a unified framework for the agro/meteorological data exchange between the system and the services must be created. The proposed solution will be sensor infrastructure and set of apps informing grape producers about potential fungi risk. A part of the solution will be also focused on data management. The solution will consist of four apps: Early warning about fungi risk based on Complex Event Processes, Farm data management (uploading of sensor data and transforming them into the internal format), Farming data editing including in-situ edits (allowing change information about plots) and Advanced visualisation and analysis of historical data (supporting different types of analysis of short time and long-time measurements.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3358,Smar92,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,Zoidberg Solutions,Reco,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Rogier van der Hee,"The Reco or Remote Consultant platform will be a product that allows grower-supporting vendors in the horticulture sector to automate and improve their consultancy and/or advisory cycle. It will enable them to efficiently digitize and acquire form data, feedback and other information from the grower. All data is aggregated at a central data store from where advisory statements can be created and/or quality of service can be improved. The idea is to lower the administrative burden for the grower and lower the cost for the vendor because they don?t have to implement such a system themselves and, once implemented, more work can be done from the office instead of on premise.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3359,Smar93,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Poland,ZETO Software,Remote Consultant,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Piotr Jodko,"The project is a response to the demands of the modern breeders and assumes a construction of the application to facilitate the processing of data relating to herd and the ability to share selected data on both individual farm animals and the whole herd. Increasing number of animal population within husbandries forces breeders to use appropriate IT tools that will facilitate the herd management. Above-mentioned application will store data in the cloud and the farmer will be able to share data with selected specialists eg. veterinarian, zootechnician. Thanks to this, some of the specialist visits will be able to take place remotely which will result in faster reaction time and reduce the service costs. The project assumes the possibility of consulting on all aspects related to the care of farm animals including veterinary care, nutrition, herd management. FiWare components will be used during construction of application which will positively affect the quality of the software functioning and increase the number of potential users. The main feature of the product that distinguish it from already functioning similar applications will be ability to select data and share it with chosen specialists, advisers. Moreover, the application will offer the following services: ? hosting of data from collection systems and other analytical data ? preparation of reports and analysis of collected data ? sharing collected data with the specialists in the required scope ? Ad-hoc data sharing with any specialist, advisor who is not registered in the system ? visualization of statistical reports on breeding (element of gamification) ? sharing of animal data with other breeders (eg. for sale of livestock) ? sharing and streaming pre-recorded video content with specialists and advisors ? support of the system users by specialized HelpDesk of ZETO Software",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3360,Smar94,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Universidad Politecnica de Madrid,RGTM,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Francisco Mikuski,Project for fresh pasture production at site and very low price using FIWARE platform for full contol of system and lowering operative cost.,,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3361,Smar95,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,NTI Solutions,SAA,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Maria Antonia San Jos‚ P‚rez,"The solution proposed by Smart Agri Assistant is a user-friendly, mobile-based app to facilitate systematic data collection and management, application of data analysis to provide cost/resource optimization recommendations and facilitate wide-scale knowledge sharing. This system will help the agriculture professional in three fronts: - Activity logbook: a friendly, context-aware user interface to facilitate methodological introduction and collection of agricultural data. This will serve a twofold objective: first, to retrieve history data to feed data analysis algorithms
column2: and second, facilitate elaboration of logbook and activity reports in countries where legal frameworks oblige farmers to keep track of their agricultural activities in the field. This interface will perform intelligent operations to avoid data introduction by hand wherever possible (for example, including geolocation information to assign a given activity to a specific land plot), and also generate the reports following the official government templates in countries where it is required. - (Collaborative) Cost optimization: The application will take advantage of the history data retrieved in order to identify sub-optimal activities or resource/costs waste. In order to intelligently identify this potential optimization activities, the application will use several data mining algorithms, best-practices descriptions and ?big data? analysis of all the retrieved data (for instance, identifying an abnormally high insecticide consumption per square-meter, compared to the average of reported data for similar crops under similar conditions). - Crop-management: following the same data-mining + big data analysis approach, the application will also recommend optimal crop distributions according to history, climate forecasts and market situation.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 3362,Smar96,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,UK,Blue Maestro,SAG,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,Richard Hancock,"The development of an app and hosting platform for sensor data that can be used for monitoring and predictive modelling of grassland conditions. This app will help solve a problem of using models that are based on data from geographical dispersed weather stations, such as those managed by Met Eirans in Ireland where there are only 25 of them. The app will allow farmers to quickly and easily deploy cheap sensors on their farms that will provide hourly data on temperature, humidity and barometric pressure initially - but which will be expanded in the future to provide rainfall, soil moisture and soil temperature. By increasing the accuracy of data, farmers will be able to get better predictions on grassland condition which is vital for planning grazing, trafficability of livestock and machinery and fertilisation schedules.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,X,X,,Hardware,Advanced and Predictive Analytics Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,0,0,SME,40000,0

3363,Smar97,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,France,SampLyze,SampLyze,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Vincent Demortier,"SampLyze platform allows farmers and agri-food industry to manage the samples analysis performed from field to plate, and to leverage associated data for better decision making in business and precision agriculture processes. The quantity and quality of food raw material available on the market are often strategic inputs for decision making process within farming and agri-food industry. And they can vary dramatically from one season to another (like hazelnuts this year) impacting all the supply chain. To anticipate and decide the way they farm, trade, transform and distribute the products, companies gather lots of data coming from samples analysis. But the exploitation of these data is usually empirical (using MS Excel) and poorly integrated to other data analysis and to business processes. SampLize offers to turn sample analysis into integrated strategic big data process. SampLyze is architectured in three levels of apps and services: Operations: to gather the data, using the IoT paradigm, SampLyze implements the concept of virtual sensors combined to laboratory measurements (samples analysis): sets of virtual sensors are associated to batches lots depending on the status through the farming and business processes, creating data contexts. Tactical: the samples analysis are used to provide information for decision making, especially to trade the batches or to adjust the batches treatment. Strategy: tools to evaluate the global quality and profitability of the food raw materials based on aggregate samples analysis data combined to other agronomical data sets (meteorology, soil, water, feed?)",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3364,Smar98,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,Elements Interactive B.V.,SCIS,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,Wouter ten Brink,"The idea is to develop a smartphone app to be able to scan the chemicals container, and lookup the correct information for the spraying operation. This information is then automatically shared with the Sprayer Control System and Terminal through the Internet.",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,0,0,,Software,"End-User Query, Reporting, and Analysis",Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,0,0,SME,40000,elements.nl

3365,Smar99,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,Innovators SA,SCRAP,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Gerasimos Stamatelatos,"Nowadays, increase of population combined with the vast climate changes that occur and are going to be harsher in the following decades, agriculture, livestock and horticulture need to be efficiently planned so that new and more powerful techniques will increase productivity and ensure environment friendly productions. Therefore, concepts such as precision agriculture, precision livestock farming are of paramount significance towards achieving these goals. Within this project, SCRAP, a cross-domain advisory system application will be designed, developed and tested that will provide advice for arable farming, horticulture and livestock based on environmental measurements, as well as other production specific conditions measured by the farmer/breeder etc. The envisaged advisory system will feature learning capabilities utilising the feedback of the stakeholders so as to optimise the provision of precise and correct solutions in future usage. The system will develop and maintain an advice database, which will be enhanced through various sources according to individual or even cross-domain objectives and utilisation.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3366,Smar100,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Stoutic Computer Technologies S.L.,SDP-FOOD,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jos‚ Luis Fern ndez Taboada,"Agri-food systems require a path to sustainability. Current systems are overly-dependent on nonrenewable energy and water inputs, long distance fossil fuel-based transportation, monocultures that threaten biodiversity, and practices that result in widespread environmental degradation. Food systems are increasingly vulnerable to a growing range of climate-related threats, and are increasingly causing or amplifying globalized systemic shocks and cascading failures. Increasing resiliency is a key priority. Communities worldwide require stronger capacity to restructure local food systems. Achieving sustainability presents a market optimization challenge, and emerging solutions need to out-compete the legacy alternatives. Community-scale market infrastructure technologies provide a platform to streamline exchange of services and resources by more effectively applying policy, coordinating workflow and brokering transactions between actors spanning the agri-food value chain: suppliers, producers and purchasers. The proposed market exchange will connect producers with a supplier ecosystem focused on enhancing planning and management of agricultural operations, improving access to markets, streamlining logistics and enhancing competitiveness while sustainably optimizing yields. The exchange will improve system-wide planning and forecasting, increase efficiency, improve resource allocation, lower production costs, raise productivity and enhance risk mitigation. The exchange will support food system actors participating in horticulture and livestock programs targeted to vulnerable and at-risk populations
column2: key market priorities include densely-populated urban areas and isolated small islands with socioeconomically-disadvantaged populations having poor access to healthy foods and high rates of non-communicable diseases. The solution is most effective as part of a broader sustainability initiative, and participating communities should be committed to food system transformation.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

column1: 3367,Smar101,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,FERNANDO PEREZ MARTINEZ,SEMSOCAMP,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,FERNANDO PEREZ MARTINEZ,"The growth of world population makes it necessary to increase food supply for it. Arable farming is one of the important sources of food. In addition to the shortage of land is a shortage of water. All this leads to the existing arable farms to be more productive and one of the problems that can exist is the exhaustion of the productive capacity of the land due to overuse and use of pesticides and fertilizers. Precision farming in the management of small farms is complicated to deal by farmers due to the complexity and cost. Our application will allow farmers increase production and quality of their crops, prevention of diseases, pests and reduce water consumption in 30-60 %. We?ll achieve this by creating a platform that allow the logging and processing of large amount of data provided by both environmental sensors and information provided by the thermography cameras installed on drones. It will allow establish commands with the information that farmers need based on the type of exploitation, set alarms that allow a more effective control of the crops. We?ll use FI-WARE GE?s and tools by FI-SPACE. The market target to commercialize our product is global, as any kind of exploitation is likely to apply the advantages of precision farming. The two major markets that we may have better access are arable farming and horticulture. Within the market of arable farming, given the importance that is currently taking the wine sector in Europe, in the early stages it will be in countries like France, Italy, Portugal and Spain. Our business model, our marketing system and proximity to one of the most significant OD (Origin Denominations) in Spain, are the most important differential values that allow us to succeed. We think that our customers will be the Origin Denominations (OD) themselves and farms that are under their umbrella. And other very important wine farms which are outside Origin Denominations but bet for higher productivity and quality than those offered by OD.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3368,Smar102,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,Sensoterra BV,Sensoterra,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Jurriaan Ruys,"To manage the supply of water or fertilzers and the state of the crops on their land farmers, growers, landowners etc. want tot obtain more accurate data to be able to base a decision on. The idea behind the Sensoterra project is using the data from multiple sensors in the field that provide key information on the state of the crop/plant/tree and the humidity of the soil. With the help of FIWARE the Sensoterra partnership will develop software to collect data with smart sensors, manage and present it in such a way it can be used (for example) in automatized actions for regulation of production parameters. Basically with Sensoterra we want to create a low energy long range sensor network in which a central unit acts as both a data logger and a machine-2-machine IoT data provider to the cloud. Initially we want to gather both soil humidity readings as high resolution stills (images) to monitor a healthy growth of agricultural fields. This information will primarilly been used by the farmer, growers or landowners on their fields or in their greenhouses, orchards, nurseries. But what to think of the possibilities this will give to the logistic chain, the wholesalers,the resellers and last but not least the consumer in Europe and worldwide? Everybody gains insights in the quality, the quantity and timing of the agricultural products.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3369,Smar103,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,BIOGENETICS,SeQfood,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Javier Gamboa,"We propose the creation of an integrated platform of commercialization of genetically certified authentic agrifoods, so that beginning with the capability to verify the identity of the agrifoods, by the scanning of their 2DNA with any Smartphone, offers access to a large amount of different information and services focused specifically to each of all actors in the whole chain of distribution (from farm to table) of agrifoods. Solution based on a storing system on the cloud of the whole genetic identities (through their 2DNA binary/ graphical codes, based on GENOMID technology) of agrifoods from producers associated/ users of this network, called ?SeQfood? (SEcured Quality FOODs).",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3370,Smar104,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,UK,KPAD Ltd,S-GAP,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,5,1,YES,IN,Magda Krokida,"Smart Good Agricultural Practices (S-GAP) is a management information system which will combine precision agriculture application into the three levels of the decision making process (strategic, tactical, operational) together with automated compliance to standards steps. As the relevant farm data is already in the proposed information system, or may be automatically integrated using standardized services, documentation in the form of instructions to operators, certification of crop province and cross compliance of adopted standards can be generated more easily than with the current paper-based systems.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,Startup,40000,kpadltd.co.uk

3371,Smar105,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,"Shopping Leeks, S.L.",Shopping Leeks App,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Alvaro Prado,"We help restaurants make their orders to suppliers and help suppliers to ease that task to them by showing their entire catalogue and accepcting orders. Providers such as Farmers and Agriculture producers can offer, sell and deliver their products directly to the restaurant industry using mobile apps.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3372,Smar106,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Sinapse Energ¡a,SLMG,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,14,7,YES,IN,Rafael Alcaide,"Light management is a key factor for crops and flowers cultivation. A lot of horticulturists install a supplemental illumination system that must be easily managed to obtain the best results. Our proposed application and technology is addressing the light management problem in Greenhouses, easing the light monitoring, allowing asking for advice to reach the horticulturist goal and easing the light conditions modification remotely.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,0,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,38800,sinapseenergia.com

3373,Smar107,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,UBIKWA SYSTEMS,Smart Silo,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,5,2,YES,IN,Jaume Gelada Camps,"The goal of Smart Silo project is to provide an effective and affordable solution for the need of modern and industrialized farms, of accurate and updated information about feed stocks. This data is crucial not only for the farmers to trace the feed consumed daily by animals or to generate the replenishment orders on time, but also for their suppliers to optimize feed production and delivery logistics plans. The traditional telemetry solutions, designed originally for industry market, have not succeeded for this use case. The causes are the special characteristics of the farm (difficult access to a quality electrical grid, poor or no M2M coverage, bulk solids difficult to measure, etc.) and the limited budget available per silo. Consequently, and despite of his importance, the way the stocks are being controlled is manual and very inefficient. Usually, the farmers have to climb to the silos and make a visual estimation of stocks. This is a dangerous activity that also is not performed as often as it should, causing inefficiencies and disruptions in the business processes: lack of daily consumption information, urgent purchase orders caused by broken stocks, failure to properly plan the feed production, etc. Our solution to the problem is Smart Silo, a READY-TO-USE, HIGHLY-EFFICIENT and LOW-COST platform for remote control of stocks in feed silos in the environment of a farm. It is composed of a new high-tech device and an advanced cloud platform for data acquisition and presentation. The following key features makes our platform an affordable and optimal solution for the use case: - 3D scanning of feed surface for accurate measurements. - Connection to Internet through a Wireless Sensor Network, allowing communications in areas of low or no coverage. - Solar powered device, to be autonomous from electrical grid of the farm. - Easy Plug&Sense installation. - Free available apps (web, mobile and RESTFUL API). - Low acquisition cost and zero maintenance.",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,0,X,,Hardware,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,40000,0

3374,Smar108,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,LimeTri,Smart Sprayer,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Nicole Bartelds,"The Internet of Things has entered the farms. Every supplier of tractors, sprayers or fertilizers is having or preparing an online telematics platform in order to enable the farmer to access all the important data for the machinery any time, anywhere via the Internet. The problem is that every brand has its own solution. It is not possible for the farmer to get data analysis or extract management information on the combined data.To solve the problem of data islands a solution is needed that can combine and integrate all the datasources. Fispace provides the perfect platform to integrate the different data sources. The solution will be a connector for different tractors, sprayers and combines to FIspace and a connector from FIspace to different farm management systems.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3375,Smar109,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,France,Demand Side Instruments,Smart Water,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Leslie MARIE,"?Smart Water? is a complete solution pooling an application, a webservice access, a devices network and agriculture adujested devices in one package. DS Instruments provides this affordable system ajustable to existing irrigation systems, thanks to an added M2M network by using cost effective radio frequencies. The goal of DS Instruments is first to offer to its partners a solution for sustainable agriculture but also introducing an innovative M2M technology in the agriculture field, through controlled devices as electrovanne, water meter, local weather station, ? Giving access to an innovative and cost effective solution technology, our solution allows to valorize the agriculture competencies, maximize the inherent and future income but preserving the ressources.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3376,Smar110,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,LimeTri,SmartBarns,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Nicole Bartelds,"Agricultural entrepreneurs have made big investments in generating green electricity. The problem they encounter is the increasingly stringent regulations regarding compensating overproduction. In this proposal we focus specifically on the inefficient usage of green energy production, generated by, for instance, solar panels and wind mills, and the energy demand for many consuming ventilation systems. The solution we offer is to create a module to make ventilation- and other control systems smartgrid-enabled.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3377,Smar111,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,Connecting Agri&Food,SMARTFARM,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Angela van der Sanden,"In livestock farming a lot of information is registered at several places at the farm (e.g. water intake, climate control, feed intake, medicine usage) and by parties linked to the farm, like feed companies, veterinarians, slauther companies and breeding organisations. Currently these data are not or minimally shared at the farm and between farm related companies. New software solutions can realise accurate and timely connections between these data in a role bound manner to the farmer and his business partners resulting in new insights in farm management, creating opportunities for farm management optimisation.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3378,Smar112,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,B&B CONSULTING,SmartFarms,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Juan Pablo Barroso,"We are a ICT and legal SME allocated in Salamanca, where we work with many clients from the agrofood sector. When we created our SME we started working with the meat industry which is one of the economic engines of our region, providing them tchnological and legal solutions to their problems. The more we work with this clients the more we knew them, so knowing their problem we can help them to find solutions. Most of our clients have animal farms to have a better control in animal procing so they can contain meat proce to be higher. Animal farming is not an easy task, it demands hard work everyday and commitment. Many of the farmers already have automatic methods in their farms but still have not found the management application that provide them the capacityof working away. This is because many of these farms are far away and the internet service providers not always fulfill farmers ddemand. So our idea is create an app that can help farmer to reomte control the kitchen of the farm, that is ine of the most importants parts of this business. From the kitchen you can control food drinks and medecins. Some application do some similar work but none of them allow you yto do it in the cloud providing farmers more liberty not only to rest but to take care of some other things that the time that he has to spend in the farm doesnït let him. SmartFarm is the answer to remote control without needing a PC and a VPN connection that may not work and a useful tool that provides interesting feedback to farmers. SmartFarms is thought as FISPACE Aand FIWARE development as it provides the capacity of usin smart tools (enablers) and a very friendly environment that makes app easier for farmers.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3379,Smar113,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,EYZA TECHNOLOGY,SMARTGREEN,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,VICTOR CRUZ,"In the last season (2012/13) the production of Greenhouse Crops in Almeria arrived to 2,6 Tons equivalent to 1.528 Millions Euros
column2: what means a decrease 3% in the commercial operations volume that was compensated with 17% increase in the prices and the 13% of total incomes (COEXPAL, 2013). The greenhouse farms production in Almeria has an important export focus. The sales to foreign markets was near 70% (Aznar et al. 2013), with Germany, France, Netherlands and UK as the main markets this production. Even though all these incomes and enormous export figures, there is a process of decrease in farmers incomes. Mean incomes per hectare are decreasing in long term, mainly because the decrease of prices (Fundaci¢n Cajamar 2012). We see a business opportunity in improving some of the process involved in the production of Greenhouse ( In Almer¡a we have 24000 Ha of Greenhouses and 12000 farmers). We will propose a product to increase efficiency of management of the Greenhouse reducing the time employed by different actors (owner, farmer, technician) involved in the process of production. Now the farmer has to monitor and control on site the parameters (temperature, humidity, water, etc) of the Greenhouse, and the technician has to check that the production process is according the best practices. Finally there is a security problem because many of the Greenhouses remain isolated. This produces a problem of additional cost because robberies. All these processes need to be more efficient to reduce costs. The solution proposed to increase productivity will have the following components: ? Outsourcing to the Cloud of monitoring and control of the production of the Greenhouse. This will be done by means of the services created with FI Ware enablers.. ? It is a SaaS, pay per use service, that lets to consider potential customer to any farmer with their own solution of sensors. ? Connection to the B2B data base, publish in open Marketplace, receive an lisys and advices possible actions about GH Parameters ? Tools for farmers based in easy app in smartphones with access to the Greenhouse parameters stored in the Cloud ? Update sensor technology, using new Zigbee, Zwave technology instead of the present wired old sensors, and new monitoring and control algorithm. This solution is already developed by EyZa. The solutions and ideas developed in the region will also be easily replicated to other greenhouses in different areas of Spain and Europe, with a significant effect on the overall economy and well being of European citizens",Tech provider,0,X,0,X,X,X,,Hardware,Production Planning,Applications,Supply Chain Management (SCM) Applications,1,0,0,SME,40000,eyza.es

column1: 3380,Smar114,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Czech Republic,Lesprojekt - slu§by s.r.o.,SmartHoney,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,#N/A,#N/A,YES,IN,Zbynek KRIVANEK,"Beekeeping is one of the oldest areas of human activity. The object is to breed bees. Output products are honey, wax, propolis, pollen, royal jelly and bee venom. A major output beekeeping activities is also pollinate plants. The main economic importance of beekeeping is mainly in the pollination activity of bees. An important significance not only bee keeping products, although they have justified their importance. In European conditions the contribution of pollination activity of bees about 10 times higher than that of bee products. If bees and their pollination activities was, could, with hindsight occur decline of agriculture and an increase in food prices, including honey Breeder-beekeeper is in this position, which regulates the conditions for the life of the colony, so that nothing prevented the harmonious development, and thus maximize application assembly instinct of bees, thus hoarding of honey respectively pollen so targeted. New Technologies and the Future Internet allows us to arrive at a relatively cheap and simple solution to monitor all kinds of physical quantities in specific combinations, such as monitoring the living conditions of colonies, their condition and variable activity. These data can greatly assist beekeepers in their work. The objective of SmartHoney is to design solution focused on monitoring situation inside and outside of hive, providing prediction of bee behaviour and sending alerts to beekeepers and allow provide interactive analysis in time. For monitoring will be used WSN based on IQRF nodes. IQRF is a platform for low speed, low power, reliable and easy to use wireless connectivity e.g. for telemetry, industrial control and building automation. IQRF is a complete ecosystem from one brand including hardware, software, development support and services. IQRF network can easily be connected to Internet via the Cloud server. IQRF is ideal to implement Internet of Things.",Tech provider,0,X,0,0,X,X,,Software,Advanced and Predictive Analytics Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,0,0,SME,40000,0

3381,Smar115,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Italy,Aedit s.r.l.,smartIPM,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,3,14,YES,IN,Diego Guidotti,"Integrated pest management (IPM) and the promotion of low pesticide-input management are major actions for sustainable agriculture promoted by the EU. European meteorological networks, working at different spatial scales, are currently handling their own data with unconnected management system. This makes the access to data difficult, which is an essential prerequisite for any implementation process of information on climate and pests. We propose a set of modular applications adopting FIWARE technologies to develop Decision Support System (DSS) in support of area-wide IPM. The system will be based on free agrometeorological data from public and private providers in Italy, Spain and Greece. Insect phenology will be modelled, and interfaced with monitoring programs and geostatistical algorithms. Four major crops will be targeted: corn, tomato, grapevine and olive. A specific focus on pest development, agrometeorological modelling, and environmental safety will be pursued IPM applications on arable farming (corn), and horticultural crops (tomato, grape and olive). Open access agrometeorological data will be implemented in a model environment for the sustainable management of the most important pests for these crops. The main benefits are the optimization of spatio-temporal IPM applications and the flexible use of farm-specific information modules. The open system platform will provide the data in real time, as required by large companies and/or consortia and cooperatives that offer services for large territorial scale and long-term purposes. The use of FIWARE and FI-space will ensure networking and reciprocal integration of results by groups of end users and ICT developers. The in-kind contribution of Regional Phytosanitary Service of Tuscany and DuPont Evalio AgroSystems, a public local authority and a multinational enterprise, working on pest management and food processor, respectively, will provide test bed to trial the results of mathematical models and DSS.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,39600,0

3382,Smar116,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,The Netherlands,Applicatum,SSAS,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Andr‚ Kapitein,"Smart Sensor App Service Livestock farmers as key players in food production and one of the forces in European economies increasingly experience pressure from society. As the farm grows so intensifies the way in which the environment comes in contact with negative aspects of the livestock sector. The generation of undesired sounds and substances ,that in thick concentrations might pose a threat to human and animal welfare or even health, are an inherent characteristic of the stable. The precise impact of these factors however, remains unknown as most studies on the phenomenon nowadays are mostly based on survey-like measurement and estimations. Furthermore the people working on the farm have no immediate knowledge of the status within a stable. Which in many cases renders concrete actions useless as they are based on incomplete knowledge or are simply being made in hindsight. Smart Sensor App Service addresses these multiple inherent issues of the stable. The installment of a low-budget but high-performing sensor network that is connected to a cloud can measure: temperature, humidity, vibration, sound, fine particles, nh3, nh4, nox, o3, o2, co, co2 and H2s. The raw data is processed in an app enabled via FIWARE. The app runs a cloud based database in which the data is stored and aggregated to provide researchers with a structural source of emission related data (livestock) on a European scale. The service is not a mere observer of data. The app can give farmers real-time updates of the actual status in a stable. It can give warnings and advice on how to handle different situations. Via FIWARE and FIspace applications we want to come to a system that can actively intervene in a stable. Whether this constitutes adjusting ventilation or alerting emergency services, the options are endless. The SASS could help the stable to take that next step in becoming a smart environment. The sensor, cloud database and app represent the basic principle of our service: ?to measure, to know and to act?.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3383,Smar117,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Greece,Integrated Information Technology & Digital Communication,SSRF-DSS,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,3,5,YES,IN,Yannis Skourtis,"The Sustainable Small Ruminants Farming Decision Support System SSRF-DSS will provide a web-based, model-driven decision support tool for farmers using small ruminants (sheep and goats) in extensive farming methods. The model that is the basic inference engine of the app helps farmers optimize their annual income, taking into account labour hours, among other variables. EU farmers have gradually acquired more animals over time so as to be eligible for higher/more subsidies. This has led to big and difficult-to-manage flock sizes, additional fodder costs and pasture degradation. With rising fodder prices in the international market, farmers could afford less fodder but flock sizes were not reduced, inevitably leading to overgrazing and pasture degradation. Consequentially, the quality of pastures has been deteriorating while the animals are malnourished and less productive. Our calculations show that a reduction of stocking rate (number of animals), at constant level of subsidies and expenditure on imported fodder, would lead to higher incomes (an average 35%). SSRF-DSS is an integrated platform where stakeholders (farmers or other bodies) will - Use the model, through a user-friendly web interface, for an EU area with tested factors, to plan their annual income in an optimal and environmentally friendly way. - Input data for different EU areas where key factors vary (such as subsidies, land rent costs, fodder costs etc). - Help interconnect the app with other FIWARE-enabled apps or Open Data sources within the EU (eg. subsidy or price data) that can facilitate accurate, real-time decision support.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,X,0,,Software,"End-User Query, Reporting, and Analysis",Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,X,0,SME,40000,integrated.gr

3384,Smar118,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,Enog‚s Consultores S.L.,ST,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,6,8,YES,IN,Javier Garrido D¡az,Smart solutions to help farmers in tillage works.,Tech provider,0,0,0,0,0,0,,Software,Services Operations Management,Applications,Operations and Manufacturing Applications,1,X,0,SME,40000,enoges.com

3385,Smar119,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Italy,Meltin'Dot,TAJ,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING, Consumer other",B2B/B2C,4,6,YES,IN,Paolo Zanini,"The Temporary Agricultural Jobs portal is designed as a virtual place where European employers from the agricultural sector meet seasonal job seekers and applicants for apprenticeship. Employers and association of agricultural producers can access a repository of jobseekers interested in agricultural labor or services and find people filling their vacancies. Jobseekers can react themselves on vacancies published by the employers and get in contact with them. A ranking system applies to both employers and jobseekers. Employers ranking depends on references from previous employees, health and safety conditions in the workplace and accommodation availability. Jobseekers ranking depends on references from previous employers, language skills and certified competencies. Web community features (forum, Q&A, news, etc.) are provided to promote discussions, share knowledge and get information from others members and a contracted staff. As premium feature, serious educational games are available as online training courses on agricultural practices and safety and health conditions. Using serious games allows foreign people to access information in an easier way.",Service provider,0,0,X,0,0,0,,Software,Human Capital Management,Applications,Enterprise Resource Management (ERM) Applications,1,X,0,SME,40000,meltindot.com

3386,Smar120,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,0,0,Tawals,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Matija Sabados,"The scope of this project is to produce an application that enables the agricultural producers in closely monitoring, applying and managing their water, fertilizer and pesticide use. In so doing, it should assist both in reducing costs of crops production, but also in reducing the strain that the current forms of farming have on the limited water resources. Pesticide penetration of underground water systems has caused serious concern in recent years and is a direct consequence of pesticide overuse. The need for pest control in crop production is absolutely clear, however so is the need for their limited use in a controlled environment. The project aims to provide the agricultural producers with the appropriate set of tools that can help reverse this trend while at the same time safeguarding the crops against pathogenic organisms. Combining water use, pesticide and fertilizer distribution aims to alleviate the burden on the depleting water resources. Climate change is affecting the whole European continent and as such, agriculture is deeply impacted since it strongly relies on the use of fresh water in crop production. That is why it is essential to enable the farmers to produce more efficiently and effectively without having to sacrifice in quality.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3387,Smar121,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Ireland,Trish McOwan,Telenostics,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,6,2,YES,IN,Trish McOwan,"CF Pharma's Telenostics Device is a veterinary medical device for the immediate faecal bio burden testing on farm with digitalised analysis and instant reporting delivered through an app suitable for any smart phone. The Telenostic device is a closed loop solution delivering virtually instant results for efficiency and prompt action, at a price point that makes it viable for all farmers as a standard tool and simple and quick to use. The sample can be prepared, the image captured using the customised automated apparatus and the results identified digitally using image recognition technology. This allows for quicker, more accurate and cost effective results which it is hoped will increase the take up of FEC?s as standard practice, and in turn, reduce the overuse of drugs in the food chain and help to address resistance build up in parasites.",Tech provider,0,0,0,X,X,0,,Hardware,"End-User Query, Reporting, and Analysis",Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,0,0,SME,40000,0

3388,Smar122,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,EVM Project Management,TerraLayer,0,"AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY AND FISHING",B2B,3,7,YES,IN,Samuel Baute,"The objective of the project is the implementation of a platform for exploiting geospatial data, based on a model of Software as a Service (SaaS), to promote the use and integration of the evapotranspiration data with all kind of farmers and agricultural-related associations or companies, addressing the water resources deficit in some areas of Europe.",Tech provider,0,0,0,0,X,X,,Software,Spatial Information Management Software,Application Development & Deployment,"Data Access, Analysis, and Delivery Software",1,0,0,SME,40000,0

3389,Smar123,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Italy,PANON.IT,TRACE,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Srdjan Sladojevic,"Every agricultural production is associated with numerous risks related to unfavourable meteorological conditions (for example, too much rainfall or not enough sunshine, ice), plant diseases, pests and even vis major. In order to ensure expected yield and reduce production related risks, manufacturers use disease prevention and pest fighting aids. Sophisticated solutions like weather stations equipped with plant disease prediction models and smart apps can assist in decision making process and help in reduction of chemical substances usage, but producers still tend to overuse chemical products. This practice is increased by the fact that when it comes to the actual sales, those who produce healthier products are rarely adequately awarded. Even if ecological agricultural production practices are becoming increasingly adopted, only certified organic manufacturers can achieve significantly higher prices for their products. At sales stage, rules of market offer and demand, combined with negotiation skills, usually determine the price. TRACE (Tracking Agricultural Conditions and Environment) platform, is a web platform which connects agricultural producers and their customers and initiates business-to-business (B2B) interaction between them with actual production data as an integral part. Apart from that platform allows biding and auction process, presale, ranking of producers in terms of reliability and quality, provides certificates of excellence for the top producers, as well as rating of the buyers in terms of reliability.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3390,Smar124,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Ireland,Vantage Solutions,Vantage Solutions,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Michael Farrelly,"Vantage solutions has devised a low cost method of measuring, hosting and providing data on levels of bulk solids stored in silos to key users via app or cloud hosted platform. Put simply an animal feed or distribution company using our system could tell the level of feed in any of their customer?s silos at any time. Animal feed manufacturers will be compelled to buy our offering because it will reduce transport costs and improve customer retention. It is recognised that transport costs make up to 30% of the cost of animal feed. Vantage Solutions will reduce these costs by allowing animal feed manufacturers and distributors to optimise logistics by planning their routes better, ensuring maximum load is delivered every time and reducing out of hours deliveries. Customer retention is improved because their customers won?t run out of feed. Added benefits for the farmer include Health and Safety by removing the need to climb silos to check levels and allowing inventory management.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3391,Smar125,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Spain,VISUALNACERT SL.,Visual,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Mercedes Iborra Broseta,"In our proposal we indicate one of the main problems of the agriculture world: the existence of abundant and dispersed information. As a solution we present Visual. A web application that allows the use of geographical components to group all the information related to: - Integration of basic layers (google maps, meteorology, ?) - Location of crops / varieties - Georreference from layers related to the agricultural division of the territory. (Cadastral, APNs, Sigpac) - Rankings of productivity, quality, harvest, sanitary states, climatological complaints. . . - It makes easier the capture of information in inspections - Storage of documents associated with the plots - Safe multiplatform access - Integration with external systems by web services At this moment Visual implements an classic client / server architecture, located in a dedicated server, with relational databases, using a particular safe access control. Our target is to migrate this configuration to a more updated and competitive architecture as the offered by FIWARE.Thanks to this, on the one hand Visual will be able to win scalability and on the other it will integrate itself in a much more versatile way into the offered services, making use of the infrastructure and the components developed by other organizations integrated in the FIspace, such as: publication and interpretation of information obtained by means of sensors in field, integration of advanced meteorological services?",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A

3392,Smar126,Smar,SmartAgri Food2,Ireland,Whitepark Engineering Limited,Voyager15,0,0,0,#N/A,#N/A,NO,0,Steve McGinley,"Using an Android/Iphone device and some external sensors, the aim of the project is to detect, store and disseminate data from these sensors measuring environmental readings such as soil moisture levels. The goal of the project is to produce a working prototype in the form of an Android/Iphone App that will gather data using it?s own onboard sensors, in conjunction with extra, external sensors connected via an Arduino Microcontroller. The data will be gathered on the device and then transmitted and stored in a database where it can be displayed/graphed for a user to interpret. The app should also disable any service/sensor of the device that would not be required for this project as this would save power and put less strain on the battery, giving it a better performance. If time allows, a video call function would be desirable to allow for remote viewing via the device. An Android/Iphone App that the will include the following features: 1. Collection of data through internal device sensors as well as connected external sensors (soil moisture sensor). 2. Communication of this data via SMS/Email or sending it to a cloud server to save in a database. 3. Graphing of the recorded data to show trends over time. 4. Auto answering device to allow remote viewing from device of its environment. The project will focus on developing low cost sensor solutions.",,0,0,0,0,0,0,,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,1,0,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A,#N/A
